sQp64oolV0KLRsgzrL5xsg.text: Defalcos is hands down one of the only down to earth family restaurant left, they always care about customer service and food quality!  Love their spaghetti & margarita pizza is to die for

RpsWsFplESIdRor5QTUTug.text: Nothing makes me happier than pulling the car up to Defalco's. Seriously. I'd offer up my first born to eat one of their hot sandwiches. If you're opening up this app to figure out what you should order, listen up. The cheese steak or meatball sub are both divine, get it on the baguette. If you're leaning towards a cold sammie, the II purista is your move. Finally, the cheesecake (how am I not 500 pounds) it is the best cheesecake you will ever eat. Defalcos I love you, never change.

1VtfcOWifCJyrKB3RMsIjw.text: I was referred to this place from a friend. It's so close to us. I LOVE this place. I love they sell fresh made meats and cheeses. There pizza is the best! Their calzones are amazing and HUGE! It's our new favorite Italian place now!

iZm89qM9UaoNGhxfyryq6g.text: I felt like I was eating in a storage room. Soup was good...sandwich nothing special.Bread was like pizza dough.....doughy in the middle and done on the outside....Service was very good....might go back for take out and try the pizza. If you ever had a Pat's Philly Cheesesteak in Philly this place can't compare.

X--sxb5-5bmtI5p3SMFHGg.text: One of the Best Italian delis and restaurants I have been to in the valley!!  Super good food, cute little quaint cafe with an amazing deli counter!!  Fantastic pizza, fettuccine is amazing!!  Their calzones are out of this world!!  I ordered a small and it was bigger than my head!!

ljp42_CISTDGx3dadjqqmQ.text: This is a "South" Scottsdale neighborhood hangout in an average strip mall but we enjoy this place so we'll travel south for 30m to get here.  Authentic, fresh deli with amazing choices.  Beer & wine available.  Outside patio.  Minimal indoor seating.  "Can-do" service!  You'll have to browse the grocery offerings that aren't in the big stores:  everything from oils to gelato.  Enjoy!  DeFalcos is a treasure.

vHlofuVvVh-nIbqQcCRKZg.text: Got their eggplant parmigiana spaghetti! To die for! Very chill and calm place to have a sit down lunch or semi romantic dinner. Their cheese lasagna is also really good! A must try for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

68BXWwFMYCkHOXenp43cWg.text: Best Italian deli. The food is amazing. The staff is so helpful and friendly. I love this place.

y4-2HkyI7qM4GF0SeWYCiQ.text: Been here a couple times. Wasn't amazed with the service the first time. Can't remember what I thought of the food. Decided to give it another shot and ordered a pizza for pickup. They said it would be ready in 30-35 min. Got there in plenty of time. Took it home and was completely cold. Had to warm it up in the microwave which basically turned it into cardboard. Spent $25 on a pizza I could have gotten at Papa Johns for probably $8. Won't be back for a third time.

Joav0Zh5gXCFep8jKJposw.text: This place oozes Italian with its meat and cheeses on display. I've never actually come here for Groceries, I always come for dinner and sometimes lunch. Most things here are pretty tasty but the I always come back to the pasta. It is very good with my favorite being the Gnocci w/ Alfredo sauce.

970D2IforJOw3ZDhuLJarw.text: I Can't say enough good things about this place. I come here frequently for takeout food and dining sometimes as well. Their sandwiches are amazing. Their salads are huge and delicious. Their pastor is out of this world. Plus it's a great place to buy different groceries.

Xne0Yf_tPyA7NlsJ8ONUwg.text: We had lunch here. We split a Rubin. Which was plenty for the two of us. The sandwiches we saw others enjoying were huge. Half order is enough for all but the biggest of eaters. Our sandwich was excellent and we will go back. We also bought some deli meats and cheeses all of it very good.

-Ze-xVogbAeycaCHdSnaiw.text: Great cheese steak sandwich, and great pizza.  A kitchen that cooks with love.  Owner takes pride in the food, and clients. I'll be back.

ge18U_QoceRe1A61B2mGRg.text: I'm so in love with this Spot. Best Italian deli I have found. The pizza  is great! The sandwiches are so delicious . You may want to order a head because seating is limited and the wait can be long because it is so yummy everyone wants to eat here.

pmSzQjesH1xpwZtJngTjAg.text: Wish I could give this place negative stars...  The food is over-priced and the quality is poor but what tops it all off is the rude staff...  I came in thinking customer service is something every staff member should be proud to have.  The male employee behind the counter kept staring at me when I came in, as I ordered and when I sat down to eat.  He then pretended to clean a table near me only to use it as an excuse to come over and ask me if I had my cell phone on. He then said "give it to me babe so I can add my digits to it"  Not only offensive but over the top rude.  I got up and left. The owner needs to sit down with his under-trained staff and either fire them all or al least train them to be nice.  NEVER going back again.

aFaPCjBVPUEGxXZSwlHYIg.text: I have been going to Del Falco's for years. And I have never never been disappointed with the food. The wait can be long at times but that's a testament to how good this place is. Give yourself plenty of time for the pizza and the calzone. Portions are large. Especially the full calzone. It will take you 4 meals to eat it. The groceries are very cool too. There are some Italian things there I've never seen. Makes me want to have a dinner party. I absolutely love this place!

SSVpXez_V-6q12pk2-KNkw.text: Delicious every time we come in or get Togo! We love the chicken Parmesan, the Italian sausage, and the gnocchi... but you literally cannot go wrong with anything! Their sauces are all fresh, but red is our fave! We each had full portions of chicken parm, salad, chicken cutlet sandwich, a cannoli, and bottle of Cabernet all for $40!!! You will. It be disappointed with this choice!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy food and huge portions

Pun-q51_IdtyLjEbo8mydw.text: What a great place!  It's a market... no, it's a deli... no, it's a bakery... no, it's a restaurant.  Hmmm... nope, it is ALL of those things!  And the food?  Spectacular!    I have only tried a chocolate shell cannoli and a sandwich that I forget the name of (it had prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, tomato, fresh basil, and handful of other deliciousness on it)... but Defalco's is one of those places where you just know they know what they're doing!  I'm super-excited that I found this gem and cannot wait to get back over to Scottsdale to stop here again!  Bravissimo!

7eWD2yVKowrdvmDQ12deaA.text: I'm being redundant adding to the 5 star reviews but it was deserving. I wish there was a place like this near me.  Loved the ambiance....good outdoor seating... Enough tables inside among the groceries. Great place to relax.  Meatball sandwich.....excellent. Chocolate eclair. ...superb Great drip coffee  Counter order....then food brought to table. Service very attentive.   Definitely a place to check out.

vSdIDMOCbH-2J5ZpOfgkrQ.text: Well, I have come here several times now. It is a grocery and a restaurant. While it is supposed to have the feeling of the Neighborhood store. I just don't feel it. It is nice ,the food is good, but it is not great. The grocery food items for purchase have dust on them. I do not like that at all. It creeps me out a bit. Living in AZ ,I know Dust comes in from every direction. But, that is why you have to clean it.  It is a great location in Scottsdale. I do love their Mozzarella and the sauce they use for the restaurant meals.  However, I am just not blown away with everything else. It is good though. We are in the Desert and it is hard to find really good Italian here. Although Las Vegas seems to have it down. Maybe there are just not that many Italians here. So they do not need as much great stuff.  I do find Romanelli's to be much better. More Neighborhood like in it's feel. It is worth checking out though.You could definitely do worse.

wg94ElCYopeYey3IrGiaFw.text: My boyfriend introduced me to here after moving to Scottsdale. I have seriously been missing out my entire life. My favorites are the calzone and antipasto salad. On top of it, every time I come im remembered and all the staff is so friendly and helpful. Never disappoints!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Antipasto salad is so delicious!

ZbfNhf1fp1LyDc5sYgDFHg.text: Defalcos is the kind of place that makes you want to move closer to it.  Every neighborhood should seriously have a place like this near by.  Small deli/market/restaurant that delivers the goods and flavors.    I've had a half beef half sausage whole sandwich on a roll.  It was the best damn roll I've ever had in my life.  Crunchy outside crust, and soft hot on the inside.  Life changing.  The sandwich was big enough for two full grown men to share and came with au jus and marinara.    I also tried the Italian sub and the procciutto sandwich both were legit.  The shop has some yummy looking treats plus wine and beer.   If I lived near here I'd try everything on the menu.  Outstanding!

9N2Gbnv1GgYhsmvg-cCkSQ.text: I like the laid back atmosphere and cafe / deli style of DeFalco's. Portion size could be bigger but the food was really good! Staff was nice and service was prompt. Look forward to coming back.

mTi1kMThWlupKbrVnaGpSg.text: This review is based on just food.  I have no idea why people rave about this place. Ill go piece by piece.  Counter style ordering doesn't really bother me, and the guy taking my order was super cool. The behind him though, kind of a jerk and kept bitching about getting in late orders. It was close to closing probably 45 minutes out, I wasn't at the 30 minute mark so I think i was good. I walked in and then 20 others walked in behind me, obviously DeFalcos is no stranger to later diners.  Ordered chicken parm and mac and cheese. The chicken cutlet itself was absolutely nothing to call home about. It was pounded out, breaded and friend appropriately, nothing special at all. The pasta was way over cooked, and the red sauce, was watered down and lacked any depth or flavor. Ive cooked, and eaten both American Italian and traditional Italian my entire life and this sauce fell very short of what I expected. It wasn't like it was a quick crushed tomato, garlic, red pepper, onion, basil sauce that you through together on Tuesday. It was an I spent all day making this sauce, let me dump some water into it.   Mac and cheese, same deal. Noodles were overcooked, the mornay was a joke. Literally watered down and tasted like nothing. I tried to taste it, it literally tasted like nothing. I put some salt and pepper on it, it tasted like nothing and salt and pepper.   Finally the garlic bread. It was good, extremely reminiscent of the frozen garlic bread. Not being rude here it just was reminiscent of the frozen garlic bread. I regret having to write this, i thought everyone was spot on about this place but it was not good at all.  My $0.02.

pkskitKTLj_xbnhM2k301A.text: A nice little Italian grocery/restaurant in a small, older plaza along Scottsdale rd.    The store part of it had a good selection of deli meats and cheeses, as well as shelves of pastas and sauces.  I'm sure there were more things, but we were there for dinner, not shopping.  We ordered the large portions of Chicken Marsala and Stuffed Jumbo shells.  The marsala wine sauce was excellent, and the orders were very largely portioned.  The side salads were not the best, but the garlic bread made up for it.  The service we received was friendly.  It's probably not recommended to come here with a large group since seating is limited (It's more store than restaurant), unless you all sit outside.

TUw9DuKZfphE6o6FCaWDSQ.text: While I can't speak for the pizza (yet!), I have had two different pastas and sandwiches, both perfect and delicious. The larger portions of the pastas are LARGE. I am no light eater and that meal put me out like a light - although that may have been partially due to the fact that I was eating pasta :). The philly cheesesteak sandwich was excellent - probably one of the best I've had.  The store/restaurant itself is very quaint - an Italian style grocery with a small amount of seating. The staff while kept busy is friendly and quick.  Oh, and the lemon bars. Do not leave here without a lemon bar.

atbKsD_T5WcSXIJ2VxKMAA.text: This place is charming. The food is top notch. The service is great. Anthony is friendly, it was nice to meet the creator of many of the recipes. I always buy my favorite wine here. The deli is also great!  I am waiting with an orange blossom by Papago brewery for my artichoke veggie lasagna!  Can't wait to try it!  Do come here! The mornings are chill.

DceFVJaWocNTY5rnk7A2Dg.text: Try the Italian Combo for lunch on marble rye bread and you will thank me later. Great atmosphere, great food and don't forget to buy sweets on the way out.   Perfect for lunch.

vK3jmwArxF7rkJeu9ZJ97A.text: Amazing selection of deli meats!  The prosciutto sandwich is my fave, I haven't tried anything else but I just love prosciutto.  I've recently started buying the grocery store products to incorporate into my Italian cooking and my recipes have never tasted better.  I feel like a master chef now.  I will never again use Prego, I'm embarrassed to even admit that I ever used it!

2EWcGA1sclxAR-2G27Wvig.text: Hmmmmm... I guess we had high expectations for this place.  We arrived very early for lunch and were two of only a few others in the restaurant, but it took 25 minutes to get two sandwiches.  I am not exaggerating either.  We compared the time the food came to the time stamp on our receipt.  25 minutes.  The sub sandwich had a good flavor and lots of meat.  I liked the Italian dressing on it.  I also thought the ingredients tasted really fresh and stood out each on their own.  My husband said the flavor of the Italian beef with peppers and onions was quite flat. He said it didn't have a ton of flavor.  We also weren't too thrilled about the potato salad or the tortellini salad we got as sides either.  If we are ever in need of Italian grocery items, Defalco's will be first on the list.  Maybe we should try the pizza next time....but we'll call ahead and order it.

4CGGjHnsm1tAoq_Wkjppqg.text: We heard of this place after seeing it on the food network channel and had to give it a shot. DeFalcos was amazing! Authentic and so tasty! I recommend the Italian sausage sub with peppers and onions and the lasagna w/ meat! The New York style cheesecake was amazing too. Will for sure be back!

6bqjgW3kE25-3-ZPiHx8WA.text: I love Defalco's! We have so many great memories there, however I don't like taking my kids there because of all the amazing stuff that is everywhere and I don't trust my little ones to keep their hands to themselves (I have little ones).   Besides that, I love their sandwiches, their pastas, and pretty much everything. I think I switch it up overtime I go there. Unlike my hubby that orders the same thing every time. I think he orders the Meatball sub every single time. It can be crazy busy and super chaotic - which is a bummer for people like me that can't make up there mind and it's kind of cluttered, so when I just want to browse I feel like i'm bumping into people. But that is what makes Defalco's Defalco's! The place is great. Check it out!

am04GAc4rDQr26PvHu0oPQ.text: Good service but the food wasn't good, which was saddening because I was looking forward to the Philly cheesesteak and the classic pizza. Neither were good.  The Philly was made with white American cheese and I wasn't aware that the cheese came in it so it was super salty and weird tasting simply because processed cheese was in it. Pizza was bland.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Looks delicious but sadly it wasn&#39;t at all.
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Philly that automatically has white American cheese mixed in. Lactose intolerant ppl be ware!

kIRLffP04IN5XdKazGcpuw.text: Great food, best cheese steak I've ever had. Sometimes can be too much bread, to little filling. This is a very popular lunch spot for local businesses, so be prepared for a crowd if you go around lunch. I recommend calling in orders ahead of time if in a hurry.

69lMPDV1BnRkD1BpfueYiA.text: It's been atleast like 4 years since I have been here, maybe 3. But I recently passed it today and remembered how great this place is. I had a meatball sub. I think. I'm not positive but it was just amazing whatever I had. I can't wait to actually go back now that I remember this place. I recommend to everyone.

rltOzVpE3B8cDpf7ZONQ4g.text: I ordered the eggplant parm sandwich and it was crispy and had just the right amount of sauce. They have tons of options to choose from for sandwiches, salads, pasta, and even dessert.

XEUF1ow2VmFHtt8nhR7Epw.text: Overrated is one work to describe. I ordered the philly cheese steak for my fiance and I got the margarita pizza for myself.  The bread on the philly was not very soft, however the meat was Legit.  The only reason I came here was because I was craving a TRUE margarita pizza which was what the menu read. Tomatoes, basil, evoo , fresh mozzarella, basil.  when I got my pizza, I got pizza sauce , 4 tomatoes, mozzarella cheese spread on the whole thing, and a few pieces of fresh mozzarella. The menu is deceiving,  looks like they pay attention to detail when it comes to ingredients, but it tasted sub par.  I don't think I need to visit this restaurant for a while . Wasn't terrible but wasn't fantastic.

GhCsuK9i9MaEmuPcS2M7Qg.text: Tried it once, about 7 months ago. We have literally been back every week since. Rice balls, Cheesesteak Sandwiches, and Penne ala Vodka. Yaaaaaaaas!

_A7oSY80C65Hg5-Z1p8PeA.text: Sandwiches were very good.  Cross another Diners, Drive inns, dive place off the list

eWg4bABAvucF19UQ9kGd3Q.text: How are their sandwiches so so good! Literally best I've ever had. Great price, lots of real deli meat. Usually busy but worth it! I love Italian delis but this is my fav by far!

d3AUTm3R8mG09ownGpRyPA.text: Simply amazing Italian.  I love that they have family history, and the store layout is more of a grocery with tables shoved into nooks and crannies, vs a restaurant layout.  The quality of their grocery items are unique and truly Italian.  I've spent some time over there, and this is the real deal.  You could have a field day in here if you wanted to cook a special dinner.  Yes, the wait was a bit for ordering at 2pm (it wasn't packed).  But the food...the food shut me up it was soo delicious.  The portions are enormous, so you get really good value for whatever you order.  One weird thing though: I clearly stated the YELP discount for 1 free cannolli, and the cashier looked at me like I was crazy and charged me for it.  The cannoli was probably the least satisfying part of the meal.  Other than that, I'd come back for sure.

S9xLACdPuRgPdTSWdT5Iyw.text: Honest to god the best beef cheese steak in America.  Philly has nothing on DeFalco's.    Superb chicken caesar pasta salad.    Friendly, competent staff.   Great grocery.  All three color Chimay beers for sale.  Gnocchi is excellent.

L0w0MnZdqsXHjUsTx5gm1w.text: Great little deli dine in martket.  I come here for a sandwhich or sub that's truly unique.  Yea you can hit up subway but ewwww!!!!  This place serves up some mouth watering examples of a proscuitto sub or eggplant parm that are STELLAR!!!  If you're a kitchen pro or a mad scientist their choice of ingredients in the market are inspiring for the next set of recipes!  Though the hours are a bit brief whenever you can catch this place open you'll be more than happy that you did.  Always a great suggestion for first timers and I'll definately be back for more!

WHlbUb5SNdXDKYfkNDo89A.text: In my opinion, Defalcos has the best Italian food hands down. My family has tried other local Italian restaurants and we always end up coming back.   Their Fettuccine Alfredo is to die for. And, I disagree with a previous statement about the garlic bread. I always order extra to take home. The portions are huge, so order 1/2 order if you don't want to take any home. Their clam chowder is also very, very good. But isn't always available.   I have friends in Awatukee that drive into town on weekends specifically to eat here.   They have a great wine and beer selection, we always like to purchase 2 bottles of wine.  Drink 1 with dinner, and take the other 1 home.     Calling ahead of time is recommended, because as others have said, the wait can get pretty long due to overcrowding of the restaurant. But, if you are looking for a fun, friendly atmosphere, this is the place. They have magazines out front and newspapers, so it is fun to go and people watch while waiting for your food. And remember... the workers are True Italians, so sometimes you might catch an argument, or someone giving a customer grief. Its all part of the experience and fun.

UxWE6RoCh7NMb5oyH8KN7Q.text: the best italian deli ever!!!!!!!!!  outstanding pastas' like lasagne, great raviolis'. sub sandwhichs' that are amazing. great pizza and also great desserts like great cannolis' and lemon bars.

an0bcvTH1YNS3R2fqD1aEw.text: This is the second time I've eaten here and it was as good if not better than the first.   The first time I had the meat lasagna and the second time I had the cheesesteak. Lemme tell you this is one of the best Italian places I've been to in Phx.  Defalco's has a very "Back East" feel to it and I love all of the authentic Italian foods they have there, especially the meat, cheese and fresh cold pasta counters.  Check 'em out you won't be disappointed!

lK6E48N9DtvSvrpQhL9-Yg.text: Great place for fresh Italian Sandwich. Rolls are killer. The meat melts in your mouth. Also a great little Italian grocery store. Only place if the valley where I was able to find Stella Doro cookies (for you East Cost people).  Nothing fancy, but cut little place. I've always gone at off hours as I've been told it gets packed,... I can see that as they only have around 10 tables.

neCcvukIDyvqnWGI6deKQA.text: Great food.amazing meatballs. Awesome portions for the price. Service left something to be desired

CEZjM32lAMH8jTb9o5zH-Q.text: I have never had any pizza, ceasar salad, or chicken parmesian as good as at Defalco's. Somebody once told me, "quality takes time" well let me tell you waiting an extra few minutes or so for this delicious meal was WAY worth it. The quality this place puts out is like nowhere else I've ever eaten, no other place that outshines it, can't wait to go back!

NWIddHDfSlR1fA3sq3W7YQ.text: Sssh, it's all oh so so so good don't tell anyone. Omg! Omg! Omg! The best Philly cheesesteaks (outside of Philly).... Cheese is melted and chopped INTO the meat... Had mine with mushrooms and a side of homeade italian wedding soup... Simply divine... Found a few torrone and back, a chunk of smoked mozzarella and scamolz to go! Felt I was back at the Philly Italian market... Now if they only had Italian rum cake (layered cake with rum creme) like you get at Termini's... That would definitely send you over the top!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesesteaks and Italian Wedding soup

e46ecD3KID0gX6e6j2EWbw.text: We didn't get a chance to try the deli, but the pepperoni was delicious and made some awesome pizzas at home.  The homemade sausage was delicious, lots of fennel seed, parsley, and mozzerella.  YUM!    They've got a great selection of canned Italian tomatoes, olive oil, pasta, olives, frozen desserts, meats and cheeses, balsamic vinegars and more!  The tomatoes (Cento) I bought were so delicious and flavorful... made a great dinner with bread, olive oil and pasta also purchased at Defalco's.  I'd definitely come back... I'd love to try the deli items (anti-pasta, salads, etc) and OMG the desserts looked amazing!!!

Nfg_F8_Y1uNV-KiIeY8UGg.text: Impressive Italian market with large selection of olive oils, vinegars, dried pastas, sauces, etc... They also have a large deli selection of meats and cheeses. The menu of prepared items is large and varied. I was on business travel and couldn't take home any of the tempting market items, but I did get the Il Purista sandwich and a side of the marinated Greek salad to go. Both were fresh and delicious. While waiting for my order, I checked out some of the plates being brought out to dine-in customers. The calzones are the size of a football and the meatballs are as big as tennis balls. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely visit again the next time I'm in town.

ky4az_qpGpabOSUPLQlFbg.text: Best Italian food in AZ hands down. Great place to take a date or grab a bottle of vino and relax. Would recommend this place to anyone!

MCl8apTG_ykQsCrO-h6jkA.text: Defalco's is my go-to spot for sandwiches in Scottsdale. I LOVE this place. Very good meats, and delicious sandy's all around. You can get some good beer here too, and every now and again I pick up a few groceries to take back home as well (pizza dough anyone?)   The biggest issue with Defalco's is consistency. On their very best day, this is EASILY a 5 star sandwich. However, they do have off days and happen to have them often. That's when you sink your teeth into a bready mess of a sandwich that leaves you feeling totally gypped. 3 stars for sure.  Mostly though, this place is quality and I would recommend it to anyone over the run of the mill "fast food" sandwich shops around town.

qaL6KeZPbuuC-HTBvQfHXg.text: Phenomenal food! The wait is a little long but it's totally worth :) fantastic people and environment!

u00CGt_E_y0ec_U289Chrg.text: Off the chainco's! lol  Today my friends and I pondered what to eat.. a good sandwich was was we decided on but where? Looked right here on yelp and it came up.. most the reviews were good so we went for it. WOW.  I like to ask for a knock my socks off never been here suggestion and he offered up the cheese steak, with peppers and mushroom. I went for it but was on the fence for my pasta side dish.. he handed me a sample of the tortalini and I was in heaven.  Service was polite, the place was busy but not crowded, it was clean, and very appealing to look around while waiting for our order.  Took about 10 minutes to arrive, not bad.  I thought the price was fair  and i could have went with just a half sandwich as it was very filling.  While eating my buddy joked the place was off the chain.. and should rename itself to "off the chainco's" lol  Highly recommended and cant wait to take others here.  -Shawn

zD2Se9xrJTXX7UiQn2bWkw.text: Love their food. Egg plant permesan was awesome and pizza is great too. It's a great place to pick up food if you don't feel like cooking for dinner.

MIFyEvoCBcvTi8FxRXItSg.text: Being from Chicago, I am pretty picky about my Italian food.  Defalco's may not be exactly what I am used to, but it certainly fits the bill.  Service was friendly and fun, nice selection of wines, meats and cheeses; some indoor seating for the lunch crowd and the smell in there is amazing...just like your italian grandma's kitchen when you were little!!  Call ahead if you are thinking of going for lunch, this place gets jammed at lunchtime!

Elu63iyyIBqf6M2wep0w1g.text: CHECK OUT YOUR TAKE OUT ORDER BEFORE YOU LEAVE THE STORE!!!!!!!!  We recently visited the store twice.  Food and service were great for the first time.    However, in our second visit, they forgot to give us the napoleon dessert we ordered, which is $4.99 a piece before tax.  We found out that after 10 miles of driving.  Called the store to ask for credit.  Nothing has happened, kind of expected, even though whoever answered the phone said will credit it back to us.    So while you think about how good their food is ....  Make sure you check out your take out order to prevent any surprises that you might experience later ........  We weighted the two visits and give them 2 stars.  EDIT:  Anthony, the owner, was nice enough to get in contact with us and let us know of their policy.  DeFalco's has a policy where if something you ordered wasn't in your take out order they will automatically credit you back that purchase and give you that same item for free next time you visit; a credit one give one policy.  Good food and good service.

M_OeZXWq4XbDXuRmNjQMYw.text: I had the eggplant parmisian sub thing. Holy god. I've only been there once and it was a long time ago but I remember thinking "Why am I such a super-human moron? Why don't I eat here regularly?"   Strangely, God responded. Some joke about me falling down the tree and hitting every branch. You know how it goes...   I did not experience the extreme wait times that other people mention but that would really annoy me depending on my mood. Yet another reminder I'm not self-actualized.

tc1fyMlOADBm_deELMmBAQ.text: Great Italian grocer and restaurant! Philly cheesesteaks, calzones and pizzas are all excellent. Check out the freezer section for Gelato and fresh pasta. The fridge near the to go pick up counter also has raw pizza dough if you are wanting to stretch it and make your own at home (fun date night). Not a 5 because the pizza needs to be eaten fresh, otherwise it gets soggy and a bit rubbery.

a23X6zCtk1zrTyvmDKoJQw.text: We visited DeFalco's on a very hot afternoon in Scottsdale Arizona while on the way to a hospital for my husbands upcoming surgery, so it was important to eat our favorite food and enjoy the food and atmosphere. It was perfect in every way. We were thrilled to find DeFalco's and enjoy the wonderful food!! We will enjoy eating there many future times.

dSZEfNA-XLpC3uOdh-9Txw.text: Do NOT order form here, especially by Doordash!!! This place is very rude if you are with Doordash. They tell you, we don't take your orders here!" And throw you into the line of 20 people, telling you that you need to wait there, then wait until everyone and their moms food is done then they might start yours, It took me Fifteen minutes to get there, they said they couldn't take Doordash over the phone, even though while I was there I saw them take orders over the phone!!!!! Then they tell you it's a solid 30 minute wait after ordering. Super rude service, terrible food, not worth it. Please do yourself and everyone else a favor and do not come here!!!!!!

4zYbocBpdKC5EgxzwaGTrA.text: This place is so good, sometimes staff is so busy you may think you are overlooked, just hang out and they'll get to you. Pizza fantastic! Great groceries too. The cases are loaded with your favorite Italian goodies! Friendly place, good parking but need more handicapped ramps.

SySo0ODGKlVNSSmau1GbtQ.text: This place is amazing. An Italian grocer, deli and restaurant all in one. And their food is amazing. I don't even know where to begin. The gnocchi is so good, love the alfredo sauce, pizza is pretty great, but my favorite is the arancini. I'd never even knew it existed but now I'm hooked. If I suggested one thing from there it would be the arancini (beef or veggie) with a side of sausage. It's a meal by itself and the stuff that dreams are made of. Dont skimp on dessert either. Their cakes are to die for and they have this gelato ball in the case next to the register that comes in a crispy chocolate crust that is insane. I'd go for the raspberry or espresso, but that's ur call. Just dont miss it.

snR-VjOwLYkeWMnLLSsN1g.text: Let me start by saying the is some of the best in the area for east coast styled Italian Sorry not a fan of the Chicago style Eating in seems to be less risky  However if you are picking up your order  do yourself a Favor and check everything twice they mess up my take orders far more often than getting it right Especially if you asked for any kind of deviation from the menu. But don't worry they will up charge you for the changes and then add insult to injury and f@$# it up. Just thought newbies should be aware.  Great food bad service Does anyone know of a place to get both???

CHiYzG5OChmWHpiRTufeZg.text: Just left this place 12/02/18 6:52 pm. First time was 2 weeks ago,got a pepperoni pizza. Pizza was okay just very greasy. I tried to give this place a second shot, thinking maybe it was  just the pepperoni. Nope! This pizza was worse. Got 2- 12 inch pizzas. One had sausage and bell pepper, the other was ham and heavy mushroom. Both sucked. I am being honest. So greasy yet dry. Both pizzas had no flavor! Still looking for the heavy double mushroom. Almost non existent on pizza. Yet was charged for the toppings. Not to mention girl at register had a real bad attitude. Dear owner, please hire staff that actually have customer service. My advice to cashier,if your not happy, find another job. I feel like I deserve a dam refund! Disgusting and 29. 69 less in my pocket for attitude and food that sucked!

uIKYN5ugyyH2aWOZXfF6UA.text: I pick up food from here quite often and it's really good. However, last nights meal was horrible. I almost always get Lasagna. I have the meat, my friend has the cheese. For both of us, the sauce was so salty you could barely eat it. In fact, we have over half of it left. My friends cheese lasagna had a big piece of meatball in it. The garlic bread had so many herbs on it, it was green. The parmesan cheese on it was overdone as well. The cheesecake order was messed up. I ordered Chocolate Caramel and Strawberry, but got Strawberry and plain, even though the container said what I ordered on it. I called and told the manager I was unhappy with the meal and his reply was it's the same recipe and he would check on it, but didn't have any other complaints. It might be the same recipe, it doesn't mean it didn't get messed up. I love salt, so if I say it is over salted, it was. Coming from 40 years of food service, the thing to do would have been to offer a replacement meal, but.....doubt if I go back unless they resolve this.

fik3vO2ZMFmWvhszhRgflg.text: We have been coming here since they were located on Thomas and 68th Street. The food is still great but it lost the personal touch :( we still go because of the food and buy pasta, ragu, and other yummy Italiano delights. Even our 7yo loves their food!

9rPkYj69ggQ6d_yI4jBG4Q.text: I got a half size spaghetti with marinara and boy oh boy do I wish I got a full size!! It comes with garlic toast and both the spaghetti and the bread were singworthy A M A Z I N G!!!   Both such simple things but made to perfection. Will definitely be coming back for seconds.

7PVdRrzvmjfc1js8g4qPQg.text: Great place with lots of options! No fuss feel to it. From Pizza to sandwiches, salads, desserts. Everything I have had is delicious. My favorite being the spinach and chicken salad with goat cheese and pine nuts! Huge salad, always fresh and a great price! For dessert I love the almond biscotti.   While you wait for your food there's a whole Italian grocery to check out. Stuffed olives, fancy olive oil, noodles, wine, they have everything. It's a fun place to check out with delicious eats. I also love that they do a punch card to show appreciation to their customers.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Big enough for 2 people. Fresh veggies and delicious chicken. The dressing is perfect.

Ak6GrGTRjYVWSOWOYWaV-w.text: This place is fantastic both for the quality of the food and the price.  Be prepared for a wait but it is well worth it.  You can do take out, phone orders or sit down.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ahkY5E4guMoRBLzxG7G0qg.text: This is our go to Italian spot! Everything is so good! We usually have a wait due to the amount of people that come in. But it's honestly worth it. You go up to the counter and order your food and then they bring it to your table. Everything is so good! My favorites are the chicken parm, pasta salad, and Italian beef!!! If you can TRY THE DESSERTS!!! The limoncello cake, cannolis and macaroons are Out of this world!!!!

IySQb6vUeir1bpDElEKTPw.text: After seeing that this place had Guy Fieri's approval on DDD, I was really eager to try....  Unfortunately it only earns a solid "mehh."  The sandwich bread is delicious (both the Italian sub and baguette). Perfectly crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. BUT the actual sandwich toppings were bland and the meatball sub had an awkwardly disproportioned sauce to meatball ratio (way heavy on the sauce). I also ordered a bruschetta sandwich (only supposed to have cheese, tomato & basil), but it tasted like some kind of deli meat..... weird.....   Wouldn't go out of my way to go back, but might stop by if I randomly happened to be passing by.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta sandwich. Awkwardly tasted like deli meat, but it was only supposed to be cheese, tomato &amp; basil??

xUSWrw8mhuxinqbpuBYHdQ.text: Absolutely amazing I've been going here for several years never been disappointed!! Food is amazing and affordable

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LBfXnb1DFkngGb4YhrLFKg.text: The chicken cutlet sandwich was awful. Unfortunately the chicken was frozen no doubt you can tell. The bread choices not good. Italian deli without semolina bread very sad. Chicken parm isn't legit, it's cut into tenders looks like Tyson chicken tenders. My advice to management is to go back to old style old school Italian cooking. Laziness and corporate making sauce like its coming out of the jar is never a good thing. The prosciutto is never moist and that's a problem as well. The specialities selections on the shelf are great but way over priced. It's Arizona Italian food. It is what it is

cKpywklnNBTfYfXPSX-x5Q.text: Always the freshest ingredients. Since it's a shop/deli, all the food seems made in-house. My favorite is the veggie pasta salad. Always the perfect amount of dressing. My husband loves the philly cheesesteak. My sons loves the meatball sandwich and my daughter loves the tuna. I have never had any issue with anything here. Perfect for any family dinner.

gc2wZkd4pKRrXRVnt3SQ7w.text: A pleasant surprise! I'm so excited to find an Italian spot that I love! The salad, pizza, and cheesecake were ALL so delicious! The best part is it's not far from my house.. we will definitely make this our go to spot for pizza! Unfortunately I don't have any pictures to share, because I was too busy eating! Next time!

_digqII70gGuc8U4g1pp5g.text: My coworkers and I came here for lunch, and I called with our order the night before (I was told it gets really busy during lunch, so that's a big timesaver). It took a little while for the guy at the pickup order to find our order and ring us up, so it wasn't too timely. We probably had to wait 15 minutes to get the food after paying for it.   The outdoor seating area was nice, and the food was good too. I was allergic to most of the menu, but it was my coworker's birthday pick so I had to make it work. My order was essentially the Ceaser salad minus the Ceasar dressing and cheese (basically lettuce + olives + grilled chicken + olive oil/balsamic vinegar). It was surprisingly super tasty. How do they pack so much flavor into grilled chicken?!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Caesar Salad&#34; minus the Caesar and cheese, plus grilled chicken and oil/vinegar. Surprisingly tasty chicken!!

_7SCMAluG2mcjN3rn-gP5Q.text: The food is very good here and I enjoy frequenting here. When it comes to service there is one person who has worked there a while that seems to be very rude towards customers. I'm not going to say his name on the Internet. This place has been featured on many tv shows and has tons and tons of great menu items of all types of Italian food. Just go there, decide quickly what you want to order, pay, sit down and they bring your food out.

isAnhH1SVktKOfB2N3KvXw.text: Wasent impressed at all with the service or the food !! First time here my little sister brought me I had the sausage sandwich and when they brought it to the table it was cold the sausage was good though!! We ordered drinks and they came after our food did which was odd !! We were hot and thirsty and wanted our drinks !! The service was really slow  and it just seemed like nobody wanted to be there !!  I'll give this place another shot and maybe next time  it will be different !! We will see that's why I gave it 2 stars

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dQoA_dzbGnUbrbajFdsp-Q.text: Heard about this place on Dinners, Drive-in's and Dives. So glad we came here as it was better than expected.  The meatballs are delicious and remind me of long ago days of my youth. Huge portions, we shared a meatball sub. Can't wait to come back.

OlnajZRJbVIPn_2fHy9piw.text: Good, but way too busy and not enough tables to enjoy lunch. If you don't mind standing in a long line to order, standing around waiting for it, and eating at a dirty table if you're lucky enough to get one, this is a True Italian deli.

Yuujssh-Mgq5WsWjGETKbA.text: We've been coming here for years and it definitely has changed in the last year. We ordered the whole Italian sub and it was so dry and the bread was so cold it was almost frozen. The lasagna had no flavor. The only good thing was the cannoli premade at the pastry counter. The service has gone downhill as well. It took over 40 minuets to get our food.  Their was no sense of urgency for an almost empty restaurant. If your looking for an authentic Italian deli this is unfortunately not the place anymore.

5Uc-w96VP29N_ruGCjfLsQ.text: I am eating my meatball sub, made with the finest Italian sauces and tenderized meat, but I then receive a call - a call that will change my life; I receive call that Tommy just got whacked in retribution for taking out Battis. But then I blink, I am back to reality eating my sub and listening to my friend asking how in the world Phoenix has traffic.   I am mixing up life stories, I had the meatball sub, and I've seen Goodfellas, so they are blending into one another.  Defalco's is great. I swear, from sea to shining sea, I never expected to find a place that would make me want to watch Casino and Goodfellas while eating something Italian. But AZ is a place of continuous surprises.   This place is half grocery store, half restaurant. Much of your experience will depend when you go here. The food is always delectable. Man, I am talking you could probably bring all of the mafia families down to a table to break bread and work out their differences over it good. But again, it depends on the time.  I gave Defalco's four stars and it was as hard as pulling an in-grown toenail. I do really enjoy this place, but there are some things you can't overlook. They have great foods and a wide selection of groceries to choose from, but it's quite small. Everyone is in love with this place so there are limited number of seats to choose from.   And the line situation is never clear. It's like Southwest Airlines where they have you line up according to your zone and seats, but people think because they are B13, that entitles them to run roughshoud over B14 and be rude. To avoid this - go at a non-busy time, but I am not sure when that is. Trial and error.  I recommend going here. It's finger licking good. I am not an Italian, so I can't speak for their cuisine, but I think it would make them proud.

tBANaVWFkCly5yVOLNbtEQ.text: Well, not sure why everyone is so excited about this place. I got the chicken parmigiana sandwich. Kinda bland, lots of tough dough, and the chicken looked real but it had a weird texture and was shiny. Loved the grocery store-deli part.

bPbgGS6yWgx47yE633fnew.text: Bomb food  excellent sandwiches and great service. Nice little casual spot with awesome food. If you haven't tried this place you're missing out! Anytime is a good time for Defalco's! You won't regret it!

iLFhMtjVzQYvfAdKOgsIZg.text: We ordered 3 whole eggplant parm meals to go plus baklava and a cannoli. Sauce was my favorite part! Eggplant was pretty good - should've come with a knife. Garlic bread was kinda stale. Side salad was really nice and included more variety of veggies than I typically get with a side salad. Wished the baklava had more layers of phyllo but good flavor. Cannoli was also good. We didn't order pizza but the pizzas they were bringing out for other people looked really good.

NlaxlmN4QAIN1fsi_DpCRA.text: Came here with my hubs as we waited for the oil in our car to get changed. The atmosphere is pretty typical to a regular deli, but there was also a nice positive vibe (probably because of all the happy full customers).There was a bit of a wait getting to the register and a solid wait after we ordered but it was totally worth it!  The cheesesteak was the best I've ever had! And my hubs sandwich was super fresh and delicious!   If you have time to wait and savor the deliciousness of their sandwiches, go!

58uNHGnmF8MU4D4997uILg.text: Everything is awesome here.  I had the pizza, salad, and sausage sandwich.  All delicious.

9rt6tqhy1d5V1Z7aCxT97g.text: My wife and I were craving Italian food so we drove to Defalcos.  We ordered linguine and clams and a Italian sandwich.   The linguine and clams were excellent.  The sandwich however was disappointing.  Whoever sliced the meats left the casing on.  Whenever you bit into the meat you had this stringy casing you had to remove from your mouth.  I brought it to one of the cashiers attention and they didn't seem to care.  I still love this place but it must instill better quality control in their workers.  I just hope this is a one off because if it is not the restaurant is doomed.

CcJ5alw0MtCJi8YXxNvE1g.text: My husband and I are obsessed with this place! We love the pizza and their subs! It's a good size and the prices are great! I've tried a few of their pastas but I'm not mind-blown. I personally like the sandwiches, pizzas, and the dessert. Their philly cheese steak is so so delicious! My husband loves their pizza sub. Also, their cheesecake and tiramisu are to die for and they are not expensive at all! I can't wait to have a date night again, I miss the tiramisu and sub. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed!

luax98Dli6iSi_rZm0ZQDQ.text: I have lived here 4 years and also visited my family out here growing up. Anyways I knew this place has been opened what seems like a long time. I told my aunt were trying it.....and it was sooooo good! Best ingredients with a long list of what Italian food you want. So I'll have to come back and try more. And the grocery store is great.

51qE2ZCZoPflWx5Lff030A.text: Seriously the best Italian sandwiches we've ever had. We're on vacation to Scottsdale and decided to check this place out because we saw it on DDD on Food Network. It did not disappoint! Italian Beef and Sausage Sandwich OMG amazing! We are in sandwich heaven! We also ordered a macaroon for dessert and it was to die for! We loved it all...definitely a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian Italian Sausage With Peppers &amp; Onions
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian Beef and Italian Sausage With Peppers &amp; Onions

bln5kBs0Ui6zcfSIsJ30hA.text: Gone downhill. Used to be great, everything fresh and homemade. Now it seems to be processed and different recipes. Sad to see it change.

f8FP7eQ-GH-MpFT3h4OVuQ.text: One of the best Italian Grocers on this side of town. I love all the Specialty Foods they carry especially their selection of sauces. I have chosen random items at DeFalco's and have never had an item I have it enjoyed. Can't go wrong with anything here there are just a few things that are priced a little bit High but are completely worth it

t-0vXFkAKwi1lyH1SH6UzA.text: While I agree the service is slow, it is worth the wait.  This was my first visit and I am so upset with my husband for not sharing this place with me sooner.  I had the pasta with clam sauce and it was delicious.  My husband had the II Purista sandwich and I could have at that one as well.  The bread is good a little rough on the outside but nice and soft on the inside...perfection.  Love the "market" inside, it make for waiting for your meal that much more exciting.

hG-TfqJYk1yJWMCCe9W2bQ.text: Always delicious and one of our favorite spots. Love the Bianca. Their salads are also great including the pesto and chicken with spinach. And they have a amazing ranch for their garden salads!

yG5YTwUwaDVHh-mIFbr48g.text: If you're in the mood for some good, but sloppy, Italian comfort food, Defalco's will do you good. They have pizza, pasta, salads and sandwiches, plus various desserts. I've only had a couple of their sandwiches and one of their salads. The sandwiches I've tried are the cheesesteak- bomb; the meatball - bomb; and the chicken parm - meh. I've tried their Chicken Spinach salad which was pretty good and filling. For dessert, try the Tiramisu which is pretty good - unfortunately, ours was still frozen but a couple minutes exposed was enough to be edible. Aside from the restaurant, Defalco's is also a mini Italian market where you can buy wines, bread and other Italian stuff. Be prepared to wait in line and for a table as it is a pretty small joint. All in all, this is a good place to go when you need a good sandwich.

B_TPzGBG_6o1nnOGmPdBdw.text: After reading so many positive reviews, my husband and I had expected better Italian sauce than that which accompanied the signature Italian dishes such as lasagna.  However, the sauce was over-cooked, almost to the point of having a scorched-like flavor - perhaps masked with sugar since it was overly sweet, as well.  The lasagna itself was decent.  The meatballs were bland with a mushy texture.  Perhaps, since we are from Cleveland - home to some of the finest Italian restaurants in North America -, and because my husband has labored for years to perfect his family's spaghetti sauce, we're too finicky.  If so, I apologize.

7A55ZrqYAiPAKVhyIEValw.text: Delicious sandwiches!  I've been here a few times and have had the meatball and cheesesteak sandwiches. Amazing!  The cheese they use on the cheesesteak really makes it.  Also have had the antipasto salad and it is huge!  Wife and I had to take the extra home for leftovers.  Only drawback is seating is very limited. There's an outside area so that probably helps when it gets a little nicer out. I'd try off peak hours.

7q9j47fGfdd1V2NSaZx8Gg.text: Had the Italian sausage hero, it took 20 minutes before I got it. It was dry just a small sausage with hardly any sauce. Staff was not friendly. Won't go back again

iV01q3o4E4_ncyhoznqr-Q.text: No ambience but great food, particularly the sandwiches. After one bite, you will think you are in the Taj Mahal.

sDYrQ37folUQZP-CxDuXbg.text: Love this place! My go to is always a sandwich but there really isn't a bad thing on the menu from pasta to deserts.

QV-0DDgR5VPuTL9bx6wvTA.text: Best spaghetti!  The people here are awesome!  Defalco's is a family owned restaurant and the food is great!  Make sure to try them out.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zbY1UBP3ZWt7bLx_icAy4A.text: This place is THE best place for Italian Deli sandwiches in all of Phoenix (but located in Scottsdale) the bread is incredible! It's definitely an institution! Just GO!

IIhXj2RY17-Pq21vZOVBTg.text: Great food ok service. Best eggplant parm sandwich I've ever eaten and I've had quite a few!  Real au jus not watery beef juice with the beef sandwich!!  Salads we bought were a bit pricey but they were delicious. Please comment and follow me for more reviews!

nxsF2viwwjh1dJn4xO51wg.text: goddamn.  defalco's is LEGIT. nader a. was going on and on about the cheesesteak, so i had to go try one. one bite in and that's what i texted him: goddamn.  step inside and it's like you're in a whole other city. defalco's is the kind of place you'd find on a random corner in a new york or chicago neighborhood, and we're all real lucky that for some reason it exists in scottsdale of all places. it's a REAL italian grocery and deli, the kind of place that is increasingly hard to find, but when you do you appreciate the hell out of it.  getting back to that cheesesteak with everything, it was amazing, perfect in every way: the bread, the way the meat and the cheese were working together to win me over, forever. i was so impressed that the next day, new year's eve, my wife and i drove down from north phoenix so i could show her what all the fuss was about. we ordered the meatball and the portobello mushroom, so that we could each sample a variety. we also got a side order of the mozzarella basil tomato salad (swimming in balsamic) and a slice of cheesecake.   the meatball was good (i really wanna try the off-the-menu reuben) but the portobello mushroom was STELLAR, and actually complemented the meatball sandwich nicely. the mozzarella salad was tasty, but that cheesecake was the best i've ever had, and i say that with full apologies to my own mother. i understand now why they used to use "cheesecake" to describe the titillating bits of those old pin-up models.  so yeah, great flavors, huge portions, great service, and an all around awesome place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. portobello mushroom served HOT
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. meatball sandwich
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. cheesesteak

CPUQP3kFHPZY_i3ZfDj8YA.text: Service is really slow. It took them 20-30 minutes just to take my order, and I was standing right by the register for to-go orders. They acknowledged me, but couldn't send anyone to help me.   I ordered a whole cheese steak and a whole meatball sub expecting two giant sandwiches but seemed to get 2 separate half sandwiches each at around 4 inches long. You could tell they made them separately since the meat tapered at both ends of each piece.   I was seriously disappointed at the size of these sandwiches for the price. I can't imagine spending $5 for one of these half sandwiches. They weren't even that stuffed full and the baguette wasn't very crisp, bordering on slightly stale. The take out box they gave me looked almost half empty with the sandwiches in there too.  The flavor of the meat  wasn't too bad though. The mushrooms were nice and the cheese sauce was really good too. It actually reminded me a lot of  the Uncle Sam's that used to be by my house. Better quality here, but I feel like I enjoyed the Uncle Sam's cheese steak more.  The meatball sub wasn't anything special to me either.  Not sure I'd ever really come back.

f6rIxS0Y9OWDbgSvAImjhQ.text: Second favorite Italian deli in Arizona! Friendly staff, amazing food, huge selection! Only deli I enjoy more is Guidos at Scottsdale and Shea, but that's besides the point. Be sure to call in your order around lunch time as it tends to get really busy! I would recommend Defalco's to anyone looking for a great genuine Italian deli in the area!

jpVlAulY_RqJ1CUrA41PCw.text: Best Pizza, Best Philly Cheese Steak!!!!! This place is just the bomb!!!!!!!!

i0AGBw_IfbqRqooNVIyfYg.text: LOVE this place. It is my "go to" deli and grocery store when I need that special Italian item I cannot get anywhere else. Italian wedding cookies, cannolis, pizzelles and coffees. Great selection of salads and pasta items in the deli.

M_fnPGCGeUHic_dV_WDJhg.text: Defalco's has an excellent variety of sandwiches and salads all rolled up into a cozy little Italian grocery. While the shopping selection is nice (according to my wife) the food borders on fantastic!   Seriously, even the greatest carnivores among us (like me) that normally scoff at a vegetarian entree will buckle for the the mighty Defalco's mozzarella, tomato, basil, olive oil and balsamic vinegar on sub roll.   The service is friendly but the shop can get extremely crowded during peak feeding frenzies. Try to go early or slightly late if possible, you won't be disappointed.

aBcTNdKiraVtfYC8YX2aSA.text: Love this place!  Have passed it many times and wondered...is a market?  Is it a restaurant?  Was happy to find out it's a bit of both. They have a menu of delicious sounding  sandwiches, salads, pizza, pasta...it was hard to chose.  Can't wait to go back!

fTdA4_U_al2O94dYwoqnLQ.text: Great good, good price, casual small market atmosphere. Definitely a unique and worthwhile place in Scottsdale.

pKUdtZ-eiPPWMXYRuHCxPA.text: Food is good, but the service is horrible.  Trying to order today, they were not busy, I was the only person in line and it took 10 minutes, largely due to the fact the counter person abruptly left and took several minutes to come back.  Did apologize, but the person that followed him out was obviously upset with a customer and stated so, loudly.  We've been there quite a few time, but to be honest, there are other delis just as good with service and employees who appreciate you coming in .

bkPGh-NPY2c8kkDpxlx3UQ.text: DELICIOUS!  Crazy assortment of Italian products in their grocery section too, that doesn't really matter though because I'd rather have them cook it.  Can't wait to go back

FjRX91OMjCFQcPDN9DSfiw.text: Great sausage and pepper sandwich, reasonably priced.

8O7rj6JCmOmx2o1XGdxklA.text: Sooooo happy to have found this gem!!! Authentic Italian food with a first class deli. Everything is extremely fresh and delicious! We stopped in for a pizza one night. We had the PIZZA BIANCA with pepperoni and mushrooms. Literally my taste buds exploded with goodness!!! I highly recommend that particular combo and pretty much anything on the menu. We came back a couple of days later and got a variety of fresh lunch meat and cheeses. All of which we are still enjoying. They unfortunately were out of canolis, however we tried the NAPOLEON which, no surprise, was delicious!!! We got a loaf of the fresh bread to go with our deli meat that still tastes as good as it did 3 days ago when we bought it, as well as the texture has not hardened. Absolutely worth 5 stars. Service: excellent. Food quality: excellent. You feel like you're being cooked a quality home cooked Italian meal and the owners are there to personally assure that you are being taken care of and that it is up to the highest standards. Go try Defalco's!!

pAhvD2etTqbZylvssvTmJw.text: I came on a Sunday, there was really no one here, and it was my first time here, so I asked the person behind the counter, what's your specialty, what's good?  He said, "pb&j sandwich but its not on the menu."  I didn't know whether he was serious or just trying to be sarcastic, so I laughed took the higher road. He didn't really offer anything and his answer was a little rude - my friend said it was really rude.  I ended up having the sandwich combo and my friend had the meatball sandwich, neither was remarkable nor noteworthy, they were just average. So not sure what the big deal with this place is? I have to wait and watch triple d to see if they recommend something better.

DooWMOTLEM3tvhkZyx7UcQ.text: This place is great! Expect to wait in line during lunch hour, but the time does move fast. I've had their turkey and meatball sub, and have no complaints. They also have a great selection of wines.

iQozqTXSohlvbRSNyMs3bQ.text: The food here is very tasty. I've had a sandwich and pizza and enjoyed both. Love that they have a market as well where you can get a myriad of Italian foods and  find some hard to find items.

x3HdVYGVcF5sCYJoaSZK-A.text: This place was so great! I was a little confused about how the ordering process worked because it isn't a restaurant-restaurant where you sit and order which is what I expected, but just hop in line, the menu is hanging above the deli counters. Speaking of the deli counters... Yum! The sausage and salami looks so good I wish I had bought some, maybe I will before I return to Vegas. The desserts are also gorgeous and delicious looking, I ended up getting the chocolate covered cannoli which was fantastic-the filling especially!   My fiance ordered the meat lasagna which was tasty and I ordered the portobello mushroom sandwich that was so perfect! The mushroom is marinated and has a real sharp bite to it and then you get the delicious goat cheese with it which just kills it.  We came because of triple d, and after our huge let down earlier that morning this place just shined even more!

LRXHdZT0fVF3y5KLDdfetw.text: I am sitting here as I type this.  My wife, her parents and I were visiting from out of town and decided to drop by an "Italian deli" for lunch.  Firstly this place is closer to a deli you'd find on New York rather than one in Italy.  In line, I heard two people order fettuccine Alfredo for lunch...   So, here's our order:  one prosciutto sandwich (one if the few Italian items on the menu),  one Italian sausage sandwich, one portobello sandwich and one cheese panini.  While I was ordering,  the cashier ( the owner) kept giving me an odd look...like "who do you think you ordering here?"  I also got a beer which was on display.  When I asked for it,  he didn't know what it was so I had to show him the bottle.  Also, the request to have a double espresso and tea made later seemed to give him and an associate all kinds of inconvenience.    Here's what we got: The prosciutto sandwich was good albeit a bit greasy. The Italian sausage sandwich was OK. The portobello sandwich NEVER arrived.  Instead we got another half of a sausage sandwich.  When I told this to the server, he said "If you want portobello I'll make you one."  No apologies no cares.   When it finally came out, it was bad. The cheese panini (which had bacon in it!) was nasty.  When I went to ask for a knife,  the owner said that they should be out by the soda machine.  I informed him they were not.  He screamed for 'Ernesto to bring out the knives" and told me "the should be out soon, I THINK".  Also got first apology of the day.  The espresso was atrocious.  It's beyond words how bad it is.   Really awful. Seriously.  Finally,  to add injury to insult, we were overcharged 50c .  This was explained as a computer error.  We got the money back.  Will NEVER return.

FFMvIRFG7DbV8eIRdins_Q.text: Always good.  One of the best places to eat in the Phoenix area.  I always get the Purista, which has a generous helping of imported parma ham (prosciutto).  Get it with sliced sourdough so the amount of bread doesn't overwhelm the experience.  They have an excellent wine selection and much to choose from for imported Italian foods.  It gets busy, so plan ahead and bring someone with you to grab a table while you order.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The sliced sourdough Purista in all its glory.
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Doubled up on the vino this time to avoid going back for more.  This is their Cabernet Sauvignon, Ca Momi.

LH1dXyU6fNl_73Sz_claCg.text: I guess I have to review Defalco's Italian Grocery now that Brian S has posted a pic of me loving up on a package of polenta...  Brian and I rolled across the street from D'Lish and grabbed a few things at Defalco's.  I had a half steak sandwich (a grinder if you've lived north of New Haven, CT) and I'm fairly certain it was the best steak sandwich I've had since moving to Phoenix.  Defalco's is the kind of place I really miss from the Boston area.  Down to earth guys, a variety of good Italian deli meats, salads, cheeses, a nice selection of Italian grocery items, and great sandwiches.  If only it were closer to my house I would probably be here at least once a week.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half a grinduh...good stuff

bx_iQF15HL0Zn_oDvG1P7w.text: Delicious little Italian spot on Scottsdale road. I usually order pasta here but would love to try some other menu items. Good thing I will be back soon!

sdhXdqMTFjFHOvg5UrnG3A.text: Love this little piece of Italy in the valley! Great gourmet deli meats and cheeses and Italian imports of all kinds- including gems like squid ink pasta and European Nutella. All the sandwiches I've tried are good, but I prefer the hot (usually steak with mushrooms and onions or sausage). The home-made raviolis are large delightful pillows of deliciousness, and the meatballs are nice and big. I sometime order one a-la-carte, and sprinkle on the peperoncino and parmigiano reggiano. For the dessert try the Napoleon!

hiSOnpGTTk5o-u3E8dvP_Q.text: Fresh, fantastic deli and market.  Their sandwiches are to die for.  I really like their fettuccine alfredo as well.  They are a little slow and the line is always really long so be patient when you go there.

20_Tii6xPMIyoBolhOBKGg.text: This place is great. Reminds me of the delis on the corners of NYC. Very authentic Italian food. Tastes wonderful :)   Only negative is that the seating is very limited, but I guess it adds more of a NY feel. :)

Gu0t4hmQ8O9DhIklnOMX3Q.text: OMG. I found Italian bread in Scottsdale.  I found a Jersey-style Italian Hoagie. (they didn't follow my exact phone directions but I am so forgiving as it was like being home). The pizza was okay as well. Tried a saled, no complaints. Pepper sandwich, great.  Tarimisu second only to Sals. And my friend ordered some Baklava which was fresh and flaky. I can pick up all my Italian cheeses and always find something I want to try.  They should perfect their phone orders better, but otherwise, it's like being in Jersey.

dOCcrb6yetJ7F0LFdaXnuQ.text: The food is absolutely delicious and authentically Italian! Good sized portions.  The staff is not as friendly as they could be but the food makes up for it; thus the 5 stars.

voKLN6nSCAmDIz4VgtE-Cg.text: Sorry, Defalco's - I have to take a star off for you always being so slow!  Really, every time I've been, there is a long wait - and your food is worth it, but isn't there a way for you to speed things up?  The register is old school and it always take forever to ring in an order... and then I have no clue what kind of system you use to prepare food and bring it out, but for the number of employees you have working, there's got to be a faster way?!  Bottom line - if you are not in a hurry, and you want some good food - go to Dafalco's!

w_dGQvVxSFax4i_eZu55bw.text: This is by far the best Italian place I've ever eaten at!!  This is the 3rd time I've eaten here and it never dissapoints. You have to try the steak and cheese sandwich, stuffed shells, and the chicken pesto pasta is a must! I'd give it ten stars if I could.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and cheese sandwich, stuffed shells, and chicken pesto pasta! Delicious!!

wxBZMlQSNt1HTHbm1dnxyw.text: Oh dear lord.... Thank you for the meatball pizza from De Falcos. Put it in your mouth. Right now.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball pizza. Mouthgasm.

klry-ZJfGpzOW9SAbzpyWA.text: I've been here so many times that the staff recognizes us for the frequency in which we buy their tartufo cake,  but I realized I've never written a review. Their food is great (I had their pizza bianca for the first time today, their cheese is amazing), and their chocolate tartufo cake is literally to die for. My boyfriend and I have a strict schedule in which every two weeks we go and pick up some of their amazing cake. The staff is super friendly and the food's not that expensive at all, highly recommend!

djCv3aZv3qJUEUXQ-hPlIQ.text: Great local Italian food.  Grew up next to the Defalcos and they are class acts.  You might spend more than what you're looking to dish out, but trust me - it's worth every penny.

y5_OXpYXDNMrn5M_zqWK7A.text: Yum yum yum. Sometimes you just need a good ol' sandwich. This is the place. They have amazing sandwiches that are great and delicious. I had the one with prosciutto (don't remember the name) and it was amazing.   It is also a cute little place to browse around and check out all the amazing Italian imports. Next time I try to go authentic Italian at home I will definitely be shopping here.

XS7uxOFarpZdwN7HKk3d3g.text: Food was Ok , pizza was so so, Pomo's is better, sandwich was ok jimmy johns and potbellys is better my girls baked ziti was good though,  Won't be back sorry... Not enough flava for this Dego.iiiii

gBNiZbaA98Is-8pXhf3QoA.text: Had to downgrade after a recent visit... Ordered the Purista to go; took ENTIRELY too long and when I got home to eat it, I was shocked at how skimpy it was!  And NO flavor either...had to dig through my pantry for some salt, pepper and balsamic.  There was exactly 1.2 oz of mozzarella on the sandwich (I weighed it) -- so I added some of my own to make it a REAL sandwich.  Should've. Just stayed home, huh?

7uqPe3ysROo0p0vmhSzmHg.text: Can't believe this place has been around so long! Was recommended and I was feeling optimistic and what a surprise another stiff joint! Maybe my expectations are high coming from the east coast there are so many good Italian places too eat. The food here is horrible. Had a simple pasta dish and the sauce/gravy was horrible. Everything was bad, including the bread! Can't believe the people find this place good??? I give them credit as they have the public fooled for some reason. Food is garbage. Save your money!

8TPFLVtBGF3lHwjX20pqpw.text: Wow!! This place is seriously a gem. Our family has been coming here for several years now and we've decided that this is the closest you can get to an authentic Italian deli in the East Valley.   My recommendation is the "Il Purista" sandwich--a basic Italian sub with prosciutto, basil, tomato, fresh mozzarella, etc. This sandwich is a game changer. The price is extremely fair and the size of the sandwich is perfect for leftovers.   Service is good and they always have call in orders done on time.   Seriously-don't miss this place.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Il Purista&#34;

trG5icW2SmzQhoSuZup6LA.text: This place was incredible. Delicious food, generous portions, good prices..there just aren't enough superlatives to describe this eatery.

0D__A1PkjvpG2pceebzLUA.text: Just go here and eat all of things!  Penne a la Vodka is definitely a main to try! The Arancini has an amazing red sauce it comes with.  As you would expect this place is very authentic and bonus points for picking out your wine and then eating your way through the menu!  We ordered so many mains to try that we ended up skipping dessert but this will happen when we come back!

pYBxBlJwIacZtrA4jAQ41w.text: Wow....give me on the meat and juices!!   Have had several sandwiches here, and they're all amazing.   Service is fine, and the wait can be long. Sometimes there is no seating inside, but we generally take it back to the office.

TjJtSYAXwsJzEQHfu6mtkg.text: New York Italian Deli all the way.  Never disappointed    Sausage and  pepper hero brought me back home.

eGBNCFiYrZQov41V7heQdA.text: You want authentic Italian in AZ you go to Defalco's!  When you walk in you get hit with the authentic Italian smells of Italy.  Their dishes are a mix of the old school and new school Italian and you can tell their recipes have been handed down for generations.  Their staff is super friendly and treat you like family.  Defalco' was also on the Food Network's DDD, so you know they are throwing out some amazing food!  The food is Phenomenal.  You really cannot go wrong with anything on their menu especially if it has their in house made sausage.  Here is what I recommend when you go to Defalco's:  Meatball Hot Sandwich: Comes with House made Meatball, with melted cheese on a sub roll.  You get the soft chewiness of the sub roll then there house made marinara sauce with the perfectly cooked, tender, juicy meatball, then the nice creaminess melted cheese.  Best Meatball Sandwich I have ever had.  Italian Sausage with Peppers and Onions: Made with in house made sausage, red and green bell peppers, onions, and melted cheese on a sub roll.  Another awesome sandwich that was on DDD (Diners, Drivins, and Dives).  Off the first bite you again you get the soft chewiness of the sub roll then the snap of the sausage casein loaded with spices, then the hit of the sauteed peppers and onions, then on the back end you get the amazing flavor of the house made tomato sauce and melted cheese.  Straight on mouth punch to the taste buds!  My Favorite Sandwich Chicken Parmigiana: Made Lightly fried and breaded chicken with melted mozzarella & topped with out home-made sauce on a sub roll.  Best sandwich on the menu!  Once again right off the bat you get the soft chewiness of the sub roll then you get the nice tender, juicy white meat chicken with the light crunch from the breaded crust of the chicken.  Once you get past that awesomeness you then get hit with the amazing home made tomato sauce and the melted mozz!  I am telling you its a must have!  If you are going to get an amazing pizza you have to go with the  Chicken Pesto Pizza: The Pizza is Grilled Chicken, Pesto Sauce, Cheese, Fresh Tomato, then I added sausage, and ricotta cheese.  The pizza crust is perfectly cooked.  Not to crunchy, but soft, chewy, pull apart greatness.  Your first bite you get that delicious crust, hit with the amazing pesto and fresh tomato, next the juicy tenderness of the chicken and the spices of the sausage, then you get the nice creaminess of the ricotta cheese on the back end.  There is a lot going on but you have multiple amazing flavor layers that your brain will thank you for!  You are looking for the most authentic Italian in AZ and be treated like an Italian family?  Go to Defalco's!  Welcome to the Family!  BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Pesto Pizza with added Sausage and Ricotta Cheese
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball Sandwich
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage Peppers and Onions Sandwich

yxuFkJV0tnanE3QOv9koRg.text: What a fantastic Italian deli. You wait in line for counter service and then bring your meal to the table the bread and the sandwiches is crunchy and extremely flavorful the pasta was extremely fresh and the sausages are so sweet. This is a little out-of-the-way gem .. Don't forget dessert and a large to go order

om9VyujWEV2OH6KNj0pp7w.text: BEST DELI ON THE PLANET ! After a couple of hit and misses on our meals in Scottsdale while here on a business trip we decided to take the advice of the manager at Old Town Cruisers where we went to rent bikes. And that was...come to DeFalco's Deli. The huge Capacollo, Hard Salami & Provolone sandwiches on fresh Focaccia Bread we had for lunch were probably the best sandwiches we have ever had. Sadly we could eat only half because we were already enjoying our beautiful cappuccinos made by Antonio. The freshness of the food, the outstanding service and incredibly reasonable prices made this place the highpoint of our few days stay in Scottsdale. In fact we loved the joint so much we came back later that evening for dinner. We shared the best 10 inch Calzone ( Centurian ) money can buy...my God it was good ! My wife being a very versatile cook has made calzones and makes them very well but not as good as these guys. And then we shared a giant slice of New York Cheesecake which was no doubt the tastiest Cheesecake we have ever had. We even took a tub of their imported gelato back to the hotel. It was a very unique flavor and I thought it was great. If we had known from day one how good this deli was we would have eaten here every day. As it is this is the only place we have dined at twice in the same day. This place is the best !

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. And it was only about 6 bucks. Very nice Italian Gelato indeed !

3EN-3mAr5pExbyh8gIQt3w.text: Now, when I finally digested the meal, holly-Molly it was amazing! Our pastas, gnocchi and backed ziti were delicious. On top of that, we have scored two free deserts curtesy of an an awesome kitchen personnel because my friend's order too way too long after mine came out. Thanks, to this guy at Defalco's. Watch me getting bigger and bigger, people, because I found my happy place P.s. the line is disorganized because there are three different registers on the way

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

__DUvmrU3ZQT4p_zcTu1ZA.text: I was extremely disappointed with my experience here. I ordered eggplant parmigiana and got a plate full of breading. The eggplant was paper thin with a ton of breading, I asked the gentleman at the front if that is standard and he said "yes, it's breaded..." ok well I know what I ordered and know it's breaded but why in the world is is 90% breading? No one offered to help make it right so I just left the entire plate of eggplant and ate the pasta it came with.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Paper thin piece of eggplant and a ton of breading

PuYQGzBzyGWVbm8HYcj2Bg.text: Love this place... authentic flavorful huge portions and not at all pricey. The staff all are great and nice .. it's a huge deli not another restaurant like this one. Claudia Delfalco has done a wonderful job with this Deli and has made locals happy with everything this Deli provides. Don't be shy about trying it ... if your looking for Authenticity in Italian food this is your place. Pay attention to how this place is operated and you will see it's one big family that care about the food this place produces. I will be back I always do. Thanks guys for being so wonderful.

LW0-T9kB9HnMhWmiCjX-qQ.text: Absolutely amazing pizza & pasta. I love the white pizza - I always get the large pizza so I have some to enjoy later too. Their alfredo sauce is incredible, and the gnocchi & pastas are done just perfect.

0vhtxjIciGQ6NMgfJiEJAg.text: My first experience at Defalco's was great. I visited with my coworkers and we shared a GIANT, delicious pizza, salad and some pasta. We were absolutely impressed with the atmosphere and the food. We all rolled ourselves out of the building with to-go boxes.   My second experience was definitely the opposite of our first.
