I took my fiance as a surprise for his birthday. When we arrived, the employee took our order, which we had to repeat a few times. We ordered my cheese lasagne and cappucino, my fiance's italian sandwich with olives and coors bottle and a cookie. We asked that the cookie and drinks be brought out.   We sat down and waited. The food always takes a while to come out, which is fine. The atmosphere is incredible, everyone is so relaxed. After about a half hour, our food came out - still no drinks. Our food came out and my fiance's food was missing his olives. So our drinks were still missing and his food was wrong, as well as our dessert.   My fiance went up to talk to the employees and came back extremely upset. He had asked about my drink, and our cookie and had been blown off by the employees multiple times, including one of them asking the other if I wanted a hot or iced cappuccino and the initial employee responding 'whatever man, just make it hot.' That lack of customer service, infuriated my fiance. Eventually the drinks showed up at our table. Still no cookie I had ordered. About ten minutes later, the initial employee that had taken our order showed up and delivered our cookie to the family at the table next to us, with two adorable children who were delighted by the surprise. They said 'oh thank you so much what a surprise.' I tried to flag him down, he ignored me and walked away.   After we finished our dinner, I walked up and asked the same employee if I could then have the cookie ordered - he looked confused, shrugged and asked another employee to help me. The only kind employee to help us the entire night, was then this employee, who seemed to pick up on the crappy attitude and service most of his team was giving to the remaining guests. He was wonderful, just kind, with a smile, offered me my cookie (I LOVE me some italian cookies) and even two because it was so late in the day, but I really don't need that much sugar - going to a late night concert.   We then had our cookie with the remainder of my cappuccino - gave our dishes to the very sweet busser, who also had a great attitude (the only two in the building) and left.   I am so extremely disappointed because after living in Italy for a year, it is rare to find such a fun establishment with a store, and great food with a lovely atmosphere. After such crappy service and treatment of my fiance, who was trying to correct my order, we will likely not return.

bovwNnzZO-7H1Hy0TWBe3A.text: First bite was southern Italian culinary bliss. Got the meat lasagna. Just ate my leftovers from last night. Just get the full size so you can take the rest home for lunch the next day. Comes with a wonderful side salad and garlic bread. These people are not stingy with anything (doesn't seem to be any corporate scales weighing anything in the kitchen). Just good old fashioned judging on the side of generous. The nice guy at the table next to us shared his cannoli with us...oh my God, it was really really good. No wierd overly sugary fluff on the inside, but some sort of creamy flavorful mascarpone/ricotta(?) slightly sweetened..with a crunchy flavorful shell.....who knew a cannoli could be so good. Going back soon to work around the menu. Considered not putting this on Yelp so you won't be standing in front of me in line...but they deserve a great review, and I would stand in line for this food. Yum.

5tZZHfawQpN7KC9l2Ecfyg.text: We love this place every time we come it the food is on point !!!!! Being from back east I live a good crusty Italian sandwich roll it's always perfect here. We had the Maximus and eggplant Parmesan  sandwich amazing

PA1ED8VQncYdxpaq0wmdlA.text: I don't think Defalcos needs another 5 star review but it just goes to show you how good they are. I've had them a couple of times and my favs are definitely the lasagna and calzones. There's something about the quality of cheese in these dishes that make you want to sit back and rub your belly in satisfaction. My ONLY knock on this place is the limited seating. I get it's a mom & pop shop but they should really look to expand soon. There just aren't enough tables. My advice: come during non rush times. If you're with someone else have them stand in line to order while you stalk the tables

0PoD0ac9o2yQTlilb33M9g.text: Such a great little eatery and grocery store. Their lunch options are amazing. I personally recommend their chicken pesto sandwich. It is my favorite! Be prepared to wait in line for bit, especially if coming over the lunch hour. It is a busy bee of a place. You can call ahead and order if you choose.

5D-QbZkpij86NKfJdPSFPA.text: The food and the deli/grocery store combination is awesome. The real Italian stuff. Limited seating if you want to eat in. Reminds me of some the Italian deli places in San Diego old Italy. Mona Lisa for one. Food is indisputable authentic. However if you want to buy any of the shelf  items they are covered in dust. Kinda a turn off. They need to do a better job on cleaning their shelf packages. Other than that. Buon appetito!!

jMA94KIMj_6CMgB9AfzHUg.text: Delicious! Meatballs, calzones, pizza oh my! The best of the best, I will most definitely revisit this gem again.

7Rl9B58kc9YRC8sDf6bpxQ.text: Amazing. Authentic and outstanding. Expect an outrageously long lunch line, although they move it quickly. The employees are kind and friendly. The deli has amazing meats, breads, olives, pastas, etc. perfect desserts and delicious coffees. This may be the best authentic Italian in a casual setting in Phoenix. I'm Italian and from Chicago. This place tastes like home. Don't miss it!

SJ1zShrd9ektoZj_W6LvJg.text: Long lines, but so worth it. Sandwiches are so good. We just got a half sandwich, and couldn't even finish that! And the pastries are the best thing about this place.

H8AQOsEOOtLk0OyBPRndSw.text: One star for crappy customer service. I told the cashier girl, literally 20 minutes ago as I post this, that I wanted pasta salad. She said which one...I said I don't know the pasta salad with meat and cheese (it wasn't labeled correctly!! And everything in the fridge is all over the place). So I took a guess at which one since it was under that label..I ended up with tortellino salad (or however you spell it)  instead of what I wanted. But is it my fault it's on the wrong label..she wouldn't even take 3 steps over so I can point to which one. Common sense that if a customer continually points to what's in the fridge and says I don't know the name (because I was quite sure the label wasn't correct), why don't you as an employee take 3 steps over so we can both make sure we are correct. Don't just ask me what it says..because I was hesitant as fuck because I didn't think it was correct since the fridge looked a mess, either way i said the label it was under.   Also add more milk substitutes..first of all milk from a cow is disgusting and gross and filled with hormones, so no one wants to drink that.  Add almond milk, soy milk, or coconut.

CPbs9JcyWEmDiDKv5EvC-A.text: I'm so glad I finally made the trip and it did not disappoint! We ordered a pepperoni calzone, meatball and garlic calzone, Caesar pasta, tortellini pasta, Greek salad and strawberry cheesecake. The food was amazing, homemade and fresh. I recommend this Italian deli to anyone in the mood.

YM0nBxIOq7Z1FokTBemx3w.text: This place has a very nice inviting atmosphere and feels really mom-and-pop.  They also have a few racks of groceries that you can look through and purchase from.  One of these days I will buy cannoli shells and make my own cannolis!  In the meantime, I think I'll just order their food.  This particular time I had the bruschetta sandwich, which once I saw it I kind of had to laugh at myself for ordering it.  Bruschetta is kind of just like an open face sandwich, so to make it a sandwich you just have to close the breads over one other and boom sandwich.  And that's pretty much what mine looked like.  Honestly, I was a slightly disappointed by how mine looked especially next to my dad's chicken parm., sandwich that was jam packed.  However, I will say, my sandwich was pretty darn good and was very favorable and even though I probably won't order it the next time I visit, it won't be because it didn't taste good, because it tasted very good.  Rather I will get something else because it all sounds so good!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta Sandwich

dnQZ_cgiF5zvJuAJf2CCbw.text: First time at Defalco's and gotta say we were disappointed. It took us 30 minutes to get our food (1 pizza and 2 pastas), and when it came out all 3 entrees were lukewarm, like they had been sitting there for a while. The gnocchi was over-cooked and mushy and the pizza was soggy. The atmosphere is cute and warm, and you get a lot of food for the money. But it doesn't make up for the cold food and slow service. Not very impressed with the place and likely won't be back.

1dBNYS3j9mdOCVS5PHDfdQ.text: I love Defalco's! It has never steered me wrong. My favorite menu item is the beef cheesesteak! And a cannoli for dessert. It's always busy during the lunch weekday when I go, so expect a bit of a line, but worth it. You can shop for your Italian food/ingredients here as well. They do sell beer and wine by the glass/bottle, and they have a great deli selection of meats and cheeses. Skip the line by ordering in advance to go.

5ica6rGSYV0PhqKDvZ1vug.text: Let me start off by saying the food here is delicious and authentic. My only gripe about this place is the long wait times. I waited about 40mins this last time. Other times I have been here are shorter, but still longer than other places. I've had the centurion calzone and meat lasagna and they are delicious. The calzone's bread has a just baked feel and the mozzarella cheese is amazing. A ton of flavor is packed into the calzone. Really you can't go wrong with this choice. I enjoyed the lasagna and it tastes like you would expect it to. One of the better lasagnas that I've had. I also tried the tiramisu and it was rich but not overwhelming. Very airy and chocolatey!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Centurion Calzone

fsGXwXtAlf_eT_e6IDWdQA.text: Great find.  Little Italian deli and marketplace.  Food was great. Huge portions.  Ingredients are fresh.  10/10 would recommend.  Sandwiches, Calzones, deserts

gAFFJz5l8d-FHYDLXlqe1w.text: Amazing. I ordered the "Maximus" with a seafood pasta side salad and traditional cannoli. Awesome. This is on my list going forward. Taste buds are happy. Good selection of infused teas also. Love it!

ZJuXMGmUd4D2cs-GVIk2Ug.text: Great deli and Italian market. Gnocchi, sammich's, gelato and various other boot country fair. Be prepared for a wait this place is kinda slow and very busy, but that's because it's good!

uGbdrL9MBrlEFdh6UAho-w.text: Do I even have to explain... BEST and most authentic Italian in Scottsdale, with decent prices. Would highly recommend the chicken Parmesan or chicken pesto, SO WORTH IT.

BbJWlQRUPGFxnlZbgpdrLA.text: I had a bruschetta open face sandwich basically all it was was ham A ham sandwich had  maybe one little piece of tomato on each slice.was hard pressed to find  any mozzarella on it.  We also had a Portabella mushroom sandwich was way too much bread.. it really looks like a fun place to eat just wish it was better I will try one more time maybe it was just an off day.

-dhicetzsIz99phScaGOPQ.text: Great grocery for tons of Italian goodies and desserts. Calzones are amongst the best I've ever hard. Prices are fair and the 10 inch calzone is large enough for feed 2.

KXEjB1MrLpmlypt6Cj_3yg.text: This Italian Deli / restaurant is a must try. It has the best Italian food. Everything on menu is great. Can't lose here. Seating is limited but worth the wait. I would give this 10 stars if I could. I drive from north Glendale just to get my fix when craving Italian food.

gfOr_1DlOsrbq03L7urRRA.text: This place is a little, not so hidden anymore, gem. I first saw it on one of my all time favorite shows Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. And if it's good enough for Guy Fieri it's perfect for me! It's such a cute little grocery store with all of these treats and ingredients straight from Italy. There's so many types of pasta and wine to choose from it's almost overwhelming but in such a good way.  I've had just about everything on their menu and everything is always so perfect. So flavorful and mouth watering.  The subs, the pastas, the pizza and the sides everything is wonderful and so well made. Plus it's family owned so you know it's made with love.  Their dessert selection has a few different options everyday but the baklava is always my go-to it's so good not overly sweet, perfect combination of flaky from the pasty and sticky from the honey it's fantastic.  If you live in Arizona and have never been here you MUST try it!

zdCuEiKWrnmupbqWr5vgjw.text: Best steak and cheese I've had in years. This delightful east coast sandwich is rarely prepared well in this part of the country. I came back for another and will continue to frequent this place when I'm in town. I had the Uber take me here in the way to the airport. It's a great classic Italian deli and reminds me of my New England roots. Highly recommended.

I1iZwUbiBpx8x4dBe_o1Iw.text: Great sandwich. Salami and turkey super fresh . Enough to share if you order a full sandwich. Great selection of pasta dishes. Will return to try more . We got the chocolate dipped cannoli and heart cookies, both were delicious. The original owner was there . He was super sweet, talked to me and my husband for a while. Nice guy ! Go eat there ! You're going to love it !

05fVtVriRCKkoyUUewIIDA.text: Now this was definitely a new experience. A restaurant within a small, neighborhood type grocery store. When I way within I mean within. The tables are set up within the pockets of areas that they fit, next to the shelves of food, by the door, next to the kitchen , etc its really homey and a neat idea.   You go up to the deli counter and order. The deli counter has a huge variety of salads and sides within out for customers to see, which all look amazing by the way.   I tried the meatball sandwhich, tomato and mozzarella salad and Greek salad. All amazing!! The bread used for the meatball sandwich was crispy but soft on the inside. Meatballs were a generous size and full of flavor. Loved the tomato and mozzarella salad with basil and a balsamic vinegarette dressing.  Craving that again!!  Super cute spot, check it out if your in the mood for Italian yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lLPIBUlZH8dntLS5g6h1lQ.text: Great prices, great big portions (enough to take home and save for another day), and a huge menu where everyone is bound to find something! As a vegetarian I was so happy to see FRIED EGGPLANT SANDWHICH!!!! Everything I have had here has been amazing and my friends all say it's the best philly cheese steak sandwich they have had in a long time!!!! I always take potato salad to go!!! Can't get enough of this place!!!

7XB51Ov8dxbrdcp0IdghFg.text: The Salted Carmel gelato is a must! Do yourself a favor and take a ride on the magical euphoria train with each delicious bite!

BUKXYzefNohnARKLD5G0Jg.text: I really love this place. I love the pasta, pizza, and sandwiches. Basically I love everything, including the imported Italian goods I can't usually find at the local grocery. Their wine selection is pricey and I've found the same wines for much less at Total Wine. Tip: call in your order because you might find yourself eating outside on a very hot day if it's too busy.

fjM83SMlh2Zl3x9csA37gA.text: This is one of my favorite casual Italian places to eat. Love their pizza and their Italian homemade sausage sandwich. I also buy all kinds of breads and cheeses there. They have good ricotta cheese which I use for my own Italian cooking and desserts. They also have a market and a meat counter where you can buy specialties. You can also buy Italian ice cream there...love the food and love the market!

e28lD_y7Bgi9vfUQ5aj3iQ.text: Other than an occasional excessive wait time the quality of product here is unmatched. Defalco's has the best grinders and cheese steaks around, plus they offer fine-dining quality pasta dishes to eat here or take with you. They also have a mini Italian grocery with a variety of meats, cheeses and olive oils.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7tq3JzpzVfvAPDf_AK3TEg.text: We decided to try Defalco's after seeing it on DDD.  The grocery store is stocked with lots of Italian goodies (pasta, sauce, cookies, olives, etc...)  We ordered:   1. Il Purista (5 stars):  VERY flavorful and packed with lots of yummy prosciutto!  2. Calzone (4.5 stars):  Pepperoni and spinach.  Takes a long time but well worth the wait if you like lots of "bread".   3. Pizza (4 stars): 1/2 Margarita and 1/2 Mushroom.  There is no fresh basil on the margarita pizza...disappointing :(  Overall, the food was good and we love the hole in the wall joints so we'll be back the next time we are in Scottsdale!

gwU-PvyBQWzNOu0uU-xsvA.text: Been coming here for years.  I've never seen so many unhappy employees. Smile once in awhile.  I bought a cold combo Italian sub. Huge nice tasty sub roll with literally 1-2oz of meat.  Supposed to have mustard-none, sparse amount of Italian dressing. Over $ 9.00 and a 25 minute wait for my to go order.

HZarsdY3Oib4Hrpk4V1iEA.text: Yep, Like they all said, quality food @ reasonable prices. This is Phoenix, not Chicago or New York with great neighborhood places everywhere, so we're lucky to have Defalco's. Been going there for about 20 years since they were on Thomas. My only complaint is the bread seems to have changed. The Baguette seems more like a regular sub roll where it used to be much more crunchy.

F75vPO1ra43srcyjFEAMBA.text: Been going here for years and it's the best Italian spot I know of in Arizona. Fresh homemade pastas to cook at home, pizza, sandwiches, deli, anti pasta, and all sorts of side salads. I've tried almost everything and it's all delicious. Everything is super fresh, and they'll make anything you want. It's always a tasty Italian experience with a great local business feel. Everybody I've brought here has a great experience as well.  The only thing that is tough is it gets super busy at the popular times, so it's tough to get a seat if you want to eat there. Other than that I have no complaints.

nC5mJBz4m6Vh6IkYSUDzTA.text: This place is fantastic. Went with my family and everyone got something different. No one had any complaints about anything. I had the beef cheesesteak and wow. Sooo good! Highly recommend it!   You have to get a cannoli as well. They are legit awesome!   Can't speak any higher about this place. If you visit Scottsdale and don't go here, you're missing out!

GKYHF1bB6MJ3DkepQTmpiw.text: Good food but not worth the wait. Took over 40 minutes to get a sandwich. If you are hungry don't expect to get your food anytime soon

u6dZ1FYYbGaCbQctd3MUBg.text: Dear Yelpers.... thank you, thank you, thank you.  If it wasn't for you, I would have never found this hidden little gem.  Food was amazing... and I'm super picky about my Italian.  Service was fabulous and I just had an over-all wonderful experience here.  Anytime I am in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, I will be here again.

FWC9tuj-RKYTQM7Xv9HGkg.text: The first time I went here I loved it. Every time since it's been worse. Slowest staff I've ever seen. There was no line and it took me 36 minutes to get them to cut me some deli meat. The tall Italian guy acts like it's a problem to help you. This place is going downhill. I ordered a meatball sub the other day and it came out cold.

AGCB-JaZ7If-Y-mxsL9CMQ.text: Let me start off with I am foodie and I normally don't right reviews unless it is extremely good or bad. This meal deserved a review it was so good.I had the fettuccine and Alfredo with the beaded chicken. This was the best I have ever had! This meal was not even in the same league as other Fettuccine and Alfredo dishes. Though the wait is a bit longer than wait I expected, the wait is well worth it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fettucine and Alfredo with breaded chicken.

2eoZmtzwRg87mMCQif9HRw.text: Absolutely delicious. We have ordered calzones quite a few times and have never been disappointed in the slightest. We have even bought their dough and made our own pizzas and calzones. Ours didn't do theirs justice but it was still fun and tasty. The only thing I don't like about this Italian gem is it's pretty chaotic when you go in there. But that can definitely be overlooked with food this amazing!

UON8dwVNs5mNv7pkPX_5TA.text: Very busy place. Nice selection of products to buy but very little seating space to actually eat here.  Cashier had problems with computer so only one cashier available.

-c5XPa2-dxAbjXR9k_Z4uw.text: I have only had the cheesecake, but it was soo good I made a ridiculous video on how great the Cheesecake is! Enjoy: 1drv.ms/1M0VE4C

o7V8QbK0TGmSXqHMZcUw3A.text: I forgot how scrumptious this place was while I was on vacation going to spring training baseball games a few years back until the owner was making food on the food channel the other night....Unreal fresh food with large portions,super fresh giant calzone I powered down was the best ever. Lots of places in New York have great Italian food but you can tell each dish here is custom with just the right amount of seasoning and sauce.everything is custom.

YS4KPoPOIHA41kzvMX7nuw.text: I only come here for their ready-made pastas to go. My favorite is the chicken cesar pasta - Yummy! I suggest you call in your order because the wait times can be long.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesesteak with everything

Z4T5xWs2wXwMI0BBBhiDMw.text: How can you not love Deflaco's! We have been going for years and everything is so good and the service is great. I had a 1/2 ham and swiss sandwich with a side of red potato salad and my boyfriend had 1/2 turkey sandwich with a side of mustard potato salad. The 1/2 sandwhichs are such a big portion so it's plenty and the sides were also pretty good servings. I love the grocery portion of store as well!

fqDcQ0lV1n68xtFUVLJGpA.text: It's lost it's flare years ago best Italian deli hands down these days the staff is slow and the food is the exact same heavy on the sauce all the same salads sandwiches decor blah over crowded with stuff everywhere and the price per value has gone way up maybe because diners drive ins and dives did a show there a few years back not my favorite but you may like it

QD5axsARWPWZdoaHzJJVTg.text: Awesome Awesome Awesome! We are in love. This place has the best sandwiches & food for someone craving an east coast excursion of Italian! They have a full service deli & grocery, so you can take & make your own Italian creations if you want. I got sausages one night & it even made my cooking taste good! The prices are amazing too. For about a quarter more than you'd spend on your "five dollar footlong" you can get the real deal. If you want food in a super hurry, go somewhere else. They make everything after you order, so you might hafta wait, but the seating is set up well. You can still feel tucked away & watch TV until they bring your food over. I turned some friends from Connecticut onto it & also some other New Yorkers....now get your butt over there & eat some real food!   :)    PS, their chocolate (mousse type) cake will change your life!

URTO7K5AuDMJDfAqSIxnHg.text: This was my first visit and they were pretty busy, but the wait wasn't too long. There was still seating available so that was good. I shared a full sandwich with a friend which we were told it was 12 inches, but it seemed smaller than that. It was very good though. I recommended this place to a client and he loved it as well. I will definitely go back as they have an extensive menu to try.

yfEEGIzQRNguLksc9kxUoQ.text: I have been to Defalcos about 4 times, I really like the atmosphere, it is relatively comfortable although kind of small and I have only been there at off times so they have not been busy. They do some times take a long time to fulfill your order though.   I have only had the subs there, can't say a deli is the place for pizza. Had some of their cappuccino  and  I can say their food is good but not great or anything to really rave about. Actually I found their cold subs are better than the hot ones. The hot ones are rather bland to my taste and really lacks anything special especially the bread and I have tried 4 different types, there is little seasoning. The subs ingredients are plentiful, they do put a lot of quality ingredients and yes they are better than the chains so they may be a couple of dollars more, it is worth it. It really is good or a little better than average and I do not consider the chains average. All in all, I would recommend it for their quality and also they have a good  plentiful selections. Does not blow me away and I usually like it here for the atmosphere also, so the two combine is not bad.

5AC4WPiYCjCRuRdj_0EeRg.text: I work close by and a friend recommended them.  i have been there 1-2 times a week sense.  Everything I try is great.  Don't be in a rush though.    I use to drive 20 miles to get a good Italian Beef sandwich with spicy sausages.   Now I just go 5 minutes for a great one.

rYbxNTiJ4CuJqNeuCzrPzA.text: If you've never been to Italy, don't panic- you can go to DeFalco's and taste the real taste of Italy in the middle of gross AZ. Everything is absolutely authentic, legit Italian. Homemade tomato sauce, pasta, pizza- you name it. Even the owners are homemade Italians, if you know what I mean. You can also purchase Italian-style groceries (pasta, sauce, wine) so you can take home to cook and pretend you are a cool Italian.   I recommend the ravioli if you have even an ounce of attraction for ricotta cheese.

lbymiMEDnJmeueFjdIv7Ng.text: I've been here a few times and always been so impressed but keep forgetting to make a review. I feel like I say this in all my reviews lately but I'm pregnant and so really when I'm craving something, it's so specific and I end up building it up to be the best thing in the whole world and then when I get it I'm disappointed because my expectations were way unreasonable. Well today for lunch, I wanted Italian beef. I've had the cold Italian combo sandwich here before and a few other subs and they were always great. The artichoke salad is really good too.   I ordered over the phone to avoid the lines... half Italian beef sub with provolone, and a side of Giardinara peppers. I went to pick it up and it was ready right away, and for everything it was only around $7. I read in another review that they don't dip the whole sub, and I like mine really juicy, but I figured I'd still try it. Well they provide a side of au jus so you can dip it yourself, so that was exciting. I got back to work and started eating... omg, it really was so so good. With each bite it tasted better and better. The hot peppers I got on the side made the sub though (I think that's what I was truly craving all along). It was hot and juicy and the au jus was more than enough. There was a lot of meat, which was tender and perfectly cut, not a singly fatty piece and it was all evenly distributed on the sub. Sometimes I have to rearrange my sandwich to even out the meat but this was perfect. It was so good. I was really full by the time I finished but still wished I had ordered a full. The only negative thing I would say is there were too many onions and green peppers for my taste. However, I'm not mad about that because I'd rather there be too many and I can pick some off rather than not have enough and wish there were more.   The guy that always takes my phone orders is seriously the nicest guy ever. (I think his name is Joe?) He's so pleasant on the phone and just as nice in person. He'll give you his personal recommendation if you have questions and he'll help you make decisions if you're super indecisive like I am. I love this place and would highly recommend it to anyone. They have such a wide menu that there's really something for everyone!

Cy7hwVjIt5vCIMm-2i9VNA.text: Love love this place I'm originally from NY and usually we had our favor spot back home. It took us sometime to find a similar or better place here in az but this place is great everything is good n I mean everything

xYLbMkPsg80Wr6paRTjnXw.text: This was a random surprise. It looks like a market but then we realized that the restaurant menu and ordering area is in the back , with the tables interspersed among the grocery isles. The market itself has a great selection of pasta, sauces, biscuits, and wine. The food itself is great.  The menu was huge and I kinda got lost in it so I ended up ordering a half turkey and provolone sandwich on nine grain, a cup of minestrone soup (which came with bread) and a side meat ball. The sandwich was good, it wasn't the best but good for the price. The minestrone was yummy. And the meatball was AMAZING!!! My fiance had the cheese steak sandwich, which was very tasty, but the clam chowder was pretty bland.   The wait was a bit long, but we really were not in a hurry so it was not a big deal. Also, the salads looks great. The next time I come here, I'm definitely getting another meatball, maybe try one of the other hot sandwiches and one of the salads.

FLFwZbUOEfUbJx0nzFyPrA.text: Love, love, love this deli in my neighborhood.  The authentic selection is amazing, I usually get the Italian sub and rarely wandered.  However, when we saw one of the pizza's being set out a couple of weeks ago we just had to try it.  Got a 16" to go and it was amazing.  My boyfriend actually said this might be his favorite pizza place now (he's an aficionado).

uGBfINtan43yVnPvwiCU0Q.text: Good food, reasonable prices, ok atmosphere, but very rude employees who act like they are doing you a favor....except for the one guy at the register.

fzn2Ot35q1cRO7w55TF-Rg.text: We went to Defalco's after going to Italy, and were mostly looking for the Italian Lemon Soda that we had on our trip that we can't find back in the US. While they didn't have Lemon Soda, they did have delicious Italian food. It is order at the counter, and they have a few tables inside.

7LROJHWjoq96I7Md8LIbQg.text: Defalco' s the best in Scottsdale. Great sandwiches. , calzone's and every other Italian delite you could think of.  Reasonable price's but most of all geat food. Love this place.!!!!!!

RbojWzw2rm-OkshiexerjA.text: Great food, good service, wonderful groceries! Pure Italian!

wj9nAHcLkZ3B86BQb3fk4Q.text: Really the best to deli to eat at. Their food is always great and you never wait for long. They always have an A grading for food safety. Outside seating is nice as well. Really nothing bad I can say about this place.

HKwawm4giQT2cr9oAh8Z5Q.text: I know, its annoying to all you AZ peeps when I say, "I grew up in NY with good food." I accept that it is impossible for you to understand what it is like to rarely have bad bread, bad cold cuts, bad service or just plain have a place that isn't trying staying around. Of course, us east coaster's are leaving out all the corporate places; the same Chili's, Applebees, Boston Market...etc stores are back east as well (most of them) and they suck just as bad there as they do here. What we mean is that the places that everyone goes to in our old neighborhoods are like Defalco's.   Defalco's is like no other place I have been to here in AZ. They have amazing food, great bread, Boar's Head cold cuts, and italian groceries that I didn't even realize I couldn't find until I saw them here. Amazing...just amazing.   They have chicken cutlets. NO ONE IN AZ HAS THESE! It is kind of ridiculous that an easy to make, menu staple (in the east) is impossible to find out here. I have seen them on menus, they were actually chicken tenders. Cutlets are chicken breast, breaded with Italian spices and egg, pan-fried and then baked. Defalco's has awesome cutlets! They use them on their Chicken Parmesan sandwich as well. That blew me away!   They also have Dilusso Genoa Salami, if you haven't had it...you haven't had salami! This gem of a store is a constant stop when I am anywhere near it, or have family visiting. If you haven't been...just go!  Side note: If you are expecting to be told what is on the sandwich, give up eating sandwiches. When you order, tell them the things you enjoy eating on bread, they'll assemble it, bring it to you and then you eat it. It ain't Quiznos or Subway, this is good food. If you can't figure it out, walk away and eat crap, come back when you know what you like!

prjfVwQ8-PASW50oleEKEw.text: Found this place 5 years ago while searching for a deli with my friend and have been coming back ever since!  Hands DOWN the best deli in the Valley. Possibly in all of AZ. A real taste of NYC and worth any sort of wait (not that bad except for lunch).  I recommend any italian cold cut, Meatball sub,Turkey or chicken parm  Have yet to try the pizza but i would assume it's bomb-diggity!  OH I ALMOST FORGOT ABOUT THE CHOCOLATE CANOLLI!   you can tell this place excites me!

kT3Pvmn2fIjbdSYEJ2a9rA.text: It doesn't get more authentic than Defalco's. I come here for everything! Wine, homemade pizza ingredients, pasta, gelato and of course their sub sandwiches. My favorites are the Philly Cheesesteak (unreal, I don't know how they do it) the Purista and the Portobello mushroom sandwich.

Htf8QPBJj2PQ5dxXbz7RoQ.text: I've never had anything that wasn't absolutly delicious! Great Italian food and if you are in the mood to cook, they have it all for a perfect Italian meal! Try the take out to impress your next dinner party!!

LDfEcm1H4yMAhLYncT1B_A.text: My boyfriend and I's go-to-spot for delicious Italian dishes. My current favorite is meat ravioli or gnocchi with their vodka sauce (incredible!). Their Philly cheese steaks are also delicious!

eKQCHbBiPMAx-eIRxDlxYw.text: What can I possibly say?  Everything they serve there is wonderful.  The selection in their little grocery section is inspirational. Even when I go with a list, I end up with a dozen things I didn't know I needed at home for my pantry.  They have amazing prosciutto.  If you are a foodie, this is one fun place.

Kg_QsKYN9Tg4UwBQCGs7Tg.text: My God, the bread.  Sooo amazing.  I've had a meatball sandwich and a cheesesteak from here so far and they were killer.  The cheesesteak just drips out cheese and everything is so fresh.  Quality is key here, seriously.  Also getting the full sized sandwich is ridiculously filling, definitely get your moneys worth.

0ReLZ6pTCfJE-oI778JMKg.text: Amazing fresh food and on the spot import deli meats and cheeses. Super amazing cheese steak. Best around. Friendly staff and all about quality!

MYwqkMSRO0FJJjCUSTKgyA.text: Why do I see dusty groceries at every "Italian deli"? I used to work for a very picky Sicilian man that ran a pizza restaurant and cleanliness was right next to food quality and freshness. This place has the same overpriced who knows how long they have been sitting canned stuff all the others have. And I find this not very appetizing. As for my sandwich, I would have liked a fresher loaf, the bread was dry, meat was good but ended up overly chewy and the "sub roll" overpowered the sandwich.

rn74qO7s8DMW-PMtIUKEug.text: Fantastic deli, with tons of Italian specialty sandwiches and salads.

HamXVKJs-lHC9Ta6NJeX-g.text: BEST Italian food in town. Closest thing I can get to my grandmother's home-cooked pasta sauce. Make sure you come here with a hearty appetite because portions are generous and delicious. Be sure to try baked ziti and of course the cannoli. Clean place. Attentive staff.

P0RWoLwZ8e14A6tOet1llw.text: Had a great Parmigiana sandwich and my friends also ate some chicken and other cold cut meat sandwiches.. great deli at great low prices!

t6pc4zqlPe-jL8OVSfS94w.text: Quite possibly the best sandwich I've had in Scottsdale. The Capicola is incredible and their deli selection is second to none. I've even taken trips there to pick up fixings to make a pizza. They sell everything, even a large sack of fresh-made dough. I can't leave with just dough though, it's usually accompanied by kalamata olives, margherita pepperoni and a can of sauce. It's a blast to make their pizza at home but it's just as fun to browse the shelves while picking up the ingredients.

92RbyrnC0_pPY_Gjv-Dd-A.text: Believe the DDD hype. The calzone was perfect. Pizza was great. Service was some of the best and friendliest ever. They do not rest on their laurels. A must try.

OmC2rGjy8VgbmGwRKCaQpQ.text: Best chicken parm EVER!!! I live in San Fran and I dream about going back just to get a chicken parm sandwich!  My buddy Rob from Wells Fargo brought me here years ago and still this place does the best!!!!

OQ3Wn4RbHDnl6DwTEhx_AA.text: We ordered two sandwiches: Chicken parmagiana and Eggplant parmagiana.  The chicken was cut into chunks not as a cutlet which caused the meat to be a little dry.  The eggplant was good and they gave me extra sauce on request.  They seem to have a nice turnover so everything seemed fresh.  Being originally from NY I know what good marinara sauce is (a 10) and this is about a 7.5. But I must admit it is better than most of the ones I have tasted in Phoenix/Scottsdale restaurants.  They are definitely nice people and they do their best to serve you quickly.  I would only return if I were in the area.

BmQ5mYrCOW1UIGTRYbVRTA.text: Love it.  We stop for lunch every time we are in town.  Awesome fresh bread and all the Italian classics.

w4KBoXHzLCHMXSFFXSQDEg.text: So glad to have found a real Italian deli in the Phoenix area that I drove 30 miles one way to shop there. I visited on a Saturday when I had nothing to do other seeking some decent quality Ricotta cheese and Amoretti cookies.   What a charming place. My only regret is in not arriving hungry since I'd really like to try to their sausage sandwich.  I don't eat Italian outside of the home very often since I'm usually more pleased with what I cook, but in this case, I'd really like to try their food.  I overheard two people dining and one said to the other "I can't wait for you to try that sausage to hear what you think of it."  Clearly, based on reviews, seeing what diners were eating and overhearing comments, their Italian sausage must be loved by many.  I bought the Ricotta, cookies and an interesting bottle of Pinot Grigio.  I'm not sure if it was all priced fairly,  but I was just pleased to see the selections of Cento brands, interesting Italian wines and San Marzano tomatoes!

K41_FfBdRscYoMr13pMEyA.text: Busy place during lunch hours.  It was a great atmosphere, the food was delicious and well prepared.  The staff was busy but remained courteous.

0GyfWJMx1Mfv9IbkZERVuA.text: Only ordered one thing off the menu so far, but the mostaccioli and meatballs is absolutely fabulous. Highly recommended. The sauce is phenomenal, meatballs taste just like mom used to make, and prices are reasonable. Definitely check this ace out if you haven't yet.

YbN7xOYR07RWwxfWT64m9A.text: I love this place! I've been here quite a few times but have only had their italilan cold cut sandwich and the philly cheese steak sandwich. Both are delish!!  If you're impatient, I recommend calling ahead and then picking up your order. Although it's worth the wait if you're in the mood to dine-in.  They have a cute little grocery area to browse while your waiting too. If you're ever in South Scottsdale, I definitely recommend this place.

PwUEHgi0-N7Szxf-i3UBfg.text: Awesome! when i worked down the street from here i literally ate here 2-3 times a week and always looked forward to it. cant go wrong with any dish. great prices and a lot of food. yet to find a better philly cheesesteak in AZ

B1DhuX1zQZNe8TeY5Pq71A.text: I love this place because it combines so many things I dig: sandwiches, Italianism, a great wine selection, and an overall nice casual atmosphere. If I had a market, I'm pretty sure it would be like this one if I could help it.  The one critical thing I would add is that next time I'm craving DeFalco's on a Saturday at around noon, I think I'll call in the order. It's a rather popular place for lunch.

d34wic_1WwKko13HYSkYAA.text: I have heard exciting and molto delicioso things DeFalco's. See, ever since I took a trip to Tuscany a few years ago, I am always faced with yearning for the freshest prosciutto, the perfect cheese and bread, and a wine to wash down the salty, meaty goodness with. E ecco!   I ambled in and was awash in Italian grocery goodness. The giant gallon-sized cans of Extra Virgin Olive Oil with the Italia stamp on it made me long for the olive gardens of yesteryear, the truffled gelato in the freezer was whispering sweet nothings to me... I had to hold myself back fiercely to not grab a basket and start purchasing everything.   I stood in line patiently-- it was mid-afternoon on a Saturday and there was quite a bit of traffic. While I waited, I stared in the refrigerated glass counter at the stuffed mozzarella balls, the various Italian salads and fresh-cut meats. I moved closer and laid my eyes on the menu. There she was: "Il Purista," the greatest-sounding sandwich ever: Prosciutto, Fresh Mozzarella, Fresh Basil, Tomato, Roasted Peppers, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, & Balsamic Vinegar. Che fortunato! I ordered it from the surly Italian guy behind the counter. The sandwich was the perfect combination of flavors, but what was most impressive was the pile of prosciutto on it. I could not believe the quantity, quality and savory goodness. My mouth waters just thinking about it.  However, due to the fact that I had to wander around their close quarters for about a half an hour before I got my food, I think I will call ahead next time. They do have a sign that warns you about their process taking longer than usual, so I consider myself warned and cannot wait to sink my teeth into their food again soon!

hT3pG-zWHEnvxrllxcWFbw.text: I'm in love! We ordered The "Centurion" pizza and lasagna - brought it all home, cracked open a bottle of Italian wine and oh.my.goodness. The pizza was FANTASTIC and the lasagna wasn't too shabby either! The store itself carries some unique items - imports - that I haven't seen at other specialty stores in the area. Defalco's is absolutely worth a stop - check it out!

skeiJYejY7sZtF6fRplidg.text: This little place tucked just south of the main Scottsdale drag is quite a gem. I found a food tasting forum on-line which mentioned it as a noteworthy stop for some really great food. That was an understatement; from the parking lot it looks a little sketchy but never judge a book by it's cover.  Not only is this place very easy on the wallet, it's so interesting!  In addition to being a deli it is also a small Italian grocery with numerous wines, oils, cheeses, and meats.  I originally stopped in for their Philly Cheese steak and, having been to Philadelphia this past year I can honestly say this sandwich earns that name, so delicious.  If I'm ever in the area I love to take my friends and family for a bite to eat.

v4NugYuWqvZLMMg0u_M41Q.text: I ordered a pizza sub here and it was great.  They have a variety of different breads to choose from.  I really like the focaccia bread and the roll the best. The sandwiches are big and taste fresh.  I am looking forward to trying the pasta in the future.

rMXI9jwIWZkFe5wqG7TtXw.text: Great food and pretty good prices on the food. It's a little pricey when it comes to grocery, but average for a specialized grocer. Also, you're buying a different quality then at a Fry's or something. Could use a bit more seating and/or a few less shelves in there as it can get very hard to get around.

cX-KyrR91xLq6g_hNrLDUg.text: Many times I've been ignored or treated rudely here.  I feel like I'm an interloper, not welcome.  Maybe that's their thing, but I prefer good customer service.

kU9UYmKP3_DaLsusmRNnEw.text: Great atmosphere in here. Good food at reasonable prices. If you have time I recommend eating in. Nice experience. After you order, just choose your cozy table in any area of the building, lots of private nooks to choose if you want privacy. When your order is ready they will come around and find you delivering it right to your table. We like it here!

jMFbjm-zm4HQpZOhnQzjQA.text: Went here three times when I was based in Tempe for work.  Great atmosphere and the pizza was pretty authentic too.  They also have a great selection of Italian products (wines, olive oils etc) and their cheesecake for dessert was sinful.  Back to the pizza - crust was chewy in just the right way and not greasy.  Good flavorful pizza.  Would prefer Florencias but this was pretty good

HbE1SzcV2rM8fJzfqqtcaw.text: Great spot!  Good food, affordable prices.  Had a great veggie sandwich that was full of fresh ingredients.  Had the veggie artichoke lasagne that was very tasty, but just a bit cold inside. Nice to be able to buy a bottle of wine from the shelf and enjoy it with our meal at a table.

Yxvwbe7T9gbUgfNi-bFlzA.text: We can only add to all the other great yelps- this place is a keeper.  Great food at equally great prices.  Always a wait but worth it.  I would love to have a fabulous deli like this in my neighborhood- it is the "real deal!"

NvAWDVj8yTPA_LmXQ-C4lA.text: If you are looking for quick, great food at a reasonable price, Defalco's will not disappoint. The sandwiches are fresh, the pastas are tasty, and the people are great. If you are in the Scottsdale area and looking for Italian food, Defalco's is a must.

fMYMFU1jwdbLXDkcQXs2mg.text: Third visit to Defalco's recently and still don't see what all the fuss is about. Customer service is very good and prompt but the food is menza menz based on the cheesesteaks, Italian sandwich, and tuna sandwich. Found the cheesesteak to be somewhat salty and bread dry and lacking flavor. The steak meat was top quality with very little gristle and cooked properly but the overall saltiness detracted from the experience.  The Italian sandwich offered better quality bread but still was lacking the punch of flavors you'd expect from a great sandwich. Very good quality meats nicely assembled but still did not meet expectations based on the reviews. I believe the tuna was a mix of the two grades of tuna and again very bland. I did see a few people eating pasta and should probably try next visit since it did appear to be fresh pasta. The store itself is fairly well stocked with both frozen and dry goods as well as several selections of jar sauces and various Italian specialties and, of course, a deli. It's nice that they offer a nice selection of bottles of wine and/or beer with your meal or for take out but overall, based on the sandwiches I tried, not the best sandwich shop in the Scottsdale area.  A special Thank You to the staff member who brought a bowl of water for our dog while we ate outside, that's customer service!

acrTy2P5rheuant8_BiLTw.text: This is a cute lil Italian market on N Scottsdale Rd.  It's a lil hidden but has easy parking.  If you go there, you can pick-up some pre-made lunch and desserts from the deli section or store up on imported groceries for your house.    There aren't many tables for eating so if you're going to have lunch and eat there, I'd suggest going a lil before or after normal lunch rush hours.  I'm a fan of their lemon bar.  It's very tart and lemony!!  Might see ya there!

1x-1Mmh2wdrYYZrWaymTqQ.text: I've only been here once, but I have to give it a 5--this was easily the best cheesesteak I've ever eaten.  Every aspect of it was perfect, from the freshly made bread that was crisp on the outer layer and chewy inside, to the wonderfully sauteed peppers and onions, it was mouth-watering just to gaze upon.  They use white American, which is a requirement to me for a good cheesesteak (don't come at me with this provolone stuff, not on a cheesesteak).  All this goodness for $5.  How can you beat that??  I also picked up some great quality ingredients for my next homemade pizza while I was there--San Marzano tomatoes, imported pepperoni from Chicago, and some cherry peppers.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesesteak, no &#39;shrooms
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Defalco&#39;s amazing cheesesteak

BTIBaugsWkDwzt6Q_ESSMQ.text: Legit Italian deli with a great selection of wine, snacks, food, and desserts. Il Purista is what I order every time, and sometimes a cannoli on the side. Have a drink with your meal!

p1uf3a3PrTpYW1Ct5RJUdA.text: Un@$%!ing believable cheesesteak!   I just want to admit something, and I'm not ashamed about it. I went to DeFalco's two days in a row for that sammich. Seriously, it's that good. From the bread to the perfect amount of cheese, it's definitely the best cheesesteak sandwich I've had in the 5+ years that I've been here in the valley. The only thing that upsets me about it is that now I'll have a hard time trying some of the other items on the menu.  From the reviews I have read, a lot of people have long waits when eating here, but I did not. I think if you can work around peak restaurant hours, you shouldn't have much of a problem. Also, the staff was pretty nice to my group and me.   I'm addicted. There I said it. DeFalco's brings the East to the Southwest, and it does pretty perfectly. It's a must if you've moved from back East and want a little taste of home, or if you've never been out that way and you want a little taste of what you're missing.  Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half cheesesteak. One of the best I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half baked ziti
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half meatball

67v1csu6h5ikyliUFkUb6w.text: Have to give it the full 5. This is a great little market with big time italian food. This is the type of Italian deli market back in Jersey or NY.

qcSjZcCI_dc4HYFAKJ8CcQ.text: Been there 4 times now. I believe they have the best margarita and chicken pesto pizza in the valley. I want to try more things there..but I always get attracted to the chicken pesto. Definitely a must go in the valley. On late nights they also offer free bread loafs!!!

_XQ57gcMkfFokhUFsDAv5g.text: Exactly what you would wish. A small italian market with incredible food. I've had half the menu and never a bad thing. If you want a sub bypass all the sub shops and go there. Eggplant parm is awesome.

dH0RRa3Bz9_69Zol72ZvyQ.text: Since moving here from Boston, I've been rather disappointed with the quality of food. Everything from pizza to Chinese food has really been nothing but let down after let down... especially the Chinese food... man is it bad.. like, you have to try to make Chinese food this bad.. the only real saving grace is the Mexican food and the happy hour (lets be honest... quality of food is NOT what you're after when going to happy hour).   That's why, when you do find a place around here that is head and shoulders above the rest, you need to tell everyone about it and always go back. Defalco's is just this kind of place.   I pretty much agree with everyone when it comes to the cheese steak. Sure my arteries trembled with fear when it saw a massive amount of ooey gooey cheese rolling their way. but i didn't care... it was one of the best cheese steaks I've ever had. It was comparable to, or maybe even better than, my favorite from back east... La Cascia's Bakery & Deli's cheese steak (Burlington, MA). it had the perfect amounts of steak, mushrooms, peppers, onions, and cheese. as bobby said... goddamn..   Some lady also got a Chef Salad that looked out of this world. its an old fashioned Italian deli so its all high quality cold cuts and lot of them!   One last thing too rave about is, this place has has a lot of stuff that you cannot find in the grocery stores around here but were readily available back east. all of the Italian sauces, pastas, oils, vinegars, etc... next time i cook I'm definitely getting most of my stuff from here.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; Cheese w/ mushroom, peppers, and onions

Lwjg6BbBEJJUEt8npfVyEw.text: Worst Italian Sub I have ever had... Without a doubt it is disappointing to wait so long for a sandwich that is made with old, cold bread & dressed like the cook has never eaten a sub. So maybe their main courses are good but run, don't walk to another sub shop.

iY-VPB57wQ3PiOf8M8MQQA.text: Suuuper slow service. My dish of choice was the chicken parmigiano sandwich which lacked greatly in flavor. Given the reviews and recommendations, I'll give it a second try however my first experience alone would not have me returning.

2LYqKG6ZBeO096CbdE9lsA.text: Been coming here for 14+ years. Love everything about this place! Being Italian love coming to pick up some Italian products and grab a lunch too.The pesto pasta is the best! My sons love the Italian beef sandwich.

KJLB7stGKYS9oxa6ZSywww.text: Defalco's is the go to Italian place in Dcottsdale for me.  Made to order Alfredo, great wines, and a really cool Italian Grocery.  Please visit these guys, usually busy during lunch but not so much on the weekend or evenings.

ERaGYDFxsqySOOj3O16PUA.text: So good! They were super accommodating to our large group and even let us use forks and plates for a cake I brought in. Food was great as always. We were celebrating a birthday and telling our family about our engagement and couldn't have asked for a better experience!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RqAW3dza495qxqID59iykw.text: I love Defalco's and it's become almost a weekly staple. Their penne alla vodka is my FAVORITE & I always order the full portion so I can get the side salad w/ Caesar and the garlic toast. A lot of times, we will just call our orders in & they are ready for pickup in like 20 minutes.   I love this place so much and it's an amazing deal for the quality food that you get!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Baked ziti &amp; penne alla vodka

bb6tSyu-Pvo31F-yPY3Hkw.text: an old chainsmoking gal that i worked with years ago said if i wanted "real" italian food i had to go here. my chef boyardee was going to have to wait next to the "tony's pizza until gloria showed me the errors of my culinary ways. fazoli's was my  idea of great italian food at that time defalcos was in the old location then and i think much smaller than the current version. not better or worse, just seemed more homey. foods awesome, service is good, ambiance is diminished from the og locale i think. i always get the same eggplant parm sandwich so don't expect an entire menu rehash. support the locally owned shops..they usually work harder and longer to make our food and actually care about the quality..thank you gloria, you chainsmoking old broad..for the suggestion..for the secondary smoke and great conversations...between your coughing fits.

NFs0azMbNXPuHjNtKU8xqA.text: I was in town for the NASCAR race and from this place from a local resident, who recommended this place. It did not disappoint and exceeded my expectations. I ordered the Italian Cold Cut sandwich and the four cheese lasagna, which were fantastic! The place is a quaint Italian market and market the offers a wide range of sandwiches, pasta and pizza. When in the area, this is a must place to try.

ZIaYC-GyrVAETbrl5iP1AQ.text: Finally, my first chance to try DeFalco's.  Not gonna add much that hasn't already been said, but yes its awesome.  Super authentic Italian deli and grocery store.  The interior is a maze, the food is incredible and the prices are just right.  Tonight for my first visit I got a full Il Purista sandwich, a traditional cannoli, and a glass of Italian red wine to boot.  Total cost was about $20.  Came out in just over 5 minutes.    I'm not quite ready to say the sandwich was up to the level of one that I had at San Francisco's Molinari deli, but its pretty damn close.  The sandwich has tons of prosciutto and mozzarella, plus basil, tomato, red peppers, EVOO, and a balsamic vinaigrette.  I got mine in an italian baguette per their recommendation.  The sandwich was huge and the ingredients were fantastic.  The cannoli was also excellent with a rich creamy filling and sweet shell with just the right amount of crunch.  So yes, the Yelp reviews are accurate and the accolades are well deserved.  Anthony DeFalco and his family have done an excellent job carving their own niche in a valley restaurant scene saturated with Italian establishments.  Here it's not just about the pizza or the pasta, its about the whole Italian culinary experience from the restaurant, to the grocery store, to the butcher, and so on.  Truly a valley landmark in every sense of the word.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A full Il Purista sandwich, traditional cannoli, and glass of red wine.  Total cost: $20.  It&#39;s every bit as delicious as it looks and more

B60h9ps-rmWkvgWCSvm9Qw.text: Beautiful place but bad service; they weren't even busy.. I ordered my food for takeout and they said it would be ready in 10-20 minutes. My food was ready 45 minutes later.   I sure hope they fix this problem because I like going to DeFalco's! THE FOOD IS SO GOOD!

-f6jGJmdhCMNka9tBn3Zzg.text: Defalco's is an awesome little Italian grocery that has some of the best sandwiches you will find in Arizona.   On my most recent stop I got the Il Purista sandwich which is one of my favorites the fresh mozzarella with pungent fresh basil, roasted peppers and the great Prosciutto come together in a flavor overload on a great sandwich roll. How fresh and high end the ingredients stand out especially with the mozzarella as it has a much more distinct and rich flavor and texture than the more bland store bought stuff.  I also added a cannoli to my order which was great. A lot of places make cannoli that is just too sweet and this was the right mix of sweet and savory. The other nice part was that it had just enough chocolate chips to provide a good flavor without overpowering the sweet shell and creamy ricotta.  In past trips I have gotten the meatball sub, chicken parm sub and the pasta and meatballs.I can tell you that you can't go wrong with any of it.

zeLrVUiJj4HzOcd3o38u0g.text: This place used to be the best ! Customer service and food has completely gone down hill in the last couple years. Don't order any of the pastas and expect anything but dry lumped together pasta. Sandwiches are ok for the price. Nobody cares when you walk in and would like to order. They don't greet you or ask if they could help you out. Let me add that this is not a cheap place to eat at. Here is a picture of my angel hair pasta that was suppose to have Alfredo on it looked like it had been microwaved and my side salad was suppose to have ranch, but came with Italian. They just don't care about quality anymore. Sad because we have been going here for 10 years.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VrQCx3zu6igcw0hBmTJzzw.text: The food was great; Calzone, Ravioli, and Linguine were all yummy. They use fresh ingredients and fresh mozzarella. The dine in seating area is very small and limited.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 10&#34; Calzone

780agsMe6C8VidQVOUny5w.text: I wish I had discovered this gem sooner! This place has all the hard to find Italian goods you need for recipes, that you can never seem to find in the standard stores.

YlbZtja0JHEtY9-k-mYFLA.text: DeFalcos is the best! The Beef Cheesesteak sandwich is the best thing on the menu. While their Cannolli & lemon bars are also very authentic and tasty.

r0vd40bJRojt_L7Q9Q7-8w.text: Highly recommend! A hidden gem just south of old town Scottsdale. If you are looking for some authentic Italian food this is the place to go. Everything on the menu is amazing and will blow away expectations. The Italian grocery store has everything you need to cook a great meal. Must eat!! A++++

c59QtPA3z-oHoxP5TWaYLg.text: The best place around for quick italian food. I've gone twice so far and both the italian sausage and the meatball sandwiches have been great. When you wait in line you'll get to take a look at all of their desserts and they are hard to pass up! I got the chocolate eclair and it was nice and fresh.   Be prepared for a line during lunch because this place is rightfully very popular. The seating is pretty limited but it seems most people take it to go so it's not an issue.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One of the many hard to resist desserts

IOSrQnLjKv-2Oo3gr1Z2Sg.text: This place very authentic. Lets just say, Nana spoiled us growing up. I have a good frame of reference for authentic Italian food.  I've had some different sandwiches, meals, desserts, and also bought some of their sausage for the grill. They have always impressed.   We walk by this place sometimes and the smell makes you want to go in there and grab something.   It's very close to Old Town if you are visiting, and if you're local, you've got a gem in your back yard.

h4CRCkvyAXPYZjfUo_ilZA.text: This is such a gem. The food is beyond amazing, the service is fantastic and even the grocery's are to die for.  I found this place less than a month ago and not a week has went by where I haven't eaten there.  I have tried a few of the cold sandwich's and tonight is my first time trying lasagna. I can't wait to go back!

bx6l88q3Bs6DSJz4WpULdQ.text: Ahhh...a taste of home! An Italian from Jersey, now in AZ, Kong's for what besides a great pizza...good old fashion Italian food...and I found it! Home made fennel sausage, cannoli, cavateli, fresh bread and sooo much more!   Looking to make Sunday dinner? Start your gravy here with canned plum tomatoes, a nice red wine, and most everything else you need :-)  Thank you DelFalcos for keeping it authentic...you guys do it right!

vR34R8gU8R6XAx7p0ckDWQ.text: This place is sooooo awesome! Food is as close to Italy without buying an airline ticket! It's been a favorite stop for years and the many others dining and grocery shopping prove their perfection.  The imported mortadella with pistachios is something I haven't been able to find since I lived in San Francisco! Thank You Defalco's!! Worth the drive from anywhere!! I can take the 72 bus from Tempe and be there in no time! Patricia St Vincent, Maple Ash  neighborhood, Tempe

Hzb2Ghzg32_tcAPs2x9ntQ.text: Always a favorite! General thought after leaving is that I need to come more often or back soon. Can get busy but they have a pick up window if you call in

YLBDRwNLpxc002_PRFDmYg.text: The food is good but not worth the wait.  It is very congested inside and doesn't seem to be run efficiently at all!  My to go order was taken by another patron because they don't take a second to verify who is actually taking possession of the food. A simple number system would work. This wasn't  the first time I've had an extra long wait either.  Save yourself the headache and go elsewhere.

gRFTAXkcl5On9hQuuAP4Iw.text: Best ever Italian Deli just south of Old Town in Scottsdale. My dad and I love the gnocchi.

cehSdetE4lPyIwHL8rmIbA.text: This is our 4th visit to DeFalco's and we love the high quality authentic food and very reasonably priced items. One's ability to bring your four legged family friend makes this dining experience an absolute five star visit.
