Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1lPxvZ4msIccVYAzC1N1wA.text: Oh my gosh, I would give this place ten stars if I could. I finally tried it yesterday after years of driving past, and I was blown away by how delicious my food was.   It looks like they're usually busy and bustling inside; there are shelves of Italian groceries for sale. I wanted to browse while I waited for my order, but didn't see a way I could do so without getting in someone's way. Perhaps next time!  The person who took my order at the register was very polite and helpful with my questions. I got my order to go, and it was very nicely and securely packaged.   On to the FOOD. I ordered a grilled chicken pesto pizza, and it was out of this world! Their menu says a small is 12 inches, but my pizza easily looked more like 14-15 inches, which meant leftovers for later! YAY! Delicious pesto sauce, flavorful, marinated chicken, and great crust. Winner all around. I also took a pignoli cookie for dessert: crispy outside, fluffy inside, made with almond paste and toasted pine nuts on top. Ah. Maze. Ing. I was in heaven.   I can't wait to try more of their menu! I'm just sorry I took so long to give this place a try.

DtQKpG9dlGBELsJKVZWbSQ.text: If you are looking for authentic italian food this is the place to go! I ordered the Rose salad not on the menu. It is chicken on a large bed of spinach with veggies avocado and peppers served with an italian oil and vinegar dressing.   My kids ordered the pepperoni pizza and the chicken parmesan and they loved it so much they let me have a taste so I could yelp it lol! The chicken parm is a large serving on linguine. The pizza what can I say its perfection.   the staff are all nice pleasant and hospitable. Ive yet to experience anything less than a fabulous time with amazing food!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

HJSslVjeYqalqAv7ZHjwJw.text: REAL Italian deli and ingredients! The food is stellar, the deli items are best in quality,  and their cannoli are on point!

PhwelalcGAm9w4or5TDjOw.text: I love this Italian deli. The reviews and ratings didn't prove me wrong at all. Me and my colleague went there during our office lunch. We had mozzarella, tomato and basil on focaccia and Multi grain bread. The mozzarella was so fresh and so damn soft! Wow! For dessert we chose tiramisu and chocolate Cannoli. The tiramisu was exceptional. By far, this is the best tiramisu I had in Arizona. I would definitely visit this place again for pastas and lasagnas of course. They had decent amount of seating indoors and outdoors. I will go to this place again and again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

yWnkdEeOjqzyydSfedPdag.text: I say it over and over.. Go where the locals go and there is no chain of restaurants.. This place has been bookmarked for while for me and I glad it was on my way home today. I was literally across the street at the goodwill dropping off some donations and I looked up saw this place. As I driving up I saw three cars pulling up and three more cars leaving with to go orders. I knew I was right spot!   I walked in to grocery/restaurant with deli counter with plenty of seating throughout. I quickly grabbed a menu and browsed for bite to go! I was amazed by all of the selections on the menu with half options for many of pastas and sandwiches.   I walked out with chicken parmigiana sandwich w/ Greek side salad and strawberry cheesecake! I must admit I as expecting homemade sauce and authentic taste and they knocked it OUT THE PARK!   My sandwich was very delicious with homemade tomato sauce and juicy chicken with melted cheese!   Strawberry cheesecake... Better than Cheesecake Factory! Very delicious   I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken parmigiana

VDa72tos6zFaVJMuedSbkw.text: Work is now closer to Defalcos and I'm pretty excited. The grocery part is still yet to be tested by me but they have a wide selection of wine, oils, cheese, meats, pasta and other things.   They make the food quickly, fresh, and you can see it with an open kitchen.   I usually get the Philly Cheesesteak no onions and no mushrooms, extra peppers. It has been consistent and phenomenal every time. Never disappointed in the amount and I always leave full. The cheese is melted perfectly for me and I thoroughly enjoy it. Maybe one of the best Philly in Scottsdale.   I get the pasta salad and antipasto salad as sides because I don't eat all the bread. All of it is great, fresh and I tastes wonderful!  I will obviously be back and get items from the deli/grocery to try them out. Super excited and I will be feasting.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Antipasto Salad
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Philly Cheese Steak
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peppers

VotBNEWVf2DmTP02J3pxOQ.text: Diggin the fresh tacos and close location. Everything on the menu looks super simple but the smell of fresh food instantly has me hungry when I walk in the door

295JQXQRbhnjiZuAtbaFXA.text: Go out of your way for this and bing an appetite!  We ordered carryout, having been told the seating is limited, and it proved to be a perfect choice.  No waiting and a relaxed pleasurably lunch on our own terms.    Everything sounds great on the menu and really end up doing a flow chart - hot or cold?  If hot, pasta, sandwich, pizza, etc. and if cold, salad or sandwich.  I went with cold.  The side of Antipasto Salad was so generous and had chunks of meat, cheese, peppers, olives and oil.  The meat were chunks right from the deli with Mortadella, Capocollo, salami and all were excellent.  The cheese and peppers along with the spices, made the salad taste fantastic.  I also opted for the whole Maximus, again with the spicy prosciutto, and Capocollo, Mortadella, Genoa Salami provolone on focaccia.  The bread was soft and fluffy with a airy crumb that was seasoned to give it a hit of extra oregano.  The sandwich was dressed with cold, crunch iceberg, tomato, onion, mustard, mayo and of course, Italian dressing.  Excellent flavor combination - highly recommended.

YjJyW3ntuAnrD5VBVwC3IQ.text: If I were rating just the food, this would be 5 stars easily. The food is amazing. However, anytime I order more than 1 thing, my order gets messed up and I pay for food that I didn't receive.   A month ago I was missing 3 sides from my order.   Tonight I ordered and paid for a whole Italian beef  sandwich with au jus, a whole order of Mac and cheese (which comes with a side salad) garlic bread, a meatball and peppers. I received half of a sandwich with no au jus sauce, half of an order of Mac and cheese, and no side salad.   While the food is great, I will not be coming here again as I am sick of not receiving my entire order.

9CggTFNoEEkjveWLrVbUJw.text: This place is everything it's cracked up to be. Honestly. I haven't had a bad thing here yet. Today I got the prosciutto with mozzarella and basil. I was expecting to get a few little slices of prosciutto like most places. This sandwich is amazing. Tons of prosciutto and the mozzarella and basil are so fresh!!!   So many things left on the menu to try but I have a feeling I'll be getting this one again and again.   Ps-- yes they are slow. Get over it. This isn't McDonald's!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

lWr-zuq1y388imffcTqReA.text: I think this place was on diners, drive-ins, and dives, but Yelp is what brought me here.  The philly cheesecake here was so good.  The wife got the meatball sandwich and my kid had the meatballs and spaghetti.  He didn't like the meatballs, but the wife and I sure did.  I would absolutely come back here again.

yAL17mciTOP6dLO4RTQgiQ.text: WHY WHY WHY is this place a big deal?! It is unorganized. Apparently ypu stand in line and order and pay. BUT if you want meats or something you have tp go back and get a # THEN wait, order and get back on line to pay. The line is walled off with wine bottles. Who's idea was that?!  The cashier is rude, not a people person and overall miserable. She was not helpful at all when I ordered and attempted to ask questions. The place was crowded with people that were desperate for their food but were held captive WAITING for it. I didn't even order sandwiches. I ordered alacarte deli items, like pre-made salads, desserts, bread and meats. Save yourself.......go somewhere else. Costs way too much for long wait and hassle. PLUS THEY OVERCHARGED ME!!!!!!!

ll5KjCm28eC1o5XoToi4DQ.text: I remember when DeFalco's was a service oriented business and had the best selection of imported groceries in Scottsdale. Since moving back to Scottsdale I hate their new location. The Grocery is much smaller and they have sold out to making pizza and sandwiches their priority and not service to real Italian food lovers.  When you call you are usually greeted with some kids running three words together so fast you can't comprehend as they immediately put you on hold and forget about you.  I stopped in twice now and you can't even browse the store items without having to weave in and out of the Starbuck's Drive-thru SUV driving, can't cook crap consumers, standing and waiting to place an order to go.   Are you a deli-grocery? are you a sit down restaurant? are you a crazy busy take out place? Make up your mind.. I'll go get my fresh dough and groceries from Tony up in Sunnyslope. I can get there and back before I can wait my turn at this atrocity.   PS: to the take-out consumers.... try making your own pizza sometime with ingredients from a real Italian grocery. It's so easy, park your SUVs, do something that makes your home smell good and your kids appreciate a home cooked meal. Enjoy!  To the owners, buy a store next door and give us back our grocery.

t1FxUve9Zdh8wsdZRmKvmg.text: I have been eating there for years. Food is fantastic, service is great and the prices are extremely reasonable. The pizza is as good if not better than Bianco and Grimaldi's and no where near as expensive. The lasagna is also one of the best I've had.

Xa0syHw-0PLLCs7CnuXaYQ.text: If you're looking for great Italian, Defalco's is the place.  Their lasagna is so good that I have dreamed about missing a slice of their meaty, cheesy, saucy goodness. I really like the sausage they use because I can taste the fennel and it just ties everything together. Lasagna is pretty expensive to make at home. (All I know is that when my bf and I made homemade lasagna, we spent almost $80 on all the ingredients. But maybe we splurged too much on expensive cheese idk lol)   A slice of lasagna here should set you back $9. Not bad because it is a pretty hefty serving. I always have to take half of it home, especially since it's served with a piece of garlic bread.  We also tried the cheese ravioli. Scrub mistake. Order the meat ravioli because the ravioli is already good, but the meat takes it over the top. I love their red sauce so much I could drink it.  The first time my bf and I came here, we thought one tiramisu cup was going to be enough for the both of us. It wasn't. The tiramisu is so creamy and the amount of coffee is just right. Now we always order 2 tiramisus so we don't have to fight over who gets the last bite :)  The restaurant is pretty cozy inside but I think the environment definitely makes it a cute date spot for good food.

iwRRvsG7pU4L2UN5R5wwNA.text: Honest opinion bc I love food: The food was mediocre ...and it smells there really....really...bad around the "fresh sausage." No stomach pain..or nausea. Thank god. Would not go back.  P.S. your cashier who worked on August 6th 2018 at around 5 o'clock was extremely rude...and I have no idea why...all I said was may you please add extra virgin olive oil on the maximus sandwich..and she responded..we don't have that oil...rolled her eyes...and went ahead to help her other worker...then continued to take down our order...very...very...weird.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Food was mediocre.

msOLBQG5rDgIFTCf-CI-Bg.text: This place is a classic. Can't go wrong with anything here. Order by phone ahead and pick up/dine in for lunch and save yourself some time.

HkqoCbB_Brwy69m-HBO7XQ.text: My wife and I are each half Italian so I like to say we make a whole Italian!  I've been looking for a place like this since I moved to Arizona more than 30 years ago - an authentic Italian grocery store that also serves prepared dishes.  For us, this was everything familiar - familiar brands, familiar ingredients, familiar treats and sweets.    We ordered in and did a little grocery shopping as well.  Their prepared food is outstanding and the real deal.  Their groceries and other items are a tad on the pricey side but that is expected when you want genuine Italian brands and you need them quickly.  Although we live a couple of hours north of Defalco's, we do visit the Valley frequently and this delightful establishment will become a regular stop for us when we find ourselves nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Just Part of the Menu
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZsZVFdipjaEBj5Zk_KyiXQ.text: This place is GOLDEN! Try the Spaghetti and Meatballs or the Stuffed Shells. It is set up like a mom and pop type of place with a store inside. You can buy wine from Italy among all kinds of things. Last but not least GET THE CANNOLI - I don't care what kind of diet you are on and if you only get a salad for your meal but I'm telling you, you haven't tasted heaven until you've had one of their cannolis.

UWRbjPlIDjt20nVYF_NPEA.text: DeFalcos feels like home! It is an amazing experience, from food to employees to the satisfied feeling after anything you eat here! I am new to town and don't like to spend a lot of money on eating out but this Gem keeps you wanting to come back for more. My sons and I make it a point to all order differently as to try many items and I can honestly say have never been disappointed! Cheers to your family DeFalco's & to many more years of continued success, thank you for your passion!

U9Ew4e4boo1W-_O3snb5tQ.text: Defalco's is half Italian grocery store and half restaurant. The ambiance is very authentic. I had the Italian sausage sandwich which was the featured item on the "Diners Drive Ins and Dives" episode. It was pretty good but nothing too special. I also had the penne with vodka sauce and I thought that was better than the sandwich. On the side I ordered a meatball to have with the pasta and that was good as well. For dessert, I had a cannoli which was great. I also had the chance to talk to the owner who was also in the "Diners Drive Ins and Dives" episode and he seemed like a genuine guy. Overall, great experience and can't wait to come back to try more items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Penne with vodka sauce and a side of meatball on the left and the Italian sausage sandwich on the right

hZyQ7LKCmylsXi0mpdrFPA.text: We come here for all of our Italian grocery needs, there is no other place for it! Fresh pasta is a MUST in our house.   As for their restaurant? Wow. Delicious!! Everything we try hits the ball out of the park!!  Gnocchi is heavenly, meatball sub is crazy delicioso, italian sodas are creamy dreamy and the desserts? Well, make sure you save room for a food coma. The cookies are LEGIT scrumptious and the cakes (cheesecake) are perfect and creamy!  They know how to make sure flavor is bold and packed!  Real Italian for real Italians too.

VV5gSrSg6OlyJ8gUSr9XwA.text: Be still my heart. I loved this deli grocery. Saw it featured on Triple D and put it on the must try list. Good food, great desserts and huge selection of  grocery items, many of them I have never seem in my Italian grocery in Florida. I had the sausage and egg half sub, my hubby had Salami capocolla full sub, fresh and tasty and we shared a limoncello cake that was special. Prices are very reasonable for what you get. We would definitely go back for another foodie experience.

hypVXxtNpvDzIFqBFLcMVQ.text: My love affair with DeFalco's continues. There was 6 of us there last night,including my elderly parents,and my sister from Montreal. I had to take her there so she can experience what my wife,myself and my daughters have experienced in the past. Perfection!!  We got there earlier than usual because of when my parents eat dinner and it was great timing before the Friday night crowd came. My sister loved DeFalco's and was so mesmerized with all their items,including the wines and Imported items that you can't find in most places.  I had to have their Pizza Bianca White Pizza), which as usual was delicious. My wife has their Chicken Parmigiana, my Dad had Spaghetti and Meatballs (incredible), my sister and my Mom had the Eggplant Parm, and my daughter had the Chicken Fettuccine. Of course we all tried each others and all were amazing. Oh,I ordered the Fresh Mozzarella Ball to share and dip in sauce. Every dish was amazing.   My family are originally from NY and ate some great food there, and I am so grateful to have found a wonderful place like DeFalco's where they make great Italian food.    As I have stated before, if you want a fancy place go there,but if you want great, inexpensive, consistent Italian food,go to DeFalco's....   OMG, make sure you have some of their desserts..

zgYsBeJkME9Tb9b-ttjylA.text: Some days are just golden. Everything turns out perfectly.  Usually those days dont include touring a new city, getting lost, and then randomly seeing an italian deli and saying "oh, im hungry i'll just get a sandwich from there."  I didn't expect to get what I did.  I mean common, how many times do the food gods put you in the most amazing hole in the wall you ever discovered?   Thats defalcos. Out of a dream (and literally, too. one of the workers there is a cuuuutttieee! Hey yelp, how about YELPDating.. For the Foodies in your heart).     Listen, I lived in NYC for a good amount of time and the food can compare to little italy.   Just go. Trust me.

blEbGEYYLdrG0gJ3CWbzwA.text: Its a small store and deli packed with italian stuff.  Large selection of pasta and sauces as well as desert makings.  We went for lunch to the deli.  I must admit, one of the best cheese steaks I've ever had.  Its a shame we live so far away from here, I'd definitely frequent this place.

bAsqGv7deggyzkOtr5l1xQ.text: My coworker and I decided to try Defalco's out after hearing it had been on Drive-in, Diners, and Dives. I read the reviews and knew it was best to call our orders in. Boy was I right. There was a huge line and 2 girls arguing over who was first. Exciting.   My coworker ordered the Centurion calzone and really liked it. I ordered the panini grilled cheese. I love a grilled cheese but not that one. Too salty. But we both loved the marscapone lemoncello cake.   I will definitely be back to try something else. Oh and the staff was super friendly.

9bkDAIW1i-yvzz6DNiYjwg.text: I used to be a fan of this place, especially with their huge portions. However, this has changed. I got a "half" order of fettuccine with pesto sauce and Italian sausage. I ordered a half because the last time I ordered pasta, the whole order was almost enough for three meals!    I got the pasta and opened it up to make sure everything looked okay, and was astounded to see the amount (or lack there of) of pasta in the container. I took it back up to the register and asked if this was correct as it just did not seem right. One of the cooks in the back came out and said "yes, this is what you ordered. We do 6 ounces of pasta for a half order, you have the pesto sauce and then this is what we add on for the sausage".   Not only was he not pleasant, but if I had known the half order was going to be the size of my fist, I would have gotten the whole, especially considering they charged me $11.50 after all was said and done.   Certainly not worth the price and did not meet the taste standards that I am used to associating DeFalcos with.   Big disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. &#34;Half&#34; order of pesto fettuccine with sausage. Not tasty and cost $11.50. Waste of money!

-sR5eN6oUoWf0z-FVs9T3w.text: Upon sinking my teeth into the Il Purista sandwich, I was filled with a sense of fear...  Had I just bitten into the best sandwich I'd ever tasted? Would  I never find another sandwich that could compare? Can I eat this sandwich for the rest of my life?  The answer was Yes.   Another favorite here is the Chicken Parmesan. This is by far the best marinara sauce I have ever had, smothered on the best breaded chicken breast on this earth.  The grocery is neat, a bit of a novelty, and seating is sparse. I enjoy sitting in the more private section to the right of the entrance. Prices are fair, and you can split most entrees between two people.  Would definitely recommend to anyone seeking authentic Italian cuisine!

io3AM7V7ZFsJR3jf-MT_eQ.text: We used Defalco's catering for my mom's 75th birthday celebration.  We worked with Robert to plan the event.  He gave suggestions, and kept telling me "you are ordering too much food." He was right...we had too much food but that was o.k. because everything was delicious and this gave us an opportunity to have left overs. I did think it was very kind of him to say you are ordering too much when other restaurants would have not mentioned it and been happy to have a bigger order. Robert was placing the customers need as the top priority.  Our guests ranted and raved about the food and of course the cannolis.  Everything was hot, fresh and delicious!!!! I couldn't have been happier and the cost was extremely reasonable to feed 60 people.  Highly encourage you to try their Italian grocery for dine in or carry out.  Thanks Robert and staff for making our party a huge success!

iTbulYgYtYS7d79zXQeTQg.text: Love this place! I've been here a few times with friends and never had a bad visit. The food is amazing and all of the staff are really nice!  I had the chicken parm, a slice of chocolate/ vanilla moose cake and a chocolate cannoli. All of these were amazing.  My roommate had the gnocchi, a slice of some kind of white cake, and a cappuccino. My roommate is Italian and grew up eating gnocchi and absolutely loved DeFalco's.  I always recommend this place to friends looking for some good Italian food!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken parm, chocolate moose cake, chocolate cannoli, a cappuccino, white cake, and gnocchi.

q81ZPdkZBVxlDHa1ROPY5A.text: Been coming to Dalfalcos for years and it never disappoints! If you are looking for speedy service you are probably not going to get it because they are busy making their food with sweet love! My go-to item is the Cheesesteak (better than any cheesesteak you will get in Philly.) The Mac and Cheese is out of this world, seriously the best I've ever had. Their homemade pastas and pizzas are super legit too. Not to mention they have a great Italian grocery selection. I like to grab their pre made pizza crust and toppings for pizza night at home. Did I mention they have amazing deserts too? Only downfall is you are immediately going to need to renew your gym membership once you leave.

GuqIiLNz6DzqryFRRexSwQ.text: Great Deli! Our first time visiting on our vacation in May. We will definitely come back.   We shared  an antipasto salad to go and it was really good, Nice and fresh and lots of meat/cheese/olives etc.  Can't wait to try their other options on our next visit.

CI2vhaGIuLru8pgUE51q2g.text: Went to DeFalco's yesterday and had a great Italian Sausage with peppers, onions, melted mozzarella and home made tomato sauce on a crisp Baguette. The nice thing about DeFalco's is they are willing to give you what you ask for, unlike some other Italian grocery market in Scottsdale. DeFalco's Italian eatery is the hot spot to go for lunch, dinner and take out. They do a great "to go" business, all with a smile and a thank you. They have a great looking deli counter.  I couldn't walk out the door without grabbing a Cannoli to go. That too was very good. So, if  you are tired of hearing "no or we don't deviate from our menu", or "no you can't have a small side of red sauce with your Calamari", then you should give DeFalco's a try. They appreciate their customers and it shows. They are willing to make you happy and give you exactly what you ask for.

nkgrpuHQX7wVSKpN1fA-_w.text: Can't go wrong with a single item on the menu. Their pizzas and cheese steaks are my go to orders though. Great food.

wB1az5gMgAnbzixwL-2UfQ.text: Busy (line from the counter to the door) but don't be scared off because they have quick service. Happy hour til 7 seemed decent but we were too late. My friend had the meatball sub and it was the best one I've tasted. We got it with sub bread and it was perfect. They also have several other bread options (sesame, crunchy baguette, etc).  The linguine (pasta options are spaghetti, linguine, fettuccine, and penne) was a bit mushy but I liked the basic marinara sauce - it had some heat with lots of red pepper flakes. The sausage was bland - I would go for the big, fluffy meatballs. The garlic bread had a lot of herbs but was also surprisingly bland. This place is inexpensive and laid back - it has a family owned feel that I like. Everything has a lot of options as I mentioned above, and you can do half or whole orders (half was plenty for me). There is a soda fountain and free refills.   Based on my spaghetti and sausage meal I would give 3 stars but that meatball sub was honestly amazing. Next time I am definitely getting a sandwich!

9Ebi9ZQdvrVLe4SP9o6H2A.text: Absolutely everything I've had here has been freaking delicious! The chicken parmigiana, various pizzas, the hot sandwiches, pasta, desserts.. This place is a gem.

o5JlHlf8DhRZHyK0yOhRBA.text: Great place for lunch, along with their outstanding deli salamis, prosciutto, homemade Italian sausages and different cheeses. Had the Italian sausage with peppers and onions. Friends had the corned beef sandwich in the eggplant parmesan. Everyone said they were delicious.

FOHI1o7xqGn2tC8TJWGHXA.text: The best local Italian deli in Scottsdale. No contest. The food is excellent and I love the atmosphere.  Very authentic neighborhood deli/grocery.  Gourmet pizza to boot. Prices are reasonable and the quality is outstanding.  Great selection of wines and some imported beers. Patio sitting is a good choice on a beautiful Scottsdale day or evening,  inside seating is among the grocery shelves. Typical of a NY deli.you can't miss with the cheese steak sandwich,  any pasta or pizza. You won't be sorry.

Y2Kt9gUeRcUy-QKw7HW_bA.text: I love this place, it was featured on diners, drive ins, and dives and this place is amazing. Being italian we are always looking for the next best thing and this is the closest you will get to fine italian food. Defalcos does not mess around I just wish it was not so crowded all the time

pXMzLClBwtVlfKx1KYsr2w.text: If it's your first time at Defalco's, then you must order the cheesesteak!!! Best sandwich on the menu, although everything on the menu seems to be the best.  Pizzas are crazy fresh and delicious. Try a cannoli for dessert!  Defalco's needs to be open late night...seriously!

IcNIa5W6f0xsXDJ0uABSbQ.text: i might toy with the idea of maybe giving this place another shot and trying one of the pizza's or pastas...  i just was not impressed. Waited 20+ min for the sandwich and when they finally brought it out it was on white bread when i asked for wheat. So right off the bat i was peeved. i didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for a damn sandwich so i sucked it up and put my big girl panties on and ate it anyway. it was alright, honestly just another sandwich.  However they do have a considerable large choice of meats, cheese, pasta sides etc..i am a girl who likes choices. The atmosphere was also interesting as well, ya know, the whole Italian grocery store thing inside a restaurant is pretty creative.

nE0xEFB0N0u-xDa59r0pDA.text: Worst experience ever from this great place! Body builder about 35 behind the counter, lost our order after 35 minutes, asked when our order would be ready. Got major attitude! asked for our money back, he wanted the receipt after just taking the order 45 minutes before and loosing our order. where did the nice guys go?

iJWo3RZY39V3n7ac9CZPBw.text: Upon visiting Defalco's I had their chicken parmigiana sandwich and my friend had their chicken pesto. The food was very mediocre, just very bland. The tomato sauce for my parm tasted like it came right out my of school cafeteria from when I was in grade school. I went at a time when there were very few customers (about 7:30pm) and the wait was a little ridiculous, about 25 minutes.   However, the bad aside, there were some things I liked a lot about this place. One was the layout, its a bit confusing but kinda fun. The tables are kinda strewed out through the store and its kinda cool eating among the various grocery products. Two, they had an excellent bottled beer selection with a very wide variety. Three they had an excellent happy hour special, 3 dollar imports, 2 dollar domestics.

AnOBOOwUMjdLER00p36ZFw.text: Rating this as anything less than 5 stars is damn near offensive. This place was outstanding. I had the chicken Parmesan which was awesome; my husband had a calzone with sausage, pepperoni, onion, and peppers. The sausage and pepperoni were made right there and were downright bitchin! We ended up shopping at their store too and picked up some salami and cheese for the trip back home. I wish that we could have something like this in Wisconsin, we would be there all the time!

5kgRfbJzGztkpPge-O1C3Q.text: You should go to Defalco's if any of the following apply to you:  1. You have been to Italy before and you want to relive that Italian food adventure but not leaving the confines of South Scottsdale 2. You want to have some of the best Italian Beef or Philly Cheesteaks sandwiches you have ever had.  3. You are in no rush for your meal  I have been to Defalco's over 15 times while leaving in Phoenix. Their food is superb, the staff is friendly and the experience is always consistent. The only glaring problem, which they address with a sign on their front door, is it takes FOREVER.   This is the closest you are going to get to an Authentic Italian Delicatessen in Phoenix.  The food while eating there is delicious but I would also suggest having them set you up with a Pizza Kit so you can make authentic Italian pizza at home. It is delicious easy and very affordable.   However if you are a cheesesteak lover and you go to Defalco's and don't order it is a sin. It is a huge hot messy mouth watering I can't believe I finally found such a delicious sandwich.   The portions are huge so keep that in mind and it's not the cheapest or quickest place. But it is the BEST Italian Deli I have been to in PHX.

yHnt2-MYg388SBTxklP44g.text: This place is authentic and awesome! Best Italian I've ever had. Large petition sizes. The calzones, meatball subs, and baked ziti were amazing!

wfZs4IjDPuzKC5WF9M2yrg.text: Authentic Italian, pizzas calzones and sandwiches are excellent but spirits a bit pricey.  Overall a great experience.

9XR8p9OmqnPxoRr7G1EHcg.text: This place is pretty dang cool! It's right off Scottsdale Road (just before Oak). Part grocery store, part restaurant, part deli, this place has a lot to offer. I've eaten here a couple times and have enjoyed the food. They have Italian classics to sandwiches (and desserts!). So yummy!! The only criticism I have is that it is really small inside. I feel squished trying to pass through people in the aisles and the seating to eat is pretty tight too. Other than that, it's fantastico!

Djwm6c72FadX3suKSU-BpQ.text: I'm Italian. From the NorthEast.  Places like DeFalco's are all over the place back home. So, living in AZ (outside of the insane culture shock I went through when I moved here) left a void in my life! But then, husband and I found DeFalco's. The cheesecake! The lupini beans! The sandwiches! The pizza! and OH MY GOD THE PROSCIUTTO!  When it's Friday night and Husband and I don't want to go out - we run to DeFalco's, grab some grub to snack on and watch a movie at home. Perfect!

khZL5aNSzNmViFILIakf-w.text: My husband and I were in a rush so we stopped by here to grab sandwiches... Sandwiches were AMAZING! however it was not fast. Took about 10 minutes to get our sandwich but although we were a bit rushed, it was worth the wait. Service is great too.

J1Yp0a5zkp7ZnBADBjqoVg.text: Just tried DeFalco's tonight after it was featured in the weekly YELP newsletter on cheesesteaks. I had the margherita pizza and a dinner salad and enjoyed it.  The italian dressing was meh. No spices- just oil and vinegar. I expected it to be a special homemade type of dressing since this is an italian deli.   Both my husband and son had the cheesesteak. They loved it. The roll was great and that is very important to the whole package. It was meaty as well. My husband liked the fact that the cheese was mixed and melted into the steak. Not on the bottom of the roll or laying on top. My son didn't like the fact that they didn't have WIZ but he is a teenager and  well...if you have a teenager you know where I'm coming from.   Even though we liked it, we like Philadelphia Sandwich Company better and it will be hard to go right by it to go to DeFalco's.   Another quick thing to mention. The guy taking our orders was not rude but his attitude was "I'm doing you a favor by standing here taking your order". So....I don't know if he was hung over or having a bad day but it was our first impression.

nSlaiyKHOLmEO0QOzMqvPQ.text: Their marinara sause is out of this world! Stuffed pasta shells are wonderful, Phili cheese steak (with a side of marinara!), and deli sandwiches are all outstanding. It's a fun atmosphere with the italian grocery. Highly recommended.

KD2wlVHKJQrBUl3Tgg767g.text: After reading all the wonderful reviews, I had very high expectations. I was completely disappointed. The customer service was horrendous. My husband was made fun of in Spanish by an employee over his France football jersey. Funny thing is my French husband is fluent in Spanish. Next time wait until your back in the kitchen to make fun of customers. Philly cheese steaks mediocre. Most of the food in the deli case was old and crusty. The place was disgusting, too many employees standing around doing nothing as well. It was actually uncomfortable to be stared at while we ate. Also noticed health code violation of storing food items directly on floor. We bought a few food items to go and a lot of cheese, my husband forgot his wallet at home and had to wait for me to pay. The manager on duty proceeded to laugh in his face. This place is a joke and we will never spend our hard earned money in this establishment again.

fN8cC4nv8FAvhzCa_h5smw.text: The only thing I hate about this place is how many times I should be going there for lunch and forget about it.   We've ordered takeout here for work on several occasions, and just recently I was able to eat at Defalco's for the first time. What I've realized? The line is absolutely well worth it. I've tried to order a different sandwich every time and every time it's been just as amazing as the last, if not better.  I love how the line goes through the store, allowing you to see all the wines, beer options, foods you can buy and the deli section in slow motion before you make it to the counter. Next time I am definitely getting the German potato salad!  Two minor issues I had with eating in last time: 1)  One of the displayed beers, a microbrew I look forward to every year, wasn't actually available. 2) Upon going up to the counter to get a refill on my beverage the man taking orders was very upset. He told me the people in the line were gonna come after me. And I'll stop there. I think this took longer than actually refilling my drink.

y3wrnMPnQS_G9vEoq-N87g.text: I have never had a thing here that wasn't amazing. The wait for your food is totally worth it and acceptable with their quality.

EygqllMYPQ4oI4Tv9Vz6Ug.text: Hats off to the family who owns this place.  Great authentic food at good prices in a fun atmosphere makes for a winning combination.  Just don't let it get to your head.  Oh, and be sure to call in and order instead of just swinging by during your lunch break.  Shaves off about 15-20 minutes of waiting.

MuyRywF5B1t44aPQXC6HjA.text: I've been here more times than I can count & it is always delicious.  Usually pretty busy and hard to find seating, but the food is enough to keep me coming back.  They have added pizza to the menu which I have yet to try, but looks amazing.  They have also added a lot more Italian items to their grocery than when I first started coming & organized it a little better. Wonderful!

5RFNIXNUQafKRSgY1nZncA.text: When we arrived there was a pretty long line and only one person taking orders. After a long wait in line food was brought out pretty quick except the calzone I ordered. My husband got done eating his food and dessert and I still had not eaten. I wished the would tell you the Calzone takes a long time  but other than that the food was good and the calzone is really big and delicious.

Qfq2Zi7D8pb-RZqkP8wFnw.text: Both my cheese stake and my wife's lasagna with a small salad and garlic bread was amazing. Both of us thought it was the best we had, had in a long time. The staff were very friendly and were very out going truly showing pride and ensuring that customers knew theypp were number 1. The inside was extremely clean the staff were on top of ensuring that tables were cleaned as soon as a customer left. We also ordered desert I got the chocolate eclair in my wife Delhi New York cake. Those as well were outstanding extremely fresh. We will be coming back we drive from far West Peoria  so it's a drive so that should show how good this place is.

dsuz6EEsT_JphWTdE6rOew.text: Went there for lunch today and it was sooo good. The pizza was delish! Authentic Italian New York style awesomeness- this jersey girl would know! The meat, the cheese, the sauce, the crust... it was all yummy. I highly recommend and would definitely go there again.

la5g-8KEDmX1c0-1lv9FAA.text: DeFalco's is easily one of the best, if not the best, Italian spots in all of the Valley. Everything about this place feels authentic the second you walk in. The atmosphere is amazing. DeFalco's is a hybrid, both a place to eat, and a place to shop. The store looks a little cramped, but there is definitely space for everyone, dont let the looks decieve you! Their menu is relatively large, and definitely fair in price (10-15 dollars per meal) for the quantitity and quality of the food you recieve. Personal favorite is the Chicken Alfredo. It's just Chicken Alfredo, but it is done right, every single time. Their pizza is also amazing, decent cheese to sauce ratio, and the crust is perfect! Food is delivered to your seat, whether that be in-store, or the outside patio they offer. They also offer to-go. Their fountain drink selection is pretty standard, Pepsi products + Dr. Pepper. They also offer a variety of unsweetened teas, all of which are delicious in their own right.   DeFalco's has amazing food and amazing quality that they offer their guests every single time. When you come here, you come in expecting great food, and leave with great food in your belly (or hand)!

qdxZJhNzRkDQ_3Ykl68nFw.text: We ordered a pizza from these guys for the first time Saturday-normally, we get their yummy sandwiches- and it was SO good!  Very fresh and the dough was delicious. Better than Oreganos!  Highly recommend this place!

6c8A-tfUaV384JIrrGEyIQ.text: We arrived last night at 6:05 and the line was not long but certainly busy.  We ordered Chicken Alfredo, Spaghetti and Meatball, Eggplant Parm and the il Purista.  The food all in was solid with a couple of snags.  I saw reviews about slow service, and that is the rub.  We had two couples and we ordered back to back.  The first order came about 15 minutes later, which is no problem.  After my wife and I had waited a full 30 minutes and our dining partners were nearly done eating we went and found someone to help us.  They brought us the food then, and while good, the Alfredo was lukewarm, meaning it was sitting up there ready.  WTH?  I suspect the issue is with their numbering system which is out of sync.  We watched a table that ordered 10 behind us get served far before us.  Why?  They had the number 24 and we had the number 45.  Just a guess that the delivery guy was picking off the lower numbers, or going random.  Either way their is no first in first out process in place.  We will go back, and expect to have to bird dog our order.

XKJB6ikAZZ_y0tSoYHTFTw.text: We ordered the 10 inch centurion canzone and split it!  So yummy.  We saw Guy Fierro on food channel and wanted to try this!  Mind blowing good

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious!  Mind blowing good!

qvNfNjqkjkHxmMLrdf9ddw.text: I have been craving for pizza for awhile now, so my friends and I finally decided on defalco's for their Italian food. It was a right choice. :)   Quick tip: I was rather confused in terms of how to order at first because it was a grocery store and a restaurant at the same time. Unlike the others, they have tables and chairs between the aisles so there isn't really a clear separation between the grocery store and the restaurant itself. Once you enter, you can just go ahead and stand in line to order, then find a table afterwards. Think of it as getting a sandwich from Safeway!   I ordered the II Purista since almost everyone on Yelp recommended it. There is a variety of bread you can choose from, like marble rye, sour dough, and wheat, etc.  I ordered the crispy baguette to go along with it. The sandwich was very fresh and the mozzarella cheese in it was very spongy! It was good and I'm so proud of myself for getting it.   My two other friends ordered the calzone and the pizza margherita. I didn't get to try the calzone because it looked huge and stuffed with cheese. It's just like a pizza folded in half. I knew I was going to get sick if I ate that, so no thank you. However, the pizza was PHENOMENAL! My friend says in order to know if an italian restaurant is really good, he always order the most basic margherita to test it out. It didn't disappoint. The basil leaves were super fresh. It was great!!!

Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Purista, a must get!

20x0sYhXyUua-notzM4nnA.text: Went back for the first time in more than 2 years.  Bottom line...just not good. Ordered two sandwiches on two different types of bread.  Bread on both was stale. Sandwich fillings were lacking ant type of flavor.  Hugely disappointing. Unlikely to return.

5ptJBcQBagVXlYY8Zlml-Q.text: What a great sandwich! Defalco's definitely is your Italian eatery. The meat is super fresh elegantly placed in your sandwich. Everything traditional and New York style deli. So happy this place fell in my routine spots. Just a tip order a head if possible. You will wait a bit

HRN17u4_4ceCwtFCkl6sNQ.text: My first visit to Defalco's did not live up to my expectations.  Ordering food at the counter is sufficiently quick and orderly.  Though, I had to ask how I was going to receive my food, because there is nothing to imply they will deliver it to your table.  I guess they simply remember your face or something.  Within a few minutes, my order was delivered to my table outside on the patio, but I still had to convince the young man that, yes, I ordered a half meatball AND a half cheesesteak.  Sheesh.  Don't judge me!  The sandwiches come with a small pepper on the side.  Both were very good, but I have some complaints.    The meatball wasn't as warm as I would have preferred and the bread they use makes their sandwiches difficult to eat, especially the meatball.  The bread they choose to use is big, flaky, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, Italian bread.  I don't like it.  I hate trying to maneuver my mouth around a sandwich that is obviously too big, so my only choice is to flatten, mold, and manipulate the bread to where it is edible.  Doing this invariably creates a meatball mess, because the bread is not properly designed to contain meatballs and marinara sauce.  Though, cutting it up into smaller portions seemed to work.  The cheesesteak was delicious, but the one-note, repetitive flavor became overwhelming towards the end.  I think it was the cheese they use.  It overpowers everything else and diminishes all of the other elements to an imperceptible degree.  I couldn't even taste the onions and green peppers.  The meat was also barely perceptible.  Too much cheese, I guess.  Though, I did appreciate the fact that I could squish the cheesesteak without making a mess, which was the complete opposite of the meatball.  Overall, Defalco's is still a great place, but personally I prefer Casella's.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half cheesesteak (no mushrooms) and half meatball

btm9JDta5rtmCnEYdbssOQ.text: My husband and I are 20+ year happy patrons of DeFalco's.  In the last year, we've visited a few times, and the quality is simply not there anymore.  This last time, it was inedible (chicken parm).  One of our friends (also a long time patron) mentioned that he recently visited and had the same reaction to his meal.  The three of us are sadly done.

wI5C0sKYwAW0zwAyWhDH_w.text: This little local Italian Deli and Grocery store is awesome! We stopped in for some authentic Italian groceries. They have a wide variety of imported pastas, sauces, cookies, olive oils, vinegars and other oils. Cheeses and meats. We walked out with ingredients to make a super yummy lasagna. The deli here is stocked with pasta salads, sandwiches, and other Italian delicacies. The service here is top notch. Tony was there when we were there, and my husband(who is half Italian) and Tony traded lasagna recipes. We will be back!

gnp6AmuEYijGapvSmO0zcg.text: I've been going to Defalco's for 20 years. I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I didn't live or work in/near South Scottsdale for many years and just rediscovered this place when I moved back to the East Valley. So lucky to be close to it again. The food is always fresh and delicious. I've had many things from here. The pizza's and subs and dinners are all wonderful. The egg sandwiches are to die for!

vchm4qtDlwHd1BJKQaRUiA.text: WOW!! This place has solid Italian food! you can eat there or get it to go but either way you're making a great move by eating here! I had the chicken pesto and it was amazing! they also have a great wine selection!

Oz2A-yjiGplsobjUjCkYNw.text: This was a very fun experience.  If the place wasn't near closing, we would have eaten there.  The choices are abundant!!!  We ordered pizza but also picked up deli meat and cheese.  There dessert looked amazing, too.  The service was over the top!  My Dad wants to come back and bring his girlfriend...lives in Pinetop:(. This place just has the most amazing atmosphere...nice mix ofcombination of a Store/Deli/Restaurant.  Loved it!

d-NwHN6xyJUKKGMXrX1VBA.text: I have been here a few times and every time I've eaten solid well made Italian food.  The front of the space is a market with pastas, frozen foods, and plenty of other neat little items to pick up on impulse. The deli and pastries are wonderful as well, my personal favorite is the rainbow cookies.   When I go we normally share so I got the opportunity to try a good amount of items. The calzones to warn you are just as huge as they are delicious. The gnocchi in pesto was great and cooked perfectly. And the bruschetta sandwich was different than expected but still a good size and taste, once again was perfect. All of the pasta and noodles will be just what you're looking for. The allla vodka was perfectly creamy and rich! I can't give this little spot enough praise and suggestion if what you are craving is home cooked heavy Italian food.

ILbButb2ZUKUgDJc0IcLHg.text: I get the Maximus sandwich on sourdough each time I come and it never disappoints. They have many options to choose from and I plan on trying new items on future visits.

lRc8wDaV7u6XAzhhO7Tliw.text: It was ok. I came bc I had seen this on DDD and to be honest I wouldn't come again. The bread is WAYYY too thick. I ordered the chicken Alfredo and the chicken was an overly seasoned fries chicken breast. The sauce was good though. The pizza my kids got was ok but the Italian sandwich wasn't what I expected. Too much bread made everything dry.

RlU1ixy7NQKWwv6lQN4yeA.text: I really like this place , I've ate this please multiple times and has yet to disappoint.   They have fantastic Cannolis fresh and cold just how it should be .   Price is very good with a huge amount of food  quality is is worth it .   I'll revisit again ..

V7kwYJybSAWSI5k8LQ4nkQ.text: Everyone needs a good 'ol Italian deli in their neighborhood. I'm a vegetarian, and I still think this place is great. For starters, the wait staff is hilarious and create the laid back ambiance. The Caprese Salad is good, but unfortunately their "amazing" marinara is not vegetarian :(.. Still highly recommend

hH7Fp5U6ZBQCWRI2I2_EEQ.text: This place is very cramped. The gal at the ordering counter had an attitude, didn't give me a copy of the credit card receipt until I came back to get it. The tables are too small and there is hardly room to get to the station where you get soda, water and silverware. I prefer to dring water with my food, but the water tasted funky. Oh yeah, when we got our food, they didn't bring any silverware, so I maneuvered over to the station and they were out of forks. So I had to go to the pickup counter and ask for forks for my wife and me. The glass of wine I got (Chianti) was very stingy in quantity and bitter. This place is so tiny that we didn't feel comfortable talking because our business would become everyone else's. We ordered eggplant parmesan and spaghetti and meatball. Meatball singular is what you get, pretty lame. Prices are too high for what you get in this no-frills place. Some inconsiderate employee was hogging the restroom way too long. On the plus side, the food tasted good and they did include garlic bread and salad. But the salad came at the same time as the main dish, so that does me no good. I don't think I'll return, at least not for dinner, maybe lunch or for pizza to go.

8NOuqyzy3-OivrZRMNHZmA.text: i love this place, fresh made to order subs and sandwiches, the eggplant parmesan sub is awesome, hot and crispy, with a great marina and cheese, its not like the heavy overbaked trays of eggplant parmesan  thats usually soggy, , i have it with only a bit of that great gravy so its not messy, nice deli counter, very friendly staff. and the brick oven pizza is to die for, has a del counter, fresh imported cheeses , assorted fresh and dried pastas, nice market.

y_Tj-rrjvPw66v7CkFhiAA.text: two words: FRICKIN YUM!  Whenever the boyfriend and I drive down Scottsdale Road the boyfriend ALWAYS has to mention that he wants to try out Defalco's...so, last night I did my homework and yelped Defalco's before giving it a go.  I decided the reviews were pretty damn awesome and that I would have to go by for lunch.   Ok, this place...so amazing.  It's seriously like Italy decided to give birth to a small little grocery store in the middle of a pretty lame plaza to grace Arizona with its presence.  It's got racks and racks of Italian wines, balsamic vinegars, Italian breads and sweets.  They've also got some frozen pasta to cook up in your own home. Anyway, let's get to the good stuff.  As many have mentioned it does get packed during lunch so expect a wait.  The boyfriend got a full chicken parmigina sandwich. It was pretty good and a HUGE serving.  He got it on the soft roll and they do not skimp out on the chicken.  The roll was filled with perfectly breaded chicken breast, topped with a simple, yet flavorful marinara sauce and of course...so cheese. YUM. Like I said it was pretty big and filling and it was $7.50.  I took fellow Yelpers suggestions and got a half order of the beef cheese steak with mushrooms, onions, and peppers. Heaven in the mouth for $5. Enough said.  One star off for the wait but it was worth it!

OQ7jVZ7ye5BkbfBPbymMXw.text: Love love love it! I had the half combo, which is a sandwich on sourdough w/Salami, Mortadella, Pepperoni, Provolone and I asked them to hold the ham- comes with their house italian, lettuce, mayo and mustard. Absolutely delicious! After I finished the 1/2 sandwich I decided to be daring and grab a piece of the cheesecake, which was to die for. I haven't had a slice of homemade cheesecake in a long time.   The staff was so nice and friendly and the locale was very clean and tidy. I think I found a new fave spot.

HjEpkppU--O228L97l4bUw.text: Ahhmazing cheesesteak. Was a bit of a wait but pretty much worth it. Loved the wine selection and other grocery goodies!

TXpJbXbYELXTMjmCW8qwtA.text: This place lives up to its reputation and I always leave satsified.  One of my favorite places to go for good subs, italian cured meats, and antipasto. While it's setup as a mini market/ deli, the market offerings are a little pricier than i've seen elsewhere.    Back to the subs tho - great crusty loaves, high quality meats, and made in True italian deli fashion. The also offer some traditional italian dishes if you're in the mood for a real meal.    While I usually just get a quick sub or am picking up some things to go, there are some tables to sit at if you choose.  Plus the people are pretty laid back and friendly.  Only complaint that I have is the traditional Euro-style reusable and communal towel in the restroom.  A little hard to shake considering how many people don't wash or don't wash properly.

tbtkAvWyFaM2zOmG4Q27gQ.text: Best chicken parm in town, best cheesesteak in town, best Italian grocery in town.  I wish they move to a more comfortable location, but in a way, the cramped nature is part of the charm.  Love this place.

EeprsgK7OzjeXvVw1WWjeA.text: A coworker and I checked the place out for the first time a few weeks ago.  I liked the atmosphere. It seemed more of a grocery store with a few tables than a restaurant, but that's not a complaint. The chicken parmesan sandwich was awesome! I can't wait to try the pizza. And, I'd like to go there for one of their Italian beers, as well.  The grocery part was awesome. They had a good selection of pasta, sauces, cheeses, etc.   Call ahead your order! Especially if you have a time limit. Otherwise, great place that is a must to check out.

RUfcUOHdTCnUU7ALhnQt-Q.text: Not really much of a grocery store but a great little deli and restaurant.  I had a wonderful calzone that was enough for two meals.  My friend had a sandwhich with a side of antipasti salad that looked really good as well.  A small selection of wine and beer but the reason to go here is all about the food.  Didnt try the desserts but might next time if I have room.

QeiXNo4z9ZOJckm6ZZ0lUA.text: Update - was contacted directly by the owner after my previous review, who was very apologetic and sincere and offered to refund me for the bad experience and to buy me lunch if I would come back in.  Can't say enough about the customer service now.  He was very upset about my experience and the last employee's reaction to my phone call.  No wonder he is successful!

TXKgfTLC8hRwYTnRAhJF_g.text: Food is great! I usually order a pasta or sandwich and have tried the pizza. The pizza is not as good as the pasta though. Also they sell pizza dough and have used there dough to make pizza at home! Easy to order and casual atmosphere is my type of place when looking for a quick lunch or dinner. I've never done any shopping here but have been tempted to buy some wine. I highly recommend this place if you want a sandwich or some really good pasta.

KNOoC90ZUgBW1A3G5CMeRw.text: If you're craving some good italian deli food, this is the best around. It's got an extensive menu from pizzas to deli sandwiches. It also has Italian groceries where u can pick up some great quality meats. I always order their hot sandwiches  like the meatball or Philly cheese steak. The portions and price are just right at about 6" and $5. The only knock I have is the wait time can be a bit long if you can't afford a long lunch at work.

cWZCIcIx-IdcMdbhnuMaNA.text: Awesome deli!  had the Li purista....super good, tons of prosciutto and banging flavor!  We will be back!

DJMRWyD_yuQpN4xUCYOgjQ.text: I can't believe the BF & I wasted 30 minutes of our time at this place waiting for our cold cut Ham, Turkey & Provolone on sourdough & Pastrami on wheat roll sandwiches.  There were only a handful of people ordering at the time & in the store.  I'm assuming they were short handed that day, or had to fly all the way out to Italy to get our frickin' sandwich fixings.  The sandwiches were mediocre at it's best.  The sandwiches tasted bland and cold cuts were dry.  The crapeteria here at my work makes better sandwiches than this place.    I guess the saying, "you get what you paid for" is definitely True here & for a 1/2 sandwich at $4.25, I shouldn't have expected too much, especially when I've been accustomed to some awesome sandwiches from Genova's Delicatessen & Specialty's Cafe & Bakery.  One good thing about this place was the guy behind the ordering counter.  He was friendly, upbeat & extremely helpful.  Would I revisit this place next time I visit Scottsdale...ummm...no thank you!

OTVjXRPzK_dK8VgKGmy20A.text: Everyone knows that Tony Soprano didn't die, HBO merely made the ending ambiguous so that America would be shielded from the awful truth that he was planning to move away from the East Coast to none other than Scottsdale, Arizona. Why you ask? Because where else can you carry on business dealings in a strip joint, be involved in "waste management", act out of control all the time, philander, defraud the government...and fit right in? But for he and many other recent transplants from Jersey, the truth is part of Scottsdale's allure rests with places like DeFalco's Italian Grocery.  Sitting in a worn strip mall in an older section of town, the scene almost evokes a little hint of the Garden State. However, the good news is that I've never seen anyone whacked in the spacious parking lot...or wearing a Members Only jacket for that matter. Upon entering, there's a claustrophobic sensation as you see the grocery aisles creating a slightly labyrinthine path to the deli counters, which are separate based on ordering prepared or raw food. Upon reaching the prepared food aisle, you'll invariably see a microcosm of Scottsdale, ranging from senior citizens to high schools girls using platinum cards to buy lunch for the whole family. (Luckily though, no sign of Carmine Gotti just yet.)   The menu? It's a pageant of sumptuous meats and cheeses, and they even offer I-talian soda to go with. It's so good, you might think like many a famous eatery it's a front for the local outfit. While I don't believe that to be True...(it is Arizona after all) the owners certainly make purists and old school Italian food fans happy with its inclusion of more traditional meat choices like capacollo. The food also will seem dry, but that's only because they are careful not to drown out the meat's character with too much mayo or other condiments. Some may not like it.  Price-wise, this place is pretty much a steal. It's a shade more expensive than Subway, but not much more-so. But as Scottsdale goes, it's almost unbeatable. They also accept plastic and have a loyalty card, so as you can imagine, you'll want to come back often if you know what is good for you.  Since it's a deli, there's no waitstaff. Still, service is total class. People are friendly, and professional so that it still feels family-owned and not corporate. The tables are usually clean in the seating area, and spaced evenly enough that you won't feel like someone just broke your legs.  But then there is the one detraction to this place: the supposedly endless wait for your order. I've never been on a weekday, but weekends I have found are pretty manageable. For some people it won't  be like Jack-in-the-Box, but if you order ahead you should avoid some of the hassle.  Of course, part of the allure going to an Italian restaurant in the cultural attitude about savoring life, food and a slower pace than our Anglo-Saxon roots ultimately prefer. Unless, that is, you have reservations to Buca di Beppo...but that's another story entirely.

a0JHrc9-GBCchbU-UQe1wQ.text: Been coming here over the years, never disapoints. Fresh imgrediants and friendly staff. Best red potato salad in town. Get there early as they get very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Defalco&#39;s

mDraWjF-2afWFYz2y_HSAw.text: WOW, WOW, WOW!!!! Too bad you can't give 10 stars! This is a great place to get AUTHENTIC Italian food at a VERY REASONABLE price. Everything from salads and sandwiches to full meals. Real Italian creme sodas, deli, desserts, GROCERY STORE, you name it, they have it. We were visiting our daughter in Scottsdale. SO GLAD that she knew about DeFalco's. WOW, WOW, WOW!!! I had the eggplant Parmesan (it comes in two sizes, I should have gotten the small!) and my husband had their Italian sausage and peppers sandwich. My daughter had alfredo and her boyfriend had the meatball sub... all sandwiches come with your choice of homemade breads. The deli counter looked amazing and the smells... ahhhhhhhhhhhh! The first time we stopped, my husband and I shared the turtle cheesecake. The next time we were in the area we stopped specifically for their lemon cake... WOW! If you are in the old downtown Scottsdale area and you love Italian, YOU HAVE GOT TO STOP at DeFalco's!!!

hzpZ0J6aSHBnjf3OHzoatQ.text: This place has a lot of great things going on. When you enter through the doors you might get a second thought about ordering food from what appears to be a mini mart for noodles and other random trinkets; don't be an idiot! Stay in line and get something,..anything,..it is all good.  I absolutely enjoyed their cheese steak sandwiches. The Italian sodas were always refreshing and they have so many other things.   Take a second to read the owners story it adds to the reason you will like this place.

jhndN5vLQqNIXmSupRpvoQ.text: 4 1/2 stars!  Oh Defalco's.  You drain my bank account and you take up my entire lunch hour just driving to and from but I don't care, because you are delicious.    By far the best authentic Italian deli in the Valley, I have yet to have one thing there that I didn't love.  They have a gigantic menu of options, featuring everything from hot and cold sandwiches, pizza, full hot pastas and entrees like the intoxicating chicken parmigiana, and a stacked deli case of side dishes with easily the best pasta salad I've ever had.  Family owned and operated which is another littler perk in my opinion.  Let's put it this way.  My boss is usually in town for a week to a week and a half every month and he still manages to eat there at least 6 times...it's that good.  They freshly bake all of their own bread daily, which is excellent.  I prefer the Crispy Baguette with my sandwiches because it is oh so flaky and wonderful.  If you've got extra $$ to throw around they also have a quite nice-sized grocery selection right in the deli featuring authentic Italian delights.  I'm talking everything from 30 different types of aged balsamic vinagrette to over 100 different bottles of Italian wine.  The only reason I have to take a half a star off is because if you make the fatal mistake of going there between the hours of 11:30am-2:00pm M-F and you did not have the foresight to call your order in advance, you will sit there for 45 minutes, EASY.  But now that I have mastered the timed call in approach, it is wonderful and you should all go if you haven't : )

-V3sXmZAsvHE8odX8ZplbA.text: This place is amazing!   The food is wonderful and very well priced.   The staff is always so kind.   I would definitely recommend!  Ravioli was amazing!  The calzone was amazing! The chicken parm was amazing!    Go here. :)

uTU1MUzNZSvoceTHvxyMug.text: It breaks my heart...alright, that's an overstatement, but it does make me sad, that the food here is slipping.  The lasagna has not been the same since the first time I ordered it and reviewed it so glowingly; every visit I always get the spaghetti (and by the way, the one time I ordered meatballs, there was too much breadcrumbs.  Wait, what?  When does that happen?) has been mediocre at best.  The last six visits-that's SIX visits - it's not hot enough.  Look, I "can" the busboy it's not hot enough, but he doesn't know saute'.  Apparently, neither do the cooks. The chef?  Management?  No one's home.  Look, I know it's deli masquerading as a restaurant...but it's still supposed to be a restaurant.  The lasagna, which I thought was awesome, the spaghetti is cold...why am I going back?  That's the tough part about the restaurant business: every single day is "SHOW ME".

0TGP6TSV8ruCIrNT5cXZHQ.text: The food is AMAZING!  My friend and I stopped for a "snack" at about 4:30 pm and split an order of stuffed shells....so terrific that we decided to skip making lobster risotto for dinner and brought a second order home to share with our friends for dinner.  We also bought some Italian condiments to take home.  Highly recommended!

9k71Z-4r78DWqmWULVHBTQ.text: Italian is not my #1 choice but my husband has picked Deflaco's for dinner twice in two weeks! We were so pleased after our first visit that we went back not too much after. This place is great in that they have made-to-order sandwiches, pastas, and pizzas and also a wide selection of groceries.  The first time we went was on a Friday night & it was packed! Even though the line was long, the time it took to order & also get our food was reasonable. I decided to get the Grilled Veggie Sandwich & Penne/Mostaccioli side salad and my husband got the Calzone & Tortellini Salad side salad. The sandwich & side salads were both very colorful and tasted great.  I think the sandwich would have benefited from having the herbed mayonnaise inside the sandwich instead of on the top to really get the flavor of it on the veggies. I honestly should have just asked for an extra side of it since I always like there to be a generous amount of spread / sauce but still, I enjoyed it.  I was a bit hesitant in ordering the Penne side salad because it had salami & pepperoni. The meats didn't have a strong flavor though, so I wasn't even able to tell that the pasta salad had any meat in it (until I ate the pieces of salami & pepperoni), very good! The tortellini side salad was equally good, and in this one as well, the ham didn't have a super strong flavor. I'd recommend either one but if I had to pick, I'd go with the tortellini.  My husband enjoyed his calzone so much that he got it both times we were there. The first time, he got a 10" one with mushrooms and the second time, he got the 12" one with sausage & mushrooms. The calzone was was really cheesy and had quite a bit of toppings. The best part though (in my opinion) was the marinara sauce that came with it. So good!  I had gotten the Margarita Pizza the second time & even the 12" was huge, I was literally able to get three meals out of it. I enjoyed the flavors that were on it but this wouldn't be my number 1 place to get a pizza at ... yet. I am interested in trying out just a cheese pizza with toppings & the White Pizza too.  Overall, 4.5 stars for flavors, ease of ordering, & the good service (especially considering it's a grocery store). We saw them bring out fettuccini alfredo & lasagna to other tables & they looked amazing. I can't wait to go back & try their other menu options.

3UF4_I-FouyJ0H_chWLyog.text: One of the best secrets in Scottsdale. The food is excellent.  Lasagna, meatballs and chicken parmesan.  We go 2xs a month. You have to have time. The place is busy. They are family owned. The family is nice. This is a True gem in the Scottsdale food sceene don't forget the Italian cookies and pastry or the take home pizza dough.

yFI0Q-wWCu1UGbWaNKOYbA.text: Holy Cannoli    Forget "Defalco's," this biz is "De-LICIOUS!" Meatbal sub all day! Also, the CHEESECAKE is to die for! It's tiny inside but outside seating is available

CnwIZo7PIoA_mPTW3FLuWQ.text: Wow.  Defalco's brings Italian food to a whole new level! Do not be deceived by their name, it is a grocery store but they have a restaurant tucked away in there as well and you do not want to miss out. Hidden behind the aisles of delicious shelf stable Italian food, as well as fresh you will find a deli, as well as a counter where you can order pizza's, pastas, calzones, sandwiches, salads, desserts, oh and the best philly cheese steak sandwich (don't question this just get it!)   You will probably have a hard time anytime of the day or week finding seating in here, it is a really small place, but if you have the patience it is not impossible to get a seat, and you do seat yourself. So if you come with someone and you notice an open table immediately send someone to sit there even if they haven't ordered yet, because chances are that when you're done ordering it will be gone.  You can also purchase wine here by the glass or the bottle, if you want some you might as well buy a bottle because the glass will run you about $7 dollar and you can find some decent ones on their shelf for around $15. Just ask for some wine glasses and for the bottle to be opened. No corkage fee either.  I would choose a meal here over a fancy Italian restaurant any day. The calzones blow my mind even their simple cheese calzone is amazing. They come with marinara on the side, not inside of it. This prevents it from getting soggy. The dough is light, crisp and perfect.   The pastrami sandwich is the best I have ever had. The Philly cheese steak sandwich is also the best I have ever had. It makes it so hard to choose!  They also have these little marzipan cookie/cakes that are so delicious for only about $1. Along with a wide array of other desserts like cannolis.  So if you are in the mood for Italian head to Defalco's everytime.

p0bBdarYmnqglAKIKPwCow.text: In a town full of expensive, yet mediocre food, Defalco's Italian Grocery is a local gem. I will say that I think some menu items are better than others... The first time I went, I ordered a margarita pizza and was not very impressed. But luckily I decided to give it another shot. They have amazing desserts and sandwiches. To be fair, I am vegetarian but some of my favorite items here are the grilled veggie sandwich (make sure to specify your bread at the register or they will select for you), the vegetable and artichoke lasagna, the caramel fudge cheesecake (it's literally unreal...), and the lemon ricotta cookie. Once you find an item you love on their long, extensive menu, you won't stop coming back to Defalco's. The prices are also amazing. A whole portion (they have whole and half) tends to be at least 2 meals for me. They also have a great selection of cheeses and grocery items such as frozen pastas and ice cream. Definitely check this place out!

Uq1FEoHLUV0p3jdceBPbCw.text: Everything about this place is great. I usually get a cheese steak but everything ive seen come out of the kitchen has been excelent

CGcqr6ukcnn0j6WFgPuEOg.text: This place is lost on me. The store front is cool and has a lot of neat stuff (cookies, canned tomatoes, frozen ravioli, etc) but the food is not good. I got a meatball sub and a sausage sub. The board says homemade but to me the sausage tastes like a frozen breakfast sausage and the meatballs were not the consistency I imagined. Can't speak to the pizza or pasta.

sL5y11sZjIAmqhmdeR0IFg.text: Thank you Yelp, you did not disappoint.  We are staying in a rental in the neighborhood. After a long day exploring the area, we wanted a meal we could bring back and just relax. This came up in a search So we decided to check it out based on past reviews.  We ordered two pizzas, a salad, and some cannoli.  When I went to pick up the order, the place was super busy. That's a good sign in my book. Folks like me picking up orders. A long line of people placing their orders. The few tables were full of happy diners.  The food did not disappoint. Everything was delicious. I only wish my stomach could hold more.   If I'm ever back here I know where one of my first meals will come from.

IR3Xk6chetn1a145e2wNZA.text: Very good!  The portions are VERY big. I had the sausage and peppers n onion sandwich with Havarti.  It doesn't come with cheese but the havarti was great on it.  I also had a chocolate cannoli.  I saw a lady with a salad that was huge!  Worth the visit!

gQuzMQfyBVAvhbJoklOpjQ.text: The best cheese steak in Phoenix! The purista is pretty bomb too! If ordering the pizza you should have it in the restaurant. One of my favorite places to eat, not just in Scottsdale, but in all of Phoenix.

OOhbjymw_E5kP-M54UXLHw.text: While the food here was really well prepared, the service here is poor. I'm constantly asked why don't I buy meats on my food like some sort of up sale... and instead of asking if I need anything with my to go orders every other day I eat there, I have to ask and ask and ask very dry people with no customer appreciation.

9gS07OKmLoBRCrKBzQ6N_Q.text: This place is disgusting. The employees are unhelpful slackers who hang out in the bathroom for long periods of time then don't wash their hands afterwards. I had to wait forever for my order also. This place sucks. Do not come here. I won't be surprised when this place shuts down before next year.

Z16xD-tFzrUCK-W6MsQFsw.text: Wow. So very good. We had pasta, chicken Marsala, cheesecake. All of it really good. More seating than I thought as they have outdoor patio seating. Not too crowded for a Saturday evening. Tables a bit dirty is only real complaint. We certainly will be back!!!

LEQk_XcL4Mv0_OlbbPdRQg.text: Great authentic food and service, tried lasagna 4 cheese pasta. Will be  back but don't have wifi which to me is very important and would have given 5 stars. Get it please!

xr4-LGsMHMP6vlVInBgTmA.text: In my original review four years ago, I said:  I'll make it simple.  Come for the food, and stay to shop.  Or, come here to shop, and stay for the food!  Either way, you cannot go wrong!  We have been coming here for over eight years, going back to their previous location. They've grown and yet they still need more room.   At DeFalco's we love the food, the Italian sandwiches, the cold cuts (mostly Capocola), bread, frozen Ricotta filled Ravioli, Wine, and that was only our shopping list for today.  LOL  As I said in my Check-In, it's hard to get out of here for under a $100. But it's money well spent!
