Ug4S9YNoXcaBNp6EiQR5AQ.text: Not a lot of seating. So be sure to get Takeaway if it's crowded. I recommend the baked ziti oh my goodness what a great evening we had

ewvTtiEuw188X7WaNNmMwA.text: I was scrolling through yelp food recomendations and saw this place. I love places that you can buy imported specialties. This ensures at least that the ingridients in the deli are authentic. I picked the reuben and my boyfriend picked the prosciutto. Both were on fresh bread that had wonderful texture. I choose to have the corn beef on my reuben and it was cooked perfectly. It reminded me of home.  I also purchased there lemon bar which was cooked well and tasted fresh. Had the right amount of lemon flavoring without being overwhelming.  We arrived at 7 pm and they seemed busy. I was slightly confused on where to order but I also believe I misunderstood the signs directing the customer. At the end as we were leaving we were handed a loaf of bread for free. It made my day!  I will definitely be returning again and will test out different times to guage the best times to go!

8AoKJuNCYTaK_uS8S_oq-A.text: Love love love this place . Shout out to Jasmine or J something girl with glasses and braces and a very pretty smile and friendly customer service driven demeanor . They rock and replaced a sandwich they slightly messed up no questions asked . Customer forLYFE!

LH__4oFVyXOBSyeooTtBEw.text: My fiance and two of our friends went to Defalco's for dinner tonight. I ordered the Meat Lasagna (half portion) which came with garlic bread and let me tell you..it was quite possibly the best lasagna I have ever had! The sauce was fantastic, perfectly seasoned. My fiance ordered the Pesto chicken sandwich, which I sampled. The bread was wonderful,chewy and slightly toasted, not like those terrible deflated buns at most sub shops, that they somehow manage to make shatter due to over toasting when bitten into. The bread itself was amazing here, coupled with juicy chicken and an almost floral fragrant pesto. Worth every bite!   Our friends ordered the Vegetarian lasagna and Pasta Alfredo. The Alfredo was buttery but needed pepper, which was fine since a lot of people don't like pepper and there were salt and pepper shakers at each table so the customer could decide if they wanted it or not. I didn't have a chance to sample the veggie lasagna, but by the pace at which it was eaten I assumed it was very good. All our orders came with a side of garlic bread that was absolutely fabulous, I would come back here just for the garlic bread.   This place is also a grocery store and so I couldn't resist but buy a jar of Puttanesca sauce and an order of tiramisu to go (which is sitting in my fridge as I type this), which I must say, sounds like a marvelous breakfast. Overall I really recommend Defalco's, they have an extensive array of wines, cheeses, meats, pasta and other products, particularly gelato. Don't miss the tubs of gelato in the freezer section in the most delectable flavors. I didn't buy any this time but definitely will the next time I go here.

NbeLDkgRRTmwfLExK-asBA.text: The classic Italian combo on marble rye was devoured before a pictures could be snapped. Wished I had order a full sandwich but had to save room for a slice of original cheese that towered high. Officially the tallest cheesecake I have ever seen and what a delicious slice. Pair with a pleasant shot of espresso this meal was beyond memorable. Will be back next time I am in Scottsdale! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Classic cheesecake

Wk_hyt1IHH41yH8PGZDuNw.text: What a great place, they have just about everything Italian when it comes to food. You can even buy a ball of just made pizza dough. They even have Lupini, if you know what that is, you are Italian. Fun just walking around the place and looking at all the stuff they have. Then there is the deli. While waiting for my pizza I stood and watched the items coming out of the kitchen. I wanted to take a bite from each of them. Everything looked just great. Got a pizza to go, the only problem was that traffic was heavy and it took me 40 minutes to get home.  I wanted to grab a slice from the box while driving but I just could not manage it as the slices were quite big and I think it would have ended up in my lap rather than my mouth. Even though it was a bit cold it was still quite good, great crust, nice sauce, cheese could have been spread a bit rather than just big slices placed on top. A bit light on the mushrooms, tasty pepperoni, but all and all a pizza I would return for. I only wish it was closer, if it was, I would be there several times a week.

EwKmEwLaPgBPDSUpV-FUzA.text: Awesome little Italian place. I highly recommend the beef Philly cheese steak. Been coming here for years. Sometimes it can take a very long time to get your food (even if they're dead) but i keep coming back for their great food and good prices.

jwJ-GFrsW01W8YG0lAzyMA.text: Great food ! Their pizza crust is really good. We also ordered dinner salads and tiramisu...all which were great ! Nice patio to eat on too !  This place has the True Italian feel to it especially with the market inside. I'm from Pittsburgh and it reminds me of the Strip District when I come here :)  I would definitely recommend.

58dxteqE7_t9QhS7gcKiVw.text: I saw this place profiled on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives last night, and it looked amazing!  I only live about 2 miles away from it, and not sure why I've never been there before.  I went today, and there is no doubt that I will be a customer for life.  I bought a bottle of wine, and Il Purista sandwich.  The sandwich was fantastic!!!  The meat, veggies, and cheese couldn't have been fresher.  They give you several options for what kind of bread you want.  I got the seeded sub roll, and it was perfect.  Soft and tasted great.  I'm already planning my next meal at Defalcos! :)

P3OZfkeVEeHlBzIQQwPeoQ.text: Solid Italian deli in Phoenix.  Not the best (could use more variety and service and goods) - the best is Bayside in Santa Monica, CA - but it's worthy addition to the Italian deli pantheon.  I had the Italian sandwich.  It was good, not great.

9PmzpSKq3Iyazsr310bIQg.text: Eating at this deli is like eating at a NY deli.  They Il Parista sandwich is amazing.  The cheese is fresh and prosciutto is delicious.  The meatballs and spaghetti are equal in taste to NY Italian food.  Excellent food and a quant market with interesting items to try.

IMk7OdAb1U9v0ojFow9d4A.text: This review is long overdue. My GF and I probably eat here 2 to 3 times a month. If we are struggling to think of a place where we should go for lunch this is our spot. There really isn't a lot on the menu I don't like. I love the Corn beef on Rye but they have mazing cheese steaks as well. If you live in the Old Town area and you haven't tried this you need to rethink your priorities.  If you have just moved to town or you're visiting, you need to make time for Defalco's.

Q1Ai5EWxVDCU02CrU91QPg.text: my husband and i loved the cheese steak sandwich. A full  sandwich is enough for two. Also cant go wrong with caprese salad -- probably better if they used arugula.  We're excited to try their pizza and wine next time

DcJToNLPe3T42tbFwAMZQg.text: Arguably the best pizza in town.    So much care is put into the each ingredient to make sure they provide a high quality product.  Thick mozzarella, zesty pizza sauce, crispy/chewy crust, & fresh toppings.    The wine selection, deli, desserts, & grocery offerings provide a nice distraction while you wait for you order.    Their staff is cheerful, friendly, and eager to help.  All around great experience.

zp048JPOptB0Nvc7heO2TA.text: Ok...this place is super cool. I haven't been here forever and I stopped in 2 days in a row! I tried the arancini, which was full of flavor, beef, peas and deliciousness. I did the fettuccine alfredo and it was creamy and garlicky. Yummmm. And I did a cannoli as well. Perfection. The next day, I went back for mini cannolis for a party I was going to. They made a fresh batch and they were a hit. I cannot wait to go back and explore more of this menu. Also, the staff is all super friendly and knowledgeable.

hvXNVqX9QV1ENO90dDvuSQ.text: We have lived less than 2 minutes from Defalcos for 15 years and it has never disappointed! My favorite dish in the EggPlant Parm, which is to die for! Thank you Defalcos for always being our go to restaurant!

T4y_6pBZzPUqK04V5dh1Ng.text: Eclairs to die for! The word foodgasm does not even begin to describe the feeling I got with the first bite! i just want to drown in the filling!   Also- the II Purist is delish.   Every time I go I give their herb infused olive oils the googly eyes but never end up taking it home. lol I will one day!

Wz1MDT89o9luzmhHN9UlkA.text: Love love love this place.       Deffinelty will be willing to stop by anytime nice staff and great food.

SX6ywb-fWXMjtbSNLdaQNw.text: This review concerns the sandwiches only.  I really like their food except for... the bread (which is kind of ironique for a sandwich).  The breads are way too soft (even the crunchy one which is not crunchy at all).   Being from France, I love bread but there is nothing like european bread in that shop. Other than the bread it is really good. That's why i usually buy my own bread somewhere else and when i get a sandwich at Defalco, i just put all of the ingredients from their sandwich into my own piece of bread.

LivbLRG-tMTa_5Kt2hwAkw.text: Best Italian deli/grocer ever! They make homemade dough, pastas, calzones... Everything!!! And they have the biggest Italian menu .... To top it off there are Italian groceries and some are even imported from Italy!!! Wow!! I love everything I've ever eaten here!!! They're busy so call ahead to pick up with plenty of notice.

pWTXcbp0Mcd0j4P9Dix4DA.text: Really liked this little gem.  Good food very reasonable prices.  Only downside is their process to order is ridiculous.  Waited in line for over 20 minute to place our order.  After that food was fast enough but man get another cashier or some help there.

cwlZBZndVsposhLBcauxlQ.text: A homey Italian grocery. Moreover a wonderful Italian restaurant. Nine of us (kids and all) went in. All were raving about the food. And nobody left with a feeling less than full. The star at the table(s) was the calzone. A feast in and of itself. Even their regular coffee any large chain's best. We will be back again.

dq6ZtkW8gXc6jYbHKHmsxw.text: DeFalco's is a Italian market deli and restaurant that will truly have you coming back for more :) We stopped at DeFalco's yesterday on our way out of Scottsdale and as always it was amazing . The stuffed pasta shells and the antipasto salad are the best I have ever eaten and as we shared a half plate that came with garlic bread I left a very happy mamma .

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8mJu935iLaj9rHljcKexVg.text: Great sandwich, good price, outdoor seating is a plus as well.    I do wish I could have seen the menu prior to getting to the counter to order (it's cramped and the menu is posted on the wall behind the counter so you can't see a lot of it until you're up on the register).  Also, the outdoor seating is very tight as there are probably 3 too many tables out there.    All of the food that came out looked delicious.  I had a sandwich this time but look forward to trying the pasta next time as it looked great.    The grocery area is great and I picked up some old Italian favorites after lunch.

IN-G-McuR_7PuQdIuoOfYw.text: This place was so good my husband and I could not believe it. Triple D does not lie we came all the way from Toronto just for this little gem. Great sandwiches and anywhere you can drink wine at noon without judgement is great in my books. Friendly staff and fresh product it was the best!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best sandwiches ever

_UuN1tXvZgWSgh0mbHnkZQ.text: This place is simply awesome Italian food. I get the sausage sandwich or the cheesesteak!

WaYpn8SF4chrDZbYBFjkmg.text: I stopped here yesterday after arriving after traveling all day from the East Coast. Needless to say after airplane snacks I was starving.   My wife and I have a tradition of going to at least one Diners Drive ins and Dives location in every new city we travel to.    We ordered an Il Purista sandwich on whole wheat roll to take back to the hotel.  While waiting for the sandwich to be done we perused the groceries and wines they have in the store. They have everything imaginable for a great Italian meal from antipasto to dessert. We ended up buying some fig cookies to nosh on as well.   When arriving at the hotel we dug in. The sandwich was prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, fresh basil, tomato, roasted peppers, extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The wheat roll was soft and worked well with the sandwich. Total cost for the sandwich, two drinks and cookies was about $25.   The best compliment I can give this place is that it reminds me of Italians Delis back in Hoboken.:)  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone coming to Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guy was here.February 2013
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Storefront.

ah8WWTja53t1nDBVFJ4crA.text: Great deli with a fantastic calzone. You can certainly taste the high quality cheese they use. Hands down best i have ever had.

nLc2iZi32jTkW-vxjb7utQ.text: Lunch with my family! It was my dads first time there. It was amazing!!! He had the capecolli, salami, provolone sub. I had the turkey sub, mom had the sausage and pepper sub!! My kids ordered their sub with whatever they wanted in! Everything came out perfect. Went back in line to order cannolis for dessert and a pizza bianco to go!!! We will be back soon. The weather was so beautiful we got to also enjoy the outside patio which was a bonus!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli for dessert, although next time just stick with the regular and not chocolate!:)
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage and pepper and sauce full sub!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cappiccola, salami and provolone with everything full sub!!

o_Twd08IkX2SDzPNiwsPcg.text: Authentic, delicious, accommodating are just a few worlds to describe this Italian gem.you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The pizza is made perfectly as the crust is not too crisp or soft. The lasagna and cannolis are must have, too.

ojhC86mVyClpH5syD9mm1A.text: Oh my!  We've tried Triple-D places when we travel, this little place is amazing!  Of course I had to try the Pastrami on Rye.  My wife tried their famous meatball dish.  If I'm in Arizona, I'll be visiting them again!!!    Oh, bring an appetite!

-f_SfGjM_eB0yfd6XrwdFQ.text: Defalco's is probably the biggest reason we were sad to leave Paradise Valley. We loved the family, the food, the grocery....everything and after 15 years, miss it like crazy. My husband is returning for his 50th reunion and this will be the first place he visits!!!!!!!!!! Geesh, I can taste that incredible food!!!!! How we miss you!

0CbfXkqH9t4R2DrR2qGVfA.text: Wow. The food here is just amazing. Small Mom and pop place. Everything we tried was delicious. especially dessert! Try their "pink" sauce.

9eb5AuSXA_JGlh2qNee7Tg.text: Had a margarita pizza and it was a perfect Naples style pizza. The crust was slightly sweet and exactly the right amount of crispness on the bottom. The sauce was outstanding...Not bitter or over spiced. They kept True to the high quality ingredients they use. They have a good selection of Italian groceries at a lower price than what I've seen in similar places. Service is fast, friendly, and efficient.  Highly recommend!

5tRiJ1T-6UW0YX4zy50maQ.text: It had been a long time since visiting DeFalco's. We had just come from the Scottsdale art festival and this place is fairly close by. It is a restaurant/grocery store with seating indoor and outdoor. We ordered the chicken pesto sandwich and the chicken Parm sandwich.  It was quite crowded when we were there but the service was quick and the food was nice and hot. On the chicken Parma sandwich the chicken was a little overcooked. Otherwise everything was good and we enjoyed our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken parmigiana sandwich
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto chicken sandwich

xI6wN9cdKwguPJuf2xzl8A.text: OMG this place was sooooooo good! We will definitely came back again.   I had the baked ziti (half a plate). My husband had a calzone. And we got the kids a small pizza which was huge (it was bigger then a Barros medium pizza)

ZEMIzO_8X74ele8VUwdgCg.text: There is very little to say about this joint that has not already been said, but I can see why there are close to 700 reviews with almost a perfect rating.  It has been on my list for years, and yesterday I had the chance to have a late lunch there - I'm so glad I did!  There are a few Italian deli / markets around town, but by far this is the best one I've been to.  Of course they have a nice selection of Italian imports that will help make your meal the best it can be, but walking past the counters seeing the menu I knew I was in for a treat.  I went with a sandwich, since it was my first time, which was easier knowing my girlfriend would order the shells and cheese with a meatball on the side.  I got the Il Purista - it just made sense.  Fresh basil, mozzarella, prosciutto, tomato and topped with a splash of olive oil and balsamic vinegar - it was perfection on a deli roll.    The shells / cheese / meatball / fresh tomato sauce were everything you'd want in a bowl... the ricotta was hands down the creamiest and freshest I've had the pleasure of eating.    Topped it off with a beer and a healthy serving of Italian nostalgia for a lunch that everyone in Phoenix should have at least once.  I did notice that they cater for large groups / events and this will be on a short list in case I ever need anything along those lines.  GO HERE and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. What a glorious sando - perfection!

Obd1PsxTG9p5DrZNOy5ZnQ.text: Everything is pleasant here from the people to the ordering to the taste of the food.   I've had a Philly Cheese steak in the heart of Philadelphia and it didn't even come close to the heavenly sandwich found here at Delfalcos.Also, its HUGE! I couldn't finish mine but it was even good heated up the next day. I cant wait to come back to try their pizza and some more of their salads.  They also have a large selection of wines, pastas and various other snacks so Its a great place to do some shopping for home while you wait for your food to be prepared.  The owners are great, really cant wait to come back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Philly cheese steak with peppers, grilled onions on a crispy French roll! Yum!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto chicken salad
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Caesar pasta salad

fa5sssCyQgUREbZlUvAAkg.text: Loved it!  Glad to say it's the first place I've eaten in AZ.  The gentleman behind the counter was very outgoing and helpful through our decision making. The food was delicious (Italian and Purista sandwiches, with side salads).   If I lived here, I'd be here a lot!!

h8l10hiVsn4DlAv3_LlsQw.text: Wow! Really good Italian food with a grocery store attached. Wish they were closer to where i live.

rAh1gD2VUrvcKBeM0tHwUA.text: Their sandwiches are top notched their food is on my top 10 favorite places to eat staff is quiet but im sure they have to do some major multi tasking . they have tables inside and outside patio they get a huge lunch rush which makes it hard to find a table but seriously there's some good food there I give it I give it a AAA+++

t93SSdS7yG2Mekseg9fddw.text: I want to start this out by saying that this was my first time at DeFalcos and I will definitely be going back. So that's always a good sign.  I got there right before the lunch rush so I didn't have to wait at all to order. I ordered the Italian sausage hot sandwich with peppers and onions and my boyfriend got the steak and cheese hot sandwich.  We ordered to-go so we had some time to poke around in the grocery part of the store while waiting for our order. Mostly the wines and olive oils which looked like a good selection.  It took about 10 minutes for the order to be ready. It seemed like a lot of people call in their orders ahead of time (note to self.)   The sandwiches were pretty amazing. I'm actually not usually the biggest fan of sausage but since this place is known for it I wanted to try it. If this is what sausages are meant to taste like I feel like I've been missing out my whole life. It was impossibly moist and flavorful. It didn't taste too "sausage-y". I don't know if that will make sense to anyone else, but the "sausage-y-ness" is what I dislike about most sausages. It was topped with their red sauce which was wonderful and the Italian sub roll was perfect.  I'll be back for pizza and desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage with peppers and onions
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and cheese hot sandwich
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage with peppers and onions

M9sejrVtQP4MgVGpny6S2Q.text: I have been waiting to try this place for a while and was disappointed by lackluster service, cold entrees, and an item missed on the to go order. When we walked in, there was a line of customers watching the cashier take a phone order for an extended period of time. When he finishes the call, he walks away from the register without saying anything. Meanwhile, a family is asking if they can clear some tables of dirty dishes since there was nowhere to sit. When our food was brought out, the lasagna was somewhat warm, but the eggplant parmesan was nearly room temperature. The garlic bread was so loaded with butter that it was soggy and also room temp. I don't know why we ordered desserts- maybe because we were still trying to figure out what made everyone suggest dining here? Well, we ordered 3 items to go and purchased a couple of items from the grocery. After leaving, we found out that the cashier failed to give us the tiramisu. We will not be returning.

Shkc-MRlKDBM-3TQE4uBCA.text: Walked in not knowing what to get at all. The cashier dude said to me that I should get the Philly Cheesesteak because it's the best in the country. I told him that's quite the hefty statement and chose to go with the Italian Combo sandwich and also told him I'd give the ol' Cheesesteak a shot next time. This guy seemed to know what he was talking about. I then decided to grab a side of two of the pasta salads and try them both. I also got a side of their marinara. My bill total was $19. So cheap!  So I take the food home and I am really expecting this to be absolutely amazing since the reviews on this place are off the charts. And...the hype is real amigos. I tried a bit of everything and I couldn't find one thing to complain about. I hate going to hyped up places because I'm afraid they'll disappoint but I stand by this hype. I'll be trying that Cheesesteak next time!

0bGC7iROnCgZX_0cGL--fA.text: The best sandwiches ever. I frequent this place, only thing to remember is its old school Italian deli, so be patient, the good food will arrive.

adOglGd5w18OqtmPiNjTuQ.text: Best Italian in Scottsdale/Phoenix. So yummy! I'm always going to go here for some authentic italian.

KrC6LlYySUCBKrfxHHZUAw.text: went today for Italian groceries and deli items, we stood at counter for 20 minutes before the workers would even speak with us, the deli staff took so long to help us we ended up leaving,i was prepared to spend a lot of money for their products,because Italian goods are hard to find in Arizona,i guess because we did not go with a tv crew we were less important!!!!! Will never go back,rather have my goods shipped directly to my home from back east!!!!

ePEiFWcNC12cFUN7td9oAQ.text: Great food! If you want Italian this is the place to go! Great homey atmosphere to the place also

ESnUTMzOZWl-KvslPvPZ4w.text: Best Italian I've had in Phoenix! The half portion of the pasta alla vodka fills me up and is usually my go to. It includes garlic bread. My friends love the steak sandwich. It's a cute grocery store with a lot of imported products from Italy. I also would recommend the chocolate covered cannoli.

LnQBTI39mtf8nXE3e5YWDA.text: Very authentic.  It's a ways away from where I live now but it's my go-to spot when I want to treat myself. It's reminiscent of some of the Italian eateries I grew up going to in the Boston area. Definitely give this place a try

lR2gEig38uWU9NZGfP5CsA.text: I had an amazing meatball sandwich and tried they're homemade sandwich. Marinara sauce was on point. I also enjoyed that it was inside an actual Italian market.

qHd4GRCdNqeFmnB8g7ISzw.text: My new favorite place to get Italian food. It reminds me of when we lived in Philadelphia.  The Centurion Calzone was awesome.  The deserts are close to the quality in Italy.   I am definitely coming back to Defalco's.

44288Msjz4-PKZqbY43ULg.text: Wowza. Wanted to try everything here, but ultimately went with the beef cheese steak with peppers mushrooms and onions as rec'd by the girl working the counter. Next time would love to try the il purista and the pizza. The sandwich blew me away, but 5 stars also for ambience and service. Really cute market & can't recommend highly enough!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef cheesesteak with peppers, mush, and onions. Best cheesesteak I&#39;ve ever had

3Ejz-xdmtLL7pM0XEG3PVg.text: Defalco's.... I've been coming here since I was 14. I'm 24 now. That's 10 years and it's still  the only Italian spot I can go to and order ANYTHING on the menu and be  completely satisfied. I crave their clam sauce with pasta! The pizza sub! Literally any cold sandwich! But especially the pastas... And let's not forget the desserts.... not to mention they have a great selection of dry goods and wines to par-use while you wait in line. I seriously love this place - go and you will too!

csIJKYE26FGtyNKf_MXFsA.text: Nice environment, the calzone has waaay too much cheese it's hard not to choke on it , other than that it's good experience.

r3XGNZj2BsxH_vBKh666vQ.text: I can't believe Dave B's crumby review. What a troll. DeFalco's is consistently delicious. Dave B... I hope your silly hat blows off the next time you put the top down on your Miata.  I have explored the menu, and enjoyed everything I have tried. My go to menu item is the Chicken Pesto Sandwich. DeFalco's nails it every time.

b2D854xBqH5Z25PQuA-l5g.text: The line goes quickly! My grilled veggie sandwich was absolutely delicious on a toasted baguette. The menu is extensive!

U1xOAtSlFpUUxGCp6h-eLA.text: Amazing food and deserts no matter what is ordered. We have tried hot sandwiches, calzones, pastas, and a chocolate gnocchi cake  So yummy!!! Would recommend this place!

IGHpsoUiPOZPb-FoFEAZUA.text: This is a great Italian place very good food and sandwiches I personally love the cold cuts from here very fresh The appetizers are really good to The meatballs are amazing The anti-pasta salad is one of my favorites my wife stops in very often to pick up some ingredients and fresh sausage we love Italian food it's our favorite highly recommend this place come try it out

ZqqbgtZf-mzFsUTgo-5abQ.text: This is an unusual place. A delicious unusual place. It is often confused as just an Italian grocery. At least that is what I thought as I drove by many times. Now it is my go-to for Italian takeout. (It also has an eat in deli style seating blended in between the grocery shelves) I have tried a wide variety of their items. From sandwiches to pasta and even their cannolis. Everything was delicious and tasted freshly made unlike the Olive Garden variety of Italian restaurants. What makes it great, however, is their prices. Their rates are great considering the quantity and quality of the food.

I-DqzgtrC37-GFb4wJyR6Q.text: The Italian beef is a B+, maybe a different bread could help. Great selection of all sorts of good quality food. The long lines and table/ seating situation diminishes the experience. If you place quality over the wait and limited space, then this place 5 stars.

Vb0iT3lTLXaP5iQxmsfFFg.text: Stopped in for an Italian beef and walked out with the best Italian beef sandwich hands-down!  From the melt-in-your-mouth, tender and lean beef to the oven-fresh bread, every bite was amazing!  The whole sandwich was so huge, I took the other half home for later.  I've had a lot of Italian beefs around town, but they don't come close to DeFalco's.  Can't wait to return to try one of their other sandwiches or pasta. Great value, good people and quality food!

_D8V6jSiiPWLVIN9KNFVQg.text: Excellent food. It's crazy crowded during lunch time so I usually go around 1:30, 2:00. Their roast beef sandwich is delicious with roasted peppers.

B326XkULxqVpSDns0_cU4Q.text: Went yesterday for a late lunch with the family (only three of us).  Was really excited to try it after reading the recent reviews, ended up being extremely disappointed with the staff and food.  Won't be back.

476ErSwLmXsuVU_36ZtEQA.text: A beautiful piece of Italian heaven!  The food speaks for itself!

r7tbcADa54T5gFg_P37T-w.text: Wow! The food is great.  I am in love with the Calzone here, but I've had a number of other things in the past and have never been displeased.  In addition, these guys have a beer selection that rivals most grocery stores.

TkAcjPlMJmizpd3fnD7iGQ.text: I've been going to Defalco's for over 5 years, and I've never been disappointed.  The place feels a lot like a typical neighborhood Italian grocery and I like that.  The food I've ordered has always been delicious (and I say that, having ordered nearly every sandwich on the menu) and it's always made in a reasonable amount of time.  They're not "fast" and they're not overly friendly or warm, but that's okay.  I usually don't stay there to eat anyway; I usually take my food to go!

XZbBkkrsiLYz9i_wC4pxEg.text: Stuffed peppers = delicious!  Of course the sandwiches are good too (just read the other reviews).  Only negative is that a weekday lunch might take a while to order and then get your food.

y7prfFaJecy_Ib8VQGe2nw.text: If you are from a Little Italy back home then it is the Little Italy food and stuff place you are looking for in Scottsdale!

Sp77asq6LTFizpFKSX450A.text: Yes the sandwiches are better than most in Phoenix, but this is a terribly organized establishment.  35 minutes for 2 sandwiches to go?  Please.  We've been to lots of delis and italian grocers that are more crowded and have less personnel, and they all find a way to run smoother than these guys.  We won't be back... food isn't that good.

hKtAHL_kYfdjM7T0TI15wA.text: I just ate a pepperoni & black olive pizza, you can taste the quality of the ingredients. I am defiantly getting another!

3WOS4jSiV6M534zsQonzMA.text: I had a Defalco's prepare two appetizer trays for an upscale cocktail party at my home. The trays were not only impressive to display on the table, but the variety and quality of cheeses and meats were outstanding. One of the trays inlcuded bell peppers filled with delicious pesto sauce for dipping with the huge order of sliced italian bread included. There were over 20 guests at the party and the amount of food was more than ample. I also thought the price was more than reasonable to feed that many people. Perfect price and quality for any event.

PpoJJsAQO14Wi8qFKSRpTA.text: I cant give more then three stars at this point. However on my next visit it will probably update to a five. when ever I try a place I like to have something simple. This time I opted for the roast beef Sub , with lettuce tomato, onions and mayo. It was pretty darn good. I also had a chocolate cannoli, the cannoli was a five. Next time I will try the Philly with mushrooms. Look for my Update. Be patient it takes some time to get your food.

SZH_bmN7TShejeqNvezbcQ.text: It's often crowded, but these sandwiches are the most satisfying I've had in Phoenix.

Y36UuI8SaTb6X1HJ9w4uXA.text: Awesome subs.  Although it can be quite busy during lunch time if you order ahead it's all good.  I especially love their imported goods and I can't get enough of the eggplant parm!

sSovgtPrt8u16SvlsA8svQ.text: After reading all of the positive comments about this place I thought it would be fun to try with the family.  I have to say I was truly disappointed.  The pizza had little or no sauce, the chicken parm sandwich was very dry and I had asked for extra sauce but it still came out dry.  The fettuccine alfredo was actually very tasty, but the spaghetti and meatballs was not good at all, very overdone and burnt tasting.  Overall I cannot recommend this restaurant, although they do have quite a nice selection of italian groceries.

gNCwgaB6_EolbYxR8_sBJg.text: Well I was in Scottsdale for a business trip and saw this hole in the wall deli / Italian grocery and thought I would give it a shot.  I thought it would just be sandwiches, but this place is an Italian restaurant with a deli / grocery store front!  The Veal Parm was awesome!  I came back the next day to try the famous cheesesteak and it was incredible as well.  I do admit the cheese was kind of strange because it was melted into liquid consistency, but the taste was awesome!  If I had another day I would have tried the pizza because it looked just as spectacular.   I also got a chance to speak with the owner and he was really cool.  The wait there is a little much, but when you are ordering food like this you have to certainly expect a wait, and there is a sign on the door warning customers of this, so it should be no surprise.  Some reviewers complain about the prices but for food of this quality it is really a bargain!  This place is the real deal, I highly recommend it!

PJmVqjOdCGqSCswzfWBZXQ.text: This place is fantastic. It looks like a deli that they put a bunch of italian groceries in and some italian baked goods. Its not a small place, but it feels small because there are so many shelves of groceries and not that many tables. Anyways, there was no line and ordering was very fast. They make you walk past the baked goods and deli meats before you get to the register to order, so look away if you know what you want and don't want to end up ordering extra baked goods and taking deli meat home! After you order, they give you a number and you find a place to sit. They will come out with your food and call the number when you are done. All-in-all, fast process.  On to the food! My girlfriend had the Gnocchi with Alfredo Sauce (you could also order it with a Pesto or a Red Sauce), I had a Lasagna and Half of an Eggplant Parmigiana Sandwich, and we shared a Chocolate Cannoli. First off, the Gnocchi was the BEST I have ever eaten, which is saying a lot because my girlfriend orders Gnocchi EVERYWHERE we go that serves it. The texture of the Gnocchi was perfect; tender, but not too soft. The alfredo sauce on top absolutely completed the dish and complemented the little potato dumplings perfectly. I highly recommend the Gnocchi and Guarantee you won't be disappointed. The Lasagna was good, definitely above average, but it was missing my favorite part of Lasagna, those delicious burnt edges. The Eggplant Parmigiana sandwich was good, but the breading on the Eggplant Parmigiana didn't have any crunch to it. I know that Parmigiana isn't supposed to have a lot of crunch, but I just wanted a little. The Cannoli was awesome. The shell was dipped in chocolate (you don't have to get it this way) and stuffed with the classic ricotta cheese-based mixture, which I think had some chocolate shavings in it. If you like cannolis, definitely give them a try here.   In conclusion, I will be back, and I will have to try a cheesesteak, because they are supposed to be legendary and that seemed to be what 75% of people came in for.

FDI8T2Bsejqqwfx2Uv5JUg.text: This place is a great NY/East coast style Italian grocery store that offers a wide variety of pastas and sandwiches.  I've been coming here since my ASU days and found Defalco's to be a good deal for the money and taste for sandwiches. I almost always get the sausage sandwich or the baked penne as they have become staples of my visits there.  Recently, I tried the pre-made pizza dough ($1.99) that only requires rolling out and baking.  It takes a little effort, but the results were spectacular. The only downfall is there can be a bit of a wait to get helped (which they now have signs up for this) and their actual groceries are quite pricey.  There are some decent deals on anything that is pre-made, but the wine, pasta, sauces, and deli meats are pretty high on the price scale. This place is a great place to grab a bite to eat, but don't buy too much of your groceries here unless you are looking for that True Italian ingredient to make your recipe exactly like in Italy or some rare item that can't be found anywhere else.  Otherwise, it's definitely worth stopping in and at least looking around.

jJVikeovskE7ayNOD0beSQ.text: Love this place! The meatball sub is out of this world! Homemade meatballs swimming in homemade marinara sauce on a crusty baguette. Don't forget the pizza, the crust alone is so tasty, buttery and herbacious, then add all the tasty creative toppings and you've got a pizza masterpiece! I love getting fresh cannoli's for desert or a couple of Baci which mean 'kiss' and are little dark chocolate hazelnut truffles.  No matter what you choose, I'm betting it is all good!

tygnJjMC-I8SuZReGvDqAg.text: When the moon hits your eye, like a big pizza pie, that's...Defalco's.  It's hard to find a good deli, and after living in New York for six years, it's almost impossible to find one that matches up with the Big Apple.  We walked in, and the first thing to come to my mind was, "Where to you order?"  As you walk in, the grocery store is the main focus, with Italian spices, snacks and the best part, wine, filling the store, I wasn't sure what I was in for.  The ordering counter for the sandwiches is in the very back, not to be mistaken for the deli counter right next to it (though after looking at the selections, you can be assured that I'll be back for that too.)  The selection ranges from a multitude of sandwiches, to basic Italian pasta dishes.  It's always nice to not have to meander through a menu when you are hungry.  Along with the two people I was with, our order was placed.  The prices seemed very reasonable, and we also were able to order a beer from the counter.  I ordered the Italian Sausage sandwich with roasted peppers, one friend got the chicken parmigiana and the other copied my order, but with cheese.  The dining area is very simple.  One are is designated for tables while other areas happen to have tables in areas throughout the store.  We sat down, and to our amusement, they had three flat screen TVs up for people to watch sports.  It's playoff time, so we took in the AFC Championship game.  Our food came out rather quickly when one of the guys from behind the counter came out and called our number.  (Note: keep your receipt after getting it because they right your number on it.)  I dug into my sandwich like an Ethiopian into a Big Mac.  The sauce was wonderful.  Rich in flavor, it had a certain spice that brought out the perfectly cooked peppers and the sausage.  The sausage was perfectly cooked, but to my dismay, there was only one sausage in it.  Now I have to admit, I love Italian food, and I might be a little soiled for my time in New York, but I was hoping for a little more.  My friend who got the Chicken Parm let me take a little sample (sacrifice for the good of a Yelper) and I would give it two major thumbs up.  Sauce good, chicken good, pasta good.  I got a little jealous, but don't get me wrong, the sandwich was awesome.  Defalco's is a great place for a quick bite or even an intimate evening for a couple who doesn't want the hassle of a restaurant.  The food was good, and though I might have had issue with the portion size, that could be me just being a large man wanting more of a good thing.  I would also recommend Defalco's for those of you who would like to make romantic dinners at home.  Italian food is very easy to make, and who could deny Lady and the Tramp as a wonderful representation of Italian romance.  One thing for sure, this Tramp would take his Lady to Defalco's.

os1ARFMgv4tt0wL9er7XRw.text: Defalco's is a family favorite! they make handmade pizzelle cookies that are amazing! they don't make them often but when they do my wife will buy all they have.  While she was pregnant, she asked if they could call her anytime they made a batch, and they did!  This place is usually incredibly busy yet quick to take care of the customers.  So for them to take the time to give her a call and let her know about a desert was impressive.  We take friends here anytime they are in from out of town.

et_X_32_IIz3qKUSWwqhWw.text: Love this Place! Pizza! Spegetti & Meatball! Sandwiches! Salads! All Great but the Chocolate Cake is to die for!

2WX46VCnOsWFxWbXiWz9MA.text: Came back again and had a great customer service experience and sandwich. Wish there was a little more eggplant stuffed in the sandwich, but that's just cuz its so good. Will give it another try and see how the pizza tastes once I work up an appetite or try the other grilled veggie sub.

GiBIHep1bbUqdAEjwhvAPA.text: I can not say enough about how fantastic DeFalco's is, they have managed to knock it out of the park on all counts; atmosphere, taste, speed, authenticity.... my only complaint is that there is just toooooo much to choose from, come on, a girl needs help with this problem!! Seriously!!  I could look at the selections for an hour and still be just as lost, I am sure you could eat at DeFalcos every day for 30 days at least and not have the same thing twice.    I absolutely love this place, I try to take anyone with me there as often as possible, every one always falls in love as well!!

_Oo8u2hmZp6uiiQtuv3mTg.text: So good!  Everyone ate something different and everyone loved it.  The cheese cake was out of this world.  Seating was hard to come by, but that's just an indicator of his good the service and food is, I think.  There was an episode of Friends where Rachel and Chandler dropped a cheesecake on the ground and ate it off the floor.  If the cheesecake tasted like the cheesecake at DeFalco's, I can see why!  It is the best I have ever had.

fMNc9piYN7B9n_MnF2AGeA.text: Was really excited to try this place because of the show and the fact that's it's True Italian......but sadly it was a letdown the pizza was no were near the quality I thought was going to be and the cannolis were just ok nothing special the restaurant seems cool though and the staff were kinda rude

pO_VublGx4wFT9rA6Lqh6Q.text: If you want some AMAZING LOCAL ITALIAN, without the fancy.. this is your NEW SPOT!  I've NEVER had anything that wasn't DELICIOUS  Wine by the glass and beer, TASTY deserts, try the cheese cake   I have been coming here since the 90's

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

llIe8biyXk07c6I4Ro5qNg.text: Yum Yum Yum, can't wait to go back!  I travel to Arizona every month and always need a low key spot to tone down after a long day on the road. This is just the place. Had a sausage parm sub and a canoli. both just perfect

IAIU6YClhubYLYRRrWzyvg.text: This place does brisk business and for good reason. They have excellent food at massive portions (for the pastas).  I waver between eggplant parmesan and chicken parmesan and I learned not too long ago that you can ask for double the bread instead of bread + a side salad. I mean, I'm getting Italian food and pasta - why have any shame about the amount of carbs I'm consuming?  Speaking of, for ~$10 for eggplant and maybe $12 for chicken parm, it provides at LEAST three meals for the whole size, and sometimes even 4 when I'm not too hungry. You truly cannot beat that- especially since it's always so delicious!  They have lots of stuff for purchase (hence the grocery name) but I've not purchased anything grocery-like except for ice cream. They have tons of drink options, including wine by the bottle for those taking out. Wines by the glass are surprisingly enjoyable for ~$6-$8 a glass (had the red blend and sauvignon blanc this visit).  For the deli items, they have pre-made deli salads, olives, and tons of cheeses at really good prices. They also have sausages but I'm personally not a fan (of sausage in general, so I've never had theirs).  I like a locally-owned place, and this fits the bill, being super close to my house, very affordable and yummy. I've lived nearby for about a dozen or so years, and I feel like I see a few familiar faces when I visit which leads me to believe they treat their employees well also.  Minus a star for - Using such potent/pungent cleaning supplies in that bathroom that the stench wafts into the dining area, further limiting the amount of seating available (it's been REALLY bad on my last three visits) - Being super stingy with napkins for diners. Our table was dirty and rather than ask the busy employee to clean it, I wanted to self-service with a little water and not bother him - I was told that napkins come with the food.  Sure...that's fine, but when a patron asks for that to clean their own table, you either 1) get the napkins with no comment or 2) clean the table for them. To their credit, I was brought napkins promptly, but why aren't they out for messy people to grab as needed? I'm eating spaghetti for goodness' sakes!!

JgcWs9Z_VjWVTrNjbsntHg.text: I. Really. Like. This. Place!  So glad my friend suggested this place for lunch. It is a very authentic italia deli type place and also a market. I had a salad and it was so fresh, it tasted like I made it myself at home. I had some of the pasta salad my friend ordered and it was delivious. I wish I could have stayed to try more food but we had such a short lunch. I wonder if they have biscotti and italian espresso, because sitting on the paito was beautiful this time of year.

HOs_Ao74Vg6oOFnj5OODng.text: By far the best Italian in Arizona. The staff is always on top of their game and the family is great. Try the cheesesteak or spaghetti I highly recommend it.

CTxNklsW0gWDb_TtsFZY7w.text: Excellent and authentic Italian food. The pizza is the best I've had in Phoenix! My wife says the tiramisu is the best she's ever had. A definite must go to!

NWhK5BPEiY17Pqco7dLqcg.text: This was a guy Fieri spot but I'm just not a fan. Sandwiches are decent but there is so much bread it overpowers the meat. The pizza is just ok and the help is a bunch of teenagers who seem to take pride in being as slow and unresponsive as possible. I do like the little internal market but I think there are better delis around.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DaA61u0uuiFT7zBfHs9oVg.text: Went for lunch and got the spinach chicken and goat cheese salad. It was so good! Everything was fresh and the chicken was grilled to perfection. It had Avocado on it too. It was massive and I took it home and ate the other half for lunch the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled chicken, spinach, goat cheese salad. Yum!

-m3FiJdJU6kpZk-ymNdFJw.text: We came here for a vacation. It is really really really good. The chicken marsala and the pizza are to die for. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We saw this on triple D We came here for a vacation. It is really really really good. The chicken marsala and the pizza are to die for. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We saw this on Triple D and are so glad we did!

pqHG-3aXijRSuLT2AnuvXw.text: This is the best Italian deli in AZ, I so love this place, best sandwiches reminds me of Northern California, very good quality in everything they do !!!

1qA2YxIzaHub42pID9T0OA.text: OK.  In Phoenix for a Billy Joel Concert.  Never been to Scottsdale before.  Kids and wife starving.  Picked DeFalco's out of Yelp.  Un-freaking-believable.  Talked to multiple people in line who are regulars and they told us "It doesn't matter what you get here.  It's all awesome!!!"  Being from Detroit where we have Italian food coming out of our ears, I was a little skeptical.  In fact, one of the pictures of "La familia" has a detroit market in the background.  Well.....Food didn't disappoint.  They also have alcohol.  Absolutely made our day.  Pasta was excellent.  The grinders were phenomenal.  I wanted to eat every meal there for our vacation but we needed to branch out a little.  Too bad!!!  The only drawback I could come up with was the line was out the door, but now I know why.  We will return next time we're in the area.  Keep up the great work guys!!!

Xli0ZY8sA034ouFip7x2OA.text: Definitely more of a cafe than a grocer, the sandwiches here are top notch! Didn't take long for take out order to get prepared. Chicken parm was solid but the Maximus was a 5/5. Cannoli were decent too. Really looking forward to trying more items in the future. We saw a couple pizzas come out and they looked gooood!

s0ljXXuEyyRWB-P1z2cWtQ.text: Since I found DeFalco's through a friend a few years ago, I go at least once every two months or so. My favorite is the chicken pesto sandwich, but nothing on the menu will disappoint!

fP07Gube4V8AvzNnxpd_4w.text: The One, the Only.  My eyes almost welled over when I first bit into their lasagne.  For seven long years I went all over the Valley looking for an Italian joint that could serve up a plate of Nonna's finest with no nonsense and no pretense.  I found a few that were the real deal, but nothing of this level.  Defalco's truly is an oasis of Italian dining in the desert.  Fresh imported meats and cheeses and old country finesse in the kitchen have finally given me the masterpieces of flavor that I have been looking for.  This ain't a fancy place that makes you feel like you should be wearing a tie.  You go up to the counter, you order, and you sit next to the racks of Italian groceries to eat your meal.  Forget the diet, okay?  You have your pasta, your salad, and some garlic bread, and the world is a better place.  They also have sandwiches, pizza, and delicious desserts.  All right, that's it, time to go back--there's so much on the menu to try.

zTfEr76WtBL5MoKvFCX4TQ.text: Believe the hype! This place is very very good. I love the market aspect, if I ever need something specialized for an Italian dish I'm making I'm definitely coming here.  I've been here a couple times to get some pasta, I've had the gnocchi and the baked ziti. For the price that you're paying this place is top notch.  During lunch it gets very busy because people love this spot, but there is a good amount of seating available.

l8zWMMTTpoMWdUQeWj18Kg.text: This is a nostalgic eatery, reminiscent of a NY Italian deli. Wonderful food, wonderful staff...absolutely lovely.

2EllFjLoM-rrd8AD8GqZNQ.text: Very good sandwiches plus an area to sit and enjoy your food. A very good variety of pastries . Tried the rainbow cookie and it was very good.

50npOXwzclxBzXrSmspY0g.text: Hands down one of the best cheesesteaks I've ever had. It's definitely authentic as well. I ordered half sizes of two dishes and the portions are extremely big, but who doesn't like leftovers

jhHwLsyXsm-XHre-WXzJYA.text: We love Defalcos for casual dining and take out!  It's my teen daughter's favorite chicken Alfredo and they make a delicious chicken cheesesteak!   It's small and cozy with fantastic groceries to check out while you wait.  Unfortunately they also have wonderful desserts and baked goods so prepare to break your low carb diet from start to finish!  They also have lots of nice wines too!

rlPoJ8BqRkKNYE0_z-QSbw.text: Was in town for 2 weeks... it was the ONLY place I went more than once (3 times lol). There are no words... if you want authenticity, just go here... period. I want to live inside this shop, I couldn't get enough. I can't wait to visit again!

6n-Vv910GNoczXZe2viUZA.text: Love this place but know that it's going to be packed and you will be waiting.  I've had the meat lasagna which I loved  I also buy my Italian deli meats there.

AIfHr_-g-y3ly3ZLuFzcGw.text: True 5 star deli. Big menu of classics and Italian delicacies. If you leave hungry it is your own fault.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wednesday lunch feast
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bRKMa8pHxsiDGEGEdafGUA.text: I walked in for someone else one day and I wanted to try it because of how cool the place looked. I finally tried it with the in laws last night and it was phenomenal! Would definitely recommend to anyone

9X7w_S3WUYPd7l-RB3NSpg.text: Had the steak and cheese sandwich for lunch.  Took about 25 minutes to come out and the deli wasn't very busy.  Flavors were great.  Would recommend if you have time for a longer lunch or dinner.  Great value for the money.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and cheese sandwich- full portion

_yoclpkRGrChZWu-saO0sg.text: Absolutely the best lasagna ever! Twenty year customer and now return every October. Great staff, wonderful food and extras in the shopping area-family owned business too.

z7Mg6NUyQ05xxkWEzScasQ.text: My boyfriend and I had spent way too much time researching good Italian food when I remembered Defalco's. The person sitting next to me on a flight had mentioned it to me over a year ago and I was amazed I remembered the name. Thank goodness I did. This was one of the best meals I've had. The Alfredo sauce was creamy and flavorful but not too think or too thin, and not too cheesy. Even the garlic bread that came on the side was wonderful. The carrot cake was so delicious that I never wanted it to end, and even went back after dinner and bought a slice to take home. My boyfriend loved his linguini with clams and the pesto pasta salad was delicious, though I just tried a bite and we took the rest home. They were busy the whole time we were there but the counter service was fast and our dirty dishes were cleared promptly. We love 30 minutes away but will definitely be back over and over.

tgR-7ME6aUEWdBtQEFQN6A.text: This is one of the best lunch places in the entire city. The whole menu is incredible.  There are fantastic buys in the deli/grocer area if you so choose.

NtFEmN7EBZ3vB2W0N5jJRQ.text: Really hate to do this but: We are vacationing in Scottsdale for 3 weeks and went there last week for the first time.  We did take out and were blown away by the food, selection and quantity. Being Italian and from Boston I am usually pretty critical when traveling, but this place hit a home run! I mean the food was GREAT!  Today, 3 days later we go back for more: Mistake!  We ordered the same thing-Chicken Parm (full meal), again take out, and wow what a surprise.  Last week it was 3 palm sizes pieces of chicken and a cup or so of pasta.  Today it was ONE, almost palm size, piece of chicken and 3 cups of overdone pasta accompanied by what looked like the scrapings of the family salad bowl, not to mention (very) soggy wheat bread garlic toast-UGH! (It actually looked like someone put yellow curry on stale bread and steamed it!)  Good food is a tremendous accomplishment and a great asset for any restaurant, but it must be consistent or its all for not. If you're looking for hard to find Italian grocery items, you may find them here, and if you're lucky the food will be as awesome as it was on our first visit.

p8nWLr_ahCKPE0-zdV30bA.text: This place is great. As an Italian guy from upstate NY I have a decent perspective and this is the best Italian grocer I have found in Arizona. I've gotten both a cold sub and pizza here and both were really good. I'd love to try more of the stuff on their menu and buy some of their specialty items for cooking at home.

Glqel5GJDZkVRYyGO8tT5w.text: Had never heard of this place before my girlfriend Double Dee recommend it after she seen it featured on a food channel network. Staying at a nearby hotel, we ordered out and picked up a bottle of pinot gringio to wash it down. Dee ordered a chicken pesto sandwich on focaccia bread while I ordered a full order of baked zitti which came with a salad and garlic bread.  The food was excellent.

s22HpxH5HxOK-ViuPO6tFQ.text: This place is dope on a rope! The desserts are amazing, the sandwiches are amazing the pizza is amazing and the people are amazing! The smell is recognizable while driving and is definitely a favorite of mine!

_eqcY2kGKt41DLuJFbbiJw.text: This place is amazing! Food is amazing and price is reasonable.  You can buy fresh pizza dough to make your own pizza at home! It's a nice family feel with lots of variety.

EwjCxv2VFLIY__bVnBd_CA.text: Funny set-up but great food.  People were eating all different types of menu items.  I ate the meat lasagna which was very tasty.  This place had a lot of customers getting take-out.  Looking forward to trying their pizza next time.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 16&#34; calzone, soooo huge.  This can feed 4-5 people.  Extremely cheesy.  You&#39;ll love it.

RlTECTXiUB-Qt_UufnI-0g.text: Have really enjoyed going to Deflacos throughout the years.  Issue is more recently it seems to take forever.  Plan an hour during lunch to get food and eat it.  Recently had the thick crust pizza and might have been worst pizza I have had.  Cold...they didn't really seem to care that it takes forever and food is slipping.

bGnykNn1vgldzMMBQPkkeg.text: I'll be honest with you. I found out about this place from my Twitter feeds. They are big Sun Devil fans and a lot of my fellow Devils stop by this place. So of course I had to bookmark and try this place.   Walking in there's shelves of Italian groceries but in between are tables to sit at. Inside are usually tables for two but outside they have bigger tables. So you order at the counter and they bring your food to your table.   So I ordered a half meatball and half beef cheesesteak with grilled onions, peppers, and mushrooms with a Latte. I'm always looking for the best meatball sandwich in town and would have to put this at the top of my list. Freshly baked and toasted bread with two huge meatball and fresh mozzarella. Man this all came together. So good. So fresh. Loved it. The beef cheesesteak with thinly sliced ribeye was so good. The beef was so tender and juicy with that creaminess of the cheese and fresh mozzarella with peppers, onions, and mushrooms. Oh my goodness. Freaking good. Hit the spot. To top it off the latte just made this lunch to freaking over the top. Loved it.   My daughter and wife split a full meatball sandwich which they couldn't finish. Plus they ordered a cannoli. Oh my goodness. We all took a bite of that cannoli it was so good. Out of this world. So creamy. So good. You just have to try this. My son ordered the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and he really liked it. Finished it all up.   I really liked this places. The tables are small but the atmosphere was great. Great food. Good and friendly service plus they are Sun Devils. So Forks Up and enjoy

Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half Meatball sandwich

mmOUcGuBAIzFQ9OMKE94DA.text: They Have No Guanciale!!! I know most people don't know/care what it is, but that's why I went there. (BTW it's jowl bacon that's been seasoned and cured, it's good stuff, and the ONLY way to make legit carbonara. IMO it makes a big difference. FYI they don't have carbonara on the menu.)  Had the baked ziti, it was good, not amazing, but good. It's a minor complaint but the garlic bread was not particularly good, it was almost stale you could tell it was made a few hours before. Nor was the bread crispy or toasty, it was meh. The salad was OK, had a jalapeno; why? I don't know. But like I said the baked ziti was good.  I would go again but I would order a calzone.

vhbg2Buc94kUH8ri3PhOVQ.text: I have been here twice and ordered the chicken pesto sandwich both times. It explodes with flavor. Everyone in my group ordered something different and there wasn't a single person disappointed. It can get busy around lunch time, but that's the price you pay sometimes if you want the best!

ANQEHGNTesMh1IWJLeSiBg.text: This review is mainly for the customer service, a 2 at best.  The food is delicious and authentic.  DeFalco's lacks more staff and ordering lines for dine-in service during peak times.  This is based on a Saturday at 1:45 PM.  One major issue is the failure to place menus upon entering.  When waiting in line to order, there is easily a 10-15 minute wait just to get to the counter and place the order. We were stuck behind several customers with no knowledge of the menu until they made it to the counter.  Then another 10 minutes to figure out what they wanted.  Meanwhile, the line is out the door, so the deli slicer begins take orders from several customers BEHIND us, cutting the line.  Three line cutters until we spoke up for the actual "next in line customer".  While this was going on, we asked our 12 year old to grab a table that was just being cleaned off.  The employee told my son that he couldn't sit there but have no reason.  My husband had to approach the employee and ask and she shrugged her shoulders.  Still clueless why my son was told he could not sit at the table when I saw at least two other adults sitting at the table they grabbed.  Our food was ordered at 2:08 and arrived about 20 minutes later for two subs (1 hot 1 cold).  We enjoyed the meal but terribly turned off by the lack of customer service.  DeFalco's- I know you can do better.

afQDIA6BSVQ8fN7XZlp9pA.text: great sandwiches and good value.  Nice grocery store too for specialty Italian items.

ALfwdL1lcsCfTD5T4Y2RcA.text: Ordered an Italian Sausage sandwich and a Caesar Salad, to go.  It took 30 minutes.  We placed our order at 1:14pm and received it at 1:45pm.  The Caesar was the yellow heart of the Romaine, the dressing is the same as I have in my refrigerator from Safeway.  It used to be GREAT!!  What happened?  The sandwich was so-so.  Won't be back.  Too bad, because their pizzas look great.

83dqDuFPbqeNn2aFIz3qjQ.text: Amazing, legit chill spot nothing fancy awesomeness .....good food cheap nice staff. Had meatball sandwich boooomb!!! I'm sure the rest is amazing .

Lz3r5JRDkO967AQ7bXHK4w.text: My family and I have been customers here for decades. Easily the best Italian Deli in Scottsdale. Great selection of imported meats and cheeses. They also have a great lunch menu. Can't recommend this place enough. Defalco's food has been a mainstay of every family gathering since I was a young boy and even as an adult, I can't get enough of their quality food.

9XvpdQhkMmlT3qoZu_jNFg.text: This is my very favorite Italian deli. The food is delicious and so fresh. Love the pizza dough and homemade sauce!!

fDGuJgtVtTBzrh4-dpRoYg.text: I've been looking all over Scottsdale for real spumoni ice cream, and finally found it at Defalco's! Along with a nice selection of Italian cookies, it made my last dinner party. Have eaten here several times, and can't say enough good things about their prepared foods. Takes a while to get your food (mostly because they're always busy), but it's well worth the wait!

fIXDU-w6zCBeZXNwMvf5qg.text: This is a deli - market, strictly Italian. I had the stuffed shells for lunch one afternoon. If you go during the rush hour be prepared to stand in a long line and wait for your food. However if you have the time to wait it's definitely an enjoyable meal. They have a wide range of meals, small and large, heavy and light. And a fantastic dessert spread. It wasn't the best Italian food in the world but for the price and style of the meal it's a great stop and I recommend it.

gYne7vyvbf73EweaeZkV6Q.text: The cheesesteak is in a league of it's own. I used to work at a cheesesteak restaurant that specialized in making greasy, cheesy, melty deliciousness like any classic cheesesteak. however, the defalcos cheesesteak is more than that. the bread has a perfect crunch to it, the meat is hearty and delicious... 5 stars. not to mention the rest of their menu... all i need is that cheesesteak though

Ke4pzAZytxKI32cAK4fzXg.text: My family has been loyal to DeFalco's since its Phoenix inception back in 1972.  For me, this is home away from home.  Stepping in to DeFalco's takes me back to the days where we'd spend all day in Grandma's kitchen preparing for Sunday family dinner.  Preparing everything from homemade sauce, meatballs, chicken parmesan, and almond biscotti to name a few.   DeFalco's offers an extensive menu (both for takeout and dine-in), and although I venture here 2-3 times per week I remain loyal to a few selections on their menu.  If you are feeling like a sandwich I urge you to order the homemade Meatball Sandwich on the crispy baguette - or - if you're feeling like chicken then I must recommend you try the Chicken Pesto Sandwich (again, on the crispy baguette).  I'm a hot/toasted sandwich type of girl so I can't speak for the cold sandwiches, but I can assure you won't be disappointed with any selection given that all their breads are delivered fresh daily, meats and cheeses are sliced to order in house, and their toppings are fresh to boot!  To complete my go-to list I also recommend trying the Chicken Pesto Salad and a few side salads including the tuna pasta salad (BEST EVER), the chicken caesar pasta salad, pesto pasta salad, and....the tomato and basil salad (of course you must drizzle a little evoo and balsamic to make it truly Italian). They also offer many pasta dishes, pizza/calzones, soups & sides, salads and desserts, oh my, and nothing will leave you disappointed or starving for more since their portions are generous in size (it's an Italian thing)!!    And not only does DeFalco's do Italian favorites just right, but their store is also stocked with Italian specialty foods for purchase (hint grocery in the name), and many wonderful and rare wine selections only to be found in their store.    My Sunday dinner now belongs to DeFalco's as it makes me feel like I'm back at Grandma's place.  Heck, you can sip on some vino while you await your lunch or dinner to be served in the dining room or outside on the terrace!  And although this beloved establishment resides in Scottsdale, please remember to check your pretentiousness at the door because this place is loved for its traditions and laid back people.

Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Chicken Pesto salad is great for the pesto loving chicken salad lover.

Q3TzmuDt0tYoDFMFrcikqw.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Scottsdale AZ.  We've enjoyed everything we've tried.  Some of our favorites include their fabulous pizza and the baked ziti with meat balls.  My children enjoy their sandwiches and desserts.  Great family environment, good wine and beer selection.  Love it.

yncQQh2nWaj4gF8K2yAzxA.text: My favorite deli in the Valley. The chicken pesto sandwich is amazing, but they're ALL amazing. And there's no other place in the Southwest that comes as close to real, NY-style cookies.

tCZhAB2kNL8sshZQuVTdFQ.text: I have eaten here umpteen times, and have loved every sandwich, pasta, and salad I've had!

IcaP-VVX6NaXWFUmzoL3Cw.text: What a disappointment. It should NEVER take 30 mins for 2 cold sandwiches and a cannoli... EVER! Especially when we were 1 of 3 customers! We've been to many Italian delis in the Chicago area and never experienced something like that. Then to over hear the manager scolding two of his employees in the front of store. No thank you. Never coming back.

wxGEGq1hkGp1gc79Ol5WEg.text: Great to see a place on a tv show from the local area.   This food is unique to the area and excellent quality.  Highly recommend.

sjl9L8Ogzvp3aoD0tPQE6w.text: Found this place on yelp and took my wife mom and 4 kids and wow it was amazing. Definitely worth it. Best lasagna ever

lDJIaF4eYRF4F7g6Zb9euw.text: I used to work food service and my manager at the time recommended I try Defalco's. He knows food well so I was excited to try one of his favorites spots.  This place is really, really good. Lot of authentic Italian choices and they even have a grocery section with tons of legit Italian goodies. I had a Chicken Parmigiana sandwich that was to die for. Anytime my ex-manager comes back to town (he left for Vegas and I think he misses Defalco's more than anything else in the valley), he is sure to stop by and grab his favorite grub.  Parking is a bit tricky during busy hours and the wait times for food can get a bit long, so I recommend calling your order ahead of time (unless you want to take a look around while you wait, first-timers).

feIbvS_RDFXgt7JP-ThlIA.text: Great pizza. Loved the ambience if sitting and dining in a grocery store. Not cheap but worth every penny.

3-T3IBXpZA-fPFaNhBgDlA.text: Delicious and great service! Tried for the first time last night and was not disappointed! Split a Chicken Pesto Sandwich and The Il purista Sandwich with my S.O. and both were amazing. I can't wait to explore the rest of their menu and plan on going back to check out their wine selection and and grocery.

r4g39V0RSFIyw3r2CGGkMg.text: The place for lunch.  I'm happy whenever I work in Scottsdale as that usually means lunch at DeFalco's.  This place is an institution in this part of town and the consistent crowds attest to its reputation.  The philly cheese steak sandwich is so good that I rarely get up the courage to try something else.

CrHLzjD9iGQJtAUpa0Lllw.text: If you're looking for 'authentic' Italian food this is the place. The guys behind the counter had that deep Italian twang to their voice that you see in the movies!   The building is an Italian Grocery with imported (albeit expensive - - 5.29 for the box of crackers I saw, they must be basted with Olive Oil by Mama Celeste!) foods everywhere.  You order from a little counter in the back, and you can choose from pizzas, pastas, and sandwiches among other things.   I had half a grilled portobello sandwich, and half of the Cappacolo and Provolone.   The portobello was meaty and came with a thick red pepper covered in their homemade pesto. The Cappacolo was the star of the meal, however. Thin slices stacked high with some of the best tomatoes I've ever had in Arizona.   It's pretty inexpensive too, spending more than 10 bucks a person would leave you with a belly bursting.

FyrJ1dmr20tHtPirDXMoSg.text: The fiance was showing me her favorite places when she lived here and this was the first stop! She raved non-stop about everything and I finally had to try it. I got the egg salad sandwich and we split the tortellini salad. Man, the salad was out of this world. We've been craving it since we got back. I can guarantee the next time we are in her old hood, this will yet again be the first place we check out. Thanks Defalco's for cranking out some great food. The cashier was also very friendly and not pushy!! Thanks

TpLPeR4u0QbCYjYve2Mr2w.text: This place is awesome! I had the roast beef and Italian sausage .....AWESOME! Then I had the corned beef sandwich with cole slaw and fresh mozzarella. OH MY GOD! You have to try this. This place reminds me of some of the Italian spots back home in Detroit.

vOIoEoiJ2mbWhk0OyT1DaA.text: This place is the best.  My go to is the Il Purista and the Tuna Pasta Salad, so good!

io5QD4YVRCqW1buIxArVYA.text: Great little deli!  The centurion stromboli was worth the trip, I'll be back to explore the menu and wine selection further the next time I'm in Phoenix.

Yw1V4KF44_qx-uXYm4S19A.text: When I first moved to AZ, this was the first place I felled in love with but it has been 5 years now and I finally made it back (after several visits back in the day).  Today I had a sweet and sour experience.  I was craving the lasagna but I'm trying to keep the diet so I ordered the soup of the day (minestrone) and a pasta side (penne with tomato sauce).  The soup was superb (that's why it didn't get 2 stars). The focaccia that came with the soup was pretty decent and the ice tea (green tea) was pretty tasteful.  But the side pasta was totally forgettable. The sauce was pretty lame.  And the worst, I got Parmesan cheese for the pasta and I poured a little bit on top. It was like talk but that didn't bother me. However all of the sudden I started getting this weird smell. The cheese was stinky. Not like in a delish stinky French cheese, more like in a Whoeverbertos-sh@#hole-cleaning-table-cloth stinky. It reeked. Fortunately I didn't pour much so I was able to manage to eat the pasta but it was bad.  I didn't even bother to tell them since I was so upset.   Anyways, I'll go back for sure because the several other times I really enjoyed this place, but this was a bad experience. Plus $ 11 for soup and side pasta is not like super cheap.  My advise: Smell the cheese before pouring it in your food!  One more thing. The spoon was super old and bend :(

xY2v7S4KiQ6y87fHkFEuCw.text: This reminds me of being back East. Best sandwiches I have ever eaten in this city!!!

rpnucN8JbEATEqbigo0UfQ.text: Food Is above average for Arizona Italian food. Price isn't bad and decent value. The wait is the problem...I order food and it takes forever...I order to pickup and they are 30 min past the time they suggest...I tell them two hours in advance I am coming at 6pm and it's not ready to 620....come on....

fVljDL0EYfDoWJEBnXe3JQ.text: I just moved here from LA. I love Italian deli and I didn't think I'd be able to find a turkey sandwich as good as what I've had back at my old home. This deli is above and beyond! It is a currently me and my boyfriends go to place for some of the best pizza ever. We are talking authentic pizza! Great staff great place I would recommend to everyone

L78jSH2Jqc9DWfqztHhXdg.text: The food is delicious but the owner is a jerk. Went in to get some food and he was talking under his breath. My boyfriend then asked is something wrong but he continued with an attitude and talking under his breath saying obscene remarks we then left with him begging us to come back. It's too bad because the food is delicious but I will not go back no matter how good the food is.

K3v1QF7RP9TLWUIIdyCcfQ.text: I feel strangely guilty that I am "cheating" on the love of my life, Panozzo's in Chicago, but here it is: I love Defalco's. I have tried only a couple of things here, but the main goal for me was that the equivalent of the Prosciutto and Fresh Mozz sammy at Panozzo's is delicious, and it is. At Defalco's, it's called the "Il Purista," and it has - in addition to the two main components listed above - fresh basil, roasted red peppers, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and tomatoes. It is served on deliciously crusty but also soft-on-the-inside bread, and it's less expensive than you would think for such high-quality, fresh ingredients.   My husband also loved the chicken parmesan sandwich and the cheesesteak sandwich. I have yet to determine if they make fresh pizza dough, pesto, and pasta, hence the 4 rather than 5 stars.   I will most definitely be back.

UbhS6RsOs0i5yLy37lSqbQ.text: Seriously the best pizza I have ever had. Have been To Delfalcos a couple of times and they have never disappointed. From the pastas pizzas and salads everything is authentic and amazing this place is highly recommended!

U_hpBSO6NOECiG2cbeHPHw.text: One may ask why when in Arizona would you want to eat Italian food...being from the east coast there are plenty of good Italian eateries. This place is unique and fun...the food is great. And you can buy wine to go with it. Strictly casual...you stand in line to place your order, and then someone comes looking for you to give you the order. Hubs and I sat outside sipping an Oregon Pinot and enjoying the warm weather as we waited for our food. Food came, he got cheese steak and I got eggplant park.  All was delish and enjoyable. Very relaxing too.  Def would go back.

e__Ees0-b8OWsn31Z9PqQQ.text: I am a mac and cheese connoisseur. Defalco's has THE best mac and cheese I have ever had!

XL2o_kgsu54Eh2ZFTwWmfw.text: Had a Half Cheesesteak of French Bread (Excellent) with Onions & Mushrooms (Skipped the Bell Peppers) - I think I'll see if I can had a few Jalapeno slices next time. Wow, it was great! I'll be back!!

svD8NqEOvialMz8IoFAQrQ.text: This is for the tall thin guy working the phones and counter who always makes it a challange to order.  I wonder when he will stop it or just go find work he likes.    I know he has been there a long time and everyone I talk to about the business thinks he is a problem.  I think maybe the capacity is just not there for him to know the menu and it is easier to make the customer sound like the idiot.  It is really a shame they have this guy working the front lines.   I ask for the itallian and he says, "which one we have a lot of Italian sandwhiches.  I order a cheesesteak the way I order them in Philly and he gives me a hassle on that.  He actually asked me where I was from and told him Philly. What is the use for the attitude... right?  I copied and pasted the sandwhich I just tried to order.  It looks like the only Italian and it is first on the cold sandwhich list.    Italian Combo  Ham, Salami, Pepperoni, Mortadella & Provolone

cnp86CCXrbsIKgmuUGEyNg.text: Defalco's Let me count the ways thou love ye. 1. The freshest Ingredients 2. Everything is literally  amazing (especially the chicken salad sandwich) 3. Cheesecake and all deserts are off the Chizain 4. Store even smells great 5. Italian done right   Seriously been coming here for 12+ years. EVERYTHING is good. The wait is long because they make it fresh, so if you lack patience phone your order in. Go here NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Seriously stop reading this and go to Freaking DEFALCO'S JABRONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Oh really your going to sass me now? That's it no Chicken Salad for YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

HSz_0ZSqd0vgPjO09ie9pg.text: Got a couple of dishes and only thought it was okay. Glass of cab was tasty though. Wanted to fall in love with this local joint but I didn't.
