We tried the French dip w Italian sausage sandwich and the spaghetti and meat balls. Meats in sandwich were dry and lacked flavor to me. Pasta dish was "normal". Will only be back if other company suggests it.

kxCPjHSOQXDx6ty2JK-2ew.text: I personally think this is my favorite deli out in Arizona. They have a great selection of Italian meats, i go there for the soppresatta, and fresh mozzarella. The wait can sometimes be a little frustrating and a little expensive.

bY5D3_w6gp_NPecXgHxvQA.text: tastes good and good size portions. recommend ordering ahead for lunch cause it gets pretty busy. i normally like to eat my lunch right after it's made but didn't get to do so the other day. came to pick up my lunch half an hour after they said it was ready but it still tasted great, not soggy at all.

PkSmNNXaaXJvBpXJRqwOWg.text: The sandwiches here are so good. My reasoning for the 5 - stars though, is the actual store inside. Quality of meats are great and the amount of traditional Italian items to purchase is so great. One of the best Italian markets in all of the metropolitan area.

rYFzDgyH-s3mVCUXMvN9Jg.text: We had Alfredo Gnocchi, cheese steak sandwich and linguini pasta with clams today. All were fantastic and the portions and prices were very satisfying. They also have amazing ice tea selections. Check this place out!

RSvKUcFxKHrc-Ut94WmAXQ.text: Great food.   Like being back in Brooklyn.   "Leave the gun, take the Cannolis".  Line from the Godfather.   Seriously, get the cannolis

734qAZfIYwJ-YE-nlGEL8A.text: Great sandwich shop with a couple dozen sandwich options and awesome deli. Well worth The visit. I had half a meatball sub and half a steak and cheese with mushrooms onions and peppers. I got 2 halfs instead of a full sandwich because I couldn't decide between the two. I could only eat half of each of the halfs. And then for dessert I had a chocolate covered cannoli. It's a fun ambience with tables spread around the Italian deli. Looks like a great place to shop for meats and cheeses as well and they also have a lot of Italian related ingredients. I look forward to coming back soon ( but unfortunately don't live around town ) and trying a few of the other sandwiches - it was hard to choose so many look so good and the meats were so fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate covered cannoli
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and cheese with mushrooms onions and peppers
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball sub

LztT0sXgk4TSeI2kh4-O3w.text: I can basically eat here everyday. They have so many good things ion the menu I will never get through it

WAukFzrhzUdn9hG9YnrZjQ.text: Defalco's is a neighborhood favorite and the only place in Phoenix that my picky Philadelphian boyfriend will order a cheesesteak! The place is small and kind of cluttered, but there's no denying its charm or quality! Half grocer, half deli, Defalco's is legitimate Italian cuisine, and I constantly meet people who've lived in Italy (or that are from traditional italian families) picking up groceries there. (The biscotti are wonderful!)  When going in for lunch, I highly recommend calling ahead, as there's typically a long wait to get food on your lunch hour. The hot sandwiches are great (chicken pesto being my favorite!), and the salads are decent. I had the chicken pesto salad last time, which was a little heavy on the dressing, but still good.  All in all, if recommend if you're looking for a quick, inexpensive lunch with fewer than 5 people. Beyond that, seating is difficult. Call in your order to expedite the wait time!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken pesto salad and the remnants of a Philly cheesesteak (consumed by a somewhat picky Philadelphian who liked it!)

o1v_pvwIcUkA3wJ9J3Icmw.text: Small little Italian deli located off of Scottsdale and Thomas.   If you're looking for authentic deli meats, treats or just an espresso done right, this place is calling your name.   They also have a small grocery store located within the deli.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lavazza espressos.

nw70l2egzaw61sBrQk3RnA.text: Defalcos is more of a small Italian store than a restaurant, but it is definitely an awesome place to get authentic Italian food.  I tried the Half portion meat lasagna which comes with a side of garlic bread. If you order the full plate, it comes w a salad. But the half portion is enough to feed any appetite.  The sauce was amazing and the Lasagna had tons of cheese with homemade sausage which literally made me tear as i was eating this meal. Will return many times as i have found a hidden gem.  Place was also clean. Not a big dining area, thats the only negative. They would be wise to expand this place as the food is amazing. 5 stars easily!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meat Lasagna... Simply amazing!

ihj9n8c56epN_baUbHtvJA.text: First time guest! Went with an Italian sub and it was pretty delicious. Bread was good, toppings were excellent, meat was delicious. My only issue was that I waited almost 20 minutes for it. The staff was side tracked with side work.

wfQiZXrkn36yU3VWlZhtMQ.text: I heart Defalco's.  My boyfriend and I are here at least once a month.  Weirdly enough I've never actually sat down for lunch or dinner at the actual location. We usually just do take out or just buy items from the grocery part of it.  They have a great variety of dried pastas, wine, cheeses, oils and vinegar's, etc.  Whenever we have friends over we love to order a variety of pastas for pick up.  What the two of us end up doing most often is just picking items out from the grocery to make homemade pizza.  Their fresh pizza dough is seriously to die for.  And it's only around $1!  If you don't see it in the fridge be sure to ask.  They usually have some in the back.

KmQ4Pu0aYCWGVNZijcUqXw.text: Meatball sandwich, rock solid! Don't hesitate, eat it, it's tasty. Chicken Parm sandwich was also pleasant, cleaner than most chicken parm, it's lightly breaded and I assume it can't be fried, so I assume it's baked. It's very tender and not greasy.

udbW5pyxAmtSL83UyprIpQ.text: One of a kind in this neighborhood which is probably why they are overpriced. However, coming from NY (born and raised) where there is a "defalcos" every 1/4 mile I feel at home walking in. That says a lot about an Italian Deli out here in AZ. I originally found it as they were the ONLY place I could find Basket Cheese during Easter time to make meat pies. They saved the day that holiday and have been saving the day ever since.

jBj-GpgXacAiuViYsZfDoA.text: 1st off, the food is awesome. DeFalco's does not ever disappoint.  The fresh moz is stellar, just salty enough. The sandwiches are fantastic, just like the little place around the corner from my grandma's when I was a kid... The deli meat selection is perfect, they have one of my favorites, Parma Prosciutto, which is basically pork candy. Oh yeah, and they have Molinari salami..the crack cocaine of dried and cured meat...  I live in the Far East valley and routinely drive out of my way to DeFalco's. After you try it you will too. Defalco's is the best Italian deli in Arizona.

qOK4bgMLQcDufDvU-JXVKg.text: The place is cute, the food was ok! The best part of our meal was the sandwiches maybe they are best known for them . We were unimpressed with the spaghetti with and the pasta sauce it tasted like dry sauce and the pasta your conventional grocery store barilla. I was disappointed since there's so many good reviews.  The staple items such as pasta and sauce should be super important to this restaurant. You definitely get what you pay for. Would not recommend

132u1HsRiDcCxrSUIGpujA.text: This is my go to!!! Being from New York, it's hard to find a legit Chicken Parm hero, and that centurion calzone is amazing!!!!!

gbzU5r0lurwZMJ9b7NnYEw.text: Some of the best Italian I've had in Phoenix! Chicken parm sandwich is to die for, and I always have left overs.   I will definitely be back!!!!

wEHAl15W9LWuaplYplK3bA.text: While visiting Scottsdale,AZ., looking for a good Italian deli I found this place. It has. great reviews so thought I'd give it try. I ordered a small pizza cheese pepperoni and Italian sausage. The pizza is huge and priced good($12.95). It took a while to get it ready(30 min.) The dining area was packed so I decided to sit outside in the patio. The person delivering the pizza to just dropped it off didn't bother to ask if I needed anything else, LIKE NAPKINS!! When I chased him down and asked, he said "go to that counter and ask him" WOW that was rude.  Anyway, pizza is good not awesome or anything but pretty good.   Don't know if I could recommend this place to friends based on that "RUDE" person.  Maybe get some nice friendly waiters or waitresses?

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Well 1/2 way done!!

3V6IH7TvCLv1qUveXObbwg.text: finally got a change to come here, I ordered the Italian sausage sandwich and my wife and daughter got some salads since they didn't have anything gluten free for my daughter.  the bread was perfect and so was the sausage, only thing I wish it had more cheese, next time I would order it again but with the peppers and onions. Lots of cool food things to buy also.

ME33wRAKWqZzlTJEXPXPJQ.text: The second I landed in Phoenix, this was the first recommendation I received from the locals. I had heard about Defalco's from Diner's, Drive-Ins, and Dives on Food Network so I knew I had to at least walk into the place. It wasn't until literally the last hour I had a rental car in Phoenix that I was able to stop in. If you've read my review for Kramrcyk's in Minneapolis, MN then you should have guessed that I ABSOLUTELY loved Defalco's! It's just what I was hoping it would be - cozy, inviting, authentic, family-owned, and a personality that could only have evolved through generations of experience.  When you first walk in you are greeted by shelves and shelves of Italian goodies and a meat counter. I noticed a very diverse group of customers sitting all around the restaurant section of the store which was a great indicator that the food was likely muy delicioso. I was a little overwhelmed with the menu selection because there were so many items but went with the beef cheesesteak because it was the most yelped about option.  Let me just say that THE CHEESE STEAK DID NOT DISAPPOINT. It probably would have been the best sandwich I have ever had if pickled jalapenos would have been thrown in there. The beef was tender, well seasoned, not too salty, not too bland, just perfect. The mushrooms were grilled long enough to be soft but still have a bite to them. The grilled onions were caramelized and tasted amazing with the melted cheese sauce drizzled on top of the sandwich. The bread was soft, fresh, and not too dense. For a sandwich that was probably 2000 calories, it felt like I had just eaten a light and refreshing meal.   Parking is very easy, it's in a strip mall so spaces are ample. Prices are reasonable for a deli and service is fast.   I definitely recommend this place if you find yourself in the greater Phoenix area aka, Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef cheesesteak #bomb

Avc0qzR-4vio-xnqC9UMEQ.text: Great place, they have a ton of authentic Italian ingredients. I hold my delis to a high standard though and it's not basic enough to compare to delis from New York. My friends presents who are from Italy we're impressed but not amazed. Great for AZ standards.

mY6Noalfvl-YyL-WMhhGOw.text: Excellent food and groceries, but this is a very poorly managed establishment. The employees literally look like they are moving in slow motion. There is zero organization in the deli, and customers walk around aimlessly since there are no clear signs indicating where to go. I come here about once a week, and it's the same story everytime. Plan to spend over twenty minutes just to pick up some deli items. The problems could be drastically improved with simple signs, but they are popular and management probably just doesn't care. The quality of the food will keep bringing people back until another deli/restaurant opens next door.

Xkjy4yxEc2jXEG7y0IJC9Q.text: The food here is excellent. We ordered a sausage and beef sandwich and vodka pasta and they both tasted great! The service is fast considering the fact that it was lunch time and busy. It does not have the typical restaurant feel since it is also a grocery and a deli but don't be discouraged. Larger groups are probably hard to sit but if there's just two to three people then there are plenty of spaces for everyone. I will definitely come back again for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage and beef sandwhich. Def recommend. Taste great with the gravy.
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vodka penne. So delicious!

n7qLOavU0DdliWtRmXHPCA.text: I couldn't find an Italian in the place. The food is 100% canned garbage. They serve there meatball sub on a hotdog bun. The customers are sheep.They would eat anything you feed them. Make sure you have your toilet paper very ,very close.... YUCK!!!

xTx2jhW3q1YEvglKk8RKKg.text: The only problem is the lunch rush. Call ahead! This is an Italian grocery store, so you can find some unique ingredients, exotic beers, wines, and sweets. I have only had sandwiches here I had a Tuna sub, and a meatball sub on separate occasions. Generous portions for the price, the bread is fresh baked. The meatballs are a nice array of seasoning. the tuna itself was ok, nothing too special, but the bread makes up for it. I am a sucker for pizzelle (anise flavored cookies) and Defalco's has some incredible pizzelle I like to bring it in for my coworkers every now and then, and they love it too!

C2fo4Y9K9qPuqxYZL1LPdg.text: Saw this place on that tv show, diners/drive ins/dives.....food is authentic...and fabulous!!!  Tried the Itaian sausage sandwich, the meatball sandwich, and several pastas.  The salads are great, and save room for a lemon bar or piece of cheesecake.  Yum!!!  Good for eat in, and for take home....enjoy!!

N5g34Z1zY16UIJepjznd8A.text: A local food establishment that make a wide variety of Italian sausages by hand and they also make their own spaghetti sauce - everything is made to order, from what I can tell, so if you order food to eat there also order a glass of wine - they have a number of red and white options and find yourself sliding into the Italian frame of mind while you wait for your food to be prepared. In addition, I almost always get an order of hot Italian sausage so I can make my own spaghetti sauce at home. Along with the sausages you can get canned tomatoes from Italy and any number of delicacies from the land of pizza and pasta. I must like this place because I have a strong urge to stop in every time I'm in the area. A wonderful little bastion of Italian food culture.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lovely wine glasses and great wine!

yiSUGmyEBi4CvNTb79JH-w.text: Italian grocery - you can find what you need here for your next authentic Italian meal and they have the BEST sandwiches!  Cheesesteaks and cold Italian subs to die for. Get it on a sub roll!  I love that I can acquire obscure ingredients and enjoy a delicious pesto gnocchi, Italian sub and rich dessert that is noteworthy here.  Pro tip: call ahead.

ZIccK-4Szuz8ulpbUu_O_A.text: I could eat here everyday! I love the steak and cheese & calzone!!!! This place is absolutely phenomenal and I would recommend it to everybody

BCvx-zqmPSjY8pleMjhB0w.text: If you live in the Phoenix area, you must come here and partake of the goodness that comes out of this quaint little Italian kitchen. My wife got the pizza sub and I got the cheese stake. Tender juicy and full of flavor. You will love this place. Not to mention you can buy fresh Italian bread too on the way out.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I haven&#39;t had many cheese steaks, but this definitely set a high bar. Very tender and juicy meat. Big serving!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pizza sub. It&#39;s like eating heavenly bliss. It won&#39;t disappoint!

JBBHftnIzOxofr9cx4vIzg.text: I had the cheesesteak sub my husband had the chicken Parmesan sub. Both were delicious but mine tasted better. Portion size: We each ordered the small one so we could save room for dessert. The sandwich covered most of a normal sized dinner plate and we had to take dessert with us.

aQEnT-pyWU_pcuRDcSDYpA.text: Best Italian food in Arizona there is no other restaurant that I mind me of back "east" more. Everything on the menu is amazing, and believe me I've had everything!!!!! Is a must for anyone wanting Italian.

WQD7n5mSo1fz9EPlujAyqQ.text: The best Italian food that I have had since coming to Arizona plus's all the Italian groceries you could need

j7zyaz7uBtKSCNTVbsehoA.text: Unbelievable place. You'd never guess looking from the outside how great the food is. Forget paying crazy prices and just get maybe the best Italian in greater Phoenix area.   Read the reviews and just stop in.

OWV64GLbb5ahFN1tXN6Vsw.text: I have loved Defalco's for years. They have a terrific Chicken Parm sandwich. And the canolli's are delicious.  I've tried several sandwiches at lunch and nothing disappoints.  They use Boar's Head meats and you can taste the difference.  If you are coming to eat in, don't come around lunch time. It fills up fast. It has a tiny eating area (surrounded by the groceries: Italian canned foods, wines, specialty items), and a patio.    Order ahead and come with patience.  But it is worth it!

r2gDGBaFXbSkGMimDUIrAw.text: This is really Italian - always the freshest of ingredients used- great deli and store too  A DDD stop that really is awesome!

oD_vTG6knJjR1l78LAdPcA.text: My new favorite place in Phoenix! Great quality food for a reasonable price. Delicious and I can't wait to bring my family here!

sfj8z0RgveuvVXcV8SRjmg.text: Fresh Italian grocery store - small, but amazing place.  Picked up 2 Italian Combos with peppers added - delicious!  Friendly folks! Call in order to speed through the line.

yyP2lU-GATaKmDmMGPy-hA.text: This is the real deal. As a person of Italian decent, this is about as close to authentic home made your going to find in the Scottsdale area.  Had one of their eggplant parm subs. Nothing but excellent. Also had an order of cured Italian olives.  These are an acquired taste and are not ready available in Italian restaurants.  Not only is this a great restaurant but a great deli/grocery. This is worth a stop.

aykAfBLrnx498teSJKL1GA.text: Best calzone ever!  You will not be disappointed. The dough is perfection and not too much ricotta, which I prefer.   Antipasto salad is another fabulous choice.   Defalco's is always consistent. Definitely worth a visit- lunch or dinner.

EUrFmzeI155_pXewUsPTCg.text: Alright so the reviews here are spot on. The sandwiches here are VERY good and I can see why this place is so busy all the time. I had both the Cheese steak and the Chicken Parm - both are excellent choices and it's hard for me to decide on a favorite. I would like to try their pasta sometime here which only means that I should come back here on another visit.  The location is a bit tricky to find at first but it's not too bad, it's right across from the China Wok right across from the parking lot. I would recommend calling ahead and ordering your food beforehand as they are quite busy during the lunch rush. As it is part grocery and part restaurant I would also recommend take out if they're busy since there's not much seating.

SYNKx7Z_dS3l-MhOcITZfQ.text: I spoke with the owner again - he's recently become aware of the reviews here. He even mentioned the one 3 star he got. They recently expanded into the store next door, so it's less crowded than it was before. They also added shelf space room for more wine. Great selection...   I still love this place. I still have yet to buy pizza fixings to make a fresh pie at home, but I will.

NM0nZULJbpZBQFT8_kDTFg.text: YUM!!  Went back tonight, got the baked Ziti, Wifey had the lasagna... wonderful.. took the mother inlaw, she loved it as well... AND we have left overs too!

TXLU1AwcLVUn9QeOgTHgBw.text: I kind of think this place is highly overrated.  It pisses me off because coming from Jersey this place is kind of weak.  Like others have stated the service is very slow and everytime I order hard Salami it is this little thinly sliced salami and I have never had it in any other Italian deli.  Not so good.  They do however sell jars of Centos products and I love the olive oil, cherry peppers, and pepperocinis so I will give them their due.  Go for the products, but if you want a sub sandwich go down the street to Jersey Mikes.

sneVb3kCodtU6i9Uy2Nnsw.text: Places like this are such a refreshing change of pace here in Phoenix.  Even if the food weren't good, I'd recommend people to come here just for the atmosphere.   I came here on a recommendation from a customer of mine, and I was not at all disappointed.  The place is usually busy, so I'd suggest ordering over the phone and skipping the 10-15 minute wait, if you're in a hurry.  The employees were friendly and made good suggestions for a 1st-timer like myself.  I'm with the other reviewers: keep this in the DeFalco family!  You've got a great thing going, keep it up.

Kb_syKz20CvEz6-EZqZV8Q.text: You should only eat at Defalco's if you have a lot of time on your hands. The line to order your food is really looooooooong and the wait to get your food after you order borderlines on absurd.   Other than that, and if you have an extra 8 hours on hand, this place is pretty good. The cashier is friendly, the food is fresh and  tastes above average and the portions are big, but not so big it is offensive (Cafe Delux I'm talking to you). Also they have lot's of good drinks like Diet. Dr. Pepper in the fountain or Dr. Brown's soda in the bottle.   Some dishes I tried and liked include: Chicken cutlet sandwich, Chicken parm dinner and sandwich, chef salad, chicken pesto sandwich, turkey sandwich, blt, tuna salad, baked ziti, all the soup - oh - and the mozerella caprese sandwich is the best thing on the menu.   Okay, I'm giving it one more star. I was going to give it 3 but I guess it deserves 4.

iEv4bPlzRZ2GJ6rT6Gh9Ww.text: I haven't had a carb since 2004. The other day I decided I would try something new and have a bowl of spaghetti. I am sooooo glad I chose Defalco's to break the streak.  The pasta was incredibly satisfying and the meatball was the best I've had in recent memory.  I can't wait to go back in 7 years to try one of their sandwiches.

flU0tDXJPIJxK3B0D0k5AQ.text: The key to Defalcos is calling IN your order before arriving.  This place is awesome but its SWAMPED at lunch time.  You'll end up eating your lunch for dinner if you dont plan accordingly.    They make fresh sandwhiches and salads and I've never had an "off" meal there.  Try something Itialian...its what they do best, my favorite its the meatball sub.  Also the antipasto salad ranks right on up there.  In the grocery section, you'll find specialty items to take home... homemade pastas, spices etc.  Delicious!!

ALOFWLrSJf794n-XJ5u6kg.text: I was disappointed to find that the antipasto salad that I ordered and picked up on my lunch break didn't have any olives.  I called to let them know and the person that I spoke to thanked me for letting him know.  He offered to replace my salad on a different day.  I really appreciated the customer service recovery and I will continue to recommend them to everyone that I know!!!

hhAQHt5w8K7AfwGydvWgmQ.text: Great Italian deli....I love the hot sandwiches. Pizza is good too

Enywyn5kN4NXmTsiOwzdCg.text: Had the pastrami on Italian bread. Quite liked it. Baklava was delicious. Antipasto = top notch. Canelone, though, was my favorite.

tPtlFM7xQXVvWwCvCW4R3w.text: I think I've easily eaten at DeFalco's 1000 times. I used to work literally next door to their old location. While I was baking brownies, they were making my sammiches. One time, we scuffed up the picnic table that Gerry had just built for his employees breaks. I took about a week off cuz I heard there was a contract out on me. But the sammiches pulled me back in, and I apologized and ordered bologna.  After moving downtown and losing out on my sammiches, I started revisiting them in their new, expanded location on Scottsdale Rd. Same great people, same great honest food.  Here are my favorites:   * Boars Head Bologna, sliced thin on Italian roll with lettuce, mayo and swiss cheese   * Ham Cappy on Italian, lettuce, mayo, mustard and dofino   * Chicken Parm w/red sauce on wheat roll   * the weird salad with penne and peppers and salami chunks  And give their pizza dough a chance. It's my new favorite for making thin, bubbly pizzas on a stone at home.  Please Tony, keep it in the family. Pass it on.

pfMRYek7_s7M2lmkYar06g.text: I stopped in here on a lazy Saturday afternoon after reading these good reviews. Service was pretty quick.  I tried the capicolo, salami, and provolone cold sandwich and it was very tasty. Great meat and condiments. I definitely recommend this place and will go back.

FYfu0bIz54D40zTrsR_cdg.text: It took us a minute to figure out how to order at this place, but once we did, we had a really good experience. You have to figure out which counter to go to to place your order, but once you do and get your food, it's outstanding. We had the baked ziti with homemade sausage, and it was fantastic. The side dishes are also excellent, particularly the mustard potato salad. It's also a grocery store, with all kinds of tempting Italian delights. The dessert display also caught our eye, but unfortunately we were too full to partake! Highly recommended for a unique and delicious lunch experience.

IL7p4aJyv-pvjlELwlXPqw.text: My mom and I stopped in at a weird off-time: a Monday afternoon around 2pm. About half the tables at the deli were occupied, which hints at how well-liked this place is! The young gentleman at the counter was very pleasant and acknowledged our presence right away. We ordered a roast portobello sandwich on sourdough, a cannolo, and a latte to go. All were DELICIOUS. The sandwich was hot, fresh, and flavorful; the latte was very tasty, not bitter; and the cannolo was excellent. We had a look around the grocery while we waited. Nice little place, and unlike other reviewers, we had lovely service. It's out of our way, but we'll definitely come back. Makes me happy to shop small/non-franchised businesses like this one!

p_x4GTD_H6O_WBnI3maeZw.text: Love this place.  Bring some patience because the wait is sometimes long and there is little seating.  The outside patio is excellent in the fall and early spring!  But I gave it 5 stars for a reason - and that is because the awesomeness of the food absolutely outweighs the wait time.  I acknowledge that this is a personal choice - but if you go and try any of the sandwiches, you'll likely agree.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AW0J70D21B_q2II7XmZZvQ.text: This is by far the best deli in all of the Valley (OK, that's noy saying a WHOLE lot), and may also be the best sandwich place too.  Every single thing on this menu is great, from the caprese sandwich to the lasagna. And don't forget about the Italian sausage...delicious!  Plus, the people are super-cool and the environment is friendly and comfortable.  Only two drawbacks:   1) The wait, especially on the weekends. This place gets busy, and it takes them a really long time to make stuff.  2) The bathroom still uses that old cloth towel rotator thing...you know, the one you have to pull down in segments? That thibg is really gross, and may not be at all sanitary. Seriously, do they just keep using the same one huge cloth the whole time? Does it get replaced, or do the just wait for it to dry and then rotate it back in? Either way, I don't see how that's a good idea.  Ok, sorry I spent so much time on that. For God's sake, I gave this place 5 stars you'd think I would concentrate a little more on the positive!

4NlAj1GANuJTaGLqaskEeA.text: So good!! Seriously, I mean it. This place is fabulous. You will walk in and think, "What the hell is this place?" Then you will eat your lunch and then start planning your next meal here. Super delicious.

m0JlIGyzG3JNEG7IV5Q0sA.text: This place is seriously overrated.  Food is good, but not great.  I think something that bothers me the most is the attitude we got from the staff...as if we were an inconvenience. Yeah buddy, I hate when customers come into my restaurant and give me money too....  Anyways, you can get much better Italian elsewhere!

5o3hNAkTui6tOZCAhkTeSA.text: Its amazing! little place best cheesesteaks! you have to try it!

Q2Z5oV6IZ9MhrXkORrWZVw.text: Ate here for the first time today, my husband has eaten here multiple times before and has always loved it. I was not disappointed. We didn't order anything fancy, just some sandwiches and a side of macaroni & cheese for our daughter (we ordered a side because they don't have a kids menu.) The sandwiches were great, just the right amount of meat and the bread they make there was delicious. But, the macaroni & cheese, someone must have sold their soul to the devil for that recipe. It was so good. Even our four year old said it was 'really, really, really good.' It lucked out for us that the side was a full bowl because when she was done with it, my husband and I got to finish it off. We will be going back.

XlAoVi-QSF03OvzDJAWJlA.text: worst italian beef sandwich ever. No taste no flavor to the meat. sweet peppers were taste less and not roasted. tried everything ...added salt, put salad dressing on meat, added sauce. nope..nothing helped.

4JkZc5lXu-3gKBY0zcvq0w.text: Purista sandwich! Coming off of a big night of booze and gambling it seemed like the right call. Prosciutto, Fresh Mozzarella, Fresh Basil, Tomato, Roasted Peppers, Extra Virgin Olive Oil, & Balsamic Vinegar. Come on! What's not to like about that ass kickin sandwich! The Crispy Baguette is the perfect vessel for all of these fresh and imported ingredients. We were lucky to get in and wait just a short period of time for our order. Great, no bullshit, straight forward sandwich and deli. Tony Soprano would be very proud of this Gastronomia! Will be back again, so many more things to try.

vvIzf3pr8lTqE_AOsxmgaA.text: We have been trying Eggplant sandwiches all over the valley because my day loves eggplant.  Delfaco's sandwich on the Italian Hoagie had way way too much bread more bread than eggplant.  The eggplant by itself was very tasty, but get it without so much bread, you will thank me later.  We will be back to try something else.  I went at 11 am on a Saturday morning and still waited over 30 minutes for a take out order.  It is a very crammed space, a little Italian deli in between a Italian grocery store.  The prices for the Italian pastas and cheese are a bit over priced.  The espresso is nicely priced at $1.40 for a single shot.

lZkhVszAkTFVyUw7bkaASQ.text: This place is super yummy!  It's literally a deli and grocery store, so don't expect much for ambiance or service.  But the food is excellent!  By the way, if you like a good mac and cheese, this place makes one of the best in all of greater Phoenix!

W_kvL-DNbbAenflAX1Xj-g.text: We went to Defalco's for my mother's birthday dinner and it was all around scrumptious! I ordered the pesto gnocchi-- delicious! We also ordered a white pizza to share for the table--fabulous and fresh! By far the best Italian food I've had in Arizona.

mmmZki25Y39wp6jMKa7tkw.text: Amazing food. Lunch lines can get long so I generally call my order in if I plan on going around that time. I generally pick up a grinder if I'm looking for a lunchtime bite. I don't understand how or why people would spend their money at the local chains with this place around. Ive seen some of the same staff members there for over 5 years which tells me they treat their employees well. Always a fun and friendly atmosphere. They also play good music. If you havent been, check them out. I highly recommend this place to every local I discuss food with.

NTifu3qNx8LTaTsZckgaFw.text: Ahhh love this place. Walked in and instantly felt like i was home in a brooklyn deli. Calxones are bomb! Good fountain drinks. I even bought great quality groceries. Thanks Defalco for a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

NZ_iyHkw_Vm3CnbeQPUjwA.text: One of life's greatest pleasures is revenge, and I can't think of a better place to dish it up than at Defalco's.  Here's how.  It's Saturday and the girls are looking for a place to lunch. Recommend Defalco's, explaining how their sandwiches are off the planet.  When you get there, hang back and order last. It's a small place with nowhere to loiter once you've ordered, the girls will be forced to a table.  Now the revenge. You recommended the Italian sub to the others, saying how the portions are super small and to order the whole instead of the half. They believe you and order.   Only now, as none of them are within earshot, having wandered off to their table, you order a small cup of mixed olives, a plate of Italian cheeses, and a glass of Chianti. So very European! You won't find this anywhere on the menu, but Defalco's will make it for you special, it'll cost around 10 bucks.   Go take your seat with the girls and wait, as the server tries to squeeze three subs the size of Shaq's sneakers onto the table - right along side your tiny plate of cheese and olives.  They're mortified.  Staring at their 'subs' as all the hot ASU guys in this place are now staring at them. This, as you daintily pick up an olive, a small piece of cheese and take a sip of chianti while smiling at the girls.  Now enjoy, as your bitch 'friends' pay for that remark you overheard them make at Jessica's bachelorette party last weekend, the one about how your butt resembles Kim Kardashian's on steroids.  Have another sip of wine sweetie. Beautiful, isn't it?

45WVrex0akEl7fsQu6SxxA.text: Real, True authentic Italian. I haven't had anything close to his authentic since I went to Italy last summer. Non pretentious and set up like an Italian supermarket you can buy pretty much all Italian delicacies. Affordable. By far one of my favorite places to go.

l9y5oMQ2rAaG9a_3fpqC8g.text: Last time I had a bad experience. This time was back to amazing. This place is True authentic Italian food. Chicken parm sandwich is my favorite. My wife absolutely loves the cheese cake.

dYNGmMeC25puBMMx5pQJww.text: I am moving and will I miss this place.  Everything I have eaten has been outstanding.  The steak and cheese may be one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth!  Calzone is huge!  Deli counter is outstanding as are the other items on the shelves.  What a selection of wines and oils!  This is a can't miss place!

o9TvHF3VEF9Bi2-pbd_ohA.text: This place is the real deal. I haven't ordered a sandwich yet, but this is my deli of choice when purchasing Italian meats, bread, salads, pastries, etc. It's quite a ride from the West Valley but well worth it. Can't wait to try a cheese-steak!

haMtAXYJKU3JFCi5ry_Kaw.text: I love this place. It's authentic. Excellent selection of Italian delicacies. It would be 5-star if they had Italian chefs in the kitchen--rather than cheap import chefs like the rest of AZ.

EUdXLK9JVtEZhc6O244gKg.text: So far I've had the calzone and the steak sandwich. Both were absolutely amazing. I really want to visit this place until I find something that isn't 5 star quality but I have a feeling I would have to catch them on a rare bad day. Its quant and if you get there 15mins before 12 then you're out pretty quick. And the pastries are insane!!

58Tq8j-OCrbGQub89xiw0A.text: Good but wasn't amazing, but we only had the calzones so I will try again! Centurion calzones was okay and I recreated a chicken parm calzone

5Q32SEnJLlmbnTKQAWD4JA.text: Recently moved to Scottsdale. My cousin was in town couple weeks ago and we gave this place a try.  Why Italian? I don't know. It was his idea. And we look Italian, but we're not. So go figure...   Anyways, the food was amazing. I've had lots of Italian sandwiches but the ones we ordered were delicious. I got the regular cold Italian Sandwich. The bread was fresh and not too hard. We also go the meatball sandwich which was great too.   The guy was telling us that his store was going to be on TV pretty soon, or it was (I can't remember). Regardless, they deserve it. Good quality food.

5BW5MlF4jkL9_ufE2TKkOw.text: Real deal Italian deli, or at least as real as you'll find in AZ.   My search for the best cheesesteak west of the ...well, west of Philly...led me to DeFalcos. The sandwich did not disappoint. Can honestly say that their steak fixings (steak, cheese, shrooms and grilled onions) rival just about any I've ever had. Seriously great. The only slight demerit comes from the roll. Just doesn't compare with an Amoroso imo. A bit too bready, crusty outside that cracks easily and makes that steaky goodness hard to handle. I think it would probably be perfect with something like an Italian beef. Probably try that next time. But if you're someone that wants to try a legit cheesesteak, they present a terrific option.  KT had the cappicola, soprassata and provolone on sub roll and rated it a solid 4 stars. Again, she thought the roll a bit "dense", but delicious overall.  Sides weren't too exciting, more than likely due to our late visit.  Red skin potato salad was the best; mozzarella salad had wonderfully fresh basil and tomatoes, but the mozzarella was not flavorful at all. Very flat.  Managed to have some dessert as well. DO NOT get the chocolate mousse cake. That way there will be more for me! Absolutely fantastic. And KTs lemon bar disappeared in a hurry. Nice cappuccino as well.  Very impressed.

1jW-bjkpYY3yGFaLEyXYMw.text: Had heard great things about Defalco's and wanted to try it out.  We arrived and got in line.  There were only about four people ahead of us in line, but the order taking was going VERY slowly.  They finally opened up a second register.  The girl took our order, we paid, and went outside to sit.  After about 15 minutes or so they brought my husband's cheesesteak sandwich.  We had ordered some additional food to take to someone at home and he said that would be out shortly.  I asked about my stuffed shells and he said they were not on the order.  I went back up to the counter and the girl who took our order apologized and said it was totally her fault and that she had never placed the order for the shells.  She charged me, I paid, and she rushed the order. The shells came out pretty quickly, but by that time my husband had already finished his sandwich.  Luckily he decided to eat the piece of caramel fudge cheesecake he had ordered to eat at home later, because when he opened up the cheesecake box he discovered they had given him a regular cheesecake instead of the caramel fudge.  Again we went up to the counter to get our order corrected.  Instead of telling us to keep the regular cheesecake, they actually took that from us and then gave us the correct one.  I'm sure they just threw it in the trash.  Given the multiple errors with our orders it would have been nice for them to offer us to keep it. Overall the food was good, but the issues we had with the service made our dinner less than satisfactory.  Hopefully this was just a fluke, but not sure if we will risk it to try again.

ZnKd5AoOv-u-chuXAudQHg.text: All I can say is overrated. Nothing like good delis on the east coast. I can say their chicken cutlet sandwich is pretty good. You must get it on the crispy baguette with lettuce, onion, tomato, mayo, oil and vinegar, otherwise it's not good. I wish there was a good Italian deli in town!

QMDOH-vMVr1lMpstFtrPSg.text: I feel pretty lucky to have found this place. As a recent Chicago transplant I had low expectations but must say this place does it right. Huge menu, lots of great choices. I have only had a few of the sandwiches so far and they have both been delicious. The cheesesteak and the chicken parm. Can't wait to go back and try more!  If they start baking porchetta I might move in.

M1-nc02YUgTifIRh28cQAg.text: Stopped in today for a late lunch.  It's nice to get here after the lunch crowd has come and gone.  The meatball sandwich on a soft roll was over the top.  Great big meatballs, good flavor and plenty of sauce.  Highly recommended!

brcRXxrNlwA9EzKac-QdCQ.text: This place has everything I want in a deli. After living back east and in Italy, I wanted to just sit back and soak in the vibe.  Counter help was very timely with our order, even asked us if we needed drinks.  Food came in an appropriate amount of time for the number of customers. My sandwich was the best. Gina's spaghetti was great tasting and came with garlic bread. All very fresh and tasted like the old country.   Everyone eats here, lawyers, doctors, golfers, blue collar, you name it. We all come here for the same reason, great food and atmosphere. Thanks

Jv_mXvCrFnI2E0g1xM_4Kw.text: On our latest visit here, we ordered the meatball sub, and the eggplant parm sub--specifically because the owner sent me a very polite e-mail.  He was right. The eggplant this time was not greasy.  It was delicious and perfectly cooked.  The flavors were very delicate and it was very lightly spiced.  Delicious! The meatballs this time were hugely better as well!  Firmer, more flavorful and much less salty.  Yummy!  As usual, the breads are delicious and the crab pasta salad with dill (the owner said it was his own recipe) was "smack yo momma" good!  I'm still having a problem with the desserts.  This time I ordered a Napoleon to go.  Now, let me say that Napoleons are my favorite dessert.  When I see them anywhere, I order one. PERIOD. This one was disappointing.  It had a chewy, gluey, texture.  The filling was just OK, and I wasn't a big fan of the flavor of the icing.  Just an overall disappointment.  Overall, definitely better than three stars.  The owner was absolutely correct, and I want to thank him for contacting me, otherwise I would never have had that fantastic eggplant parm!

4m0DHamo6wCa-7MCtlMgng.text: BEST CHEESE-STEAK IN ARIZONA.  BEST MEATBALL SUBS IN THE WEST. I am from New Jersey and have eaten all up and down the east coast.  this place is a real jewel, only authentic italian deli i have found here in arizona. Try the cheesesteak on the italian baguette (crispy outside soft inside)  Pasta, deli you can't go wrong here.   It's important to understand that everything is home made and takes time.  more than you may think approx 15-20 minutes for most orders. CALL YOUR EAT IN ORDER AHEAD OF TIME- then you will love coming here often.   they sell limited quantities of pizza dough daily to make at home.  it's amazing and cheap!

VFSbaKstyY2Vzh4gQGJx5A.text: hands down the best deli/grocery in Phx and one of the best in the country.  hot/cold sandwiches, traditional italian dinners, and a wine/beer list that will blow your mind.

kjXPRsFNUKZnQ2ERKchLrA.text: The food quality is great and they have many Italian options but the prices are a little steep. The dining area is small so you would not want to take a group here, but they do have options for some ingredients you would not find and other large grocery stores.

ckiV6KoAlW5nWacvnXIt_g.text: Try the meatballs and wine; absolute flavor - including the ambience! If you want to pay more, check out downtown Scottsdale but it may not be as fun or as reasonable. This is a neighborhood gem.

EsTqRVi0lMPGPk38FdHxhA.text: Great little place, I love the grocery store concept with the deli. The pesto gnocchi  and pest chicken pasta salad was super delicious and I always leave with a few items from the shelves.

I_NEDR_zR4Y5AQV-qItUFA.text: Stopped in here on our way to Luminarias in the Garden at the Desert Botanical Garden. We had the grilled portobello sandwich and the caprese salad, both delicious. It was also happy hour, so we both got glasses of wine for $4! They have a great selection of pastas (like pappardelle, which I can never find!) and sauces. They even have muffuletta filling!! Friendly staff and plenty of seating on this Friday night at 6 pm!

dGqCxMwTtJ7XVr7yVKyI1g.text: Great food! Really horrible service. I was there yesterday and the man waiting on us (we are they frequently). The man who was tall with grey hair and a mustache had a hard time taking an order and was getting frazzled that I wanted just one 2.00 meatball which was offered on the menu. It started to get weird... He asked my mom if she was from New York (a car parked outside had NYC plates) she said no that it wasn't her car. He continued to say that she was acting like one, (whatever that means) and continues to say how he wanted to punch al New Yorkers in I the mouth. I was shocked at the fact that he oddly threatened my mother and would do so in such an open environment. Needless to say not going back. At least subway doesn't condone violence among women.

iVmSRwrqhg1djKpCbhoQKA.text: I've traversed the lands in search of a magical Philly. Every time I thought I was close to completing my quest, I was meet with an unsatisfying sandwich and had no choice but to trek forward. But not today. Today was different. Today I discovered DeFalco's. After many years, my quest has come to an end. They have possibly the best Philly I've ever had. Surely it must be be best in Phoenix at the very least.  I was offered a sizeable chunk of my buddy's enormous calzone. It, too, did not disappoint.   I shall return here one day. Though I fear now there is a hole in my heart that my quest for a grand Philly once occupied. It was my driving force; the wellspring from which I flowed. Perhaps one day, I shall find new reason to live.

CWQhd5ey062RTu_8SjijWA.text: Meatball, Mushroom Garlic Calzone is just so good.

WiWf_UGr60hzEojQ7jomHA.text: Wow! This place is the real deal! Authentic Italian deli. I had the half Italian sandwich and shell pasta salad. Sandwich is huge for a half and was excellent and so was the pasta.  Love that it's an authentic Italian grocery with items you won't find anywhere else. Totally worth the trip and will absolutely return.

3veBDHktryp8GcMg8Qezow.text: Call it in a head of time. There's always a line and its not fast service by any means. Inside is kind of cramped and outside seating is very limited. Customer service is not where they excel, but I've gotten over it. Getting in and out of the parking lot is always entertaining but well worth all the hassle.   They have a lot of different pasta salads in their deli case that you can get by the pound, perfect to go along with your sandwich and so far all that I've tried have been delicious.

0ufgTz6tYg8JPldhSrQuoA.text: I vowed never to return after my last experience here but was in the area and we were in need of hot cherry peppers and thought Defalco's would have them.  I had the half Italian beef sandwich, I liked the taste of it with the onions and peppers on the crusty hard to find good bread. This half sandwich was big and sloppy and I felt like a pig woman eating it. They give you a tiny cup of au jus with it and a pepperoncini.  My husband had the Italian meat sandwich also on crusty bread and upgraded the cheese to the sharp provolone (.75 extra) and added roasted red peppers (1.50 extra)  They do sell hard to find Italian meats,and boar's head meats,cheeses,oils,vinegars,candy and pasta in shapes you can't find in your local grocery and many other things but not the whole (red) hot cherry peppers in vinegar that we were hoping to buy.  The sandwiches were good and overall maybe 4 stars but I still feel it is necessary to remove one star for the salad they made me last time.  3-8-12 just tried the hot cherry pepper spread....BAH not hot or satisfying one bit

GQSQEuuEOlqK17A6UgLlMw.text: Visited from out of town after seeing on Triple D's food network and it was great ! Small looking place with a grocery store so not your traditional type of joint. You walk up order off the menu and wait for your food... So worth this find !! Lots of options but here is a sample. Ordered the pizza with the homemade sausage and it was fantastic. $12 for 12" and $1.50/topping Chicken pesto was so deli$$h and not bad price Calzone was Huge and lots of ingredients ($15) The Marinara sauce ...yum. GET Dessert !! Had the New York Cheesecake and it was DA Bomb.com. ($3.99/slice) Loved this joint - great price , great food.

iKPzsGtlDMa5o8YUAceApA.text: Great sandwiches!  I love the prosciutto sandwiches and the prosciutto & provolone stuffed peppers.  Well worth it if you're nearby at mealtime.

hFZGM0D891UnwDAa7yHggQ.text: I just moved to Phoenix and have only lived on the West Coast for a few years now, but I am Italian, born and raised in Brooklyn, NY to a family in the Italian bakery business in Greenwich Village for 30+ years, so I know what real, authentic Italian food and hero's are supposed to taste like. I know good food in general, and Defalco's blew my mind.   I ordered 1/2 of eggplant parm hero and 1/2 of a portobello mushroom hero, and it was the closest thing to NY food I had had in years from Florida to Los Angles. I thought I was back in Brooklyn. It was out of this world good.   My husband is a native of New Jersey, and he was stunned to see Taylor ham on the menu as that is a traditional NJ classic, and only people from that area would know of such a sandwich.   He ordered 1/2 of Cheesesteak hero and a 1/2 of Chicken cutlet parm hero, and though the Chicken cutlet hero was amazing, not one piece of fat and cooked to perfection, that Philly cheesesteak brought him back to his childhood at the Jersey Shore and was reminiscent of Pat's Pizza in Point Pleasant. He said it is the best he has tasted since moving out of NJ.   We just can't believe this family is not from Brooklyn because the food is as close to Brooklyn and East Coast as you will ever taste in this part of the country.   We were impressed and nostalgic after eating there today, and I highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a taste of NY as you have always remembered it to be.   Simply amazing!

3MU2imPvGgAXtUuWUr_tHA.text: We were visiting Scottsdale for a week and stopped in Defalco's about 6pm  to pick up some things to take home for dinner after a long day of sightseeing.  It was our only visit to Defalco's during the trip but we'll be back during our next visit.  And if we lived in Scottsdale we'd be regular customers.  From Yelp reviews we expected to find a great selection of Italain staples, like dried pasta and canned tomatoes, and also a great deli selection of meats and cheeses.  We found all that and also great service in a welcoming little store with a helpful man behind the counter who handed us  a menu and offered help when we said we were just in to "drool" and get our bearings.  We ended up with a nice fresh salad of mixed greens and other veggies, like tomatoes and carrots, with a really good Italian dressing that had a perfect red wine vinegar bite, foccaccia, and cheese and olives from the deli case.  The prices were very reasonable for all.    The big surprise for us at Defalco's is what a good wine selection is displayed on the racks in the store of domestic and imported wines at a big range of price points from inexpensive to "deluxe" offering something for every kind of wine buyer.. We had fun browsing through those and picked up a wonderful Italian wine to take home at under $20..  The Leonetti  (Walla Walla WA) San Giovese whispered our name, but it's a tad outside our spending comfort zone at $70 / bottle...a fair price as it was marked, but not our speed on this vacation.   There was a good steady stream of what seemed to be regular customers in and out for take out as well as eat in (the pizzas coming out of the kitchen looked and smelled wonderful) which is a very good sign at the time of day we were there given folks were off work and on their way home.  Next time we'll definitely try some of the homemade Italian sausage and a calzone!

RyF1JHq_dzvmukqFWPABmg.text: Last night my friend came over to watch the Dexter season finale and we decided to pick up food from Defalco's. We decided to each pick something and share.    I got the cheesesteak- brilliant.  He got an egg salad sandwich- idiot.  I was pissed I had to share with him.  Seriously, never agree to share your cheesesteak.  It is just too good.     On a side note, their egg salad is just fine. It's just not that good when you have all these flavors from a cheesesteak dancing around in your mouth. Also, their sandwiches are larger than my head. I have a big head, so that is saying a lot.

IWNewIuKsSgdbJvjuZbH2g.text: Absolutely the best eggplant parmigiana sandwich I've ever had -- and I grew up in New York City. The cold cuts are absolutely top drawer. Thought I'd wandered into a deli in Brooklyn. They even have Dr Brown's soda at a REASONABLE ($1.39) price!!

rrP9tXwAQEjQbukgv1vd0A.text: FOOD: I've had good experiences and bad experiences at Defalco's, so my rating may be lower than most. The cold sandwiches are good, but I had a pizza sub once and it was probably the worst thing I ate at an Italian restaurant in a while. I'm sure there are other great dishes available. The bread is fantastic, though. For sandwiches, I prefer Dilly's Deli. I haven't had any of the pasta dishes, though.   PRICE: Decently priced with most items being under $10.   ATMOSPHERE: I love the market/restaurant mix that I see a lot of around Tempe. Defalco's offers Italian cuisine ingredients right when you walk in the door. My most memorable experience was when I was eaves dropping on several middle-aged/older men sitting at a table talking. They were obviously from New York with their thick accents and talked in an intimidating style much like mobsters. I would not be the least bit surprised if they were part of "the family." Listening to their conversation and eating in a small Italian grocer was a great experience. Does anyone else notice that the bathroom is very large?  SERVICE: Nice and helpful staff.   SKINNY: I've had a bad experience along with good memories at Defalco's, so give it a try to see for yourself. But DONT get the pizza sub!

y6bgQYdvkjTRVdLMqmA-PQ.text: Went there for my first time for lunch today I ordered the Italian Sausage With Peppers & Onions. First off the  online menu was cheaper that in store price I had said something to the person who took my order and didn't ask what online price was to even honer it nor seemed to concern about my comment, two I ordered it to go I only work a mile and half from there and my food was luke warm. It was ok not the best I've had.

OSlFi_d6_ExrqXLraMm3Lg.text: Cheese steak sub was one of best ever. Lived in Philly for years and can't believe that this actually beats any cheese steak there. Located in an Italian grocery store / deli. Great atmosphere

-upbGRT_PIF8pipGh8pkIw.text: i'm really torn about this review.  until about a month ago, i would have given 5 stars.  my husband and i have been going here since we were dating, and he was a frequent customer before that.  i fell in love with the eggplant parm sandwich and the selection of breads.  then i discovered the portabello sandwich, and began a torrid affair forsaking my eggplant parm.  my husband started ordering the chef salad and it looked so good that even though i think $10 is a ridiculous price for iceberg lettuce and cold cuts, i gave it a shot.  it was delicious!  they used actual cheddar cheese and there was so much salad!  the employees were pretty indifferent but they weren't rude.  then about a month or so ago we noticed a change.  we usually call our orders in and pick them up.  it's never been a problem before but recently the guy that works the pickup counter seems to have a bit of an attitude.  he seems to feel that customers are an interruption to whatever else he is doing and he has no problem making comments (not directly to customers of course) to that effect.  he will even right out ignore customers if he is doing something else like slicing meat.  because looking up and saying, "i'll be with you in a minute" would just be asking too much.  four times we've gone to pick up orders, and four times we've come home and debated ever returning.  now the food... as i mentioned $10 for a plain jane chef salad.  but it tastes good and there's a lot of it... or there was until tonight.  our salads were considerably small, there were fewer meat "wheels" and those were smaller made with less meat, less tomato and cucumber, and the orange cheese did not feel or taste like real cheddar.  american?  yuck.  overall the salad had a "funny" taste like it came from a bag and hadn't been properly rinsed before being served.  my husband couldn't even finish his and tossed it.

xvbJmr_HiI99cQQ1FiK_dg.text: They have the best herb filled and parmesan sausage around, not fatty and all flavor. The sandwiches rock, the groceries sort of pricey. It may take an extra 10 min or so wait but this is not subway. Good value too. Expected them to have an excellent giardineria in a jar, it is still good on a sandwich but AJ's has the best and I could eat it out of the jar plain!

k7uxXRjnM1Uu3pijrRmv2g.text: If you want  authentic type Italian food, Defalco's can't be beat.  The sandwiches are amazing particularly the Il Purista -  prosciutto, fresh home made mozzarella, basil, roasted peppers and balsamic drizzle - Its the best sandwich I have had since I moved to Arizona...I grew up in Brooklyn NY - eating frequently in Little Italy and this restaurant comes so close to the vibe and taste of NY - that I call it 'home'.  The owners care about their customers and although it is always crowded and you may have to wait on line - it is WORTH every second.  I highly recommend Defalco's!!

fi7uQfGT2Eh0sM3-7YNzbg.text: I love this place. The crew is fun to chat with and pick on just a little. The foods are wonderful, and how can you not love a place with a case of beautiful, delicious meats?

aTgt6ob4P8X4gwDtpptx1Q.text: Great hot sandwiches. I would highly recommend. Hidden off the West side of Scottsdale Road. Small interior. I would expect a wait if you hit the noon crowd. I've never seen anyone shop at deli, but the shelves break up the restaurant nicely.

wNoxsGD4LK0T0QXwUI8bmA.text: I just stopped by here today for lunch and am so happy I did.  I've driven by a number of times and just never went in.    I ordered the Combo sub on an Italian roll.  So good.  Everything I was hoping for.  They had a fresh deli and frozen section with all sorts of frozen pastas.  They also sell canolli baked fresh everyday.  I could definitely get in touch with my eye-talian roots here.  I will most definitely be back on a regular basis for dinner, canolli, parties, Italian beer, you name it!  Mamma mia!

ZLMdx9jqcRj3jN991Vww7w.text: Oh, how I miss Defalco's!!!! My saturday's were not complete without an eggplant parm sandwich. The chicken caesar pasta salad is delicious as well. It's all great and homemade. Waiting in line (there always is one) is so painful because you just want to eat everything. The aroma of the place is insane. The hot sandwiches take a few minutes and I am quite antsy but they are very worth the wait. They also stay well. I would always have to take half home and eat it later that night or the next day (sometimes even cold). Regardless, this place is sooooo good!!! I found it hard to find good authentic Italian anything and this was perfect!!!

AoYvafdU8e0vv4KEtykf3g.text: This place is the best Italian grocery and deli I have found in Scottsdale. Not only are the sandwiches excellent, the antipasti salads are spectacular.   I have also purchased some of the cured meats they sell, yum. What more could I say.

k735iSRfZX__m-iIgOXd5A.text: I stumbled on to this place while looking for cannoli shells.  I couldn't pass up eating here so I got the 'Il Purista'.  It reminded me of my grandmother's food and the real Italian food you can get on the east coast.  The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because of the wait to get my food.  Don't get me wrong though, it was worth the wait.

aGR9MnNb1a-jEtBSJQmoeg.text: imported groceries, fresh caprese salads, salami and cheese as far as the eye can see, fresh baked pizza, half orders of spaghetti with clam sauce. Need I say more?

j_afIfkPpFE1Yd5eiBKWQg.text: This place definitely gets 5 stars. Defalco's has the best cheesesteak you can get in the desert. I have yet to have one that compares. Unfortunately I now live 30 minutes from Defalco's, so I can no longer visit as often as I like.  The only real downside to this place is the wait-- if it's busy, you're gonna wait at least 20 minutes.

Q1cqcfGGJhSY9Fq_9m8oQA.text: This is my 3rd time (I think) coming to DeFalco's. The first time I went with my husband for lunch. We both got salads, which were huge. I didnt even finish half of mine. They both were good. My husband loved his. I couldnt finish mine and it was pretty good.. probably get 4 stars that time.  This time when I arrived 11/2011 This time, I was irritated, because I got a sandwich and it was OK not to great and not something I would ever order again. The reason I am writing is the guy behind the counter seemed shady. He seemed like he was doing something he shouldnt. When he rang me up, he acted very weird and I didnt get it. When I got back to my office, I found out that the sandwich looked half made and there were no utensils or napkins. The whole feel was weird. I am not sure what was going on, but felt like he just threw the food in unmade and non tasty. I will give them another chance and still give them 3 stars, due to the first time, having good salads.

97CQVmyJxuW8jMQBQ5ZzNg.text: I am not a fan of chicken (I know, weird), but Defalco's has one of the best sandwiches I have ever had in my life- the chicken cheesesteak sandwich is to die for! I was shocked at how much I loved it. It is extra cheesy and the bread is incredible! Do yourself a favor and order it asap.

YiN0m7Jgdm1EDHxt-vDI_Q.text: So, I fly in to Scottsdale to visit a friend and while I am waiting for her to get ready for dinner I am watching Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and featured on that episode was DeFalco's.  So naturally we decide karma dictates we eat there.  DeFalco's is a market/deli/restaurant and is pretty much set up like a deli with tables.  You order at the counter and then they bring your food out to you. We ordered the Centurion calzone, eggplant parm sub and the sausage with peppers and onions sub.  All three dishes were great. We washed all that food down with a really good bottle of reasonably priced wine.  Before leaving I went to the counter to grab a to go box and I saw the owner (I recognized him from the Triple D episode) and I spoke to him a bit.  He was a really cool guy and you could tell we was really passionate about serving good food and   proud of his families long standing business. Overall great place, great food and service to boot.  If you are in the mood for classic Italian comfort food in a laid back setting or something to bring back home, Deflaco's is your place.

-T8Kmz1STU_cvVcBF92puw.text: This place has gone downhill very fast. The food is not the question, the food is phenomenal. But if you want some of the worst customer service you've ever seen, than go to Defalcos. Employees are not friendly, staff will ignore you, and I've asked questions on multiple occasions and gotten blank stares. Today is probably my last time here

q3HIkbh8y1K8iwjuOxVNbA.text: I remember the original in a strip mall that I used to go to all the time.  The new location is also in a strip mall, but it's cleaner and bigger.  Great place for a sandwich.  They even have giardiniera.  Nice folks run this place and it is always packed.  Go here if you get a chance.

DbgFk09Fj9KuM5dzC99NOw.text: Service is poor. With a group of 5 and order comes out inconsistently so we are in shifts. Person bringing food very rude. Chicken parm was dry and over cooked. Tiramisu was frozen. Did not measure up to expectations and certainly did not live up to the billing received on the Food Channel.

AAFkeH2Ly7WXZtiiJz2M3g.text: Excellent spot. Great sandwiches at a good price, friendly service and lots of products to purchase. Coming back to try dessert!

PHbyF9deE-dPjLs84y5GoA.text: Very cool little find. Has been in the valley for years, but not until recently did i wonder in. To my delight not only do they serve food, but there is a shopping section for me to choose items to cook at home. Hard to find pastas and unique wine. Line however was really long,but that's all.

0-C_g-4R1wfqnlQA2gNLcA.text: Got hungry after going to the botanical garden and found this place based on all the reviews. The place is pretty cool - inside a grocery store with seating all around. Their portions are very generous for the price. I would recommend their pizzas but keep in mind the small could maybe feed three people.

O991DvBOLsurbRMuaPWFEQ.text: Not sure what has happened recently, but quality and consistency are sorted lackly of late. We had the Italian beef sandwhich many times for lunch  and it has been the standard to which we compare others....tender, well seasoned beef, thinly sliced grilled onions (we don't like peppers so omit then) - delicious!!! Tonight we ordered some to go for dinner they erre plain awful. Beef was chewy and tough, and "light" onions somehow translated to big chunks of not well cooked onion slapped on top of the meat. If we stayed at the store to eat, we would have sent them back.  Even the best place going to have a bad night but the last few times the customer service has been poor also. Tonight the person behind the deli counter told several customers how busy he was and how he had been dealing with catering orders all day. The line was long, so politely keeping it moving would have been nice - like a lady behind me commented- everybody in line had a busy day too... Disappointed in the food, further disappointed in the service. Hope they get back on track.

KpQ3hbPwPeoWYQVUJ0U1jQ.text: The food is awesome! The pizza is made with fresh ingredients and is so delicious. The subs are great too...meatball especially! I highly recommend

M8nrW9YCtZGLOlBRdqyQVA.text: 10/27/10  Had I not have to wait 20 minutes for two sandwiches, I'd easily give this meal 4 stars.  Looking over these photos and remembering how good these sandwiches tasted, I'd like to visit again soon, but recalling how long my wait was, and the negative vibes that bounced off the cook (that took my order) and another whom I thought was either an owner or a manager, I am very hesitant on returning.  :(  I did enjoy the sandwiches, especially the cheesesteak, even though half-way through my half-sandwich, I decided it was a little too salty.  I thought the marinara on the parm a great contrast to the rich, creaminess of the cheesesteak and kept me reaching for another bite of the eggplant!  Loved munching on the hefty wheat roll, but I didn't care much for the soft white roll that the parm rested on.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/5 of my eggplant parm ($4.5 for a half-order).
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/5 of my cheesesteak ($5 for a half-order).
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant parmigiana and Cheesesteak bites.

R7vS3g6DdiX8G4s_y43afQ.text: South Scottsdale treasure! If you don't mind a short wait this is one of my favorite lunch spots around. Great staff, great food, laid back atmosphere... highly recommend

MFTHLkXOA6Shsdw5GM8ctQ.text: Incredible sandwiches. A little pricey, but price really doesn't matter when your food is delicious.

6WxkI_-XkozSyJT4Swq06A.text: Wow! What an awesome place!!!!  Grocery store mixed with restaurant? I'm confused... pleasantly confused.  Wine selection: amazing!  Sauce selection: perfecto! (I'm part Italian, but I don't speak Italian haha.)  Food: great!  Service: great!  Will I be back? Absolutely

FqQwTBiuhNG7RhK66kR2NA.text: Went in with high expectations since this place appeared on food network's diners, drive ins, and dives and it surpassed them.  It definitely fits the definition of a dive. Defalco's is a grocery store with tables wherever they can fit, but don't let looks deceive you.  Centurion calzone, the Italian sausage, and the canollis here are some of the best I've ever had. Definitely would recommend!

QyMcsV47wyrNrSZAvClTOw.text: Thank you fellow Yelpers. You did not steer me wrong here. Food was good and price, well that was amazing considering how yummy it was! The atmosphere is fun too. I liked the little Italian grocery store. Wish I had taken more time to browse it, maybe could have taken some of the nom nom goodness home with me. Better yet, could have impressed the wife!.. Who doesn't know I ate here since it was a fun casual business lunch. ...Did I already tell you it didn't break the bank? I mean if you are going to pay for lunch, which I did, then pick this place! ..Hope Mat and Arnie don't read that.   Check it out already!   Did you really just read that entire review? Well if you did read this and you did enjoy the awesomeness of Defalco's then I would appreciate one of those nifty little icons below. Clicked -click.

FQIcAUkM22_5zBig0Y-m1g.text: Defalco's is my go-to Italian place in my neighborhood when I'm looking for something to-go or one of their giant sandwiches; there's a reason they offer a half order on their sandwiches!  Defalco's can get pretty busy during lunch time so if you're looking to get food quickly, I'd suggest ordering ahead. If you order in the restaurant, it can take some time so be patient, that's the just magical workings of Defalco's. They have a very friendly and helpful staff!!  My favorite sandwich is their egg salad sandwich. I also had their chicken salad sandwich recently and it's just as delicious!! My boyfriend loves their meatball sub and philly cheesesteak. Some other notable sandwiches are their Italian sandwiches (duh! makes sense!)  I've also had their gnochhi and garlic bread, yum and yum. You really can't go wrong with any of their menu items. They have a little Italian market before the register in case you're looking for something Italian specific! Defalco's has been around for quite some time now and there's a reason for it, it's awesome!

Af4DPVNcQGfHT9R4KH0tgw.text: Best deli to get any slice of meat or cheese. Even eating there is amazing. I have nothing bad to say about Defalco's but If I wouldn't get fat, I'd be here every single day

aLly-QdxruBXpwbKfQMwDA.text: Got some fresh lasagna sheets. Turned into dinner fantastically easy and tasted great.

RhLyeTZo9wvBfBiRZbLrUg.text: This place is classic. Love the vibe of walking in a classic Italian deli and eating at small tables among the shelves of items for sale.  While we only had a fraction of what's on the menu, what we had was good and I look forward to going back.

nY-0bivAU7kIWld73cQMvQ.text: Defalco's is my go-to lunch spot, and one of my favorite places in the area! Everything I've tried (which is about half the menu) is delicious, and the store is full of great Italian goods. Highly recommend the beef cheesesteak and chicken pesto sandwich!  Something to keep in mind, however, is that there is not a lot of room to eat at the restaurant, and the place is generally packed (especially around lunch), so it's often a good idea to call ahead and take your order to go.  I know others on Yelp have complained about the service, but to be honest, the service reminds me of the service I used to receive at similar places all over New Jersey, and I really don't mind it. This place is always busy, so it doesn't bother me if the staff isn't the nicest I've ever met. That said, they've also never been rude to me either. They're just busy and moving fast -- the food is amazing and very reasonably priced, so that's what matters to me at a place like Defalco's.

AHQri0f7IoZN98rlRoR9gA.text: My go-to place for anything Italian. Just so happy that it is close to my place.  To be honest, dishes of Andreoli in the McCormick ranch is a bit better, but for the price and proximity, Defalco is great enough.

Yd4yYy_DPN9cgnl4UmPXtQ.text: Why can't we have one of these in the bay area - I am doing an Italian grocery search and nothing comes close!!!  I only wish It was walking distance from old Town - I mean, SURE, one could walk there, but you might burn off some of the delicious calories from this mecca of Italian goodness.   Everything I have had there is good - spaghetti and meatballs, meatball sub, chicken parm/sub, all wonderful. Plus, since the last time I visited, I have learned a thing or two about cooking - jeeze, I wish I had access to all the Italian goodies they sell on the grocery side!   I will continue coming here as long as the Giants train in Scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Why Can&#39;t I find this meatball sandy in california?
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I wish I could find a chicken parm like this in Cali
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meat Ball Sandy

LcA-tV1CjkiJDwZGfXA5sg.text: Such a cute authentic Italian experience!! And the pizza was amazing! I loved the patio experience and the weather was perfect! I would recommend to anyone!!

0XzCn2wdo8agPNN7imhpPg.text: We drive from West Phoenix to eat here and what a disappointment we have always gotten good food here. But today I ordered eggplant parmigiana it was terrible and for my grandson spaghetti the both meals were cold.  And there was water on the bottom of spaghetti they didn't drain the noodles enough before serving the plate. What a disappointment to drive that far for food that we love and to be disappointed. Maybe next time but if it happens again then never again.

fZG_n-8CVLTAXiCeHUDrUQ.text: Unbelievably and deliciously good food.Lots of imported ingredients from Italy, very fresh homemade pastas and best of all low prices with very big portions! Will come back again when in the Phoenix area!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Raviolis

e_-Cvslv6-_zVqJIDfVRqA.text: Love love love this place! I have had dinner here twice and will continue to go. It's a small little store which also has a restaurant inside. You order your food and someone will bring it to you! I love how quickly they bring out the food, but most of all how delicious it is. The whole size comes with salad as well as some garlic bread. I have tried their mac n cheese, stuffed shells (super good), and lasagna...they all tasted yummy!

B4h25KkjIbQezxJg9d1C6w.text: Was not impressed with eating here after a Family friend recommended it. I got a lasagna and a Greek salad. Interesting part about the salad: there wasn't any lettuce! I don't know if that was intentional or not, but it tasted just ok.   Lasagna was cool in the middle and my friend's dish was ice cold when she cut it in half. When she said something he offers to reheat it (in a microwave I'm guessing), not a new one that was at the correct temperature.   If you were grocery shopping here this place may get the job done, but I wouldn't make a special trip here.

D16zJMBUeWW4gCm_O3ADkw.text: I really wanted to love this place because it is so close to me..but no such luck.  I ordered the Beef Cheese Steak, and when it arrived it looked so good but my first bite revealed an overly cheesy and flavorless chopped meat.  Granted, I did not get the peppers and onions but I expected the meat to be able to hold it's own..I was wrong.  Too bad, the search continues.

iCZ_GRAhIAml0zvFI8EUog.text: We came for the first time because of all the nice reviews and left dis -appointed, -gusted, -approved, -dained.  The people were terrible to us, the place was a mess, we did not get any help or service being it was our first time.  Then when we went to sit down the floor was wet all over and we ended up having to jump around to sit outside.  Apparently the bathroom overflowed per one of the employees.  It probably should have been closed.  The food was nothing special and actually below average.   I ordered one of their sandwiches and it was missing items that were supposed to be on it.  Not to mention they forgot to even make it; I had to go up and ask for them to make it.  The pizza ordered was soggy, greasy and devoid of flavor.   No napkins or silverware was provided.  Nobody bother to check on customers.  The tables were disgusting, I cleaned them myself with alcohol wipes.  In our time there, we noted two other customers who also had bad experiences.  Maybe a bad day, but still unacceptable.  Just not worth the money or time for that kind of experience.  Never again!

MsS0EFZHHzUWdAi28wMhOg.text: You have got to try this place. I love Italian food and this place did not disappoint. Go there and enjoy it!

lnCZM_KWDZ-sMijiEY2NMQ.text: Back for a simple Turkey and Provolone hero and discovered the homemade choc. chip cookies laced with macadamia nuts, coconut and lots of big chips. Both of these items were quite good and the key for the sandwich was the sesame seed roll and of course the price was only 7 bucks for a giant 12 inch fresh sandwich. On this Sunday at 2pm it wasn't crowded, but I did call and order ahead which is still the best method for take-out.  Stuffed Shells - 8/15 - The shells are stuffed with a dense ricotta which is both creamy and filling. Five good size shells, but they failed to melt any mozzarella over the top, leaving me feeling a bit empty inside. Only 9 bucks for the meal, but cheese was a big omission in my mind.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shells

BkGH1BSluL6aN1_UTPlaVQ.text: I've been here enough times to write a review, so here goes.   Short and sweet: I have had the Italian Combo, the Il Purista, the Italian Beef, the Proscuito, and Italian Sausage and Beef. Every single time I've had a sandwich here, it's been the best I've ever had. Every time!! The bread is delicious, the beefs are delicious (not over salted), and the fixings are always fresh. Their cannoli changed my life, it was so darn good. The service is always fantastic. They give me great suggestions every time I order and the food never takes more than 15 minutes to arrive (usually ten min). I absolutely love this place and consider it my favorite sandwich shop! Five out of five stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage &amp; beef sandwich. Words cannot describe how much I enjoyed this.
