6sPXysAr_hzrZNsKVpJkJg.text: So my friend that lives nearby recommended this place. She told me that it's known for Italian food & its deli. When you go inside, there is an assortment of wine, deli meat, and even sauce you can purchase!   I've been on two occasions. The first time I got a Philly cheesesteak & a side of fettuccine alfredo. They were both okay, the Philly cheesesteak was probably better than the pasta. The second time I got take-out pizza & it was decent. Overall it was a very good experience & that's why I gave them 4 stars.

NLSWZ_3-Gg9ps4ll-hIs6Q.text: YUM! Great place for a hearty sandwich, fresh pizza and the best macaroni and cheese ever. When you walk in the place looks busy with all different types of pastas and sauces you can imagine. The menu is posted on the back wall along with cold cases filled with homemade sides and fresh meats and cheeses. If you're smart, call ahead and have your order ready when you arrive because the wait can be long during peak times. I love how you can grab a beer from the cooler or a bottle of wine to share on a cute date. I haven't had the chance to buy the fresh pizza dough, but will get on that pronto! Make sure to get their stamp card (spend $5 and get a stamp) for some future savings- trust me you'll be back!

56xz_vFIzbY84CjVECaXdQ.text: Saw this place on diners, drive in's and dives. Guy made it look really good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but twice now I have just been lukewarm on this place. Got a sausage sandwich, roll was hard and way too much red sauce. It was a mess and not the good kind. The pizza was average nothing I would crave.

UnaRWfmGm5CeO6inje0fow.text: Get the Italian beef and sausage sandwich! It does not disappoint, especially with the two sauces that you get to dip you sandwich into!

KDdyMx0J2zksdNVCCHIcnw.text: Defalco's is the place to be for authentic and delicious Italian food. I tried this quaint little grocery/deli while on vacation last year and, now that I am a permanent resident, I go as often as possible. I could spend all my time just admiring the imported products on their shelves and behind the counter; wine, olive oil, pastas, sauce, cured meats. But, the real treat is the food they serve. This is the best casual dining Italian restaurant you'll find in the valley. Their pastas and salads are out of this world. The sandwiches are to die for. I'm always down for "Il Purista," a cold sub that includes prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, fresh basil, tomato, roasted peppers, e.v.o.o & balsamic vinegar. The gnocchi with Alfredo sauce can't be beat, especially with a side of marinated artichoke salad. And they have an assortment of beverages to wash it all down, including beer and wine. Just order at the counter and they'll serve you at your table. Take-out is fantastic. Catering..highly recommended. Sitting here, writing a review for Defalco's, is enough to make me want to head on over. You should do the same..you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sandwich &amp; Salad. So nice.

8vxlbEm_iBxLIJ60AwAi2w.text: Went here in yelp reviews . So glad we did the food was delicious . I had the eggplant parm which was one of the best I have ever eaten and my husband had the sausage sandwich which he also enjoyed . price was also very good for the amount they gave you. Carrot cake was also very good . Will def return

G5QJiAuEj_BKvcNXXNcdeA.text: I have NEVER had a bad experience here!! I've been coming since 2010 and try to bring everyone who hasn't tried it! The pastas, pizzas, and of course the cheesesteak on a sub roll  cannot go wrong at this place.

AgMb7CfIfLJRlzsqipkLXg.text: Location: small parking lot and it was hard to find. The store isn't very well organized. It is a Italian grocery store that also service food, sells meat products as well as selling coffees/sodas/dessert. They have dining table in between the aisles - it makes it tough to shop for things by constantly reaching or peaking over tables when customers were eating their meals. I honestly don't understand why they don't separate the shopping from dining area. It was very confusing and inconvenient for shoppers.   Service: it was decent, but staffs were doing too much and too many things. Within 2 minutes of ordering my vanilla Italian soda, he turned around and helped someone else. Once he turned back around, he completely forgot what I originally ordered. Nevertheless, staffs were friendly   Food: I ordered a Italian soda and it was almost all sodas. I couldn't even finish it. However, a group of us ordered dessert and it was delicious. Especially the Tiramisu. I purchased their ice cream here. Though it was a bit pricey, it was totally worth Every penny.   Rating: I want to come back and try their sandwiches and lingerie with clam sauce I've heard so much about.

Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Rmq11Y75QBEOODsEYoZBgQ.text: Excellent food, nice staff, great grocery items. Eat a sandwich, a side salad, and a cannoli, and take home some bread and meat!! Yummy! I recommend the sourdough bread and the side pasta salad in particular...

98D1Q2zxUQgLAYCf2ZYtNw.text: Seriously this place has the best mac and cheese. The fact that this place is also an Italian grocery store with a variety of cheese and wines is really neat. The food is good, and it's a family environment. I came here with family visiting from out of town and we all loved our entrees.

mVWvTOs3ZwHpfS9fof4rKQ.text: Was across the street getting my tire fixed and saw this place. Being a sucker for Italian delis, I decided to head over and see what they had. The menu is pretty decent sized to the point where I wasn't sure what I was going to have until I was at the front of the line. They also appear to be doing a pretty hopping business judging by the line at both the bakery and the hot food section. I ended up ordering the "Hot beef in juices" which is basically an Italian beef sandwich minus peppers and onions. It was pretty good though I wasn't in love with the roll it was on, but otherwise no complaints. I plan on going back and exploring the menu more since there is a ton of items on it that I'd love to try.

3UBG2daomiDaymVWr8_dZg.text: Imported delightes from all over... Their food is great, and I end up picking something to take home every time. Oh yeah, their coffee and Cannoli are the best!

EvDXNMcZgtdbunVTiJQdWw.text: I Love this place. It is by far the best Italian deli in AZ. I have been here numerous times and never once have I had a bad experience.  The guys who work there are always very nice and helpful.  They have lots of food  and beverage options!  I recommend the caprese salad and any of their sandwiches. SO delicious   The only down side is that when they are busy, the long line can also mean a long wait before you actually get your food.

i7IyMhL9bXOExmoAZ7cgbA.text: Drove 5 hours with family after seeing on tripple DDD. Food was fantastic. I don't like Alfredo sauces but their chicken Alfredo was unbelievably fantastic as well as their subs. and marinera sauce. My family and I will be back. This is highly recommended.

315B4QSEXgvpS6rxIzLSTA.text: I don't really understand how anyone can rate this place lower than a 4. The food is amazing. I have tried multiple sandwiches and pastas, and the pizza is ridiculous. The people working are usually in a good mood and have a short conversation with me if they are not overly busy. I usually call ahead for pick up and its always a smooth process.  Extra info: The have Pepsi Products for fountain drinks and they have a fridge with a variety of drinks including Snapple, which is also amazing. Lastly, the cannolis are my favorite.

Mu303twod7AS6ATp-FUeJQ.text: Went to Defalco's for lunch recently and was instantly consumed by the smell of fresh bread, garlic and sauces. Like walking into an Italian Grandmother's kitchen. Intoxicating.   The deli case stocked full of salami, pastrami and every other -ami you can imagine! There were olives, cheeses and already prepared dishes that you can eat there or take home. I ordered the cheese lasagna. You pay for it, take a number and wait. While waiting, let your eyes and senses shop the grocery area with all sorts of imported pastas, sauces  and other products.   You can't be in a rush with this place. About 10-12 minutes later, voila! My lasagna arrived to the table with a warm, crusty side of garlic bread. So damn good! I simply cannot wait to stop in again.   Bon Appetite~

NckltKzGvVXXdwIe8caUdg.text: Absolutely delicious!!! First time so I tried the Alfredo, hubby tried the spaghetti and meatballs- both were fantastic. Oh and dessert so many choices! Their lemon cake was to die for! My new favorite place! Can't wait to go back!

za6hCjidGB-ElL2Q1m7lIA.text: YUMMY! Quality and Simplicity are what make great Italian Food, they have those two important factors down! Their sandwiches are delicious! The meats they have are par to non int the city. One of my favorite sandwiches is the 'Capacollo , Hard Salami & Provolone' on their outrageously wonderful white italian sub roll! I usually go for wheat, but I make the exception here, it is worth it!!  They are also a great Italian grocer for all your Italian, fresh pasta, pizza dough, wine, italian goods, etc... The prices are reasonable and you won't be disappointed! This is truly a little Italian gem in the desert. and very casual and low key, but delicious! I highly recommend Defalco's! P.S The wait wait can sometimes be long, but it is worth it! If you are in a hurry, CALL AHEAD!

V6IXLPtxCQ4N8sPWGdqfZg.text: This the best and only place to go for Italian food in Scottsdale. Their Pizza Bianca is the best I've ever had! All of their sandwiches are huge and authentic. The side salads are amazing. I bring people here from out of town because they are always blown away by how good the food is.

Ei86gX5Ryq9dppksUQRF6g.text: Tried the Italian beef sandwich w provolone and it was simply amazing. The provolone is perfectly aged, the sliced beef roast is juicy and flavorful, the baguette roll was fresh and crispy and the au jus was delicious. Looking forward to trying their pizza next!

uaoz2FDkC-DYc1WC3ZeNKg.text: Oh my god.. Such a wonderful place.. With tons of options and great service our family went home happy :). Usually we find it tough to find a place with both veg and non veg options plus kids options. This one fit perfectly for everyone.

aRJCiT6O-m9TsLUU9_tmIQ.text: Hearty sauce made my cheese ravioli dish simply wonderful.  This really is an ethnic-style grocery store that just happens to have a few seats inside and out.  Lots of sauces, breads, and premium cheeses to choose from, and prices were comparable to what I pay for the same cheese at AJ's.  Garlicy/buttery breadstick was just alright.  Given the limited seating I would only come here during off-peak dining hours.  Also, it took awhile for my entree and there were no orders ahead of me (quiet Sunday afternoon).

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

alj96Iw3KyrimHtoapLJnQ.text: Small deli serving up some delicious sandwiches!  The pizza sub is awesome! (I like to add green peppers and mushrooms) They serve beer as well so you can have a cold one with your lunch.   Also have a stock of specialty Italian foods like your jarred veggies etc.

1kC1ooW0TJsxt-sBm4EZ2g.text: I haven't been to many other delis here in the valley, but I would go ahead and say this one is among the best.  Update: This place is still amazing...I literally can't get over it

bQmuAk8CUbBg1kgyzcgykQ.text: I liked this place because it looked like an authentic deli that was far enough away from the trendy restaurants on Scottsdale Ave. I have to say this place is hit or miss for me due to service and food choice. I can't say everything I've gotten here was good, but I will mention what was good. I've had the "Il Purista" cold sandwich which includes prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, basil, tomato, roasted red peppers, extra virgin olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. Tasty sandwich, one of the best I've ever had and the bread was soft and fresh.  The calzone was also good. We had to try it because this is what the restaurant made for Guy Fieri to try on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. You can put anything in it. I think the best combination I've had was spinach, olives, and ricotta cheese. Seriously, adding ricotta makes all the difference. I had it once with regular cheese and some meats, but it was whatever. The ricotta is just a great touch. Get your calzone with ricotta. It makes a difference!  Now, it has to be said because I think rude people just don't get that their attitude makes a difference in a restaurant's atmosphere and how people feel about coming back. There is this one cashier who just has this funky attitude like he could care less about working there. I'm like, this is De Falco's! It's such a cool little restaurant and they got this dude working there who could care less. Once he messed up our order and my mom asked them to make us another calzone. Well, the cashier reluctantly put in a second order for a calzone free of charge but the order was still wrong. We didn't complain a second time because the owner/manager of the restaurant came out to apologize for the cashier and let us know everything was okay. Now, that's customer service. He made up for it really and I still think this restaurant is great despite. But it has to be said that little things make a difference.  This place is real cool though. It's a cute deli that sells Italian imported pastas, sauces, wines, etc. So unique and a little pricey but it's imported stuff.

ghY5erWWRP_Gg4CCataKhQ.text: cool place. really is more of a grocery that happens to serve italian food. portions are good and the price is right. i worry that I might lean from my chair and tip over stuff on the shelves but other than that it's fun looking place.

_7z2g6aDuETXg0yDc7Alew.text: Delfalco's is amazing, everything you eat is  burst of flavor invading your taste buds. This is my go to place for the best Italian food in the valley.  Sei il migliore! :)

9BNkJo8_JU7rfK85NfYjnQ.text: Wife LOVES this place. Former Italian resident. Took her here once we came back every day for a week straight it seemed like. Sandwiches, bread, phenomenal.

K97o91zXReOxQ3TKe_GIhg.text: Great for a take away Italian lunch - I've never not seen it busy here during lunch hours! If you're trying to dine in, best of luck in finding a free table.

rSrJ3qL1JLibq5y1_t07Ng.text: My experience is this:  I heard the hype, wanted to taste the hype, could see the hype, didn't like the hype.  I ordered one of the two barometer sandwiches for an Italian deli; the meatball sub. The other is the Italian cold cut which I will try.  Price was OK, size was OK, bread was VERY good, meatballs were pretty good, sauce was MEH.  The real reason for the 2 star review, trust me I am not a hater, is that it came out cold. Not like NOT-steaming hot, not luke warm but actually cold.   It was super packed and right at lunch time, just before noon so I would have expected it to be piping hot.  I will try the Italian cold cut and may update this review to a more favorable one. For now, color me unimpressed.

5ekmKWyaW995RMhjhHTRdA.text: Fresh, delicious food, outstanding staff in a comfortable restaurant/grocery store deli setting. Doesn't get any better than this!

PeHqT3b1uRpd7lswnbv8wg.text: Hands down the best Italian food in the valley! I usually order the baked ziti with sausage...super yum. My husband and I can split a full order and leave full. They make great antipasto salads and their chocolate covered connolis are fantastic. I really have nothing negative to say about the food...Every time it is delicious!  I see a lot of people complain about the service, and honestly, they need to get over themselves. It's a smallish corner store/ deli...not a full table service restaurant. That being said, the people who work there have always been friendly and accommodating. The food does some times take a while, but it is well worth the wait...and the price!  Another word to the wise...this place is always busy, it's definitely a local spot and close to ASU so you won't be able to avoid a lunch rush if you head over after 1, so give yourself some extra time to stand in line to order and then to wait for your food.  Their grocery is pretty cool, they have quite a few things I haven't been able to get elsewhere and a HUGE selection of wine. (They offer wine selections with their food too)  This is definitely one of my favorite spots! I highly reccomend it!

mW-cLX7Se2OLqxuC2bVy9A.text: To simply put, nothing special.  We had steak and sausage combo sandwitch and margarita pizza.  They were both bland and terribly uninteresting.  Based on what we had, I don't know how they are rated 4 stars in Yelp.

hwsXIQ-9plgpyyUc5aaQhw.text: Chicken pesto pasta and steak sandwich are my favorites! This place is authentic Italian, it doesnt get much better than this in the valley. Order well ahead of time if you are wanting take-out. Grab a jar of hot giardiniera while you are there, and throw some in to your home recipes for a real kick!

D_RtnRlpJY1y36eaXgAJaA.text: Defalcos is a small gem of a deli. Ill keep this short and sweet. Fresh pasta, meats, cheeses and more. Just.show up at lunch and realize the 30 min wait is because its fantastic food.   If you are a cheesesteak fan, this is about as good as it gets.

xy0yf-Zvn9wZ417IebiI9A.text: There is no place better than Defalco's. Everyone I know loves this place and righfully so. Their sandwiches are killer, the side dishes are all so fresh and taste like something out of Grandma's kitchen. I am a huge fan and I cannot wait for many more delicious meals from Defalco's!

cAAczdAAwtbr5MlIr9FiEA.text: I've never been to a real authentic Italian bakery before but I am so glad this was my first experience, the staff is amazing, the manager was so hospitable and so genuinely sweet. He came by our table to see how the food was and talked with us for a while. Overall, He made my experience here so fantastic. The chocolate mouse cake is to die for.  Definately coming back. Thank you for such a great meal!

SgOkxjvlQAmsvANkw8VgeQ.text: What can you say about this place that hasnt already been said. When I am close by it is usually my go to joint for lunch the sandwiches are awesome and I usually enjoy taking a few bakery items home for desert that night or for breakfast the following morning.

WZYUMN7pRbIrYQzcWaSJEg.text: Finding real Italian food in Arizona is an uphill battle, I wanted a grilled chicken sandwich with broccoli rabe and roasted garlic and the people behind the counter looked at me like I was nuts.. No broccoli rabe and no roasted garlic. I've had better Italian food at Irish joints and probably would have fared better at Olive Garden

XriUApdnMMX9HxjC3-z7cA.text: I stopped in around 3 pm during the week. Perfect timing. No wait and very fast service. Love the Italian market that is intertwined with the restaurant. Very casual. Walk up ordering. Great variety on the menu. I ordered the gnocchi with red sauce. It was perfrct. Not too doughy or chewy. A good sized portion for the money. I ordered the meatball as side. It was delicious. Just like back home in Ohio!

PeFlMw5BzEPYtSafEytWDA.text: The pizza was above average.  The cheese calzone was delicious and the veggie sandwich is great.  The italian bread alone is worth the trip.  Their wines are some of the best we've had, especially for the price. And, the staff are very friendly and accommodating.   Stop in for a great Friday night dinner.  You won't regret it.

lo0qvZBsrAmpaEKOVJdk2Q.text: Be prepared for a good wait time around lunch. Interior is also pretty tiny, so don't expect to eat inside.   The cannolis are pretty much perfect.

66FSicWLrv7GljknqSel2g.text: Food is great! Just would like the parmigiana dishes were smothered in tomato sauce,(I will ask next time) The Italian Combo best one I have has since I moved here from NY. I always rate a great Italian restaurant by the meatballs and sauce, they passed the test!

jKKElmpgs717sKD0olbRLQ.text: Had Ceasars Salad and Margherita Pizza. Both outstanding. Crust on pizza was the best ever. Order at counter and it's delivered to your table. Definitely going back.

ryiHuHEgAwt4K3HrE4AMlA.text: Amazing food! It is always busy because it is so good. They try to get everyones order at a timely manner. The pasta is my favorite along with the pasta salad. I will keep going on my lunch breaks!

syrBbGeHw8gygNQv_gtFwQ.text: Best in the area for excellent authentic Italian food. Just browse through all the great reviews here...enough said:)))

LCum1ItBXamFZoXCUPY_Yg.text: I absolutely LOVE Defalco's! Quaint, charming, one-of-a kind place with authentic Italian Food. What more could you ask for?  Start of RANT: In perusing some of the other reviews I noticed some yelpers don't agree with my rating. Sorry, but who in their right mind goes to an Italian Grocery and DOESN'T order Italian food, then gives the place a poor rating? WTH? I don't go to Mexican place, order a pasta and expect them to experts at it. End of RANT.  Back to the review. I had the combo sandwich cold, while my partner had the Italian Sausage with peppers and onions. Both were excellent and the service was great.  Now if we only had a place like this up in the vast wasteland called Desert Ridge.

L8UiiZ5fRL--qhgc_WgNRg.text: Everything, deli take out, eat in, Italian sausage, spaghetti sauce is delicious.   $2.00 per meat ball is outrageous though

tCGW5EJo_meuu1jAsVHuJA.text: I have been a customer of Defalco's Italian Grocery/Deli for years and years and years. I love it there! As of late I have been sticking with the spaghetti and although there have been a couple of times I found it a little overly salted, for the most part it's perfect every time! The bf is a fan of the sausage and beef combo, only he adds Havarti, with a sub roll and substitutes the marinara for Alfredo and calls it a day. Last night I had the linguine in white clam sauce. It was impressive to say the least. The portion was far larger than I had expected it to be, although I had no trouble finishing it all. Of course we'll be back, we always are.

rBA7kIUf4UBLXnUGMy4YxA.text: Being from the East Coast, I have been searching for an Italian Grocery/Eatery that can reliably and consistently dish up Italian food like I am accustomed to back East.  I think I may have found my new Italian home!  I found this location on Yelp (thanks Yelp) and visited based on the extremely strong recommendation from Christy S.....you know a restaurant is good when a fellow Yelp'er is willing to pay for your lunch if you dont enjoy it!  So today I stopped and ordered the meatball sandwich on an Italian hard roll....just like I would back home.  WOW!  Absolutely amazing!  While waiting for my lunch, I wandered about the grocery to see what I would come back to purchase later.  Defalco's will certainly receive some of my money in the near future.  They have a great selection of meats, wines, pasta's and deserts!  One of my favorite deserts that my mom used to make is Pitzels....and yes - they have them!    I look forward to going back to Defalco's soon....and sipping on some wine next time while I wait for my meal.  Definite 5 stars in my book!

eoNNrhG8AxkxVawaBWc8hQ.text: amazing back east feel! food is tremendous, service impeccable. Definitely a hidden gem of Scottsdale. Eggplant parmesan was delicious, thinks crusty outside, delicious chewy inside, and the marinara, yum! Sausage and beef combo just melts in your mouth, complete with marinara and au jus, perfect.

0EoMDQZb1WBANMc7caIf7A.text: My first time eating here.  Ordered a Italian classic sub.  The whole is easily shareable.  Great flavors.  The right meats.  Everything I saw looked great.  I definitely would recommend this place.  They also have beer and wine.

QH1jTMpk7jIZIXUzwLDCCQ.text: This place is amazing. The food is delicious and I love the deli style environment it offers. They are always busy but worth the wait!

fTQpMKwBEHWMyeaWufLZfg.text: Been here multiple times.  Usually always get the tomato spaghetti, a full order is like 2 bucks more than a half so I almost always get that.  I had the Il Purista once and it's very unique. Don't get me wrong it was delicious with fresh mozzarella, peppers, prosciutto, balsamic. Just rich. I had to split it with someone else :D

zqPet0ubPJ73tbwy45WzvQ.text: This is one of my favorite stores. I'm half Italian and come here for authentic Italian ingredients. The deli is filled with pasta dishes, antipasto, and Italian meats. There is a variety of homemade pasts in the freezer. They carry imported olive oil, cheeses, and sauces. I can find everything I need to cook a traditional Italian meal just like mama used to. There are several wines to choose from to enrich the Italian dining experience. To quote The Godfather, "leave the gun, take the cannoli". The cannoli here is the best I've had in a very long time.  Today I picked up a bottle of garlic oil and some pasta flour. Tony was working today and we spent time talking about lasagna. He makes the lasagna here. In his enthusiasm I think he let a few family secrets slip to me, but don't worry Tony, mums the word. I can not come to Scottsdale without a trip to Defalco's.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice wine selection
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian meats

qFPf8H6vwtS3eblhblzVtg.text: We were here couple of times with my work friends and team. It is a really nice place for quick lunches, though cramped up some times. They offer great selection of authentic Italian food and groceries as well. If you are an Italian food lover like me then try this place.

NoD14goJrcm7N3CRF7zoJA.text: We used to love this place would recommend it to everyone. The last few times we've dealt with rude employees and incorrect orders. The last two times we ordered off of door dash and it was incorrect, called the store and the manager even admitted that he always has incorrect orders from them...shouldn't you stop dealing with them then? Or do you only care to get money without delivering on your end?? The only thing decent here are the cheesesteaks, anything else we've tried hasn't been palatable. After being a customer almost weekly here for a year I won't be returning. I've been in the industry for twelve years and Defalco's you should try having managers that actually manage instead of letting sixteen year olds run your business into the ground.

7kh18zJwOuP7S3jjtTkv3g.text: If your looking for a DDD place, here's one for you. It's really good Italian food for being in AZ. If your use to east coast Italian you'll think it good but not great. I have had there pasta and sauce it good meatballs taste like over cooked meatloaf, sandwiches are good but a little dry. Staff is great and store to get quality ingredients is great. Definitely a must try to check off your DDD list.

0Gywri7_QZPfjzIpW2dkwA.text: The Il Purista sandwich has it all! Prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, roasted peppers, tomato, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar. We paired it with the antipasto salad and the side salad. Don't forget the strawberry cheesecake! A delicious Italian feast for sure. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry cheesecake
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Antipasto salad
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side salad

P0YHNor8EWbEu9z_gYTdhQ.text: Love the traditional Italian food and deli. All the food options are excellent . Hats off to the cooks and staff. Portion size is good as well and he staff is friendly. Love the authentic Italian olives and quality products this place has.   Frustrating part is speed of service. No sense of urgency. Trying to get in and out on an hour  lunch break even when it's not crowded is close to impossible. A place this busy should have multiple cash registers and quicker service taking  in new orders.

5_Q2cIR_H0Pu1nkZWt1qIg.text: Yum.! Had sausage and peppers and it was just like momma used to make! Great customer service!

qaoXdbe4awNUIT9KMsdLPQ.text: One word: YUM. I have had a few different pastas and a few different sandwiches- all are amazing! The place is always busy- I recommend calling ahead and placing your order so you can pick it up and go on your way! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and they sell a bunch of Italian groceries

9CIo4G0rkef6e784nclgew.text: I believe that I have found the country's best cold sandwich. The "Il Purista" is stuffed with thin-cut prosciutto, thick-cut fresh mozzarella, roasted red peppers & enough basil leaves to make a large pizza. The balsamic vinegar & extra virgin olive oil complete the beauty that is served on your choice of bread. Since I'm keeping with the purist theme, I opted for the traditional Italian sub roll.   This place is oh so much more than just a phenomenal sandwich joint, it is a full-on Italian grocery & butcher shop/delicatessen. Indoor seating can be a little scarce during busy times but there is something special about sitting next to racks of cannoli shells & lady fingers.   Now, I want dessert

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Il  Purista on traditional Italian sub roll.

nJHgE73tqXfDQHJM1LOdrA.text: We live right downtown the street, and I'm so glad that we do! Their pizza, calzones, and desserts are all amazing, and the service never disappoints. It can get a little crowded because of the grocery shelving and displays, but the food makes up for it.

uZBgQMta7FutXgdfnqq39w.text: I love Defalco's! It's so tasty and cost effective (all the menu items are really affordable for Italian food with large portion sizes). The menu is huge. You could eat here a 100 times and probably still not try everything. That also means there is something for everyone! My go to order lately has been Il Purista sandwich, which has prosciutto, mozzarella, basil, tomato, peppers, balsamic vinegar and olive oil. I order it on a french role. I only order the half size because even that is quite large. And the best part, it's a ton of food for only $7!!! All the sides are tasty; I like the artichoke hearts and assorted olives. For desserts, I love their Tiramisu ($4), and cheesecake ($4). They also serve wine and beer. It's fast casual style, where you order at a counter and they bring out your food to the table. I will warn you that sometimes there is quite a long line, and it can take awhile to order. It's casual but not always fast. But even if there is a wait, they get the food out quickly and it's worth it!

ifrE-96yixBV7E9cS0BwDw.text: I read reviews, some mixed, and dove in not knowing what to expect.  Neat place as I was amazed at the grocery store aspect of the restaurant.  The menu has me feeling like everything!  The wine was superb and meal was excellent.  A little cluttered at table and was a bit used but the price overrides all that!  Good choice

fVNeZgIbWrtxWC0QJjC-SA.text: Amazing Italian sandwich!   Loved the side salads.   The Italian grocery was heavenly.   You must try it!

yuPZbgsBQ4zx1FplSHketA.text: ZOMG - the chicken fettucine alfredo is ridiculous SO x 100 good my lactose intolerant gut withstood the pain and let my tastebuds enjoy themselves  the chicken parm sandwich was just ok i don't like when the breading on the chicken gets soggy and falls off also, the breading wasn't very flavorful or crispy meh  oh yeah, and that chocolate, praline, caramel cheesecake to DIE foe

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MkAQlCASzA3SnfxZO46q5A.text: I had the most amazing gnocchi here! It was like little pillows of deliciousness. The decor isn't anything special, but the food more than makes up for it.

cdfkCRNuHwMjQ4afS_9_WA.text: Being from Boston, italian food is a necessity. This is the first authentic grocer / deli that delivers absolutely delicious food & generous portions. Absolutely recommend the calzones!

kPomVPP_qcB83P8EfLbhkg.text: I love Defalco's and have been going there for years. The only issue I have is when I order Togo their is alway something wrong or missing.

gZDQfXASjh52bCok2LuH8w.text: After reading the reviews about how great the cheese steak sandwich is we decided to try Defalco's and absolutely loved it! We have tried several places in Phoenix and have not found one we have liked until now! We will definitely be back.

pY9ktutu0TIctdO4_eTjeg.text: This place has been one of my perennial favorites for over 10 years. I love the subs, eggplant parm and greek vegetarian and two faves. The platters are great too. Tons of great deli salads and all the best ingredients an Italian grocer should have.

qI6lhF14RMJ_zFib_-ab3w.text: This year we decided to have an Italian dinner for Christmas with the family instead of the usual ham, prime rib etc... For me italian food is always a good choice. We went ot Defalco's for italian sausage. I got the sweet and hot italian sausages but i tried something I never had from there, it was the sausage with garlic and cheese. YUM this stuff is delicious and I will be getting it often. I grilled it which is wierd cause I usually cook it up in a pan with olive oil and peppers & onions but this stuff was so good it did not need all that.  I have been going here for years and everything is delicious. The sandwiches are great, pizza is good, and they sell wine. I love this place. If you go for lunch be prepaird they get busy.

iqtFxQD27reTgRfdljKKVQ.text: A great Italian deli on par with the best Italian delis in the US. I  tried 6 or 7 dishes. I was thoroughly satisfied with how authentic and fresh the food was. This is a standout Italian eatery amongst a lot of competition in Scottsdale.

WsfZcX4VkgPj9Oyd8V-OwQ.text: I had the combo sandwich and the pesto pasta salad, both were awesome. I can't wait to go back and sample all the other options and there were tons! Huge selection of pasta salad, sandwiches, pizza, hot pasta, and desserts. The food was worth the wait at lunch hour, but take their advise and call ahead if your in a hurry .

OB9EjSRnEg3D0WLJclFihw.text: Everyone has their own idea of how pasta sauce should taste, unfortunately D'Falcos isn't the best in my opinion. I like my mom's much more especially with her Sicilian upbringing I might be asking too much. But their eggplant is awesome it makes my tummy rumble just thinking about it. What I also feel needs improvement is I wish they were open a bit later. For Italian food than is adequate as a dinner entre being open later than 8pm on weeknights would be appreciated but then again im just one person. I do like that they are very similar to the new york city delis and that is something I definitely dig.

OVCe9HPmu5gFX5W00lOQXg.text: Authentic grocery deli and restaurant...great staff and the best Philly cheese!!!!

rkJhJkA3Am4G3-tvSFC4EQ.text: Good food especially the hot food like the meatball or sausage sandwiches.  If you order a cold sub get a side of Italian dressing, the 1/8 of a teaspoon they put on makes for a very dry sandwich!  The place is very busy for lunch on the weekdays, and service is very slow, 45 mins for us to get two subs. 20 mins. standing waiting for a table.  *Updated with response from owner* Changed to 5 stars, Thank You  S.B.  Thank you for your review of DeFalco's.  I want to apologize about the wait time.  We have been very busy, so it does tend to take a bit longer than I would like for food to be prepared.  As a way to avoid some of the wait, you can call your order in ahead.....  We can have your order ready for you when you arrive, and we can also have that order made to dine-in if you like.  Just an idea.....  Also, in regards to the Italian dressing, we will put as much dressing on the sandwich as you desire.  I don't have any thoughts of rationing the dressing out.  We tend to prefer NOT TOO MUCH dressing on the sandwiches, as opposed to OVER-SATURATION.  The methodology behind this, is that we can't take the dressing off the sandwich, once it has been put on.  If someone doesn't want all that dressing then we would need to remake the entire sandwich.  We are more than happy to offer you extra-dressing if you ask us to put it on.  Also we will give you as many extra sides of dressing as you desire, free of charge.  I just thought it was important for you to understand why we do what we do.  I appreciate the review and I appreciate your coming to DeFalco's.  I consider all reviews to be on of my best ways of understanding what my customers want.  You have been quite helpful in this regard.    I hope you have a wonderful day, and thank you again for taking the time to let us know how you feel.  Warmest regards,  Anthony DeFalco-

SNHnu3XZu-8PhlhF-ktfqQ.text: I had a lunch meeting today and we decided to deli, but the question was Italian or kosher deli? I hadn't been to De Falco's for over a year, so it seemed to be a good day to revisit and have a sandwich on the patio. I was a fan before and I am a fan now. I had the Italian beef with peppers and onions, and my only comment is that I wish they would dunk the entire sandwich in au jus (I think it's OK to get messy to have a good time...in fact it may be required).  That's not really a complaint, mind you, just a comment. De Falco's gives you plenty of love in the form of a nice big sandwich with great ingredients, great fresh bread choices (crunchy italian roll is the best for sandwich like this). My lunch companion had the chicken parm (he had never been to De Falco's, or really an italian deli of any sort) and he was really pleased with his selection as well (in fact as we were leaving he saw one of the pizza's and said he was going to give them try for pizza this weekend, so he really was impressed). The only other italian deli/sandwich shop in Phoenix that I've tried is Luke's of Chicago (I know, not really the same, but some of the sandwiches are similar and italian beef is italian beef, so...). I think De Falco's is substantially better, and their broad selection of sandwiches, meals and other take out really gives them a leg up. Service is courteous, prompt and everything shows up at the table hot and on time.  Great place for lunch, and take out italian!

3stn8wRuJxjxi6u1G8xPrg.text: I love this place! Everything about it! The great food, the grocery section, the cramped seating (it gives character). It all goes together perfectly. Haven't found one bad thing yet:)

58b4RLkIv_XMzcUYDJwasg.text: Friendly Services. Good Food. Fair Prices. Eager to go back there to try something new~

hXNeaUmPuVe2s49vhJ4EBA.text: I heart Defalcos. The sandwhiches are always good and yesterday I had a bite of a friends pasta and it was delish.  I have also purchased things from the store and they are always amazing. Four stars only because sometimes the wait is ridiculous.

d6PjG_pi4duiSvozwoM6bg.text: They had a large selection of cheeses and meats which was rather impressive though I was at work so didn't get the opportunity to purchase or try them. There was also an amazing selection of pastas to purchase, a lot of them were made in Italy and organic! A decent selection of Italian wines as well. I met for lunch! Such a great selection it took me a few minutes to decide. What I really liked about them is that they have half and whole portions and the sandwiches are properly priced!! The wait wasn't long either. The blackberry jasmine iced tea I had was amazing!!! I ordered the Italian beef with the peppers and onions. The peppers were soft but very flavorful. The onions didn't have as much flavor and were a little overdone for my taste. The meat was great but sliced a bit too much for me (but each place does things differently) and there could have been a bit more on the sandwich. The au ju was great but not quite hot enough. Overall I will definitely be back to try other sandwiches, I just wasn't as thoroughly impressed as I expected.

dtQyEV9M8zcpD6gy80pKTw.text: The sandwiches are very tasty - I've liked every one that I've tried so far.  The pizza we had last time we were there - not likely will ever be ordered again.  Maybe I'll try a pasta dish next time I'm there.  :)

7kKuIpmrBk7Zbskmv-PMgA.text: This is a great place. It's a cute Italian market with a deli. What a gem to find in Phoenix area. The sandwiches are delicious and the atmosphere is so cute. We love this place.

ER3xDS3HCxn2hfuToUkfKg.text: YUMMY!!!  I have only had delicious and fresh food from DeFalco's....and I have been a customer for the last 5 years!!  Great food, friendly staff.  Just a heads up...because the food is so good...they can tend to have a long line and you may wait for your food for a while.  They even have a sign up that states if you have don't have 15 mins to spare to wait for your food...you may not to make other lunch arrangements.....and it is True. My advice..... If you're in a rush, call in, they will take phone orders.

1j0WebqbkUztTIrlaGZKwg.text: Great sandwiches at reasonable prices. The bread is good, the au jus was flavorful and not too salty, and the sausages are made daily.  It was nice to find a place to get great sandwiches. The line moves a little slow, but it's definitely worth the wait. I had the italian beef and my friend had the sausage, both were great.

quV1VgS9ptZnVxqEqiSfiA.text: I love their turkey and provolone cold sub! Delicious with pickles added.

ci6ieMOxWL-nvcikCLO9nA.text: Coming from New York, it's great to find something like this in Arizona. It did take forever to get the food, but I had fun browsing the food and wine on the shelves and the food was worth the wait. I highly recommend the stuffed shells! I look forward to going back.

Og37Yfbayg_7RzsvF_yEOg.text: this is by far my favorite lunch spot in the valley. The fact that it also is a grocery store only adds to its charm. All the ingredients are fresh and the servings are big. I reccomend the itialian sausage and there cold chicken pasta is wonderful. Highly reccomended for anyone who wants a nice little lunch spot. be warned though, wait times can be very long. If your willing to wait though this is a great spot.

Sa2h3CBfxsNGdQB9qwsBZw.text: One of my friends introduced me to this great Italian deli. I ordered the meatball sub. My friend ordered chicken parmesan. So we shared each other's subs. It's always good when you have a friend and you can share.  The meatball sub was the best I ever had. And the chicken parmesan was almost as good. If you haven't been to DeFalco's you have to get over here. It's a mom and pop place. And that makes it even better.  5 stars!!!!!

QLNRPe9SeTjh6q3YWWz5TA.text: Always a great place to grab a bite to eat. Food is always fresh and the service is very welcoming and kind. Only reason I am giving them a 4 star instead of a 5 is it seems to be missing some sort of wow factor. Not sure what it is but something is missing. Overall I highly recommend you check it out for yourself.

i2kCZu0vC7aWmfAdQwQeOw.text: First visit here and I was impressed. Delicious food, fast, friendly service. I ordered the small margarita pizza. HUGE enough to easily feed two people for lunch. Fresh delicious ingredients. I will be back soon

4g9R6vOF24soJvfSKv6SVg.text: My boyfriend and I just ate here and we can not shut up about how DELICIOUS this place is. I was craving a cheese steak sandwich which led us to try this place out, and it was literally everything I hoped for and MORE. Boyfriend got a meatball sandwich, it was just as good. We also had a side of the macaroni and cheese, which ended up being the "best mac and cheese "I've ever had" from my Bf.  SOOO SATISFIED.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef cheese steak, meatball sub, &amp; side of macaroni and cheese.

gWFKYsNdi6HQduLEoiuUCg.text: Defalcos! YES PLEASE! Invite me here anytime and I will say YES and then I will eat EVERYTHING all the time!   This place, unfortunately, is right next to the dive shop we have been visiting regularly... which means I fortunately get to have an excuse to drive from Gilbert and devour anything made by Defalcos that I can think of.   We have been here numerous times as I used to live nearby for college and it was a favorite among the four of us who lived together. Plus, I don't think anyone has ever been disappointed with what they ordered. There is a wide variety of Italian options on the menu and everything appears to be fresh made in house and served up hot and delicious. My favorites have been the chicken pesto pizza (the larger the better), the lasagna, and anything desert.   Everything you order is HUGE plus it comes with garlic bread, a salad, really it's the whole Italian works.   Really... you will not be disappointed here with what you order. This place is also like an Italian market so they have all sorts of pastas, sauce, oils, desserts, everything Italian that you can buy and take home to make on your own.   JUST. DO. IT! You may be sad afterwards... but it's only cause you realized you couldn't help yourself from eating way to much delicious food.

AY6y_fJzc5FT3VDeIgjy6Q.text: I would highly recommend this place. I went during lunch and I had the chicken parm on the wheat roll from here and it was amazing! It was very flavorful and even though I got the half order, it got me full! I also got a side of macaroni salad which was ok. It was a little too sweet for my taste but still good.  It got pretty busy around 12 lunch time. But everything came out in a decent time.

qwktwpD5Nk-h_CQ6Ojpkiw.text: I had an Italian sausage with peppers sub for lunch. Everything you would want! Not too spicy sausage, green and red peppers cooked just right, lotsa marina sauce, all on a fresh hoagie. And a single pepperoni on the side. Felt like I was back in the North End. Yummy! And although the line was just under ten deep: they got it served PDQ.  Just an update: today, I had the antipasto entree salad (my afternoon fav) and a chardonnay.. always AWESOME!!! 5MUnX7_voQ0JkYkUdA7oKQ.text: My first taste of De Falcos was at a catered retirement lunch of pizza and salads. I was impressed with the huge antipasto salad.  Several co-workers recommended the cheesecake for dessert and other salads. So the next time I got a chance to grab lunch in the area I dropped in. It happened to be during Spring Training season so it was crowded but I got a couple of the premade salads to go. My fav is the tuna pasta salad.  Luckily it was too crowded for me to  check out all the options in the pastry case so I ordered the plain cheese cake and a cannoli to go. Both desserts knocked my socks off. And I have been back for both.   This wonderful establishment is close to my work so I plan to keep dropping in for cheesecake and cannoli fixes when I have my moments of weakness. But its oh so good, and smells delicious as you are waiting for your food.  Support local family owned businesses!!

nTAWV_m-Jz1GDeUk1ph0fw.text: The food is just ok, the dry goods and wine selection is nice. The service is just abhorrent. Can't understand why the staff can't rally and do a good job when all they are doing is standing behind a counter. Wasn't busy the last two times I was there. BCFQx0EeURQPdP_q4u0GTQ.text: I've been her multiple times PRAYING that the food would knock me out and the service would at least treat you like it's important to have paying customers come in to this Overrated establishment  Workers all look like zombies with bad knees and hips SLOW and smug attitudes I stood her today for 10 minutes with no one asking if I wanted to order I finally caught the attention of a girl and she smuggly stayed we'll be right with you Fogettaboutit ur dead to me we're walking somewhere else!!!

B8_KJQdndN4ZaCTH-lCjew.text: It's okay, it wasn't the spectacular experience I have been told about, but it's okay. Problem is I live in Ahwatukee and it's just not worth the drive.. if I lived local maybe I would try it again.

BnmAfUr33nzbIpO9fhLYDQ.text: So good we visited 2 times in 3 days! Every single item we ordered was out of this world. We tried the pizza bianca with pepperoni and sausage, the beef and sausage sandwich with au jus, the tortellini cold salad, the pasta shell cold salad, the build your own calzone, the meat ravioli with red sauce, the chicken caesar cold pasta salad, and the chefs salad. you name it we got it and we left with a bag of groceries! Seriously this joint was down home Italian food. It was jam packed both times we went so that should tell you something. The prices were very reasonable as well. zabA77jl8Aliq-wXZENQXw.text: Love love love this amazing Italian deli. Everything is great the pizza is out of this world. the sandwiches are stupendous and all of the wonderful grocery items are genuine and authentic and fresh. The deli itself has amazing meats and cheeses. The service people are extremely helpful and willing to go the extra mile. I cannot say enough great things about this amazing spot in Scottsdale.   Will be coming back again and again.

W6OcEAFid4lb3QYohCEfzw.text: I love when restaurants come with an international grocery store. Their novelty pastas, olives, and wines make great gifts for everyone! Their eye-catching items are fun to browse through as you make your way to the counter to order.   I've been here a couple of times, and am still navigating through what is good and what isn't.  The good: The service here is lovely. Everyone is patient and friendly, and food comes out fast.  The penne alla vodka is by far the best item on their menu! Made with a creamy tomato-vodka sauce, the penne alla vodka will give you a warm feeling in your stomach. Get the whole portion and be prepared for leftovers. I also enjoyed the baked ziti, and I hope you like cheeze, because the baked ziti is drowning in cheese. It's very similar to the penne dish, but baked and with an added layer of cheese. mmm.   The okay: The chicken parmigiana with spaghetti was alright. The spaghetti was a little cold, and you needed to ask for extra marinara sauce if you wanted to get the spaghetti to taste better. I  also think the garlic bread is way too crunchy on its own. As a dipping tool for your sauces, it's great, but doesn't hold well on its own.   And while I love the isles full of grocery items, the store can feel cramped at times, especially during busy hours. Whenever I sit by the wine, I'm always afraid I'm going to turn and knock everything down!

1Tx0C1U4dq4KF6-H2kdXUg.text: We used to come here at least once a week as it is so close to our house, but we stopped for awhile because every time we did, something was wrong. And it became frustrating and the management didn't seem to care. Lately though, everything has been delicious and correct and I'm so happy about that - hopefully not speaking too soon. The food here, when correct is delicious! Love supporting local places.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bfE2ZyzFBxE6d5QwAfxuyA.text: I love this place! I literally go here once a week! I get everything here! Olive oil... Tomato sauce... Cheese... I've dined in and ordered pizza, chicken parmigiana, raviolis... DeFalco's makes this Italian girl happyyyyyyyy!

ZymxaZNTb5_SjeMCHn-izw.text: Spending only one night in Scottsdale, we wanted to make our dinner location really count. Thanks to one of Guy Fieri's lists of tasty dives, we found DeFalco's and could not have been happier with the food. It had a delicatessen flair with an Italian menu, which was a little unsettling at first. Our family of five also had a hard time finding a table large enough to seat us all together, even at 9pm! Our spaghetti, salad, pasta, and pizza sub were devoured in mere minutes, and our whole crew left happy and fulfilled. 4 stars because of seating issues and because those desserts were just prettier than they tasted. Overall, however, this is a great place!

yOLew_YdCmxpDDCdnm2Xgg.text: Defalco's is a great stop for all things Italian and while you are at it don't forget to sample things from the deli .. this is as authentic as it gets. The sandwiches and pizza are some of the best in the valley, made to order ,fresh and delicious.  They have a full menu at the deli including pastas,calzones,soup,salad and dessert.The seating is cozy and while it may not be a full blown restaurant the food is a must try.  My personal favourites are the cold and hot sandwiches/subs. Portions are generous pricing is reasonable i like that you can get half portions.The wait is sometimes a little on the higher side but totally worth it.  Cheers!

TLnKd89SfutwFfEVGW-Qpw.text: Always great. The only issue and it's a good one for the business owners to have is that sometimes when you come by for a quick lunch because it is so busy it takes a little while. So we normally just call ahead

wsue2_4Ga8VHU6BUgAJ6Fw.text: Went in for lunch around 11:15 and there was no line. To order sign directs you to the left register but after no one taking our order and seeing someone else placing an order at the corner register i then walked and got in line there.   Only get a half sandwich as it is plenty of food. After we and everyone else got our food we all had waited about 40 minutes. They did give coupon for $5 off next time which was nice.   An awkward cook stated the computer system had crashed. The chicken Parm sandwich was dry on the bottom with only sauce on top. It had good flavor but i would definitely try something else next time.

Z49nnm9xLoKu5UBDA-eylw.text: Lived in the area for a little over a year and frequented Defalcos a countless amount of times. Its worth the wait. Theres not a single item on their menu that you will be disappointed with. I live in Chicago, and DeFalco's is still the best cheesesteak I've ever had.

yEIw1EiLngfku4yknXMKOg.text: I was looking online for something to eat nearby me and this place had great reviews which drew me in the check out the menu. I had been craving a Margherita pizza for a while so I decided to just give them a shot and ordered the Pizza Margherita with grilled chicken. I went and picked it up and found out that Defalco's is basically half restaurant/half True Italian grocery. I have been into making homemade pizza lately so the grocery really excited me. I have decided I will come back in a couple days to pick up some of their authentic ingredients for a homemade pizza night! Anyways, I got home and the pizza was great! I love how thin the crust and the mozzarella was amazing! Great little spot that I never would have even noticed if it wasn't for Yelp
