wyLDXJLYYIcyOlhZCDRnNg.text: Amazing Italian food!  I had the four cheese lasagna and my husband had linguine and clams. Both were delicious. We took desserts to go. This place is wonderful!

ZqZtqj2ZzMltLQTTBE9tcQ.text: Defalco's Italian Grocery 2334 N Scottsdale Rd Scottsdale, AZ 85257  Defalco's reminds me of many Italian deli's in New York. Racks of Italian foods that are often hard to find, and a long line to get waited on.  The sandwiches are food of the Gods. Well stuffed with premium ingredients, some are so big that they consist of more food than many third world countries eat in a month! Their hot sandwiches evoke wonderful memories of sandwiches eaten many years ago in New York, and the wonderful aromas made my stomach rumble in anticipation of the food it was soon to receive.  If you find that a sandwich is too much to eat, you can get a half sandwich for a few dollars less. Several selections on the menu are vegetarian, including an excellent eggplant parmigiana and an outstanding grilled portobello mushroom sandwich with goat cheese.  For those from back east, they serve a terrific sausage, pepper and onion sandwich which will bring back memories of places long gone. They also have sausage and meatball sandwiches that i was hard pressed to try and finish. However, leave room for dessert. Traditional Cannelloni,  Cheesecake, Tiramisu, Napoleons - all wonderful. Of course, its even better with a cup of cappuccino or espresso or a latte to help wash it all down.  Lest I forget, they also have a selection of calzones as well as pizza's and pasta's.  They stock a wonderful assortment of Italian food stuffs ranging from olive oils to boxed pastas along with an excellent wine section. In addition, Defalco's produces some of it's own pastas as well as it's own homemade sausages.  While there is not an abundance of tables, you can eat on the premises if you wish. Defalco's is open from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. so you can eat lunch or dinner there. Be prepared for portions that are large - in fact many of them could easily be split between 2 people.  To be honest, nothing about Defalco's is cheap, but then again, you are getting premium ingredients in large quantities for that premium price.  Other than it is hard to find parking and the sometimes a long line one has to wait in to get service I can't really find anything to complain about. Good food, good service worth waiting for, and good attitudes all add up to a solid 4 star rating.

aKSVF-XfpyP2prTs6sdhAg.text: My friend actually wanted to really go here because this was this restaurant was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. We were also recommended by the hospital staff at Scottsdale HonorHealth.   They were definitely not kidding when they said that you would be eating in between rows of Italian grocery shelves! I thought we were in the wrong place at first. Again, I had a hard time deciding what I wanted to eat because the menu was pretty expansive, but settled on my usual calzones whenever I try out new Italian restaurants. The calzone comes in two sizes, 10" or 16", and you can either choose your own toppings or buy their calzone concoction. You choose your toppings (or stuffings) from the pizza toppings which are like $1.50 each. My total which a drink ended up being about $17... Holy crap! But there is a big reason why it was so much, IT WAS HUGE!! I ended up just eating half of it and taking the rest back to the hotel for lunch tomorrow. The calzone was good, but not really something I would crave. I think I'd like to come back for another meal on the menu because it was not too terrible of a place.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wouldn&#39;t you think this is an Italian grocery mart instead of a restaurant too ?! Lol
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calzone with pepperoni, olives, mozarella, and tomatoes.

JUyg6MG4czCmRTFHWqIMWg.text: The Italian sub was very good. The set-up to the place is a little confusing for a first timer. I took some homemade sausages home but I won't repeat. Not bad but there are better to be had.

0QOsD5EtTgsvdtC68Q6iiw.text: Tasty!  Being from the NYC area I am always looking for a good NY style Italian deli/restaurant.  This is it!  Stop driving, turn into the parking lot, turn off the car and go inside and order.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

P3tDpGOq6AXi6fx4YLu47g.text: Ok de falcos is a staple place in this neighborhood. The Philly cheese steaks , cannoli  and cheese is authentic and really good.  Highly recommended to anyone who likes authentic Italian grocery stores.  Has a quaint and homey feel inside and a solid patio with a good wine list!  Love love lveeee itttttt

Nul4ozrjcbf4SnP5o1HLLA.text: Always the best with no regrets.  Their Il Purista sandwich is about as good as it gets.  This time I got warm bread with cool ingredients speaking to the freshness of everything they do.  The deserts were all perfect and I think our group downed six bottles of wine while there.  Great prices on wine in case you have not looked.  We had a 2010 Zepaltas La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir, Sonoma Coast that knocked my socks off.  Damn good wine!!!!  The Linguine with white clam is killer as are anything with their meatballs.  In the deli case is a home made sausage rolled like a spiral that has parsley and cheese that has to be the best stuff on earth.  If you have not tried it just do it with some good bread they sell there and you will be in love!  I've known Tony for a long time now and must say he and his wife are some of the sweetest people.  It is great to see a family owned and operated restaurant do so well and keep/improve their quality over time.  It's places like this that keep food alive and well in America and keep the massive restaurant corporations away from ever receiving a dime of my money.    I've been in the back kitchen and the place is spotless.  Everything they do they do well and they are a solid Yelp 5-star joint.  I just wish he would open a Gilbert store in DT Gilbert.  Would be a perfect place for that location!

0N2IFgD2mvCO7s2oDcoYxw.text: Chicken cheesesteak is amazing, fettuccine alfredo is so creamy, and the chicken parmigiana is unbelievable!! I could eat here every day. Everything is delicious.

qdi_91afJhx5fCqOoVL6tQ.text: This is a dandy little Italian deli * grocery that's highly satisfying and interesting! They have great soups, salads, sandwiches, pizzas, pastas, and other delicious things.   Orders are taken at a counter and piping hot food comes to the table in a rush in mouth-watering fashion. Tables are available indoors and outdoors, with grocery shelves loaded with many Italian food treasures.   Locals and travelers go to DeFalco's, and deservedly so. This place is a gem, not to be missed on a trip to Scottsdale.

bQOQNfw0QDvJFcdEN4Jiew.text: Always the best!!!  We go there as much as possible. It is completely reasonable and they have vegetarian options. Eggplant parmigiana is delicious. Don't get me started on the cannoli's. It's a must and they have a cute market.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZIPYjzBQcHLGEXYwf6wEgQ.text: Hands down this is the best Italian deli on the east side.  Everything taste home made and all at a reasonable price.  I especially like the fresh pizza dough when I feeling like making my own pizza.  Be prepared for a  line if you are going for lunch.

XT1TitDP6OmwDB_MoM5C3Q.text: My Family and I have been going to Defalco's since I was a little girl! The quality of their food is amazing and has been for years! You can never beat a delicious Italian sub, pasta, or even pizza from Defalco's!

GfsMHVayAim-SMRuL2Rk_Q.text: I love this place! kind of weird to stand in a LONG, and I mean at lunch time it can be very LONG line that snakes through a grocery store, and then eat in the aisles, but you get used to it and then fall in love with the idea.

qCnORWNJeSLHvQGjJE8p1A.text: Went back and tried DeFalco's last night, a to-go order. I decided to forgo calling in the order to avoid the same thing happening as the last time. I walked up to the counter and am relieved that the guy I dealt with the first time was not taking my order. After the long day I had had at work, I was not prepared to deal with him! The guy who took my order was very friendly and I was shocked as I was asked what type of bread I'd like. That question was not asked of me over the phone for the first visit.   J's sandwich - Whole cheese steak with everything  My sandwich (went for something different this time) - Half eggplant parmesan   Once again, the sandwiches were AWESOME! The bread was nice and soft. So soft in fact that the sandwich was falling apart on J. But he enjoyed every bite. He said for next time, he's going for just a half sandwich. But, I'm sure DeFalco's leftovers are just as delicious!  DeFalco's redeemed themselves!  :D

DM2f5uU5eixapS8QzQlwyQ.text: Bread is amazing, all around. From the pizza crust to the sesame seed bun I grab for my purista. If you're a fan of olives make sure you grab some as well.

kxzuvJPQB1zHROuOmSmdsQ.text: Great selection of sandwiches at lunch.     Outstanding Italian market with a great butcher counter.   Team is always happy and helpful.  Nice outdoor patio when the weather gets cooler..

1yWgVVX2NyjspEyKQK7ZKA.text: This is the best Italian food I have ever had! My recommendations are the Alfredo gnocchi, the calzone (I like sausage, mushrooms, and red onions), and the Cheesesteak is phenomenal. I know what you're thinking, "Why would I go to an Italian restaurant for a Cheesesteak?" But let me tell you, you will not be disappointed, it is probably the greatest thing ever. They make their own sausage in store too which is delicious! Don't be boring and just order the spaghetti and meatballs, they're good but they pale in comparison to the other options on the menu! It's located in a super cute Italian market, if you're bringing a large party you can push tables together, but I'd recommend getting there a bit early to make sure you can grab the tables!

7s9rdghsw53EFph6CuT9Iw.text: They definitely have the Italian Grocery Store thing down pat.  Service was pleasant though really really slow.    I decided to get the chicken cheesesteak....it was good, but wasn't the best I have ever had.  The pasta salad was good though it could have used more olive oil.    I'll be back to try something else for sure when I am in the area.  But it won't be something that I will run to South Scottsdale for anytime soon.

qPaf8RvStnIBcRQM2JoSXQ.text: Being from the east coast, i know that it can be difficult to find a decent Italian place out west. I had their ziti with sausage and it was amazing -- perfectedly seasoned and so filling. Their garlic bread leaves a little to be desired but still, i highly recommend this place!

QObpBh6zYI7Jo-fxb-psIQ.text: I'd been hearing about Defalco's for a while now. My husband, Jim W, and my youngest, Abby, raved. "Best steak grinda since Baston," they said. So, on an expedition to get more raw chocolate, we went.  The first thing I noticed was that the tables were scattered among the racks of Italian foodstuffs. I loved that. The place screamed "Boston" from the moment we walked in the door. When we ordered, Jim found one of my favorite types of soda in the case, Doc Brown's diet black cherry. I was in heaven.  So we got our number and sat down. While we were waiting - a short wait - I got a brilliant idea which solved a long-vexing problem. Guess it was the east coast vibe.  The food came and I was in heaven. We split a steak sandwich and red potato salad. Jim likes everything and I just like onions so they gave him the mushrooms and peppers on the side. Lots of mushrooms and peppers. It didn't look like a ton of food but we certainly got enough to eat.  What's not to like at Defalco's? The food is fabulous, the prices are good, the people are really nice, and they have all kinds of imported goodies. So I guess the only thing I didn't like about Defalco's was leaving.

fNunVEWj3lPslTJQq8rOWA.text: Friendly staff and fairly good food.  My benchmark has always been a hot beef sandwich with hot peppers and ajus.  It was ok here but did not match to the Chicago Hamburger Company's on Indian School or Miracle Mile on 16th street.

afcZ2EX4yneElyxlzNeIXw.text: I love this place!!!  I'll admit...I haven't tried all that many things here, but that's because I always end up going because I'm craving linguine w/white clam sauce. However, everything looks delicious! I have also tried their chicken parm., which is good.  I like this place because you get good food at an affordable price. There is nothing fancy about this place; they use cheap silverware and ugly plates, but who cares? The food is great! if you order a whole pasta meal, you get garlic bread, a quality side salad, and a large-portioned entree. The garlic bread is not great, but I can live with that.  I will certainly be back to try their sandwiches, prepared salads, and desserts.

0pwIkVlsEM-Q_bkUA22s4w.text: Amazing food, so many choices, reasonable prices, all around great place that I can't wait to try for a second (and third) time!

xcxr1jkW8k-iNNCFw1vciw.text: After my review I was contacted by the management apologizing for my experience and requesting more detail to address the issue or at least look into it. That is really nice and was prompt from my post. They do care and the food is great. For these reasons I updated my stars from 2 to 4.

vSSxQry1JEoVjKRdy4AFvg.text: Had a great dinner tonight.   This was our first visit and the clerk was helpful with suggestions when we ordered.   Gnocchi was light and airy, cheesesteak sandwich and Greek salad were delicious and the cheese ravioli was very tasty.  Will definitely return!

CevwYLsnEPrMMos4F101JQ.text: I've been to Defalco's a handful of times before with average customer service, and above average southwestern Italian food. However, tonight, I ordered a soup, they were out of. The cashier refused to make more of the soup of the day. After waiting 10-15 minutes to hear the news, he offered a dinner salad. The salad was not fresh and the lettuce was unsatisfactory, after waiting an additional 10 minutes. I went up to the counter and spoke to the owner. He offered to give me another salad, which at that point I didn't want to wait any longer. He finally gave me cash back, after giving me some of the worst customer service experience I've received at any restaurant in Arizona.  The worst part is that he would NOT listen to me when I told him the lettuce tasted stale and out of date. He outright denied my claim. I have not received such an attitude toward a customer before. He had no reason to give me a snarky, self-righteous attitude. He acted completely full of himself and his restaurant, saying that it was fresh and I was wrong. It's not that hard to please the customer. I will not return and can't recommend this restaurant based on their refusal to put the customer first. I'm pretty sure I know how a fresh salad should taste and this was not up to par. Not a big deal, don't attack the customer. That's unacceptable. There are a number of Italian restaurants I frequent in Tempe and Scottsdale and will go to them in the future. Defalco's inability to give a welcoming and positive experience is not well received and will not be tolerated.

zCxX7_ZOUUqtd1FjQJ9SpQ.text: Defalco's is amazingly delicious. The trick to getting your lunch in a timely fashion is to call ahead. It's usually ready in about fifteen minutes and you get to skip the line (as pickups are a separate cashier).  The cheesesteaks are phenomenally sinful, whether you go with the beef or the chicken. I try to eat healthily, but even I will admit weakness when faced with Defalco's. I'd like to see you resist once you have tasted their heavenly precursor to a heart attack, err, cheesesteak.  Also, don't skip dessert. The cannoli is epic.  If you want to eat in, there are tables along the windows. The grocery also has a good selection of Italian dry goods if you want to do something crazy like cook at home.

YRNFZS9A7Z07_Q3Tc2LeFg.text: Good place to get all the things you need Italian and can't get else where. Although they can get a bit pricy here! But I haven't found any other places in az that sell the good italian foods!

mwEJxJ_zy3E-hpnsSrRPOg.text: Food is great! Cheese steak is AMAZING!

L0tTfjRS0-KC8wBG5WwZtA.text: Coming from Chicago, it's great to find an authentic Italian-style deli near me! Their sandwiches and pastas are great and I'm excited to try things from the deli case. The best part is all the Italian goodies that my mom used to buy for us back home. Love this place.

RWc2yReInKhHmnesevSqBg.text: For horrible service. The food is delicious but if they know they have a busy lunch hour they should hire someone with good customer service and have multiple people answering the phones, not just one!

dDBFAg29W4FW8nnL3U0meg.text: Pretty much either my favorite or 2nd favorite place to get a sandwich in Scottsdale. Not to mention you can get a 12 inch sandwich for less than 10 bucks. Place gets packed so make sure you order ahead

N_IrC0TRoOQRps5Dk9ONmA.text: I heard that this was THE PLACE to go for wonderful pizza. Well as far as I'm concerned, I had the absolute worst pie ever.  The center of the pie was not cooked the crust was soggy and limp to the point where the toppings slid off the crust. What a waste of $15.00. I will not go back EVER!!! Oh BTW, this was a take out order, I threw it out and ate a PBJ.

i4zuPQCkiUrCIHAi2Ymh0g.text: I've been here at least 5 times and I'm always satisfied.   Its put together differently inside.. half grocery store half restaurant, but its cool and different than the conventional lobby of a restaurant. And truth be told actually makes you more likely to talk with other people while your there, something that's been missing these days.   So the food is made fresh to order, and with that some things take more time than others to get.. but isn't that a good problem to have? The only actual problem I see is that when someone comes in super excited with really big hopes because Defalco's has such a great rating they tend to get disappointed by the little things that usually wouldn't disappoint them... because their expecting the best food ever.. but its not the best ever. Now dont get me wrong I can literally eat there every day and always be happy and stuffed, but your always gonna have a better pasta at a pasta place or pizza at a pizza place. Its that thing that hurts... their blessing can be a curse

Q6mJvtWglBsOXHVf9eNTUA.text: This was my second time this week to experience DeFalco's. To say I was underwhelmed both times would be an understatement.  The first time was when we ordered pizza for friends that were coming over for the evening. Our friends were excited because DeFalco's was a place they had heard really great things about and couldn't wait to try their food. the pizza though was just so-so. The sausage and pepperoni one was better than the vegetarian one because the meat added some flavor to the whole thing but the veggie one was bland. No one was impressed...  My dad has been going here for years though and he said their sandwiches are what they are famous for so I forgave the sub-par pizza and tonight we decided to see what all the hoopla was about. I'm sorry that we did...  1. I don't have a problem with surly restaurant employees... I was a surly barista for years but I have a problem with rude asshole workers. My husband and I walked up to the counter and this guy turns and complains to his co-worker about all the people coming in. Really dude??? People buying food here is what keeps you employed! He then bitches again about the same thing as I am attempting to order. AND he won't even acknowledge that I am the one ordering and will only make eye contact with my husband. Like I wasn't there.   2. My husband ordered the Greek Veggie Sandwich. We got home with the sandwich and as he was checking it out he notices that it has only one piece of feta on the whole 12 inch sandwich. And one cherry tomato on each sandwich half. The rest of it is just cucumber and onions. That's it. So he was essentially given a cucumber sandwich. Lame.  3. My dad and I split a whole Combo sandwich. It was okay. Not great. I've had better sub sandwiches.  My dad says that the sandwiches were not like he remembered in the past and that this time they really seemed to skimp on the meat. In the past he and his girlfriend had split the same sandwich and it was almost too much for them both. That was not the case tonight.   The only positive thing I have to say is that one of the people with us got a tuna sandwich and they said it was really great. She also thinks Top Ramon is good though so take her review as you wish.  Sorry to say that I don't think I will visiting this establishment again. And my friends that wanted to try the sandwiches... I'll be encouraging them not to bother.

84hsLoLQKtkbcFZ0F0ohmQ.text: In a rush this isn't the place at lunch, but man o man, are their sammys fantastic! Highly recommend!

OIM0Is2KCs4iolTw1p3vtA.text: Great Italian Grocery and restaurant! Its a small place but totally worth it, especially for the price! You cannot beat it! The staff is very helpful and willing to go out of their way to make sure you're satisfied!

4dXVGOmvM9SdMhPV5oLUVg.text: Amazing cannoli's and great prices on food. Ordered the fettuccini alfredo which came with garlic toast and a house salad. Would definitely recommend this place!

bClMrjT4RCSvyKgos30cOQ.text: Quality of food was excellent! Will be back again to try pasta. Italian sandwich was one of the best. I was worried that the wife order the wrong thing, ( Ruben) but it was delicious. We had the macaroon and pre made cannoli, which I am always afraid of. But both were fresh and delictable. Can wait to go back. Guy you be right!

6BEvO2NZvJfDGBIqSs5YPw.text: Don't understand the fuss about this place.  The first time I went I got a Caprese Salad.  It was a giant bowl of romaine and iceberg lettuce (I expected a handful or none at all), whole basil leaves (not tasty in a salad), pinkish/greenish Roma tomatoes (yuck), fresh mozzarella (the only plus) and when I said I wanted balsamic for my dressing, that exactly what I got.  Balsamic vinegar.  No oil.  So weird.  The breadsticks had been warmed and cooled so many times they were like semi-chewy rubber.  And cold (again) when given to me.  I left totally confused.    Decided to try again because a friend swore he loved it.  I got the eggplant parmesan over linguini.  It was very good!  But again, cold, chewy, old breadsticks. The side salad had the same pinkish/green Roma tomatoes (who EATS those horrible things!!???)  My friend (who talked me into going back again) got a chicken parmesan sandwich which was served on old bread that was so hard he couldn't bite thru parts of it.  He was very disappointed.    I will say this: the tiramisu was the best I have ever had.  Great cannoli too.    But seriously: its really hard to take an italian place seriously when they serve terrible, old bread and can't tell the difference between the worst tomatoes ever and a good or even great, juicy, enjoyable red tomato.    Na mean?

5ENpQXMS8yJYJoX8Upok8w.text: Wow, outstanding.  Had the eggplant parm sandwich - (half - it was a HUGE half), and it was SO delicious.  The cheese was melted just perfectly.  My boyfriend had the Il Purista - w/o the meat since I'm a vegetarian so we could share - so fresh and so tasty.  We also shared the artichoke salad, and gorgonzola stuffed green olives. .... Amazing.  I can't wait to go back - like, maybe for a second lunch in 30 minutes.

zpHk2sZylPUWq6F26L8VBg.text: Terrible customer service most of the time.  Nonetheless, we can't resist the food.  One of the best meatball subs around for a cheap price.

7EEtaJWn1ZbqIGj2PZN31w.text: ok if you are looking for amazing home cooked Italian food in the Valley then this is the place to go! The food is simple and amazing! I personally love the eggplant with noodles and their pizzas which are stunning! It's a small place and expect to wait for quality but they do accept phone in orders-so call ahead!

FMZnAnjaQoH6iWGpXUPEGg.text: Usually when I read all these great reviews, my dreams, hopes, mouth, tummy, appetite and foodgasm get crushed with disappointment. I came here for the cheesesteak. Don't call it a Philly cheesesteak like I did. The sandwich comes plain with meat and cheese, but upon request they will add grilled peppers onions and mushrooms. Just the right amount too, unlike other places that will try to use the veggies as fillers. I ordered two full sized sandwiches for my wifey and I, waited ten minutes, drove home and looked at them for a while....they didn't look anything special.  First bite OH MAN! Kaching, Jackpot, WOOT WOOT. SIrens and Alarms went off! I have never been to Philly to try an OPS (kinda like OG, but stands for Original Philly Cheesesteak) and I have no desire to go to Philly either. If I ever have the urge for a great cheesesteak, good bye Corleone's and shitty US Airways Center overpriced soggy bread with morsels of imitation meat and cold hardened cheese, I will come to Defalco's. It helps having a close place by though.  PS: You can make two meals out of one sandwich unless your a fatzo like me or starving. Call ahead and just pick it up if you don't want to wait ten minutes, or plan on not eating here. I'm a big D man (work and live in Dallas/live in Scottsdale), wore my Dallas Mavericks shirt and the guy wanted to charge me twice for that. The line for ordering is in the back, don't stand around for five minutes at the front line where people order coffee and other hot beverages.

Ba3Kvj76TTvoCr2IU7QPUA.text: So.......I love Defalco's. My bf and I are addicted to the Il Purista, which is JUST PERFECTION, with and without the prosciutto. I've had someone describe their service to me as "New York style" and I agree with that assessment, so if you cant hang with it, then go be a baby somewhere else. The food is fresh, delicious, and incredible. Their lattes are bomb, and the cannolis pretty great too. I dont have a single bad thing to say about these folks or their amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Il purista
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Il Purista no prosciutto &amp; cannoli

aJ9v0cohomuv29Lth4CELg.text: This Italian Deli is top notch. Their portions are huge and the quality of the food is really good. The Chicken dishes are particularly amazing .

DfttwUzBfVM3T5zs4hDhog.text: We were so excited about this place because we've heard such good things! Service was ok. Spaghetti sauce tasted a lot like chef boyardee canned sauce which was disappointing. Also had no gluten free options so ended up with tuna salad.

JiJJMJcf3-PR6rrAYOxZBA.text: This place creates excellent food. I have been here a handful of times and have no complaints. The meatballs are homemade, you can taste it. The bread is fresh and the customer service is amazing.  I would recommend this place to anyone!!!

AWjMt6sTxXxIzabGz7ufxg.text: Reminds me of the deli's in Italy where you eat among the groceries. Awesome desserts, Good Sandwiches and the Gnocci is outstanding. Nice to have a good meal with a glass of wine at relax on their patio.

-n07p9LBJbJogLtu7m3zNA.text: You can't get any better than this place. It's fresh, family owned and they don't mess around when it comes to DELICIOUSNESS!!!!!!! They do it right and legit :) Their italian grocery is even better.. GO HERE!!!!! SOOOOOO GOOD!!!!!! I wouldn't go anywhere else for italian food. YUMMO!!!!!!!

BWzUUCbfNhDIsV80z1SQkw.text: I have been shopping at DeFalco's back when it was on 44th and Thomas Rd. I have to say the meatballs and Italian sausages are slipping big time. I just fried some hot sausage.....bland. The same time I bought the sausages I also purchased meatballs. Never again. Both use to taste like my mother's and grandmother's. I will make my own. Much better.

WJeLS5sHKyQNgASpr5ABSA.text: This place has pretty good authentic italian food. The chicken alfredo is delicious and there sandwiches are too. Their pastries are a little stale, but my fiance and I always come here for a nice dinner. I love the little market inside.

bvtiRYxFMcbIRheYY4FyKA.text: Hot Giardinara Pepper is a must! I always stop by DeFalco for these peppers. They are home-made and delicious. The menu at DeFalco have variety of delicious food and it often took me a while to make a decision on what I should order. It is because I don't want to miss any delicious options offered on that day. My all time favorite is eggplant parmigiana sandwich. The lightly fired eggplant is so tasty and juicy.

BSPAFPjexMCKT1fZR2X80g.text: What a little gem. Everything about this place was awesome. I went too one in old town San Diego and it was just as great but they are not connected in anyway they say. Great job

w2eXuxF7Dt5tMLSS1_04UA.text: They did not take food allergy serious after specifically stating allergy. I seriously trusted this place and don't know how you mess up that bad. Employees need to slow down. Everyone is always running around "busy". Man on the phone taking orders is often short. Stop and listen people, as it could save a life.

KCSGhjKuDe5v1QQuCGcA8g.text: Everything I have had is great from the pizza, sandwiches to calzones you cant go wrong here only downfall is they are always super busy so expect a wait

ue7J68rW7UIghY9sTt6XCQ.text: Quite a few Italian grocery items to choose from, had an Italian Sub, not impressed, prefer crusty bread ,prefer all Italian meat and bread..then again from Chicago..should not compare...large sandwich..just not for me.

SmW6R-kHfiT6lXxnNhINmA.text: WOW!! Must start off with this was the best lemon bar I have ever had. Absolutely delicious!   This was my first time trying Defalco's after hearing excellent things from friends and reading the reviews. I got a half order gnocchi with tomato sauce to go (still had leftovers) and it was excellent as well. I definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi with tomato sauce and a lemon bar!

JdU6pXGw5bAmrtq0o1LTlw.text: They always get our order correct whenever we order from Defalco's for our office lunches.  The food is always hot and delicious.  I've never had something I didn't like from here, but my favorite is hands down the Philly Cheese steak (beef) from here.  It's so delicious and the cheese is melted and mixed with the meat before being placed on the bread.  I always get the fried peppers and mushrooms on mine as well.  All for a price that can't be beat.  I would recommend getting a whole sandwich instead of a half because it's twice the food for only a couple dollars more (a whole is probably around 12"-14" and I believe their make their bread in house.  Totally worth the price and visit!  Thinking about it right now is making me want to go get one!  This place is also worth checking out for their vast array of imported Italian goods as well as all the things they make in house.  My co-worker swears by their pasta salads.

vvr3cBKGx3hBlp0vNh7qlQ.text: Back again for a sandwich lunch.  I ordered a full meatball sandwich, and my wife had a full chicken parm sandwich, both loaded with their wonderful marinara sauce, and more than enough meat.  We could only eat half a sandwich each, and so a great sandwich was born unto breakfast the next day!  New bread of course.  AS usual, their sandwiches were served on wide, toasted sub rolls, adding another layer of flavor, and chew.  We got there at 12:45 and by 1PM it was packed again, the second wave of lunch goers! Service was very slow and I had to go up to the counter to get napkins and knives and forks, another wait.  Too bad the service didn't match the quality and taste of the food. Perhaps another time, when it would be less crowded.

2tP8oD8Ralud693dmx01vA.text: Always great food and great service. As authentic as it comes for Italian food. Even when it's busy around the holidays they get you in and out quickly.

pvS99yhayKWNGtUluvQArg.text: We love Tony, the staff, all the deli goodies, and of course THE FOOD!  We have sampled most everything on the menu, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend any of it.  We make excuses to get to this side of town just to visit DeFalco's.

m7iNDrPfR4fTx6nwlLRHQA.text: Came for lunch. The place had a great Italian deli so I was even more excited to try the food. However it wasn't anything exciting. I also ordered a half sand but was charged for the full. Didn't realize till I had already left. So that was a little frustrating. Maybe they aren't known for the sandwiches or it was an off day. Overall it was just blah

Sg0QoTOMFuRZenO3MPNxAQ.text: We watched an episode of diners, drive-ins & drives and saw this place. While headed to Tx from CA we made a stop at Defalco's. The food was outstanding and so were the people working there. I ordered the meat raviolis which came with a side salad & garlic bread, everything was delicious!!! My husband ordered a sausage sandwich and loved it as well. The environment was great, staff was willling to answer any questions, overall I loved this spot!   Also the strawberry swirl cheesecake was exceptional, I wish I had ordered another slice and a sandwich to go.

ix8pZ2Pzx2-pEsdH4Ma6Qw.text: Love this place!  The food is awesome at very reasonable prices. Super casual spot to pick up a unique sandwich for lunch and whatever you need to make dinner that night. You're basically eating among the aisles of a small grocery shop, which is pretty awesome. Service is prompt and friendly, the food is very fresh. Can't wait to come back.

sTT2EwhOADA3aB2KAZxX5A.text: I used to come here all the time, when I lived in Scottsdale.  I've since moved (5 years ago) and am back this week for a visit. I was super excited to come to "my favorite authentic Italian deli" .... and I was a bit disappointed.  The front counter person was extremely rude and dismissive while I was trying to order .... and they were not even busy!  I'm not sure if it was an "off day", but I'm assuming not after reading other reviews with similar complaints of customer service! It's quite sad, really, as they used to be super pleasant.  I was trying to eek out a score of 4 (down a star for bad customer service), but then I got my food.  The wait was not long but, unfortunately, my Italian combo sandwich was not as awesome as it was in the past! It was lacking in flavor, as well as the pasta salad I ordered on the side.  .... so I have to dock another star! .... should have docked two stars, but didn't want to leave DeFalco's with a 2-Star rating .   The grocery store portion/selection of food to purchase and prepare at home is awesome (there... there is 1 star back!). It was very clean and well organized.   DEFALCO'S .... train your staff to be more pleasant (at least the counter people who "greet" you .... geesh .... and people MAY get over the slip in taste.   Booooooo, I probably won't "intentionally" be back during future visits to Phoenix!

Wdf0kkKXeKAz7XXzUB7XBA.text: Wonderful combination of restaurant and grocery.  We found table(s) to combine for a party of 9. The staff helped us combine the tables.  We each looked at the menu and decided on a couple of pizzas and pasta dishes to share at the table.  Two of us went to the counter to order the food.  Not long after we placed our order, they delivered the food to our table.  The pizzas were great - one Blanca and one traditional red sauce.  Each entree came with a nice small salad that we shared between 2 people. I really enjoyed the linguine with clam sauce and the gnocchi with pesto.  Service is a combination of self-service (get your own soft drinks/water) and full-service (delivery of food to your table).  Defalco's is a winner in my book - quick, reasonable prices, and great food.

AT-8aAG34uTtnPu64f3_Yw.text: Awesome local place, great sandwiches and salads at great prices.  We went in at 4:00 on Saturday and the place was almost full.  Looks like they have been there for years.  Will definitely try again.

7lO_YLjcWxKr0dFzSpCCXQ.text: Defalco's is home to the best Italian food in Arizona! They have just about everything you can imagine and the casual, deli-style setting makes for easy take-out.  The food is as authentic as you can get in the Southwest. Plus, they have a nice selection of wines to pair with your meal!

79h8thqRz0H0RslwIlN8qg.text: The food here was amazing! My girlfriend and I ordered there pizza and chicken parm and here amazed by the taste! She is from the easy coast and extremely picky when it comes to Italian food. She to was amazed by how much it tasted like "back home" food! Highly recommend!

53HdzFNFvADLDnhcTjtUgw.text: This place is a must see. What on the menu do i hate? That would be a short list. I love the calzone, I love he sandwiches (just get it on a roll), I love the salads. I get my pork roll there and my olive oils. One and the frozen pasta/ravioli!! I could go on about this place forever. A must see!

33s543_dkgAnvz16emFsVQ.text: Great NY Italian deli and grocery. Authentic Italian desserts,pasta, sauces, olives, peppers and so much more.  Friendly and welcoming. Go check it out!! Love this place

EpZk8natdCzkIBK7rBpaqA.text: I've been here many times but have never gotten around to leaving a review. This place is one of Scottsdale's hidden gems.    I have to say it has the best and most authentic Italian food around. The Deli is incredible and all of the authentic Italian groceries are the best in town. I do come here from time to time and am usually with friends and it doesn't matter what I order off the menu whether it's the meatball sub or the chicken parmesan it's always amazing.   The people here are friendly and nice and the service is always 1st rate.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zgw_-cl_L5eZ3XkvpyF7CA.text: Just wow! When you first walk into this crammed space you instantly get the vibe you are in a family Italian shop. It smells so amazing. If you weren't hungry when you first walked in, you definitely will be.  The classic Italian is where I started. The sandwich was big enough for two meals. Don't let me forget about the canole I didn't need. I normally do not like them because the sweetness level is usually through the roof. Not these ones. I ate it all without shame!

clBd5Nx3QKUqViYV_0RGCA.text: This place is amazing.   A quaint deli/grocery, you order food from the cashier, and they'll bring it to a seat yourself table either inside or outside. There are plenty of imported grocery goods that can be bought, including fresh made pizza dough ready to be turned into homemade pizzas, and buffalo mozzarella in their fridges.   Their sandwiches both hot or cold are delicious. You pick the bread for the sandwiches, the focaccia or the sub roll are my favorite options. Spaghetti and meatballs, jumbo stuffed shells, and their roasted artichoke and vegetable lasagna are all fantastic. Calzones and pizzas can't be beat, and their dessert selection is pretty tasty too. The Baklava is among the best I've had, as well as the cannoli.   Definitely worth stopping by for lunch or dinner, one of my favorite places.

5ichlLkunVBlDl0xKcvlsg.text: After a couple of friends swore by this place while we were at a wine company across the way, I decided to go over afterwards and grab a sandwich to go. My friends recommended the chicken parm sandwich. The place is a deli/marker and has tables for people to eat in.   Coming from the east coast, this place stole my heart. From its set up to the amount of hoagies offered. I have to say the chicken parm was probably the best I've ever had! They have several options of rolls you can choose from which is pretty cool. I only ordered a half sandwich and wish I ordered a whole LOL! Soooo good. Will definitely be back to this hidden gem!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Parm sandwich

or2ePvPgZ58W800xKDD9Iw.text: I love this place!!! They have the best Mac & cheese, I can't not get the half side when I go here. I also really love the tomato mozzarella & basil sandwich. But all of their sandwiches are good! They have such a large selection of pasta, pizza, salads, and desserts! They also have a selection of local beer and SOO much wine. The grocery aspect of this place is so cool, so many imported pastas, cheeses, meats, & olive oil! This place really is a hidden gem plus the prices are so reasonable. If you come here you have to try the lemon bars, they are hands down the best lemon bars I have ever tried. For the size of the store there is plenty of seating inside and out. Try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Two lemon bars, they&#39;re to die for.
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half Chicken Cutlet Sandwich, still so big for a half!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half Fresh Mozzarella Fresh Mozzarella, Tomato and Basil Sandwich

Jhif5O6DW2uUsJoITAIPqg.text: Place rocks. Low key atmosphere and filled with authentic Italian ingredients, especially those used in Italian American cooking. I got a pizza and wow. It really comes down to the quality of the meats they are using, absolutely top notch stuff. Staff is also friendly and the grocery aspect gives me great joy. Highly recommend!   PAC MAN pizza was because my hunger was unstoppableee.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Supreme Pizza (you must create yourself, they have very few premade pizza orders)

dNPkstkALRSTcnajyFWkmA.text: So I've only checked in once...but been here a thousand times! This place is Italian heaven!  I love the simple concept of a grocery store with a few tables to eat if you'd like to stay. Even takeout, the food is phenomenal!  My favorites are the chicken cheesesteak sandwich, the gnocchi (in any sauce), lasagna, and build-your-own calzone! To finish it off- you have to have a piece of cheesecake- the best, most creamy goodness ! These are always mine and my hubby's go to!  We stopped in the other night for dinner- I got gnocchi in marinara sauce which came as an entree with a side salad and garlic bread. My hubs got the meat lasagna...and we shared a piece of cheesecake and rolled ourselves out of the place!  The food is truly something special. If you don't eat anywhere else in Phoenix, visit this place, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side salad and garlic bread
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi with marinara
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A slice of the best cheesecake ever

AqBxN7G7wn_0jA1knSl-0g.text: I think there is no need to explain in details of how good this restaurant is as the rating is very high. This restaurant deserves this rating.  I just had mac and cheese as a half plate and yellow potato salad. There was really few salt and pepper so you have to add which i like it because i like my food to be salty. It was very delicious and half a plate makes you full because of the fats. Really tasty. The yellow potato salad is good too. Just salt and pepper is needed.  Reasonable prices for your stomach. Friendly staff. Would come again for more food!

ET-a_YumIJxJon4u21svzA.text: Growing up in Philly I have really high expectations for cheesesteaks. My sister highly recommended them since she feels the same way as I do regarding cheeseteaks. I ordered the half beef cheesesteak with extra mayo. They definitely did not disappoint. It was absolutely delicious.   The place is pretty small but they have a pretty big menu and it's such a variety, so I would definitely want to come back to try some more items.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half beef cheesesteak with extra mayo

T38q0JDfid-HpS0zpIvCLw.text: The food is good If not great.  However the service is hit or miss.    The portions are also questionable. I ordered a full portobello mushrooms sandwich. When I got home, I looked at this small portion of a "whole sandwich"

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portobello sandwich.   This is a &#34;whole&#34; or full size sandwich.  Very very small portion.

jK93V3qsctbiAbe-ij8clg.text: I have visited this place numerous times and I'm finally getting around to leaving a review, I've had the alfredo pasta, a lunch salad and the stuffed shells and nothing disappoints! I love their large menu which includes pastas, sandwiches, salads, entrees, pizza and etc, my favorite thing about this place is the way the dining area is set up, it's an italian market but has tables surrounding it. I would recommend this place for both lunch and dinner, my salad portion was large enough to leave me with leftovers for the following day. This italian spot is very authentic and inexpensive so I will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nZ8Q9l_mOaXnUkQPc-Vgag.text: Amazing sandwiches! Ask for the Philly cheesesteak with potatoes. Very convenient since it's right on Scottsdale road.

55Kphhsmp_njpJspv5cxrA.text: 4.5/5  DeFalco's has quite possibly DeTastiest selection of DeSandwiches in DeValley. In addition to sandwiches, they offer all sorts of Italian delights in pasta, salad or dessert form. There's also a deli counter with a tantalizing selection of cured meats and cheeses.   I had the meatball sub with a side of eggplant artichoke salad. You order at the counter and receive a number to take back to your table. It only took a few minutes for our food to arrive and it looked amazing! The meatball sub was a hearty concoction of tender, well seasoned meatballs smothered in an appetizing tomato sauce and the bread we chose (Wheat) was nice and toasty, holding up well to all the sauce and meat. The eggplant salad was a vinegary mixture of breaded eggplant, large chunks of artichoke, olives, carrots and peppers. To me it skewed too acidic taste-wise but the portion size was good.   There is a fridge with various drinks available, including different delicious varieties of San Pellegrino fruit sodas, as well as an iced tea station and soda fountain.   There's a lot of prepackaged and jarred Italian food available for sale as well, such as pasta, tomato sauce, and risotto rice.  Seating was plentiful on a Friday late afternoon with tables both inside and outside on their patio.  If there's only one word to describe DeFalco's it's DeLicious!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggplant artichoke salad
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball sandwich on wheat
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grapefruit San Pellegrino soda. So good!

lnVfwQh1GLlpNfVOTu4A_A.text: What a gold mine this place is!   I was brought here under the impression is was a fast food Italian place. I was blown away with what I actually walked in to.   The place is always busy, plan on standing in line for a minimum of 10-15 before getting to the register. Word of advice- know exactly what you want when you get up there.   Between their classic desserts and large selection of food, you won't leave hungry. The portions are huge, but amazingly delicious. I started with dessert, as the responsible adult I am.   Carrot cake, tiramisu, black and white cookies, lemon bars or Italian wedding cookies. You won't be disappointed.  If you order a sandwich on a baguette, be prepared to take home 1/2 the sandwich. The bread is the perfect combination of crunchy, chewy and soft. All at the same time.   They also have a great selection of wine, meats, cheese and other legit Italian food products.   Enjoy the sunshine on the patio and wear comfy pants, that stretch..

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

iPI8x5ljtUMqdvhkyPDfFA.text: I wish I could come here and get one of everything it is so good! Luckily my office is only 2 miles away so I can even come here just for a quick lunch! (If you call in your order, if not expect a decent wait) Today I was on my lunch break and for a turkey provolone and a chocolate cannoli! For 8 dollars for a huge sandwich I don't know why you would choose anywhere else! So glad to have found such an awesome Italian deli nearby, have not been to another one in az yet that has reminded me of the food I had in Italy.... definitely recommend if you love Italian food! Would also highly recommend the arancini especially if you have never had it anywhere before! I had it the last time I was here and it is sooo good! Very few place in the valley have arancini let alone this good!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Turkey provolone sandwich
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cannoli

X7XRPG8Cq1zjHnWlRuQ6kA.text: I've always loved delfalcos but seems like there quality is going down. I ordered the cheese steaks. Soggy bread and doesn't quite taste the same as before.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JKZWh-4tVX0ekP4tozZurQ.text: This a great place. Authentic Italian food. I had the Italian sausage hot sandwich with green and red peppers. At noon it's crowded. They sell all kinds of Italian canned and bottled supplements. Definitely will be back there soon. Cheers GT from AZ

7wR8bIi3ECaC9_j1VyD1PA.text: I like simple Pomodoro with garlic and onion. Their tomato sauce was loaded with oregano and/or basil. It wasn't bad, but far from the best I've ever had. In recent years, restaurants have found a way to pre-cook spaghetti without it getting watery. The spaghetti I had here was watery. I ordered a large serving and got what I felt was a small serving of pasta with a large serving of sauce. It was served with garlic bread that was not crispy because they pre-cook it and wrap it in aluminum foil. The salad was decent. I would've ordered the spaghetti with clam sauce, but they told me they don't make it there. Not impressed. Perhaps I need to sample their deli meat to appreciate the place.

FrPO7WK9Ih8RQLmvf6wPBQ.text: Great little New York style Italian deli. I've been here quite a few times. Great marinated artichoke salad and meatball sub.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uyai-YyGs-MRgkRrlwySNg.text: I'm so frustrated with trusting most reviewed and highest rated and throwing my food away.   Good- Service was good.  Takeout order was quick.  Girl behind counter was pleasant.   Bad- While I was there three customers came up to complain about not receiving their coffee orders.  Place was extremely hot, dirty and cluttered with random products from Italy.  Display cases were disgusting.   Food-  Chicken parm sub I threw out.  Chicken was cut into strips, wasn't breaded and was rubbery.  Sauce was so salt it clogged my throat.  Bread was the only good thing.  Probably because I love seeded rolls.  Despite being hungry, I starved.  Cannoli was soggy and wasn't fresh.   I couldn't help but think that this is a place that became popular after DDD and then they stopped giving a rats ass.  There is no honor in serving people food you wouldn't serve to your Family.

yM26xNlEcnWhzgPBGIaKtw.text: My husband and I accidently stumbled upon DeFalco's when we first moved into the area. I love Italian deli's and wanted to see how this place stood against the rest. IT SURPASSES any deli I've been to in AZ. Fantastic quality, NEVER a bad dish. I can pick anything on the menu and I am completely confident it will turn out perfect. We've now been in the area for 3 years and anytime we want to have a special dinner for pick-up to eat at home we think: DE FALCO'S. Lunch time is very busy (which is a  good sign when looking for good food!) so I suggest ordering for pickup if you're on a lunch break. But if you're out and about and are eating-in, its WORTH the wait! The grocery is also amazing. Tons of yummy imports. I very highly recommend De Falco's!

QHHskgEsTX9ZsVjo0NI1Ew.text: I love this place! Authentic Italian food in the middle of an Italian grocery store- good for eating in or to go.

qa0oErXv1N--iKGKSJ-ICw.text: debating not moving for fear of being a few miles further away from defalcos.  Best pizza, sandwiches, and everything.... oh and the cheese steak is a MUST.

D3VAxnuAb4c4uYEZHA39JA.text: AMAZING. The cheese steak is the cats pajamas. The chicken parm sandwich is heavenly. I would like to try other items, but I cannot stray from my usual as they are too delicious. Would be five stars if their service was a teensy bit faster, but not a big deal. It's worth the wait!

XmTZqKpKRmm1mzumobwhwg.text: This place is awesome. I eat here probably once a week on average being my place of work is a block away. Every employee iv dealt with there has been really nice and more than helpful. The food is amazing...and im not the biggest fan of Italian food. It does take awhile for the food to be made but they have been great at making that known, and what do you expect from good food? This stuff isn't frozen. Its quality. I suggest you place your order before heading there so your food will be ready and waiting for you.

M0EGh1VsrXhAH_1DK3Wr7Q.text: Where to start?!? Unbelievable sandwiches and pastas. Great deli and grocery. Customer service is always quick, friendly and helpful. I always find a way to stop in when I'm in town.

7mjbtlWmu-hpPcev2Bfjng.text: Excellent Italian salumeria in Scottsdale. Pricey if you think you are entering a typical deli, but this is no typical deli. This is and Italian deli by Little Italy, NY standards. Get the Purista sandwich. Prosciutto, fresh mozz, roasted peppers and arugala. If I move here I know I'll have a little bit of home right down the block.

6xPPM9iwG7xwDP3iuWmLeg.text: DeFalco's has been slowly perfecting their pizza recipe for the last couple of years, and I can now say that their crust is one of my favorites in the Valley. I highly recommend trying one of their pizzas with the sweet Italian sausage. Heavenly.

nnEZ2ddegsno82p4e-rRfw.text: This is the best Italian deli in town... Hands down! The best Italian food and sandwiches. The cheesesteak sandwich is the best in town. The antipasta salad is great! The eggplant parm is very tasty. A must try no matter where you live in metro Phoenix area... Worth the drive!!!

cQOJIcuxSf-KhRjkS0vsLg.text: The restaurant is totally authentic the only thing that I can say about their plates its art, starting from the perfect presentation to the best taste. As they say that when a person is eating he is using all of his senses by smelling the food, listening to it, tasting it, closing your eyes when you enjoy the taste. This is the restaurant that you really want to try if all your senses could function well in.

2Td_uzkXJJF21nASGWqOcw.text: Stay away from this place because it's too yummy, you can't handle it. The Philly chee steak sandy made me feel like hurting all the other posers who had been selling me cheese steak lies previously. Plus, the friendly guy behind the register recommended that I add avocado. Who knew?? Flavor shotgun blast to my dome!

7T4zL3xQUIoSAJx1GrnY3g.text: This is my husband and mine favorate place to go. We love the food and stopping in for stuff as well.

buLerbMpTSO1akgZ74WRHw.text: Could someone please explain to me how a so-called Italian deli can in good conscience use Boars Head meats?  Give me a break.  At least get some Molinari instead.  No good self-respecting Italian deli would use Boars Head.

MctVuTc_9--wD729fIwzcw.text: Unfortunately quality suffered the past 2 years, but still a good place to grab a quick lunch while in the area.

PLeKDi33lcg5bNyc7mhhOw.text: I recently moved to Scottsdale and had never been to Defalco's. My husband had been here a couple of time's before. We decided on a Sunday evening to get pizza and my husband suggested we go to Defalco's. We ordered a margerhita pizza. It was seriously the best pizza I've ever had. We had leftovers which I ate for lunch the following day and they were just as awesome. I will definitely be back!!!

jMtzwEvOasOhkn5nVpoYlw.text: Seriously the best deli in Arizona! The sandwiches are made with quality ingredients. The prices are reasonable. I go out of my way to get a sandwich from this place. Its a must try...you will be hooked!!

0f2dmVpkbUFiYa1Sl7eCdQ.text: This place has amazing food at a good price. They make the food quick so you don't have to wait long. The cheesesteak is the best mealts in your mouth.

KFWm0wvDo1whr2kFo80EMQ.text: Best meatball sub i've had in a long time.  Meatballs were big and just soft enough.  Plenty of sauce and cheese.  I got a half order and I was so full!  Probably hard to find a seat during the lunch rush and I've heard complaints that they are slow, but  we didn't have any trouble.

u1AWxrXt-wNqcM5Rrond1A.text: I never have a problem with the quality of the food here. If I was rating on the quality alone I would have given at least 4 stars but this place is slooooooow! I worked right down the street for years and could rarely ever eat there because I couldn't fit it in my lunch hour even when I called ahead. I don't know why everything takes so dang long but there has to be a better way of doing things. If you have plenty of time I suggest the sausage and peppers.

0Cha6PEiXSE5woorwKCFyQ.text: Get the PESTO philly cheese steak amazing.  Sounds wierd and gross but not!  Their pizza is really good too.  You can't go wrong here.  I would suggest calling in your order.  I do that all the time and you can still eat it there.  If you go to eat in, it takes time.  You are not at Mcdonalds.

008eLd8ao8b0evhjJSVTPQ.text: This is my go to spot for any type of Italian food. The fresh mozzarella and tomato/basil sandwich is amazing and the bread is always warm and fresh.  Make sure you bring a book or something to occupy your time because this place is always busy. The wait can sometimes but 20-30+ minutes and seating in the summer is always difficult.  If you are able to save room for dessert make sure and pickup a slice of NY cheese cake or maybe even a rainbow cookie.

gV6DPuYB1kdK9727x2Q1oA.text: Best cheese steaks I've ever had.   The Spaghetti and meatballs are an amazing duo as well.  Try the Pizza. Its Fantastic.  "But what about Philadelphia and New York?!?!"  Shut up, homers. Go back and sniff your own pretentious farts.  Finally, the chicken parm sandwich is out of this world. An ideal situation is to bring a friend and get one whole chicken parm and one cheese steak with everything, so you can get the best of both worlds. Every time I have someone in town, I force them to go to Defalco's, and I have never seen a disappointed face.

Utk9aEUz8h15eStgVwGpQA.text: Ordered a Caprese Salad, Baked Ziti and a large cheese pizza. Delicious with Bodega Pierce Emotiva an Arizona Wine from Willcox.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5p-QaPULYTvcSr4N-Ur_uA.text: Best meatball sub and great customer service. The antipasto salad was amazing too!   They also have a variety of different olives and wines.

RJiD7J8kmTolCRWpbUofmg.text: I have been coming here for about 13 years and in the last year things have really gone downhill here. It is sad we all have been going here forever it seems something had drastically changed in the quality of food. I threw half of my meal away last week it was so horrible. I guess all great things come to an end. No more Italians in the Italian restaurant. Sad but True.

QzwmlqvfcH4UX4qOUSf17w.text: Incredible! Absolutely worth five stars. I shared the chicken parmesan sandwich with my boyfriend and the portion was huge! The chicken was delicious and moist. It was perfectly beaded and not a soggy mess. It came with a generous amount of sauce and cheese, amazing! I would order this again and I'll definitely be back to try all their other hot and cold sandwiches and pastas!

bZcy775Ib_bwENgUJx0NRg.text: I didn't post this review last week and was scrolling through my phone, saw the picture and remembered I still needed to write a review. So here it goes...   Last week's lunch adventure was going to eat at DeFalco's in Scottsdale (fancy), actually when you walk in it really isn't that fancy.  It is a real authentic deli with a line out the door and people running out with food calling out names. We went around lunchtime so of course it was packed.  I ordered the spinach and cheese arancini (riceballs) and it was so good. It was the size of a baseball nestled in marinara sauce. It was perfectly fried and moist inside. I could not eat the whole thing, I had maybe 4 more bites left but I could feel the heart burn coming- it was my fault for not taking an acid reducer prior to going.     Apparently the food networks Guy Fieri was here filming diners, drive ins and dives so it has to be good right? The people are very friendly and service is quick even though they warn you it will take a while.  Once a table has cleared of customers, someone is out to clean it up within moments so they are always clean.  Did I mention it is grocery store too?  You can buy gelato, different types of cheeses, bread and noodles in every single shape and size. Another plus, they have wine AND you can buy their premade pizza dough for $1.99 that is a steal in my opinion.  I would love to come back and have some more food. But it would be wise to come alittle bit before the lunch rush.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spinach and cheese arancini! Amazing!!!

WX79emXcVrRUcJCIt-NIyw.text: An Italian grocery store & deli?! I'm there! I love Sandwiches and this place delivers the goods! I like to get their whole sized Combo (Ham, Salami, Pepperoni, Mortadella & Provolone), $6.45. yelp.com/biz_photos/defa... yelp.com/biz_photos/defa... It's very tasty and filling, however it's not an overwhelmingly large portion. The seating situation here can get dicey, especially around lunchtime. There's not too many tables/seats inside and while there are a few located on the patio outside, it can get real hot there during the Summer months. Overall, it's a great Sammie and I always look forward to dining here. Return Factor - 87%

m6hOfZtkYRhTe_2vUgtMRA.text: REVIEW 600!!!   YES!!!!!!!!  HOORAY FOR ME!!!  I swear I have eaten here before, but not in AGES.  I came here last night because I was on this side of town, and it brought back a few memories of years past when I first moved here.  For starters, this place is cute, and has a lot going for them.  Set up as part grocery, part restaurant, its in a strip mall on Scottsdale road near Thomas.  Hours are great, and menu is large with great pricing.  I love a good menu! You can basically get just about anything you want done your way here, and the food is pretty good.  For starters, the wait was a bit longer then I had anticipated, and I thought it would have moved a lot quicker considering I was here at 8:30 on a Wednesday night. There was hardly anyone in here!  I thought it was just an off night, but after reading other reviews, I guess their a little slow on service.  I don't mean to sound impatient, but the wait did seem long and I was quite hungry.  Secondly, the grocery store was well stocked, but some of the shelving seemed a bit tired. I was sitting there waiting for my food and noticed that some of the shelves with heavier cans on them were starting to buckle and warp.  Maybe it's time to upgrade?  Nothing is perfect, but it kind of made me feel tired after I sat there staring off at random things in the place while waiting for my food.  On a more positive note, the food is delicious!  You can get anything you want made up any way you like.  I went with a half tuna sandwich and I couldn't finish the darned thing!  Great awesome pricing with a large menu and a great concept here.  Also, while I was here waiting, I overheard a customer talking with one of the staff members. I guess Guy Fieri stopped in here recently for Diners, drive ins and dives.  I also saw a huge poster of him on the wall by the customer pick up area.  10,000 bonus points for that!!!  Overall, place is great, but I feel like they need to move a little quicker in the back with food preparation, and work on stepping up some of the grocery shelves to make it look less tired.  Great product selection not only in the grocery area, but menu as well.  Definitely worthwhile, just don't expect your food to quickly and be prepared to wait a bit...

au5BwAKNXK6lL1Yvm5IPoQ.text: Amazing food, atmosphere, and people! Everything I've tried is awesome, especially desert!! Best mom and pop shop around!

9LC8Em2_z5BmR3pH5jPOsQ.text: Great smells! Amazing food!  Good service!   Just wish that the employees were more into the culture of the food like when out east!  Missing atmosphere thats for sure, but the food is great!

ry_taJ5m0qpWg1T08Idtxw.text: This place has pretty good food. Doesn't amaze me but at the same time I would go back. They just remodeled so it's very nice and they do have a patio area:)

_hFt12xCK9oGhZNmLYDAlg.text: This food was amazing!!!!!!!! all together we ordered the chicken alfredo, the the purista, and a turkey & provolone. The place is clean, the girl at the register was kinda bitchy though, she walked away from me mid-order and was rude, so I would definitely work on her customer service skills. She was really short, and for 3 people who were first time customers, she left a sour taste, and she forgot my moms black and white cookie. Also the soda machine was all out of syrup. But the store itself is wonderful, and the food was great. I would have given 5 if she wasnt so rude.

2c6I8EQEZEaDGogqXrpvaw.text: Very good food, decent size portions and made with care. Atmosphere is very authentic, moms-and-pops shop. Small tables, products separate dining areas.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pastrami Reubens sandwich
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kNHyagOTH8EzNfROSULygw.text: Five for the food.  One for the service.  I have been coming to this place for a long time, probably 15 years. The story is always the same.  Great food and terrible service.  My girlfriend and I have been treated poorly as a couple and as individuals.  Every time I come here I am treated poorly by the staff.  So much that we usually get our food to go, just to minimize contact with the staff.  Even with this strategy the older man at the to-go register is a giant Jerk.    Every.  Single.  Time.  I've spoken with the owner, he was very nice and said he would correct his staff and even picked up our lunch.  That was super nice of him.  I believed it would all be handled.  Next time we came in, no owner, same rude service.  So for the fourth time after our chat Mr DeFalco the service remains...hostile and rude.  I'm sorry Mr DeFalco but your restaurant is officially dead to me.  And I'll be sure to tell all my friends.

ryzpvwrQCD85j-xZKm-l-Q.text: They have some wonderful things (like the ricotta-stuffed gnocchi and olive spread). The prices really are too high for a lot of the items, but that would be more acceptable if the whole experience were good. I can't give it a higher rating because the service is terrible (and I have been there a few times). It is not that the people are not nice, it is just so unorganized. And if you want more than one thing (like fresh sausage and then a sandwich), you will have to wait in TWO lines. If they could simply organize the flow of the service, I believe many more people would find the experience of going there better.

elxm1_j7Id0cVPenxdzOqw.text: Such a cute little place to get a great pastrami sandwich. Always welcoming staff never once had a problem here

mGZxSRvAj7wDtIr1_uRSzg.text: Late one night in Food Network's Diners Drive-ins & Dives I heard Guy talk about this Italian deli and tuckedvit in my grey matter.  Having a week of Cactus League baseball I took a break and stopped in for pie. Found heaven for sure. 12 inch pie made to my specs was amazing. House red wine vinegar olive oil dressing was perfect. Assortment of wines from all regions is sure to please you palate. Eat amid the bottles for a treat.

ti-J1VEA2xNvYSYiUJj73Q.text: Il Purista Sandwich and small centurion calzone  You could not ask for a better Italian deli in a major city like Scottsdale, AZ . When you step inside, you forget your in the dessert. Industrial racks stacked with pasta and canned tomatoes provide a cozy atmosphere that provide both a isle for the ordering line and dine -in area for patrons. We arrived just after 11 am on a Saturday and it wasn't too crowded at first. As you walk in you are warmly greeted and ushered through the ordering line. On your right you can order up a fresh cup of espresso or imported Italian beer. If you make your way to the left you come to the ordering counter where everything on the menu is displayed on the back wall. They have a glass case with fresh pasta, mozzarella, and cured meats on display.  I immediately checked on Yelp to see what others had ordered and one in particular caught my eye (J P.) Great recommendation!  Il Purista is a classic Italian Sandwich with your choice of Italian bread, fresh mozzarella, basil, tomatoes, roasted red peppers, and a generous portion of prosciutto. I wasn't blown away, but it did meet my standard of fresh ingredients and taste.  The Centurion calzone was amazing! I'm a big pizza fan and this one had the WOW factor, served on a pizza pan with a side of marinara sauce with chunks of meatballs. The crust was perfectly baked, crispy on the outside with just the right amount of chewiness inside. Italian salami, mushrooms, peppers, and basil combined into a very warm and savory pocket of goodness.  Recommendations: Definitely try the calzones, Pepsi fans will be extra delighted that the soda fountain is extra sweet. I actually refilled my small drink 3 times. Next time I might try some of there fresh pasta's.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Centurion canzone yum
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The centurion calzone

Mo0AiOLdzePId5fp6ehzcQ.text: I don't even know where to begin. I cannot think of a single time this was the suggested destination and anyone in the group declined. They make some amazing food! I LOVE the chicken pesto pizza and if you still think your mom or wife makes the best lasagna its only because you have not eaten it here yet. (Sorry ladies, its True) I love sitting outside, having some wine and just enjoying the food with friends. Amazing wine collection, if I need  to hit the market to buy something I still cant resist a little helping of the antipasto salad. They also have really good desert but I rarely have room left to eat it. The staff is always great too. Please never close....ever.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tough to beat this food, this patio and this weather.

V13VLQngCnuO-QAxuCUvew.text: Pretty good for takeout. Decent prices especially since all orders get garlic bread and whole orders get a salad. Salad would be nice if it didn't have onions, I always throw it away. Ive had a few of the dishes and some are excellent whereas others are average.  Stuffed Shells, pretty good but made differently each time it seems, sometimes they're more open face and melted or titled to the side with crumbly cheese in them. I prefer closed and stiffer shells myself.  Mac n Cheese, all the rage in the reviews but I can't see why. Penne with melted cheese on the bottom. Some of the top pasta was dry with no cheese. I could melt a cheese blend in a pot and pour it over pasta myself. Making a spice blend or crumbly baked mac in cheese is more effort so I'd pay someone to do that. I'll eat it but won't order again.  Meatball Sandwich, very decent, big, saucy.  Pizza, decent, would order from time to time.  Quaint (but very small and busy) eating area. Great alcohol selection but I couldn't find much merlot next to the wine. Great deli and for picking up your own ingredients.

ZjT06uDIrhY3rchUbvZs1Q.text: Always the best italian with no B.S. the lasagna is my favorite. The sandwiches are great. Stuffed shells bomb. Tiramisu awesome. Cheesecake also great.

z0RK--6Nk8V1LwC8P_vEuQ.text: I didn't know you could eat here until a friend took me, I've had the chicken park sandwhich and the Italian sausage sand which and it's been totally on point everytime. The marinara needs to be on a slow drip into my body it's that good.

60ymumXWYVRh_ERqEFk7eQ.text: Philly cheesesteak never disappoints, DeFalcos makes this sandwich the best! Meatball sandwich is awesome as well. Everything on the menu is very good. Since my last visit they have improved seating and restrooms.

NvwgrbLI_uoo8IKhL2FLUQ.text: This is a unique and special place. The moment you walk in the door you feel like you have been transported to Italy!   The smell, the feel, the look, the food, and the staff, it all takes you there. There is a walk up counter with a huge menu on the wall. You place your order here. There are so many options, including salads, beer or wine (by bottle or glass) and deserts There are tables scattered inside or on the patio with misters to beat the heat. They sell Italian groceries, meats, gelato, uncooked or precooked pasta, wine, cookies, sauces. It is usually busy and the staff is friendly. A fun place for a meal and easy to spend time browsing. I never leave empty handed.

zURSO4I2yj1XyqcNeNRf3Q.text: This place was on tv for its well loved cheese steak so I tried one and I was more disappointed than I should have been I expected to love it but the first one I had to send back the second one came over heated, the bread so hot it broke apart and crumbled up as I ate. The steak was dry even in the melted cheese I was so disappointed it was a waist of a trip.on a side note my wife had a sandwich she liked and the pizza looked good I just had a very bad cheese steak.

mkj5Yz0QiPgV6vbcWJRWwQ.text: I had no idea what I was walking into for lunch one day on a business trip. I was a little nervous to order, but decided to go with a calzone. It came out larger than expected but the red sauce is so savory and delicious. I also got a side salad that was very fresh. As I ate looking at everyone else's food, it all looked delicious. I wish I had more days in town to try everything on their menu. I also went back another day just for their desserts, they have so many options!

a40gDds3VIYNBFsdIAiRAg.text: Went here for my 58th birthday for the first time, we were going to do something upscale and thought no this has been on our list and the food is amazing, you eat within the grocery store but it has charm and the flavors...OMG!  Don't miss out!

x_j_xtm3WOoKBL3aTWU9Rw.text: Great Italian deli and market. Everything we've had there is great but my favorite so far is the fettuccini alfredo with chicken. Yum! (Hot roast beef sandwich is a close second- get extra au jus!)  The staff is great and there's always a line out the door for good reason.

QtFS3QGjeGL5k_PoE4kEDw.text: I went to De Falco's based on a segment I saw on food network. I tried to buy some luncheon meat but had difficulty getting someone to help me. Keep in mind I went at 11:00 so as to not to bother people on a work schedule going to lunch. The selection was poor to start with, and most of the choices were boar's head brand which I can purchase less expensively at a grocery store. The counter person was rude and seemed to be bothered that he was helping me. When I inquired about Italian sausage, I was told they were out. Sorry, 11:00 in the morning and they're out of Italian sausage??? Sausage is a basic product that any Italian deli should not be out of on a work day. This has to be the worst experience I've had in a deli. I would like to have tired their lunch selection sometime, but based on how badly I was treated, I won't go back.

8MJ98q8tk4WBa0-BD7Szhg.text: I've been a patron for years (at least 17 years and counting) and the food is consistently delicious. You can't beat their party trays if you're having a celebration where people appreciate real Italian food.  My all-time favorite item to order is the caprese salad. On a bed of fresh, crisp romaine and green lettuce, with thick slices of tomato and some of the best fresh mozzarella around. Simple, classic and always perfect.

PdZQ8f3nBHfqxHVfhskswg.text: I had been wanting to try this place for a long time.  I had the meatball sandwich and it was just ok, kind of bland though.  Maybe would have been better if I added giardiniera?  Probably won't be back.

ZE9WBJO6lq_g-Zp3VmT2Pw.text: This place is a hidden gem. We had the pizza and cheesesteak and both were delicious. They have a nice beer and wine selection as well. Can't wait to come back and try a salad and pasta.

YvN2sWs3byOe1V_8yQ-dgw.text: Authentically quaint Italian grocery spot in the south side of Scottsdale. Great meat and cheese selection, With killer pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Td6HzUYr7SzNu6xwSYGeKw.text: This place is amazing every single time! Every single thing I have ever got here was simply incredible! Very quick with getting the food out, clean, friendly and great atmosphere! You can even take your pups on the patio  reminds me of the amazing Italian food back in PGH! Love this place!

eZwEXOBBevFYfs8rV8_d_w.text: Portions are really big and that's good b/c I always love the food I get here. It's a fun place but I must say that I really dislike the line system. It's just so inefficient but I guess that's part of the charm.

6TY11rV8YMtNwvGDKoQm7Q.text: I eat here at least 3 times a week - it's becoming a problem. My roommate and I are here so often we always ask about their "IPO" (Italian Public Offering). Cannolis are the currency of the future.   I would highly recommend the Beef Cheesesteak - it is my all time favorite. The Caprese Salad is a staple in my diet as well.
