Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

x8wj_8K72UcWsUwBE1nF6Q.text: I've only been to Defalco's a few times, but each time I enjoy my experience. Although this Italian grocery store is located in a small space, Defalco's has a very simple line system that directs the customer to view all of their delicious treats and Italian goodies. If you're loving what you order, you can always pick up a few bags of pasta or sauce for the road! I'd like to go back here soon.

duYHijNSeba0mbW6e6H4-Q.text: This place has great pricing, the food is great. i recommend the pizza. Dont try to stop by on your lunch break because they usually have long lines.

UkuDBc5f9rKdQPqHwy0d4g.text: Ordered a simple half Ham and Swiss with a cup of soup. $10.50 which was a little pricey and it took 30 minutes to get it out to me table and they weren't busy. Not worth the wait! Better places in the area for sure.

t-wXGDjlJK_2LfLPLtAwsA.text: This place is amazing.  I'm sure you have had Italian food like me from several supposedly Italian restaurants and the food is mediocre at best.  Well that is not the case with Defalco's.  It's is the real deal.  I ordered a calzone which you pick the toppings from the pizza menu... so the options are vast.  I spotted the cheese cake and ordered a slice of strawberry and thought I was done.  Now the wait begins.  Defalco's isn't warming up your frozen calzone so ya...you have to wait while they stuff that calzone with all of the toppings you selected.  Trust me the wait it is worth every second!  During this time I'm walking around looking at the bread and drinks I notice the sandwiches being delivered again and again and again.  Each whole sandwich looking better than the last and they keep coming!  I couldn't take it anymore.  I got back into the line and ordered the epic "Maximus".  Again you pick what you want they don't assume anything which the term Made your way truly means something.  The prices are great for the portion and quality of food. My order came out Calzone and cheese cake first.  My sandwich was being made so I had to wait a little bit longer.  Again nothing pre-made here so chill while they create your master piece.  I was approached several times asking if I needed anything.  The staff is very friendly a bit confused why I was waiting since I was holding my order.  The staff and I had a laugh as I explained while waiting And seeing the sandwich's I had to order one.  I get my sandwich and head back to the hotel.  I arrive the calzone is still hot. This is an indicator it truly was fresh out of the over.  I started to dig in and WOW.  The red sauce and calzone ...amazing, cheese cake is tasty, and the sandwich ....well.. you will never want to order a sandwich from anywhere else again.  5 star because there is absolutely nothing I could find the least be disappointing.  Don't mind the pics in bad lighting.

y8QpV2YBHFBCXdw69T6C_Q.text: 2 words: Meatball Sub!!! So yummy. The pizza, salads, pastas, sandwiches all superb! A great little family deli I would recommend to everyone.

2KIbcju_WrY1qHxoHMc4dg.text: Just a real quick review- I was visiting Arizona for 3 days and went to this place FOUR times!   Highly recommend the turkey and provolone, as well as the meatball!   Call ahead so that your order is waiting for you.    Can't recommend this spot enough!

2igPvu6TDCnT6w7o44XLjw.text: This is my go to place in Scottsdale for anything Italian.  And the deli is by far the best! I have been coming here for years!

lj_sE-Pw2D8_xkXEmrCtMg.text: Wanted to try after seeing Guy Feiri review on DDD's. I live in Kansas City so it's a haul. Luckily, I have family in Tempe. 1/2 Sammie was plenty for me, the sandwiches are huge! My party ordered a bit of everything and everyone was happy! Will be back!

SlgG1jgpmboXDb3CZ1gk-A.text: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars, but our wait really hurt the experience. First, it is a little confusing to know what to do when you enter. It isn't immediately apparent where you can go to order food. No problem, just go straight past the shelves of wine until you see a register. Ordering is quick and easy and the cashier was great.  My parents ordered just before my wife and I. All of us got a toasted sandwich of some sort, but my wife and I got paninis, which apparently take a while. In fact, people that sat down 5 minutes after us got their food first. My parents were done eating before we got our food, and we ordered right behind them. I understand a short delay, but this was pretty extreme.  The food, however, was amazing. One of the best paninis I've had. The ingredients were great, and I'd more than happily have it again... just don't make me wait for it.

oa54UCh4m6woLWAH2YdbeA.text: Good food for lunch. Our pizza took 25 min at lunch and arrived cold.  Sent back for another 10.  Was good when fresh and hot.  Grilled veggie sandwich was not done and missing the portabella. ??????

CVxgZ_JltAOdh0O6huiN3g.text: I was told by the cashier that it would be a 40 min hold for 1 pizza. 40 minute hold times??????  The place barely has any room to stand or walk around in.  I ended up leaving and checking out another local Italian shop.

4kZIuNqh0wpcystZgL0SbA.text: I've  has their italian dishes and all have been good but if you are looking for a great Philly Cheesesteak, this is the best I've found in all of Phoenix. Dave & Busters, Philly Bar and Grill, Sals Back Door are okay but this takes it to another level. Plenty of meat and cheese. Got mine w the green peppers and it was outstanding.

-5piWjRY6UW8p3B10Pn82A.text: I think I died and went to heaven. I had the most tasty grilled portobello w wilted spinach, goat cheese and roasted red pepper w pesto on focaccia. The focaccia was soft and warm. I thought I could only eat 1/2 of my 1/2 but NO!! I inhaled the whole thing plus a wonderful pasta salad w fresh crudites!  For dessert....YES a chocolate cannoli with a sweet cream filling. Yum!  Everything looks so awesome in the market. Yes you eat among the groceries or outside if you like. The menu is expansive just need to figure out what I want next time!

KwVTDSRGt_ruSvAzHRorZw.text: The food here is excellent! The prices are too high now, it get really busy for lunch so be ready to wait in line.

LvTbCexqGpbrNkZ7TLghKA.text: Hands down my favorite Italian place thus far in AZ!!! Their food feels like home and brings me back to my Nana's homemade cooking. Service is also great

o0DuS7HksAFxp_kdYsijJQ.text: There food is consistently great. Whether pizza pasta or sandwiches. Very reasonable prices and large portions. I would highly recommend

MSPw77z_-HR-0cUdC-2q8w.text: Great place for lunch - met the owner. Small but really enjoyed the food. Great options on street fries...

o9sxCkQre3K8q2znuwI4Vw.text: Great sandwiches, but be prepared to wait. 25 minutes after ordering (time stamp on receipt) had to ask to cancel order to make appointment.

OONKICZXOZBFgLlNw8rFkQ.text: Defalco's will always have a special place in my heart. This one of a kind Italian deli nestled on the border or Scottsdale and Tempe has served me at least 15 lbs of prosciutto over the last few years. I go here for one reason only, the Il Purista sandwich. It's basically 1 while inch of prosciutto and fairy dust on a French baguette.   The only reason I'm giving Defalco's four stars is because the service is pretty rough. When I'm having an amazing day and feel on top of the world, I come to defalco's because I know they can even me out with their stern personalities, long wait times for takeout, and overall lack of smiling/positivity. Though I enter their doors and soon lose self esteem, I continue to come back time and time again to be reunited with their prosciutto and phenomenal ingredients.   Pro tip - leave your personality at the door but bring your tastebuds and second stoma   Update !!!  The owner, Anthony, messaged me personally about having better service and thanks for the feedback. Awesome awesome service and personability.

9vrh5foQxgexNMSYCAbyWQ.text: Stopped in for some delicious Mac & cheese and lots of bakery goods. This place is great. Had the cheese steak last time I was here and it has to be one of the best in town

6w2IMjMiZoK02u_iOaHFFA.text: Great old school Italian deli / grocery store Great sandwiches- pastas & deserts  A great casual spot - always go when in the area You won't be disappointed

I7RgEoc6oI9uaBrk751Hkw.text: I go here as often as I can. Sandwiches are fabulous. Pizza is amazing too. Highly recommend visiting on your next trip.

FB470SqUfeiA-KLEuiLS7A.text: DDD Highlighted Restaurant. This was my first visit here, Slow service, food was NOT HOT! Had to send it back my cheesesteak sandwich. I can actually see the sandwich being awesome if it was fresh! The place was only 25% full so it was not as if they were slammed. They are lucky they are getting 3 stars!

MugX0cEgHtq-eyhBjziiqA.text: Wow! They do not disappoint. Asked for a little unique spin on traditional pasta, sooo fresh, soo tasty. Great authentic italian grocer & restaurant in the middle of town. Definitely stop by & try the fresh pasta, pizza or sandwiches

4OkXoPcSP_mY8b68zrMJKA.text: Happened to visit this place for lunch. Don't think you are lost in a grocery, the restaurant is along with the grocery store. The place was really packed when we entered.   We went ahead and ordered angel hair pasta with clam sauce and chicken pizza. The pasta was really light, well cooked but was expecting a little more sauce it was too dry for my taste. The pizza was one of the best I have had. The sauce was delicious and perfect amount of cheese and toppings. We also ordered Cannoli for dessert, the filling was fresh, light and tasty. The crust was alright.   I would definitely want to try their home made sauce and long list of sandwiches.

EsQ2RCW__Bi_-7PULR8PXw.text: Meatball sub is the best ya too go. Very filling. Little boring with the flavors. But good deal at lunch. Cute little Italian grocery store to pick up some authentic Italian goodies

SkjZHMS6o3ft9MNMVgtAmA.text: If you're not getting OG Italian sandwiches from here you are surely missing out! A little deli restaurant inside a small grocery full of Italian goodies. Everything they make is handmade, and you can even buy their wide variety of desserts and gelatos to go. Very busy around meal times but if you call ahead they will have your food ready pronto!

22Uh-oQXFHaGi3GIHMIeEg.text: I haven't ever really shopped here as a market- but have eaten here a decent amount as a deli/restaurant. It is not only pretty authentic Italian cuisine- but the ingredients are fresh and you can taste it. Their handmade dishes like pasta or their hot sandwiches are to die for. The sauces are rich, the portions huge, and the flavor is out of this world. The price definitely points to the quality- and I'm happy to pay a little more than average for outstanding food. Their desserts and pastries are very rich and heavy- you can tell everything is made from scratch! I'd recommend trying the gnocchi with Alfredo sauce or one of their cannolis- those are a few of my favorites here.

F9jclP0_Y4lkotWe_xpXMw.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  Used to live down the street and miss the place.  Came back after a long hiatus to see if anything has changed for the worse or better.  My first foray into Defalco's was the cheesesteak.  This is not your traditional Philly cheesesteak.  The Italian cheese mix is thick and rich, almost creamy, like a mornay.  This is very filling, stick-to-your-ribs cheesesteak.  And it's good.  The bread is substantial and chewy enough to stand up to the filling and there is plenty of cheese and plenty of beef.  Definitely one of the best menu items, but again, don't expect a taste of Philly.  On our last visit, ordered a couple sandwiches and a pasta dish.  The linguini with clam sauce is substantial.  It comes with a side salad and an order of garlic bread, and the pasta itself is quite large.  Some fresh clams on top and what I presume to be canned clams throughout.  The noodles were al dente enough - maybe just a little overcooked.  The main issue was seasoning.  It was underseasoned - almost criminally so.  It needed a big hit of salted butter or some parmegiano, something.  It wasn't a bad linguini and clam sauce, but it wasn't great.  Also ordered the Maximus and the Il Purista.  The Il Purista is quite good, and they put in enough prosciutto to balance out the rest of the sandwich.  I can't say the same for the Maximus.  Came in expecting an overstuffed Italian grinder given that it lists ham, salami, mortadella, pepperoni.  Just one or two slices each didn't give the sandwich enough substance, as opposed to the Il Purista.  One other small critique - if you order in, the place is a maze of Italian dry goods, so the server has a tough time finding you, especially when it's busy.  So come.  Definitely come for the sandwiches.  The cheesesteak especially, but the cold sandwiches are good too.  We'll give other pastas a try but I don't really recommend the linguini with clam sauce.

dvVUKbUXGkUJ4YSBZp5Hew.text: Drove passed this place a lot and was always curious to check it out until one day I did. It's a authentic Italian grocery place and the the items you find inside are items you'll never see at an international grocery store. Also to mention the little restaurant inside. I ordered the Philly cheese steak and baklava and couldn't stop admiring the taste of both. One of the best cheese steaks I've had ever eaten! Definitely recommend checking it out!

6kBbGoneDRFo7iXk80TwqQ.text: I've eaten here a few times now and it's been so good each time i've decided to write my FIRST review just to say how good it is!! Not only is the food amazing but the staff is so kind and never seems annoyed to be here or bored. The environment this store deli has is warm and welcoming and you can't find many places like that anymore. Not only is the food good but it's also very affordable, making it an easy choice when figuring out where to eat. I will be recommending this place to everyone!

anoMRKTKPtj008VPbpBwUA.text: The Sweet sausage is best in AZ. Sad that's all I will be buying from now on. This place is in desperate need of an Adult Manager. I ordered one simple item and watched an almost 30 year old bearded infant walk around aimlessly for 20 minutes yawning with the real almost 50 year old manager that openly complains hid in the back.  Sad Andreloi is a longer ride but they have better food and service.  Never again!

k8GRbqmvHHzy9-7Ex-fD7Q.text: I went here on a friends recomendation and had take out.   I ordered a full order of chicken parmesean, for my husband, which comes with a nice salad and bread. Generous portions.    We were disappointed to say the least. The food is marginal at best. The chicken parmesean was overcooked, dry, and salty. Their "homemade sauce" is just barely okay at best.   I ordered gnocchi with pesto for myself.  The pesto was so bland with very little flavor, definitely the worst pesto I've ever had.   They do have a deli and and a small store I may consider getting some deli sometime. I will not be ordering anything from the menu again.   I do not recommend the restaurant food.

yeffBL5ChzNR2K--amHg-Q.text: Been going here for 13 years now!!!! My favorite Italian place in Arizona!!! This place is a gem! Chicken Parm sub is my favorite. And they have rainbow cookies that are delish

fRGgLBsifCt7lurb25lngg.text: My favorite Italian deli. Everything here is good from the salad to the pizza to the pasta and sandwiches. You just can't go wrong

geUJGrKhXynxDC2uvERsLw.text: Although I have been going to DeFalco's for years, my last visit was a waste. Two orders of side salads were not included in my take out order. So I returned and received them. Only to return home and find out my 4 orders of meatball subs were not even correct. How do you get meatball subs mixed up? SMH. Not worth the drive since I'm coming from Mesa for what use to be friendly and exceptional service and correct orders of what I order.

eHYYYzgfRvdRVvzAPPiA_w.text: Went with mom, son and sister and it was great. Had 2 cheese steaks, greek salad, and egg plant parmesan samdwich.  All of it was good, but cheese steak is one if not the best ive ever had. I got mine with everything mushrooms, onion, and res and green bell peppers.  Bread was perfect and the sandwich was juicy and cheese all gooey and melted not stringy.  Great place to go. Constant stream of folks on mothers day Sunday. You walk up to cashier place order and you  put the number on your table, get drinks and wait, so service is pretty quick.  Will have to save room for desert next time.

e6CiPhHdvWeR8CUPDq-5vQ.text: Good food at a decent price. Service was off, but also kind of sensed the guy was just having an off day. Will have to give them a second try before finalizing my opinion of the place.

GoYG5pTirtVWRRILBewEbQ.text: How fun like eating in an Italian grocery store in the middle of NYC.  Here on Monday night and this place is packed. That's  always a good sign.  Had to wait in line to order, but if the foods good who cares.  I am a Lasagna snob. I grew up  living not to far from little Italy in NYC so we will see.  I ordered the meat lasagna with 4 cheeses, and my husband ordered a reuben.  They did ask if he wanted corn beef or pastrami, which is good. OMG, just like my home made lasagna.  It was wonderful. Would I come back? You betcha!!

2ivIrw0A_eCg-gKNv9hRSA.text: Great family owned restaurant, it's hard to find anything here that's not amazing, from their hard to find Italian items in their grocery to the amazing sandwiches and pizza!

ffiH4UOgsm6oiElgVg4RWA.text: An excellent place to grab lunch with food ranging from hot and cold sandwiches to pizza and lasagne. On this particular trip I had the hot Italian beef sandwich along with the anti pasta salad. The food was excellent as usual. I also bought some fresh pizza dough, pizza sauce and fresh made mozzarella for pizza night. All in all a top notch place to grab a bite to eat!

bm14kIV_y5N7W73np6rhkw.text: Pizza is just ok, needed more cheese. Sandwiches are the best on the menu although it was a bit dry. Also had linguini with clams and it was more like clam soup, not enough pasta and the clams were very small. Nice market however with a variety of items available

pPtHFcoMaB0b2J9ZhZreuw.text: I had read about this place and had it on my bookmark list for quite some time.  I don't know how I never made it down here until the other day!  It was my 38th Birthday on Saturday (June 11th) and I was hanging out with a buddy from work and my brother in law.  I wanted to head down to Scottsdale and grab a sandwich here and then go smoke a cigar (see previous review).  We made our way down here around noon, walked in, got in line and ordered our sandwiches.  I went with a Large "Maximus".  My brother in law bought my lunch for me so I didn't pay squat ;-).  Regular price for that sandwich was around $10.00.  Here is how it was............  The Maximus-  This is a premium Italian sub!  Whenever I am new to a deli, I always tend to get their version of an Italian sub.  Happy to report, the Maximus is fantastic!  This sandwich came layered with Prosciutto, Capocollo, Genoa Salami, Mortadella and Provolone Cheese.  I got it topped with lettuce, tomato, onion and Italian dressing.  I chose the seeded sub roll as my bread.  This thing was set down in front of me and I was instantly happy!   This sub is huge!  A solid 12 inches or so.  The seeded bread they use was fantastic!  It had seeds on all sides of the bread, just not the top halves.  It was nice and soft and made an excellent base for the toppings.  Next time, I might ask for it slightly toasted/crisped up, because I think it would make it even better than it already was!  The meats were top notch quality and the produce was fresh.  The sandwich was just a tad dry and could have used more oil and vinegar, but besides that, it was damn near a perfect sub!  Definitely the best Italian sub I have had in Phoenix!    I will definitely be back to try out their other sandwiches.  I was highly impressed with the Maximus and if their other subs can come close to being as good as that one, I will be super satisfied.  Too bad its across the Valley, or I would be here way too often!  It was a great little store, and a fantastic birthday sandwich!  Good times!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side view of The Maximus.  Awesome bread, top quality meats and great produce.  Pretty much a perfect sandwich!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front view of The Maximus.  Awesome bread, top quality meats and great produce.  Pretty much a perfect sandwich!

v0WtcexEzBs79IbPWnqC0w.text: Delicious food to order and a variety of pastas, sauces to buy for a homemade Italian feast. I could spend hours looking at their products from Italy like olive oil, canned sauces, and other delicacies you don't find in the grocery stores.

BeeevLhuLIjUwSclmuwGWA.text: Love this True Italian experience..  You must go for anything you need Italian.. The best sandwiches in Scottsdale!

tCF_jJTI-LhV0gijHxeChQ.text: Called at 11:15 to confirm they had dough balls for home made pizza, as it's a drive to get there. "sure we have plenty" ... Do I need to do anything else to make sure it's available? "no"... arrive an hour later, sorry sold out. Didn't even try to make it right. Been a great place for many years, but start crapping on your customers like that and it will impact your business. I won't be back.

5JFwmdJxuQl4M2PdfAqKAg.text: After a long drive from Oceanside CA to Scottsdale AZ,  the clerk at the hotel suggested Defalco's (he was nice enough to give us a directions) for an Italian dinner place. Defalco's is a combo of a store and restaurant. You are ordering you food at then waiting for the food at the table. We ordered a 12 inch pizza and a one salad (I was told it will be enough for a 2 persons and it was). Well, this is not a NJ pizza and I did not expect it to be(see my review for a La Gondola Pizzeria) , but for the  Scottsdale it's OK. Seating inside with the temperature at 87 F at 7:00 PM with no A/C (fans only), I don't know how so many people were preferring outside seating (one star down).

8CU8oGzfLZebcvxIWYc7hw.text: We were in Scottsdale for another happening and wanted to try this place out. I had seen that Guy from Diners, Drive Ins and Dives had been there. My husband had the same homemade sausage with peppers sandwich that Guy had. He added provolone cheese to it. The pricing on that sandwich was very affordable! I ordered the Purista and it was fantastic. We shared an order of red potato salad. I would def go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade sausage with peppers, marinara and Provolone- full. Purista-half and red potato salad.
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

InjxKghUiZSJaQsFJhxoRw.text: They make everything to order and the ingredients are fresh, but I don't know if the food was sitting out for a while or if they don't cook it piping-hot, because most of the meal came out lukewarm.  The Italian beef with provolone was just ok, nothing special - maybe a tad better than the version served at Portillo's.  The Centurion calzone was tasty - I liked the mix of ingredients (mozzarella, roasted peppers, Kalamata olives, sopressata, basil, and tomato), but again, I wish that it came out a little hotter, with the cheese a little more melted.  The calzone is pretty large, and the leftovers tasted better heated up the next day.  There are about 15 or so tables that fit 2-3 people each, and a line quickly forms during peak lunch hours.  It's hard for groups bigger than 3 people to really sit together, because most of the tables are small and seat only two.  You're also basically sitting and eating among grocery shelves.    I'd say that the marinara sauce was the best component of the meal, even though it (along with the sausages) also came out lukewarm.  But overall the food was not memorable or worth the drive.  And since I can buy San Marzano tomatoes at more and more places now, I don't think I will be coming back here.

RjkVWfSGaumkIBEUtHT29A.text: I have drove past this place for years and always wondered if it was great. We are from New York and KNOW good Italian food. Today, I was watching Drive In, Diners and Dives and saw Guy ranting over what a great Calzone they make, needless to say we headed there for dinner.   I ordered the white pizza and a calzone...and this was a PEPSI establishment, I know that doesn't mean much to some but it does to others. Anyway, the pizza  was thin and crunchy which I like, and garnished pretty with lots of basil. The basil is what saved this pizza because it barely had any ricotta and not much flavor. I literally had 2 slices, my boyfriend had one, and we took the rest home, this is not usual. My boyfriend ordered a calzone, when it came out the bottom was completely burned, enough that scraping off the bottom wasn't enough because you can taste it through eat bite. I took his plate with the calzone upside down to the counter and asked if this looked burned to the guy at the counter who more or less shrugged his shoulders and asked us if we wanted them make another one. I just got our money back.   I was not impressed, and would not recommend this place. There are other places in the valley with much better Italian food.

7HC8cO_voV6RZAg5GdRxDw.text: If you want REAL Italian food this is your stop! The moment you walk in it feels like you're family. I am Italian and I have high standards for Italian food. They also have a wide selection of grocery items, I stoked up for my fathers birthday and he was so happy! Hurry on over and try out everything on the menu and you won't regret it... Until you put on your skinny jeans

9nNoAsCiZSVSKwOpc5XmHQ.text: Hey Paisan, This is as authentic as it is good. The deli sandwiches were delicious and the cannoli for desert was great. A wonderful selection of wines compliment the authentic Italian foods. We sat out on the patio which was very relaxing. Would highly recommend this place for anyone who'd like to go to Italia but can't afford the flight.

pj5fV5h1ybWr_R-5L5lWUg.text: I know I'm going to get slack for rating it 3 out of 5 stars, but I have my reasons.   Came here on the 28th of July, cause we saw a rerun on the Food Networks' DDD. So had to try it out. It's in a decent location and could use an expansion. For just buying something to-go, it's great. If your going to dine in, it's a bit of a nightmare. The layout of this location is way to cluttered, they have one of the main doors locked to fit a shelf with products. Then you have all the traffic by the fountain drinks and not so good working soda machines' ice maker. The ice was getting stuck and you had people banging it to get the ice.  Now! On to the food. We ordered a couple of calzones which were very good and alot bigger than we thought. The Gnocchi with Red Sauce is also very good. The pizza my daughters ordered wasn't that great, looked very unappetizing and very greasy. I honestly don't think there was any sauce on that pizza.  This is for the owners! If your going to complain (as this shorter gentlemen was doing outside) about the extra traffic your getting from being featured on DDD, than don't do it. You should be happy you were on TV.

IhmcF5Ea4FkCYiGinIaRKQ.text: Unbelievably Great! You can enjoy the smells from the time you pull up! Mmmmmmm! Great old school charm, wonderful food!

KGzBRMKYN6-aJ60X_63OvA.text: Best Italian deli in Phoenix valley , bar none. The service is on par, quality and authenticity of their Italian soups, sandwiches, and salads are top notch. Would travel 20+ miles to come here any day for lunch or dinner. We like getting the meatball with Parmesan with an added layer of Prosciutto. Just heavenly Italian food!

7JtHAvW2W7OTLlV0NnJDkg.text: First time and we are obsessed!! Definetely worth the ride (we live on the West Valley). We ordered Centurion pizza, Il Purista sandwich and eggplant parmigiana sandwich to try and we looooved it all!! Foccacia bread is delicious, the pizza crust and the sauce to die for!! Definetely the best italian deli I have been to and I will recommend it to all my friends and family. It is very casual, you order by the register and they call your number and take your food to your table. We waited around 15 minutes for the pizza and sandwiches so that made us very happy (we were starving). It is very very family oriented and we loved that too!! You wont be disappointed ;) great food, friendly staff!!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate shell Cannoli
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

V1It44qBu3XHGeVD14Tm5A.text: Great food. Unfortunately, they get real busy and it's like a sit down fine dinning experience.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside patio.

xqshaPKYhbkwXKpQlxp5bA.text: Couldn't say more about this place, drove by it by chance, this place is the real deal! Fresh meats, cheese, bread, sausage, imported prosciutto, Italian cooking products like pasta sauce antipasto the list goes on. I ordered a prosciutto with tomato fresh mozzarella and pesto on a fresh crusty bun it was outstanding!!  Arizona does Italian food better than it does Mexican food!

ma45BB8mGAyWohBAxMFSGA.text: Impossibly good Italian deli in the middle of the desert. Huge sandwiches on the most incredible bread you've ever had outside of NY. As someone who ate here 3 times in a 24 hr period, I feel especially compelled to tell you about their cheesesteak. HO-LY-SHIT. Easily the most decadent, flavorful cheesesteak I've had in a VERY long time - and I live 15 minutes outside of Philly. Im still in disbelief that they could pull something like that off. Ask for yours on the soft roll.  I should also mention the sausage,  peppers & onion sandwich, which was really good. I suspect they make their own sausage, which elevates them to superstar status in my book. The chicken parm sandwich and dinner are both equally good, and the meatball sandwich deserves honorable mention as well.  I dont do cold subs, but the ones I saw coming out of the kitchen looked huge and tasty. Perhaps I will try their pizza next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken parm

IcsD2nR7O7Sat1ofB3FOpA.text: This place is my new favorite. We went there for the first time tonight and was blown away. The cheesesteak was by far the best I've ever had. We ordered the fettuccini Alfredo with chicken as well. It was also really good but I couldn't get past how amazing the cheesesteak was. Best Italian restaurant I've ever eaten at. Highly suggest!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. fettuccini Alfredo with chicken, comes with garlic bread and a side salad, and the amazing cheesesteak

Bp6lcFE_OYbJYc9GeJ0C0g.text: If you're looking for good food, a cozy environment, and anything Italian, this is the place to go! Came here on a recommendation, and I'm so glad I did! I got an Italian combo and it was amazing. Walked around the store for a little bit, and found 00 flour, Italian cookies, and a restaurant in the back! It was busy and I totally understand why. They have a large variety of fresh pastas and cheese. Deli meat galore. I will certainly be back to eat on the restaurant part of it.

zchIeEFWlwWvJ51oNGiBMA.text: If you want Italian, it's as good as it gets, this is the place to visit.  Whether it's for the grocery aspect or the restaurant, it is delicious!!    Pizza is amaze-balls!!!!!

AukNfsf8-jGrYNA1X3xajQ.text: My family ate here on our first visit to Arizona.  I remember watching Guy Fieri feature it on DDD, so we were excited to try it.  I may offend many people, but we were very disappointed.  We ordered a few different items so we could try it all, but we didn't LOVE any of them.  Here's what we ordered (all in the large size)...  cheesesteak sandwich:  way too rich and "Velveeta cheesy" for our taste   meatball sub:  it was okay, the marinara was the best part  fettucini alfredo w/ chicken:  bland sauce  calzone:  honestly can't give a review of this other than it was humongous!  it came out later than our other food, so we were too stuffed with the other dishes, that we just gave the entire thing to the valet attendant at our resort.

cXRhOu-DEmVspwdByPDE4w.text: Super Friendly Awesome Helpful Staff! It was so busy it was a bit intimidating at first, but after we entered we realized they had everything under control! The line moved fast and the ambience was welcoming and calm. The food was unbelievable! and the dough even better! We re-heated our sausage and pepper sandwiches for dinner and the bread was even better heated (in the microwave!) A must go to for locals and visitors alike!!

kXulqdg81isBly-A-z2kug.text: Up until yesterday, I was planning on completing my draft of an effusive, glowing, 5-star review for Defalco's.  Yes, it was going to be a wonderful description of how much I love the food, blah, blah, blah...  That was until I waited 35 minutes for a cheesesteak.  35 minutes.  For a sandwich.    No, it wasn't during the lunch rush.  In fact, there were only 4 other people in the store.  I walked right up to the counter to order, as there was not a line (a first!).  And then proceeded to wait.  And wait.  And wait some more.  35 minutes, to be exact, thanks to the time-stamp on my receipt.  I have been to Defalco's on more occasions than I can count, and know to expect a longer than average wait.  Hey, quality takes time.  I get it.  I have thoroughly enjoyed each and every item I have tried there - pizza, calzone, cold sandwiches, deli items and of course my personal favorite, the cheesesteak.  My partner in culinary crime counts their food, especially their four-meat combo sandwich, among his favorite things.    Unfortunately, 35 minutes for one sandwich in a practically empty place is ridiculous enough to make me re-think my formerly 5-star opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patience is a virtue...
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. While delicious, this should NOT take 35 minutes to prepare
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesesteak with mushrooms...  I dream about this sandwich!

NrJBFLtuYteuq8lvqNO_iw.text: Amazing!  Being from Chicago, I miss good Italian food here but this place is cool.  Has the vibe of a restaurant you'd find in Italy since we were the last fall.  The calzones are ridiculously good.  The arancini ball was the size of the bowl and the spinach / cheese was so good.

faTfnWjc7XKU9iLFQBpbrw.text: The Il Purista is onto of my favorite sandwiches in town.  Tons of mozzarella, a half inch thick pile of prosciutto and basil make for the quintessential Italian sandwich.  There are so many good things about De Falcos, if you care about food, you must go.

Fd61Q6ZE6pxIynkSgXd1yA.text: Love it! I've been going there for years!! I wish it was near me in Gilbert!

vIvChRW0_UTK52LciUa30g.text: Saw this on Guy Fieris Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives and I was impressed by the food and wine selection-and for low prices. The sausage was very good, so dig in to the sandwiches and pastas! However, it gets a four star because the tables were a bit dirty and the atmosphere was a little bland. But, enjoy the food!

q7iI-X-XNVwndby346NlqA.text: This place is consistently good. I'm pretty sure over the last 10 years I've had almost everything on their menu.  The guys are great, service is always with a smile. If you go during weekday lunch expect a bit of wait but know it will be well worth it. My favorite is a classic hard salami with provolone.

2UpAzuDcZzQFZGJml2OCdg.text: Almost feels like a hidden Scottsdale gem, but every time we eat there it is BUSY!

Czp2RivcyOFTWSIJSWsurA.text: Loved my sandwhich and great service. Will definitely back when on this side of town!

bpTMCrq_7qq_KwY8YPQuuw.text: This is really an exceptional italian deli!  Great sandwich's - great atmosphere.  Would certainly come again when in the Scottsdale area.

CdLKgCEPgyO6o5P2_Wr8lw.text: Really cool how they have tables thru out the store area - lots of great specialty foods and bread is great. Had a turkey and Swiss sub to go. Bread was excellent, turkey fresh, lettuce fine cut. Nice selection of ice tea. I will definitely stop in again and try other menu items.

5Xo0TL88xTigIGNv2zam1Q.text: Loved their portobello sandwich! The pizza is pretty good as well although not quite like a ny pizza :)

THrnZxqCIYiqTM-Os-qwOg.text: I'm from the northeast and this place reminds me of home. It's like walking into an  Italian deli back east (or about as close as you can get to it out in the desert).  Chick Parm...deli meats...fresh pizza dough...I love this place. They also sell a lot of Italian groceries you won't find in the local supermarkets. Pretty cool...

JobYa8xFcJbvYJyUaNtivQ.text: Being from Brooklyn NY and being spoiled my whole life with the best heroes NOT SUBS in the world, I can honestly say that Defalco's is pretty decent for being in Arizona where there are no good heroes bc nobody knows what a hero is pertaining to food.  The roast beef with fresh mozz and au jus sauce is excellent.  Bread could be a bit better, but overall a good experience.  KInd of overpriced tho (and thats coming from a NYC hero eater).

0KCAmGXGO6_8L9nxJbDiJA.text: A great place to go for huge portions of Italian! We were there on a weekend night. The quaintness of sitting between the aisles is pretty interesting. I got a whole-size order of fettuccine alfredo, which came with a side salad and garlic bread. The garlic bread was so-so, but the fettuccine alfredo had generous heaps of sauce, chicken with a fried breading, and the salad was made with fresh ingredients. There was so much that I couldn't eat it all. The only thing I didn't like was that you have to order at the counter, and it's a long wait, especially since we got stuck behind some indecisive people who were standing in front of the register staring at the menu for fifteen minutes.

uPrEfVa_ONUb-AwTNqWQhA.text: This is, by far, the best deli in the valley.  Whenever you get the best, you should be prepared to wait.  I make a point of visiting whenever I come home for a visit.  The wait can be anywhere from 15 to 35 minutes, depending upon the time of year so get there early or call ahead to place your order.  Trust me when I say, it's worth it.  DeFalco's uses some of the best meats and cheeses and everything is sliced to order.  Sandwiches range in price from $6 to $7.50 for full sandwiches but 1/2 sandwiches are available as well.  My favorite is the dried soppressata, capacollo and provolone sandwich; it is the best in my opinion but they have a great reputation for their cheesesteak sandwich.  They have a nice selection of desserts that range from cheesecake and Italian wedding cookies to cannoli and pizzells.         They also boast a great selection of Italian grocery items that range from pasta to wine and cheeses to spumoni.  I hear their italian sausage is really good.  The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is small but clean.  I definitely recommend giving DeFalco's a try.  You wont be disappointed.

-0D4qxNrcGhUv4d4kYhCew.text: Ordered a chicken cheese steak sand and a portabella sand. So good went back the next day and ordered the beef cheese steak and YES the portabella sand. Will eat here with every future visit to Phoenix. Thanks DeFalcos

ezI8_808719QjNkL1uJ-lw.text: Uh, friggin' awesome deli turkey sandwiches -- by far, the best in the Phoenix Metropolitan Area.  For the amount of "real" turkey that you get, they load on the extras (tomatoes, lettuce, mayo, honey mustard, etc).  A big sandwich for $7.50. I'd gladly spend an extra $2.50 then have to settle for Subway, etc.  I highly recommend DelFalco's chicken pesto sandwich and pizza.  Huge fan -- just wish they opened another one near Mill Avenue...  Read Giovanni T's review -- he hit it on the head.

MQDBxWoy01EPLRiNAhbaiw.text: The best Italian deli in the Phoenix metro area hands down.  Incredible value.

HScJ8NW3F77OKCUsTeEICg.text: Nice atmosphere and friendly service. I was really looking forward to DeFalco's because it was on Triple D and because of the high Yelp rating, but unfortunately it did not live up to the hype.   The Chicken Parm was dry and pizza not very Naples like given the Italian roots of this place.   Also had a cappuccino. My Nespresso expresso maker makes better cappuccino.    Next time in Arizona I will stick to the Mexican food.

_qI1x9qJ4g5olpoMF9YElQ.text: I only go here for the fresh salads. The macaroni, chicken Caesar and seafood pasta salad are all excellent. I find the marinara sauce on the pasta to be very bland and the sandwiches take forever to be made. I shouldn't have to sit at a table to wait for a sandwich in a DELI. But like I said I love the salads

0PgB8wWluPsj61CO5sE_0w.text: I am still scratching my head, wondering why Guy Fieri liked this place so much. It was clean, the food was good, but so is Subway...sorry.

rAk6VS9R8steIcNsoNf2MA.text: I love this place! The Meatball sandwich is great and so are all the pastas. Completely authentic and not gross like a cheapy Italian Restaurant. Everything is good from the bread, to the meatballs, to the side salad. Order the half portion or full portion of all their menu items and it will not disappoint. Expect to wait a 1/2 or more for your food to arrive though, it will not be done quickly but it will be worth the wait. Call ahead if you are in a hurry! The desserts are also delicious, not to mention it contains a market with a surplus of Italian ingredients to make your own meal at home. Your Italian Grandma would be so proud!

PWD5GNiDASBAKV0blv3_Ow.text: For those looking for a quality sub and can't find it at a chain restaurant this is the spot. Subs are priced a little high compared to a chain but you get what you pay for.

Pb-FMlyiax1Vif0J2IKcng.text: Great place for casual Italian dining. Sandwiches, salad, entrees, and even a glass of wine or a beer to round out your meal. Top it off with an espresso and a pastry, and you're really living... Salute!

OjbIzX_7ZuxNSihg4RFYsw.text: To start, a quick tip for first timers here, plan on spending some time here. Not because it's a massive store, or the wait for food takes forever, it's just that Defalco's is that popular and usually always packed. If you aren't happy about that, take it up with Guy Fieri.   That being said, I really do enjoy this nice Italian grocery. The food they put out is consistent which is pretty key, and it's just flat out delicious. It's traditional Italian food done traditional ways. This isn't Olive Garden.   I usually get some ravioli or pasta for lunch here and afterwards buy some salami or sausage to take home along with some pasta. There are two really good traditional Italian grocery stores in Scottsdale, and this is one of them for sure.   The only downfall to this, is the previous mentioned popularity. It's not a big shop, it doesn't have a ton of seating and you feel a bit crammed while in line. There is definitely plenty of parking though. I would love to see them move to a bigger location and thrive more and be able to accommodate the crowds they usually accrue on any given afternoon.   Bottom line. Go here. Eat great food. Be happy.

2OeJiWiDfflys2hp8YP9Zg.text: DeFalcos is a five star eatery hands down, it reminds me of my north east Italian delis...that being said this is the SECOND consecutive time my order has been heartbreakingly wrong. First Postmates just didn't bring my sandwich and now, they put my chicken cutlet sandwich on a floppy lame piece of white bread with no dressing (despite the fact I was standing by when it was ordered properly by my roommate who is equally at fault for not checking the order before leaving with it).   I. Am. So. Sad. Why do you do this to me DeFalcos?! Whyyyyyyy!?!

d8LYdWtKd04fOc5iADxLhg.text: Yum!!! Total local spot and it's great. The eggplant parmigiana sandwich was amazing!!

4XT5p31_CoxjxHrgIbMTuQ.text: Great food and prices are very fair with the amount of food you get.  Everything there is really good.  IMO best pizza in AZ. Pizza and Pasta are my favorites but can't go wrong with any of the food there.

IVujVDvwj3z47wKa0F0LBw.text: Seriously one of my favs in town but waited uber long for a hot sandwich that came out cold? Wth?

ypg7bh-XMkvxXUH32QrUjA.text: Fantastic enviroment with great food and great service. A little taste of Italy away from Italy.

f9aEMiWc6GC2Rp3BhGQFGA.text: I have been eating here for years. However I am done. Why? because they continually screw up my order or prepare it poorly!  I have received half cooked pizzas, cold eggplant parm, ziti pasta when I ask for spaghetti. And sausage when I ask for meatball. Sometimes they forget the bread or salad.  It is pretty much the staff. They seem to have people on the kitchen line who do not care. One time asked for parm cheese packets for my pizza and they said they were out. But they asked the kitchen line for some for another customer and they got it.  Also, their food is not as good as you see on the reviews here. I am from NY and it does not even come close. Arizonians and snowbirds  have no idea what is good Italian food. This place has no clue how to make a meatball parm hero. Ordered once and never again. Pizza ok nothing to jump for joy. Portions are good. But the seating and beverage area is a little dirty most of the time.  It is shame because this was a go to place for take out dinner after a long day at work. But  tired of the rude girls working behind the counter and the constant bs with my orders for the last year. Yes I still went over the last year despite the bs.  BUT NO MORE LOYALTY HERE.

B1GbAk6Syn4bScf5zIDdNA.text: My boyfriend and I are obsessed with Defalco's. It's less than a mile from my house so we frequently eat here. Everything we have ordered thus far has been amazing, flavorful and fresh.   I believe that the owners' family originally came from Italy, which explains the atmosphere of the deli. It reminds me of a typical european deli, mixing fresh foods you can order to your liking, along with a small selection of groceries and specialty items.  I like to buy certain groceries here but they are a little more expensive, given that the majority are imported. They've got some great products - fancy cheese, a giant selection of olive oil, unique pastas (gnocchi, fusilli), and lots of wine.   To date, my boyfriend and I have tried:  cheesesteak (must try it!!! get it on the Italian roll with grilled onions, mushrooms, and peppers),  chicken parmigiana sandwich,  italian sausage sandwich with peppers (homemade sausage, i would recommend adding cheese), cheese ravioli, artichoke and vegetable lasagna (amazing!), caprese salad (homemade mozzarella cheese!!), and  spinach, avocado and goat cheese salad.  We are looking forward to eating everything on the menu, but it is always difficult to try something new when everything we've tasted has been amazing.  Don't forget about ordering desserts! Tiramisu, cannolis, chocolate eclairs, lemoncello cake... I have a sweet tooth and I am happy to report that they do not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cheesesteak on an italian roll with onions, mushrooms and peppers.

uSTf_41zkz8jyNoePkYaPQ.text: My go to Italian spot. Looks very unassuming from the street as it sits in a strip mall. Prices are great and it's fun to look at all the authentic Italian groceries as you wait for your food.   My favorites -- lemon bars (yes, dessert first! They're large and the best I've ever had!!), vegetable lasagna (banging w artichokes and assorted veggies), the salad with chicken and goat cheese (bomb!). Pizzas are great. Interestingly I haven't tried their sandwiches yet but I can't imagine they're anything less than great. I also like their lattes, my fav is the iced salted caramel.   What a cool, authentic Italian grocery/takeout/eat-in spot. I like that they have indoor and outdoor seating too.

1o3JmvtHoXZfU_jyWzXy5w.text: Awesome and large menu everything tastes very fresh, everyone I have brought here loves it.

gqpwcwXxxZ_1DeD0VE3tiA.text: Defalco's is heaven. It's debatable whether I was more sad to move away from Scottsdale because of leaving my friends, or Defalco's.    I could honestly eat here every day of my life.  Their sub sandwiches are like a meat party in your mouth.  Their noodles are creamy and delicious.  All of their salads and antipasti are unreal.   Always a long line and it's kind of overwhelming inside but it is so so so worth the wait!

m1514l_i6iFwOymnV8AoQA.text: We had heard about DeFalco's from friends, and stopped in for a late, light, lunch. The Greek Salad was delicious, and we followed it up with a 12" Pizza Bianco with added grilled chicken. Shop with your eyes while you eat---deli, desserts, wine, all the Italian necessities. Fun!

B3EA1PZd-9ChaJr5KJ8v9Q.text: So I have not been here for lunch in probably 8 years as we usually get the pizza for dinner and was just reminded of how AMAZING my favorite sandwich is! It is honestly heaven. I order the Mozzarella, Tomato, and Basil (Cold Sandwich) + Prosciutto. The bread has the perfect crunch, the oil and vinegar are authentic, and the prosciutto is some of the best in the Valley. If you love Caprese, this sandwich IS your jam, I promise! I will be back wayyyy more often for lunch thanks to this fabulous reminder! Thank you for ALWAYS impressing, Defalco's!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy salads and sides!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing meat selection!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mozzarella, tomato, and basil cold sandwich + prosciutto! The best!

xCZM_jAeev6zJdg9fxQLlw.text: We have been enjoying the food at Defalco's for the past 7 years. The reason I cannot give 5 stars is because although the food is always tasty, the service is mediocre, always.I've expereinced quite a few inconsistent orders - the dressing to my salad is wrong, bread isn't included in the bag when I get home, etc. When you walk in for a pick up order the staff is always frazzled, rushed and seems understaffed. Last night was my last straw. We placed an order over the phone at 5:30, it was supposed to take 30 minutes. We went to pick it up, stood around waiting for 25 minutes while staff completely ignored me, didn't seem to have a clue what was going on - then they tried to give me my food that had been sitting ready for 20 minutes. I don't want old food. I left the food and got my money back. Needless to say I think I'm done ordering food from here.

sRkVoS9Oq4mm9khGB3ATEA.text: Reminds me of being back in New York this is the kind of deli I grew up with in the kind of food that I'm used to being Italian and being from the north east and this place is right around the corner from work so you know where I stop for lunch food is out of this world good stuff and you can find of a lot of things there that you can't find anywhere else

xYwCsWM1d1t1CeQCSsGflg.text: Always great! & almost always very busy!   There are so many great things to choose from and I have that to look forward to.  My last few visits have been awesome once I got my order in, that's the hard part as there are 2 order stations and each one is for it's own items. First timers will be confused, as I was as the lines snake through the tiny grocery lined dining room. stick with it and focus, as the payoff is amazing  It's ultra casual for sandwiches and Italian dishes this good. Quality sliced meats and cheeses are priced well and the specialty grocery items like San Marzano tomatoes and great Italian wine abound.  This is one of those hole in the wall gems! trust me and check this place out.

SM-GXmzcQR3HzhQqnc4Fnw.text: Il puritan and the eggplant artichoke salad make your tastebuds just dance. Perfect place, food is fantastic. Service is exceptional and the speed of their service is why this might be one of my favorite Italian delis.

bAlciJiuln_kKaZXNA3qOw.text: We had the Centurion Calzone and the Beef Cheesesteak and they were so delicious.  Both were so flavorful and left us wanting more!  Will definitely be back if in the area.

flArtXbkFhg44spa0NVrUA.text: This place is the real deal. Just as good as the Italian delis I went to in New York. I've tried probably half the menu and never been disappointed. The Italian cheesesteak is ridiculously good, their pastas are amazing and you can find all kinds of random treats in the market. I'm also glad they got rid of the guy that was never happy at the pick up register.

461wphpIYwDRAr9_IKHLxw.text: If you're in the Tempe/Scottsdale area looking for good east coast style Italian food, this is the place. Hot sandwiches, cold sandwiches, pizza, or pasta they have it all. Enjoyed it very much!

zMOm6Ng0cWGGx1qc7bfdzQ.text: This is my favorite place, best pizza, the spinach salad with chicken is amazing  I usually come here once or twice a week. I like that I'm able to call in the order and 15 mins later I can pick it up.  The staff is very friendly and knows me by name. If you like Italian food I recommend you trying this place.

lggx61B73-qyspKnf1DOfA.text: My name is Anthony De Falco.  I checked this place out while I was visiting my dad in AZ.  As a resident of the tri-state NYC area, I can say with unwavering and steadfast confidence that this is without a doubt the worst deli I have ever been to in my entire life.  The level of apathy and cognitive dissonance in this place was astounding.  I ordered- Chicken cutlet, fresh mozzarella, roasted red peppers, oil and vinegar and I essentially received a Subway quality chicken tender sandwich with some shredded mozzarella cheese covered in marinara, on the stalest bread to ever curse this earth.  How people can possibly rate this place at 4 1/2 stars blows my mind.  I could literally go to the worst restaurant in Yonkers, NY and get a superior sandwich. You people make me ashamed to share the name. I think I will be legally changing my last name to Lindquist just so I can avoid any potential association with this abomination.  Embarrassing

CW9NVHB1EGZHRvD2sRuhxw.text: I finally made it over to this place after bookmarking it about a year ago. I ordered the Purista and I wasnt impressed. They screwed up my order and put the oil and vinegar on it. I specifically asked for it on the side. So instead of starting over, they included cups with extra on the side. Ew. By the time I got home it was soggy. The flavors were good but definitely not worth the price. I thought everything was overpriced actually. I dont mind spending a decent amount for a sammich but that was a rip off. I browsed the other items available and the selection was extensive and crammed into a super tiny space. I don't think I will be back.

ivt3TTCq98BNf0gRAQaeRg.text: I forget who told me about this place but thank God for them!  I have never had a bad meal here. My fave sandwich is the sausage w/ peppers and onions. Oh so good. And I love that they have Dr. Brown's soda. The line is usually all the way back to the door, but it's so worth it.  I love that the tables are set among the groceries. Ive never had need to go there for anything but lunch, but I like that while waiting in line you can peruse their grocery/deli selections.  2 words: go here!

L1v2jqPKGXucWLHK-y3HXg.text: Seating can be an issue, but it's well worth it. I always get the chicken cheese steak and love it everytime. I've been to Philly for the Pat and Geno's experience and this place is right up there with them. It has a small neighborhood market feel with all the uniques Italian grocery items you can buy there. One of my go too's for lunch!!

VdmiIEiurunSeBeTA8NxcA.text: Awesome food! Hands down the best Italian deli in AZ  Just a note - the owner solicits for tips but the employees never see any of the tips.  Have always tipped 40-50% of my tab & a little upset about it now because I believed the employees serving me were actually receiving the $ at the end of their shift. Not the case.  I would give this place 5 stars if it wasn't for the owner soliciting for tips for his profit. Not cool :-|

eL9wJAoqy4oVcwAuTO7pHQ.text: I start this review during the long wait for my sandwich. So far my experience is negative. I knew exactly what I wanted though the cashier couldn't get it right. When he asked if I wanted mayo, mustard or Italian dressing I replied Italian. Then when he said "so you want everything". I repeated no that I did not want mustard or mayo. At this point the guy in line though he would jump in and educate me on how to order a sandwich. I have some angry words that I am holding back from my review about this guy. I told him I knew what I was doing and he continued to mettle. I told him to stop. I finalized my order and was trying to pay when the cashier instead turned to ask the guy behind me what he wanted because he assumed we were together!!! 30 minutes wait and my sndwich arrives. The bread was delicious and all was fresh. Not enough cheese though. The menu should list that the sandwich I ordered is comprised of the spicey hot meat. It was not as I expected. The bread was yummy.  Overall though I have had better thus the two star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vwCDH8Mr8xvgbe0-hR97yw.text: Perhaps the reason for my three-star review is my expectations of this triple D eatery were a little bit too high.  My wife and I stopped in for a "quick " lunch on our way to run a few errands. The meal was nothing but quick, after waiting online for about half an hour to place my order, we waited for a good 40 minutes before being brought half of our ordered meal. Ice cold.    After sending it back and getting a quick apology, my wife's calzone came out. The calzone was about what you would expect - ton of cheese, pepperoni, dough cooked perfectly. It was actually quite delicious.   Then, my sandwich which was featured on diners drive-ins and dives return. While it was praised in several of the reviews on here and on TV as gods gift to earth, I felt like it was nothing really that special. A little bit too much bread and the homemade sausage while flavorful was not all that unique and mild in seasoning (I ordered the hot sausage). The food was probably four stars in quality I just had higher expectations after all the reviews and TV segments and word of mouth.  With respect to the interior, the place is crowded. But cute queens and features and Italian markets that carries specialty items that look quite interesting. Personally, not a huge fan of people looking over your shoulder to view items while you eat but to each his own.  If I return, it will be for a planed to take out order or to go order. The bakery and antipasto looked really appealing. As far as for a sub sandwich or pizza - I'm more likely to get something closer to home with an abundance of high-quality pizza in Phoenix Arizona.  Overall, it was pretty damn good. But just not that good.

BbUc_grUZDLrC8qqnNIG-g.text: We had lunch on a Saturday, the place was packed (always a good sign) and we had to sit outdoors...not a big deal because the water-misting system actually cooled us off. I had the classic Italian sandwich and it was...GREAT! A nice shot of espresso to go with, and one of my buddies got the Italian meatball sandwich (with cheese) he says it's awesome, and I always believe what he says, so it's awesome. A little side note, the deli and restaurant sit amidst an Italian grocery store and they actually had a couple items I had been searching all over for: hot giardinara mix and sport peppers. Yes, sport peppers are nowhere to be found in Phoenix...except at DeFalco's! In case you are wondering, sport peppers are the ones used in Chicago-style hot dogs, so you can't have an authentic Chicago-style hot dog without sport peppers, and you can't have sport peppers in Phoenix without visiting Defalco's. Actually, you should bring a few hundred dollars to blow in the grocery store because every item is unique, and you're going to want at least one of everything. You have been told. In conclusion, our afternoon at DeFalco's was pleasurable and  out of the ordinary. I am looking forward to our next visit. Oh yeah, CANOLIS!

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. You must buy these items, or forever be a kitchen amateur. Told ya!
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. eat me
Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. the classic Italian sub, shot of espresso, you not belief!

YK3Zt7ZvsQCYXYm7TJvnAQ.text: This place is top notch when it comes to fresh deli sandwiches! Everything I order is always great and I've never had an issue or a bad meal. Just get there early or late to avoid the lunch rush or call your order in for pickup.  The groceries are authentic and interesting, its fun to look through them all and try to figure out what you can create in your own kitchen.  Worth the stop if your in the area!

h636JYGR5Ntb62O8tZ5gSQ.text: I'm from chicago, visiting my inlaws home in Scottsdale and saw this place featured on Triple D amd had to give it a try.  I'm glad we made the drive cuz the food was excellent.  I had the italian sausage with marinara sauce. And Motz cheese.  The only thing I would do differently is request the italian sausauge to be hot sausauge, vs the mild.   Other than that, it was excellent!

-anUWF2v4xSziAVLBpKDcA.text: Cute Italian Deli!  Our wait to order in line was about 15 mins. If I came again I would order the meatballs. My husbands spaghetti and meatballs was worth the wait!

K5tYes_uPGQqhIRWsSAN7A.text: Just awesome all around.   Meatball sub was perfect as was my Dad's Italian sandwich.   Large portions and prompt service.   Wish they had more seating...  A must try if you're in the area.

ISy5tuoFMyug6VU8rKkggg.text: Absolutely OUTSTANDING. Cool little place Cool people Yummy cheesesteak  Yummy yummy yummy cheesecake! Will come again

Y5YVLYXJIwS00wmpK8-Kwg.text: The food is magnificent! It's just tastegasem! The gnocchi, the salad and the connoli is awesome too. The service is very good and the food hard ready very quick. They have order pick ups too, in case you're in a hurry!

LwMzSlr9UzDfRFqkTx1wuw.text: This place might be my favorite Italian place! The Margherita pizza was on point and same with the chicken parm sandwich! There's so many wines, oils, and much more to choose from that come straight from Italy. Recommend this place if you're visiting and you need your Italian food fixing!

-wOj_16QYhuYYFfgxnUSxQ.text: Every time I come here I get something different and I've never been dissapointed. Everything is so fresh, and put together so nicely. The staff is always so friendly and willing to answer any questions you have. love you Delfalcos. And you have found yourself a regular customer.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YeIYmcXcJJU0wJaILnomKA.text: Ordered the Italian combo and meatball sub. Came out quick and orderly. I didn't see anything special about the sandwiches, they were just reasonably priced sandwiches. I came in right when they opened and 4 people were already waiting at the door.

photos.caption: Photo of DeFalco's Italian Eatery, Grocery & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half meatball sandwich.

ZG3iZT5OehnyONThuMqzWA.text: Pretty good food, slooow service. Waited 27 minutes for sandwiches.  Yep, just sandwiches and nothing else.  My concern is that there are several reviews where the service seems to be their biggest problem, yet when people are going on Yelp and telling you how to improve, you even have a sign at the counter stating hiw you encouraging good service, you would think they would be able to take the advice to heart.

FUSf9FIDPbjXRuw70n7XDw.text: You can't go wrong here at all. Everything is so delicious. Just try some of their sandwiches with freshly sliced meat and you will realize what you have been missing out on your whole life from other sandwich shops. The pasta: delicious. The pastries?! Fuhgeddabowd it! Not much to not like here (location is kind of in a crappy area but who cares too much when the food is this tasty) There is a bit of a crowd during the lunch hour, but you would be hard pressed to find a better italian market like this in south scottsdale. Try it at least once folks.

QjdyNWZKyC_xwcs4V6pzzw.text: My favorite go to place for a sandwich and pick up dough and pizza toppings to make at home. Love this place!!

UtpBjkmSihx9TPwlzG7W8w.text: Defalcos is great, I had the chicken Alfredo and my lunch date had the cheese steak sandwich. Both were absolutely wonderful! I had no problem with the wait because I knew that the food would be worth it, as I read from other people's reviews. The service was friendly, and it had a real down to earth atmosphere :)

PZ9Wr1r_LwFZ2N4uVBuHLA.text: Wow! What an amazing find! Sadly, i have to give my best friend and Scottsdale resident full credit, but still...wow! I will now make a point to visit this place at least once when I visit. I ordered the Il Purista sandwich...yum.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the staff was not very friendly...to the point it would have been nicer to order take-out. Oh well, their patio was lovely.

flpr6BXbC_Rtqm8M7XSjVw.text: Great selection of sandwiches and deli salads. Some friends of mine go here every Friday and I joined them while in town once. It reminds me of the sandwich shop Fontanos in Chicago. Anyway, my sandwich was good, had turkey on a baguette and think I may have enjoyed something else better but still liked it. Also had their tortellini pasta salad which was awesome. Loved the outdoor patio and although we didn't get any beers, they have a great selection of those too. Very friendly people working there and looks like some interesting/authentic Italian food in the grocery area.

1SeTPqvNxIdI3xSc8-L2Vw.text: Was yelping to find an italian grocery store and found this place, sorely disappointing!  The deli part may be good - don't know, didn't try it, but the grocery part sucks to be honest.  The choices are limited and it is outrageously expensive.  Seriously, $6.99 for a can of San Marzano tomatoes.    Won't go back there anytime soon.

mmBLw2lcFdZn3b2wefrv5Q.text: I am from Philly and know about cheesesteaks. I had one today, and was disappointed. They're usually tender and flavorful, but this was tough and chewy. My husband had a chicken cheesesteak and loved it. The meatballs were bland too (the kid's lunch). Last time we were here it was better. We'll try it again. Maybe it was an off day. It's not a bargain though, so I'd expect a bit better.

VuqUQN1J3jatA1iBuR4S6Q.text: As promised, I returned to DeFalco's Italian Grocery last week for another cheesesteak. I was offered a choice of either a crunchy or a soft roll, this time I opted for the soft roll. The frizzled beef was well seasoned and not greasy. The cheese was melted and mixed throughout, warm gooey goodness on a soft Italian roll which was reminiscent of a fresh Amoroso roll. I asked for hot sauce and was offered Tabasco. Once again, kudos to Anthony DeFalco for his willingness to incorporate customer feedback. That's truly as good as it gets!

6xog2hG-YHNZarza8tea5Q.text: I crave the il purista from Defalco's at least once a week. It's such a simple sandwich, but it's the best -and closest to a NY deli-, I'm going to get in Scottsdale..    I prefer dining in. There's patio seating, a TV usually with a good game on and good music - Pinback, The Shins, Fleet Foxes?! (Although I was iffy about staying last time to enjoy my meal, due to the fact that Morrissey was playing.. but I'm pretty sure it was a huge mistake/defect and it won't happen again)   The staff here reminds me of the neighborhood deli's back East: until they know you, they don't care what you order, what you think and who you are..but when they start recognizing you, you feel like part of a secret family.   It may be a bit of a wait, but it's well worth it. I prefer quality of food and quality of staff, as opposed to how fast I can choke it down on my lunch break.    Savor it.

G_M6fLPUELaJ37RqPstH1Q.text: An awesome little Italina deli, I would recommend the Il Purista sandwhich. . the prosciuto is so good! This is not a fast place so don't expect your order to come flying out at you but its worth the wait in my opinion.   Also has a good little selection of olive oils, olives, breads, and other goods available

lP-OhE9ov1rPTdXTzG6Vgg.text: I was introduced to Deflaco's Italian Grocery last summer and I can't believe I had made it so long, living right down the street without ever stopping in! While I've never purchased anything from the grocery or deli, they do have a ton of traditional Italian products for sale. Everything you'd need to prepare a delicious Italian feast!   What I go there for are the sandwiches. I'm a HUGE fan of their tuna sandwiches. I order them with lettuce, tomatoes, onions and pepperoncinis. I also LOVE the macaroni pasta salad, but only get that if I can restrict myself to half of a tuna sandwich. I've had the egg salad before, and while it's an acceptable alternative when they're out of tuna, I only order it when I can't get my fav. They've got a pretty decent beer selection too which is great if you're stopping in on a Sunday afternoon and would like an "adult beverage" with your meal.   I've not yet tried their pizza or pasta, but will be sure to post an update once I do. It always looks and smells delicious!

eS90MEwfLMLAv0pFd6p0Dw.text: On the show Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and they make the sausage themselves! Best pasta ive had and great tasting pastrami sandwiches and cheesecake yumm

dcQUFh621Vt8oQfKZ3bqNw.text: This place is delicious! The guys are all great and their food is to die for. They have a nice beer/wine selection and a great Italian grocery selection. The sandwiches and pizza are amazing. Try the IL Purista sandwich if you like prosciutto on a Caprese style sandwich! They also offer great Italian salads and sides, stuffed peppers, cheeses and desserts.  Definitely a must try!!!  7/23/11** Ok it's been about 500 times that I've been here now and it's still delicious.

FKxE21cIqtznX12fXSttrQ.text: I eat here all the time. It really is that good. Believe the hype. Big fan of pasta, sandwiches, chicken and tuna salad.

SpWb-SnrXWm9AlJUjLp0GQ.text: This place is the real deal.  Excellent Italian food on the quick.  Everything from pasta to pizza and huge Italian sandwiches.  We can't get enough of their cannolis either.  The place has excellent customer service and offers such a unique dining experience because of it's location within an Italian market.  Great finds to take home and cook as well.  I recommend the cheesesteak, the chicken parmsean sandwich, any pizza, anything with their Italian sausage.  They also offer an excellent craft beer selection including local beers and awesome wines.

mLSgNRimPenT5Znt-LLyug.text: Classy place. Cashier was drinking wine as he wrung us up. Not to mention the misters on the patio. Great sandwiches, especially the il purista.

45g50mQXrdUrLpjQnOD38Q.text: Here again over the 4th of July weekend.  They were slammed due to another airing of their great Diners, Driven Ins and Dives episode so the wait was a little longer than usual-but totally worth it!  I am happy to wait a little longer than a 5 min McDonald's order for quality, homemade food at extremely reasonable prices.  My favorite item is their pizza (I order the white pizza with capacollo)  but they also make a mean turkey sandwich!  My family also loves the Chicken Parm sub and the meatball sub.

2euJ9vPVb4FTNo_7LdUaGw.text: A friend recommended this place to me and told me that this was the best, authentic Italian food that he could find in the Valley.  With me having a gluten-allergy, I was a little hesitant to go but did agree to meet him there, and just decided beforehand that I would get a salad to keep my allergy from flaring up.  He got there a few minutes before me and asked the owner if they had any gluten-free dishes, he advised that they did not really have any on the menu, but that they did sell gluten-free pasta on their grocery shelves and that he would be willing to set up a fresh pot of boiling water for GF pasta and that I could choose from any of the dishes on the menu and substitute the GF pasta for the regular.  How could I turn down an offer like that??  My pasta was just as AMAZING as the customer service!

3-Eg9HPenBkzbCYpjmMPlA.text: I very rarely write reviews, however lately I have heard some amazing things about Defalco's .. I have lived in Arizona for 20+ years and this was my first visit to to Defalco's..And my last.. I was very excited to try the food as all the reviews are very good.. I went in thinking it would be a back in  New York experience, store is very cute selection of items in store plentiful.. Store/ deli was clean and well organized. I went to counter and placed my order. I ordered a meatball sub and Ceasar Salad with avocado, service was pretty fast and I took my food to go.. I got home with very high expectations, wow !!  I opened my meal ready to enjoy some great Italian food :/ ummm.. not so much.. I started with my salad, it looked nice ..as I started eating it I realized there was a gritty substance in it that I couldn't place, upon further investigation I realized the gritty stuff was actually mud/dirt because the romaine lettuce had not been washed..Really??  Okay I said well I guess that was just an error on someones part I will proceed with my meatball sub.. Being Italian myself I would say I have had some tasty meatballs.. well the meatballs on my sub were not tasty at all, flavorless ..Yes , Odd texture.. Yes.. Sauce? below average.. My thoughts? How is this place getting rave reviews?? I am sad to say that my experience was very bad , and not only would I not return but I would also tell people that the food is not worth the visit to Delfalco's..

j0qeI0WUS6pBXkHUmWuVFQ.text: Oh My, Went to this place Christmas eve for a sandwich.  The parking lot was crazy full of people coming in and out, so I decided this was a great place to check out.  When I walked in, it was crazy busy.  Lots of people piled by the deli counter picking up their holiday meats and cheeses.  I just came for lunch, so I sorta cut the line and went strait to the sandwich ordering station.  It was confusing though to figure out where to go with so many people in line.    I ordered a sandwich with 3 meats on it to split with my husband. We got a monster drink and a regular soda, and some chips.  Total was pretty cheap like $12-$13 bucks.  We walked over to where the tables were to wait for our meal.  Watching all the shoppers was differently a spectacle.  Also we had time to check the place out.  It's really casual and has racks of Italian items for sale, such as hard to find wines, pasta's and freshly baked breads.    Our meal came out hand delivered in a basket, and the guy delivering was kind enough to ask me if I wanted another basket for my portion to be put in.  I thought it was really sweet of him to ask, because the place was a zoo, and just having to go past all the shoppers must have been a hassle.  But he came back with a huge smile but a minute later.  I took a huge bite of the sandwich, and wow, it was really good.  You could actually tell the quality of meats and cheeses in the sandwich along with some good dressing that came dripping out of my sub sandwich.  It was a huge sandwich and I was glad I only got half, but only wished we had ordered another one for dinner.  Yes it was that good.  But I didn't want to wait in line again.  Good Stuff....Wish this place was closer to my house.
